TE-4m7nZcC33fHZgURw26g.text: Living in Jersey, my family and I used to eat at the Carmine's in NY all the time. About 3 years ago we moved to AZ, where the food is just horrible compared to the east coast. While in Vegas about a year and a half ago I noticed Carmine's and confirmed it was the same. LOVED IT!! Finally I found east coast flavor on the west coast! Here is a shot of the penne in pink vodka sauce. SO YUMMY!!! Went back last weekend and had it again. OMG loved it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

V7NNh1AVM_olOorSHDd3cg.text: We went to Carmines for Happy Hour after a show in Vegas last week. We had originally wanted to go there for dinner, but time did not permit. We had drinks which were reasonably priced. The wine and beer were $5.00. We also had three different appetizers, all of which were very good. We had meatball sliders, with a side of marinara sauce. They were delicious and the sauce was yummy! We also had the calamari with a side of marinara and toasted ravioli again with marinara sauce. Being from St. Louis (where toasted ravioli originated) I've had better, but Carmines marinara is so delicious, made it so good!  The next time we go to Las Vegas, we will definitely go there for dinner!

EOgDUCVQ39Gvm9Wxj_wuBA.text: Came here for Thanksgiving dinner with the BF's family and some friends. There were 17 adults and 2 kids. We had turkey, mashed potatoes with gravy, carrots, green beans, Brussels sprouts, candied yams, cranberry sauce and stuffing. Turkey was kinda dry. My favorite was the candied yams, stuffing and green beans. Tim loved their Brussels sprouts. Overall food was just so so. It didn't wow me. But I do appreciate the family style serving concept.   Atmosphere was awesome. Loved the setting. Feels like a big Tahoe hotel. Two stories. And we were at the second level. Downstairs is where they had the bar and smaller tables. Music was great. Perfect for the party. Service was slow, but good. Drinks were always filled. But we had to ask for more bread. My picky eater child only wanted their pizza style bread.   I'm giving it a 4 star since I don't think it's fair to judge them base off just their Thanksgiving menu.

XQhx0ndoQJ5aYbNyB5xCfA.text: Happy hour is great. Good deals and even better meatball sliders. A must stop for me every time I'm in town.

RTA2cw9AjdaJxugvkzHeCw.text: We ate at the bar last night, and the food was pretty special.   Rigatoni bolognese like Nona used to make.   Perfectly al dente.   I thought the bread could be better, but I'm used to San Francisco sourdough, so it's a tough comparison.   Great cocktails and service.   Loved being able to watch 2 basketball games and 1 baseball game simultaneously.  This restaurant gets PACKED, but it makes sense why.   It's damn good!

8SiTmblfyb6X8smHT-ocBw.text: We stopped in at Carmine's at the Forum Shops at Caesars on a previous trip to Vegas.  What a treat!!!  Large groups are welcome.  The food is served family style.  And, the portions are huge.  The food was amazing.  I would recommend this place to anyone that wants a great Italian dinner.

Y8TgkPXz-4OLUm3x_xkVGA.text: Ran into this place shopping at the Forum in Caesar's Palace. What stopped us was a table with a big bowl of seafood.  It looked like a seafood cioppino. It had everything seafood in it you can imagine, mussels, clams, shrimp, lobster and crab.  The portion comes in a huge bowl, I kid you not.  Ordered a side of garlic bread and the garlic bread came on a huge platter about 2 feet long with 8 huge slices of garlic bread.  The serving is family style.  If you have a big group you will get your money's worth.  If you are a party of 2, you may want to think about eating here.  It was too much food and we ended up only eating half of it.  We took it to go to see if we could find some homeless people on the bridge that connects Caesar's to the other side of the street.    The ambiance made me feel like I was in New York during the gangster days.  Our waiter had an accent that resembled the guys on the Sopranos.  He was entertaining and very helpful with answering questions from the menu.  We both had a latte after dinner and it was delish!   I took away one star because the portions are large and there is no ability to order half portions.  A party of 2 cannot finish the portions they provide.  It would be nice if they would consider putting half portions on their menu.    Restaurant has inside seating and seating along the Forum side to people watch.  If you like to eat, this is the place to go.

k3f85gzHwTQ9WQ-2PflJnA.text: This place is GREAT!  the place to go if you are really hungry and with a large group. Everything is served large family size... and when i say large family size i mean like 5-8 people!  There were 5 of us and we ordered 3 different dishes since we wanted to get a really good feel of the place and being super hungry!  we had enough left overs to eat for dinner the next day!  They were also advertising that they will be open for thanksgiving! i wish i was going to be in town for that because it looks amazing!  Overall the service was good and they even had 2 tv's for the sports fans out there! it was a great surprise for me since it was football Sunday when we went. Got to enjoy an amazing meal and see my favorite team win!  The ONLY thing i wasn't too crazy about was that the menu was posted on the wall and if you weren't familiar with the menu they expect you to go up and stare at a wall for 15 mins scanning the menu. it luckily wasn't busy when we went to i didn't feel too weird about it but i know if it was packed i would have felt a little put off about standing over someones shoulder !

fmSs05e9en3n6Yw6A0YTxQ.text: Big portions and meatballs that melt in your mouth. I have got to get this recipe. The pasta was perfect and I kept telling my kids "this is how you prepare pasta!"  The Ceasar Salad was also very generous and tasty. Great place for dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big portions for the whole family!

B9G7xpGrq2p6SVj19WV8gQ.text: Super fun meal our first night in Vegas.  Firstly, I love going to Ceasar's Shops at the Forum, such a beautiful area.  Carmines is located inside, and although it looked full, they found a table for my hubs and I.  We were surprised to find that food is "Family Style", i.e. portions of everything they serve are for 6 or more people.  So this is a better option for groups.  But hell with it, we decided to order things anyway....  They serve great New York-style Italian food, and LOTS of it!  (*Note: we had so much food leftover, we gave some to the table next to us.. they then gave us some Calamari, which was really very good).  Started with Carmine's salad--  excellent!  Big enough for 8 people, but we scarfed down plenty of it, so good.   I ended up buying one of their cookbooks, mainly just to get that recipe!  Ordered Chicken Parmesan for entree, also great.  After dinner, found they had Decaf Espresso-- hurray!    Staff were all EXCELLENT-- from the hostess to the waiters to the busboy-- they were all so friendly, nice, efficient, great.   A very fun Iand FILLING!) dinner to start our Vegas vacation.  Glad we did, we'll be back (but next time with friends!!)

R5nsuYaj9lFINYGk3R4C7A.text: This was the best Italian food we've ever tasted. The staff was awesome, the food came quickly, and  it all tasted delicious. The portions are huge, so plan on sharing.

5vnU-2ItMQgjw6RDrHlekQ.text: Come check out the food here. The bartender Mr Fabiano was awesome.  Loved everything here. The manager, Anthony, took good care of us. Happy Hour Beer (Perino) and Red Wine was perfect with the Meatball angel hair Pasta & Raw Clams. We would be definitely coming back!!  You guys come check them out for yourself then yelp it... Love! Love!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RU4pTyznrO-OLLWirW_5oA.text: I've been to the New York location and now the Vegas location. We came here for a bachelorette party. We were starving and ordered a ton of dishes- the Italian salad, the Caesar salad, the lasagna, calamari, pasta with shrimp, penne pasta, lemon chicken, and spaghetti and meatballs. It was a lot of food for 13 girls. My advice is to ask the waiter or waitress what's recommended for your party. We couldn't finish our meals and were really not OK with wasting the food. All in all great spread, but huge portions. Remember it's family style.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #vivalassari

pq4Or9f8Rcy5J-G2QitqsQ.text: True family style eating.  The portions of food are huge!  Normally I can eat everything in sight but  on this trip I got a lot of stuff to go.  We were invited to eat from the awesome hostess that works there.  She warned us to come hungry and not to eat anything all day.  We started off with the fried calamari which is probably the best calamari in Las Vegas.  I'm willing to defeat anybody in arm wrestling over that statement.  This calamari seems to melt in your mouth like an m&m.  Stuffed mushrooms was pretty good as well.    The next portion was a big ol' plate of ragu with spaghetti.  It had meatball and italian sausage links and pork butt.  The pork butt was outstanding.  The italian sausage kinda gave me heart bun later that night but that was ok.    The next dish was Chicken marsala.  Two words.......The Bomb.  One more word...Delicious!    Desert was strawberry shortcake and bread pudding.  The portion side of this dish was titanic.  I wasn't able to sink it though.  If I ever decide to go back I'tt definitely have to be with a crew or a small gang.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Awesome wall of photos

v66-qeHKsmtfjCBcY1B0rA.text: Every single time my husband's parents visits I know where we'll end up. We love the venue and their staff. We typically go to dinner with about 5 of us. Carmine's is known for their family size dishes. Reasonably priced and great place to people watch through the forum shops. A few must haves-chicken Park, garlic bread, and spaghetti meatball. Don't forget the tiramisu for dessert! Enjoy!

MNepF1Sr-nBEU4SigLZvcw.text: Wow they say family size but in reality it's a scam.  It's just double portion at double price  No menus which is absurd,  also porterhouse salmon are market price. Hey guys every other place in Vegas knows how much he meat cost.  Next sardines I hope you like your neighbor they pack it in  Learn to hear the word extra , how in the hell is pasta extra at $40 plate you should get pasta   The food was ok, I wouldn't recommend this at all  Go somewhere else

B3tmeUYET09UNyem6ahK8g.text: Wait staff was amazing, but the food. Oh my gosh. Incredible. We ordered 2 pastas for 4 people and had a crazy amount of left overs. I only tried the cheese ravioli, but it was by far the best ravioli I've had in Vegas. I will definitely be coming back for more!

8_1p7-y2nnOsGqcmciTnsA.text: This place has HUGE portions!  Really yummy food too!  It's great for big groups who plan to share.  The Lasagna was excellent and I loved the fried zucchini.

vQXOCvstm7-irM905mlfxw.text: Good food and ambience. No menus at the table though, u have to read it off the wall or look it up on your phone.  Don't come here with less then 4 people. The portions are huge and served family style. Each plate on the menu is ment to serve 4 to 6 people.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cold Antipasto appetizer

G_VXKSOrPGSiiOVvwDnz6A.text: Went here with my family and we all got food poisoning and we all ended up going to the hospital. It was awful. We will never come here again and the place was packed, so I know that there must have been others that got sick too, just not us!  We all ate the same thing, so that's how we know it was from here and the domino effect started quickly for each one of us after eating here. Not a good memory for us!  (i had to give it a one star cause it won't let you post review if you don't)

kJCI0QWfozkNZMpM613tgQ.text: Food was very good it feels like you are in a Italian family's kitchen...portions are very big tho... this place is perfect for a big group of ppl, we had the Diablo 2lb yes it was HUGE the cesar salad was huge to... friendly staff and you can have wadding party's here to...really nice place...

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

s6Au0HT7VxWhDcL1dMXMtg.text: I freaking love this place!!  The fact that there is one in Vegas now gives the West coast a piece of the sweet, amazing action now too!

lbh16zaAS2Zny9YvRWVU8A.text: A taste of NY in Vegas. Very welcome. Family style so take like-minded people with you as every entree serves at least 4. Love it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni with broccoli. Perfection

LJHtp9GUVTsRO8Q8fHC5Cw.text: It might be a little bit expensive, but I probably think that because I went here with just one other person. Carmine's is really a place that you shouldn't visit unless you have four or more people.  We ordered a salad with balsamic vinaigrette, strawberries, arugula, candied walnuts and much more. It was MASSIVE.  After that, we ordered a dish that had multiple types of meat in it such as chicken, sausage, and potatoes.  I would definitely come back here again I just need to be with more people so I can actually eat all of the food. Those two dishes cost about $100 with drinks.

lku_zZf5p58-z8plMAoQpA.text: Went to dinner with my guy friends and boyfriend after walking by the night before and getting a nose full of the amazing aroma wafting from inside. It smelled too good to be True! We had fried zucchini for an app and it arrived in a mountain! So much fried zucchini and incredibly delicious. The best fried zucchini I ever had! For dinner we had chicken saltimbocca and their Sunday night special of four pasta - gnocchi with pesto, ziti with meat sauce, veggie lasagna, and manicotti. Their meat sauce is HEAVENLY and the gnocchi was extremely fresh. We are way too much but left so so happy. Some of the best Italian I have ever had!!

dDodjgVmDqssaVT8BBkZYw.text: Second time here and I absolutely love this place. Family style restaurant with large portions to prove it. I swear one plate feeds two or three and we know how to eat... start off with some amazing bread a little bottle of wine and topped it off with some veil and lasagne!  Carl was super nice and suggested our  salad which was delicious! I will definitely come again! 0

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PgbskGwVn6yEj_T4FmkyqA.text: By far the best Italian food and service I have experienced this far. Had our daughters reception dinner here and I would highly recommend this establishment, 5 star food and service, great Job Team.

4e-grxujd-0W4WvHoc3VZw.text: I was in Vegas for the marathon 11/14 and chose this establishment for my pre race pasta meal. I made reservations (for 2) in Sept for 7PM and they called me 2x on Friday 11/13 to confirm. I arrived at the restaurant at 6:50 and was told there was a delay. At 7:45, I grew tired of waiting and being ignored by the      apathetic host staff and tracked down the manager who got me a table. Chicken parm was rubbery, but the rest of the meal was good, but can be found anywhere on the strip ( Maggianos, Spagos, etc) My recommendation is to go elsewhere, but if you must dine here, ask for Carl. He was an awesome and funny waiter.

daCON-0IRAVnlhSI2WgHvg.text: Garlic overload with everything! very disappointed. baked clams were almost unedible. we had the pasta special which was linguini carbonara and it was OK but again loaded with garlic. good Italian food doesn't overload you on garlic. there's better options in Vegas for Italian food.

DB9DmYccks0k7TEtHCbvqQ.text: I came here with my family during a business trip.  We had reservations and got in promptly, although traffic  was awful.  The service was extremely slow, taking over 45 min just to get our appetizer.  Once we got it, the stuffed mushrooms were very soggy and not very good for $18.  Our main course came about 30 min later.  The portions are very large, family style.  The food was average with soggy pasta and thin, rubbery chicken.  The sauce was very thin.  The whole meal took about 2 hours for three people.  If you're trying to feed a large group for a reasonable price, this might be ok but for a small family there are better, higher quality options for the money.

r_y8VQbR9m-je6XEE90_-A.text: I loved the style of the restaurant. It had a New York/ Mob style to it. It was beautiful..... I ordered the shrimp scampi and all the plates are for 2 or more people. ( they are huge portions) I also had a pineapple mojito and it was delicious! Will definitely be back because I want to try some more of their food....which sounded amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple mojito!!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi!!!

EZYhVIAI5x3JW5G4izm6tQ.text: Oh my goodness! Excellent food and even better service. All of the staff are wonderful and helpful but i would like to single out our server, Anthony Fabiano! Always there when we needed him! I couldn't ask for more! Well done Anthony and the rest of the Carmine's team! An extremely enjoyable experience.

5Q8f1-sGOd1lgVcHDZbBPg.text: Great dinner very pleasant place Good for big groups food is great!!!!! May be some of the best chicken I have I will try to copy this for sure

jKrqlXDa95IKLOfBS0ihmw.text: My spouse retired (finally!!!) and I brought him and seven friends to Carmine's to celebrate on October 8. Radu was our waiter and he was great. He gave us suggestions on what to order and was very attentive. The food and service were excellent. Radu made sure everything went smoothly and took excellent care of all eight of us. I will definitely go back to Carmine's.

a8Ng1Ku4Ty6vlCJf7_oznA.text: This was a great experience. If you're after pasta this place is highly recommended. Walked passed the place and stopped and went back when we saw the waiter serve one of the tables facing towards us. Nice basket of different bread as an appetizer. Love the one with tomato filling on top.   We had the meatballs with angel hair pasta for lunch. It was really good. Perfectly cooked pasta, juicy and tasty meatballs and a really tasty sauce with fresh herbs.  Friendly staff, good service, not to pushy.

fklOnKTvSTnEam5636XF1g.text: Food is exceptional. But how does a restaurant offer only 1/20th of their menu to parties of two? How do they basically eliminate that customer base? They have the food. They have the table space. But still refuse to offer their complete menu to parties of two, with appropriate portions. So so disappointed. With all the top quality Italian restaurants now in LV, I have to wonder how this decision still holds up. We didn't eat there, solely based on the fact that leftovers would go to waste. Thoughts Carmine's?

hOrSwYI_0Wb-xwPa3fvR0w.text: Good food, I have taken my guest from our of town, good service. I like the day that they have special sample pasta.

sq4cVbzIkH0XIHaKXcgZ2g.text: This was a first visit for all six of us. The portions are huge. We ordered two entries and a salad and had more than enough. The chicken Marsala was terrific. The chicken was very thin, the mushroom gravy was scrumptious. The spaghetti and meatballs was very moist and tasty. The sauce was very thick and flavorful. The anti pasta green salad was yummy, with a delicious dressing. Everyone was impressed and enjoyed the meal.

Yd8Ii_IV9O51bzo1BKVz0A.text: Amazing family style Italian. Very large portions -- the Carmine's salad, lasagna, and chicken parmigiana was actually too much for 6 of us! Our server - Zoran - was amazing. This was the best dining experience we had in Vegas. Amazing service, great value, delicious food.

0xIXiKiKgRf_F6ChPBmH2A.text: Great food, but the waitress/Bartender did NOT tell us they would charge us $12 just to add shrimp to our $18 entree. Also, my jack and coke was $10. Super high prices for add ons.  It's Vegas, of course, so they're looking to jack up the bill as high as possible, but $12 for two pieces of shrimp is outrageous.   If you just won a some money at the Blackjack table, go ahead and eat here. If you're down, however, you might want to make sure you know how much each item costs before ordering because they will sting you.

bFucPm26HdFQSrDsTRhtEA.text: We picked this place because it had good reviews.  We ordered off of the happy hour/bar menu. The first thing we had was the calamari, probably second worst I've ever had. It had not flavor and chewy.  They brought out our Italian cheesesteak and that too was below mediocre.  The bread was hard and I've had better at a mall food court.  Overall  bland.  The best thing on that plate was the Caesar salad side.  They also brought us fried ravioli to make up for the calamari and that was slightly better but, still was bland and favor less.  I requested bread for our meal and it came cold with no oil or butter.  Overall we will not be back.  On the plus side it was reasonably priced for dinner.

NybxfycbubAuSNWgjlifkw.text: Great restaurant for groups. Tasty food and very large portions. They are getting only three stars because our waiter tried to update us every time he came to the table. We were 2 adults, two teenagers and a senior and he recommended two appetizers, three main dishes. We would have had enough with one appetizer and one main dish. We had a ton of food left. Such a waste,". Not happy about that but food is delicious.

Jds6JbhTH4TlOEe_TTicxg.text: We had dinner at this Caesar's Palace Forum restaurant last Friday. It was packed; our party of four was seated in the back apparently banquet section of the cavernous dining room. It was very noisy with many large parties celebrating birthdays; we could barely hear each other. Food was served family style in large portions which tend to favor larger parties. We shared mixed green salad (fresh and tangy), Bolognese meat sauce pasta (noodle cooked right, meaty), Chicken Marsala (tender somewhat under seasoned chicken slices in over-abundant mushroom sauce), and Broccoli (quite garlicky healthy). It's a lot of food solidly-prepared as expected. Nothing exceptional stood out to be memorable.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xFc3TTU6ipfCUjEvVP5oHQ.text: I'm glad I finally got to try this place, but I won't go out of my way to return. We ordered the veal parmesan and lasagna; I like pasta with my chicken parmesan, so I assumed I would want it with veal parmesan as well. It came with 1 pound of pasta! Each entree was roughly $40 each. Not sure what the charge was for the side of pasta.  I don't generally eat meat, so, this was an indulgent treat for me. Sadly, I just was not that impressed with the veal or the lasagna. Both seemed to taste as if they included canned ingredients. Yes, they give you enormous portions, and claim that everything is served family style. However, I would rather have small to average size portions and good food over ginormous portions and not so great food.   Service was absolutely exceptional. Had to be the best service received during this visit to Las Vegas. I wish I remembered our servers name because she was outstanding!  Our bill came to just over $100 before tip. This is generally what we spend for dinner in Las Vegas, however, I would've rather had an indulgent dinner at Mastro's or the like.   When I'm in the mood for Italian food on the strip I'll stick with Maggiano's. At least there I know I'll leave satisfied.  Five stars for the service. However, I'm rating this place two stars overall because it was overpriced and just not that good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan - &#34;Meh&#34; I&#39;ve had better
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna - looks good, but &#34;meh&#34; I&#39;ve had better
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread Basket

8U64gHuFmhVU7iZbAlIdCg.text: Bread, Carmine's salad and fried zucchini were all delightful. We also had a spicy sausage, broccoli, penne with butter garlic sauce that was good as well. Definitely too much food for our party of four.   Our waitress wasn't what I expected. We consulted her on what we wanted in terms of a pasta dish. She was rather short and seemed a bit agitated. She certainly needs to polish her customer service skills. The place was rather loud which made understanding her soft tone, along with accent, difficult. The value compared to amount of food is worth it. Just wish we received better service. We will likely return.

gR_9SRZJIp7GsFUCZ6TQuQ.text: My husband and I came here during happy hour and had a few appetizers before going to a show.  We shared mussels, meatball sliders, and fried zucchini with a couple of Peroni beers.   The mussels tasted a little fishy.  The meatball sliders and fried zucchini were good.    Good service.

89J_UTAe_k8WbMp9L8S03g.text: I've been here twice now and the food has consistently been delicious. Made reservations in advance and was seated pretty quickly there after. Food is served family style and portions are massive.  Started out with the Caesar salad which was so big it was falling off of the plate. Because we were so stuffed from that and the basket of bread served beforehand, we only ordered one entree. The chicken Parmesan arrived and it seemed to overflow from the plate. The dish was crispy, and dripping with cheese and sauce.  Everything was seasoned well and delicious. My only complaints, and I am digging for them are the water cups are super tiny, so you're constantly refilling...and because it's crowded, it can be quite noisy. Like I said, I am digging for things to complain about. And a bonus feature is the restaurant has its own bathroom, so you do not have to venture outside to find it.   The food here tastes as good as it smells. If that's not a huge endorsement, I don't know what else is!

I4PAs-YXMoo_9NVKqtXkiA.text: Excellent place to go with family and pasta lovers, the Carmine's salad its the most tasty and juicy salad the garlic bread it wasn't that good it was very dark toast and hard to bite it, the calamari rings are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

AvyZfoiEhRKxM8SiCbn7xA.text: We had been to their NYC location last year.  Decided to try Las Vegas branch.  Had the shrimp Fra Diavolo and it was AMAZING.  We enjoy the hint of spice.  It had great big shrimp.  We did not even add pasta to it and enjoyed it even more without all the starch.  Calamari was great too.  Enjoyed wine.  Definitely a place to go to share a plate as they are very large servings.  Very friendly staff.  Great atmosphere.   Will go back.

DTiseAzGW6gkW5e9sf55IA.text: Great idea as shared dishes I highly recommended it for a group or people  more than 4 persons as the idea of the restaurant depends on sharing dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4QYUdYPpZ1E0su-WuK3g8g.text: It was our cousins 21st. We came in a huge group due to a birthday dinner my aunty provided. We were probably a group of 20+ they accommodated us so well! Food was good they even did the menu to the choices our family chose. The reason for 3 stars I'm not huge on pasta lol... But I felt at home and the food had a huge factor to that. If your a pasta eater by all means throw down! You'll be happy with this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RBTO7NlnIGYzwMMRMcII6w.text: Amazing restaurant we had a private event upstairs where Chef Michael prepared an array of yummy goodness! The environment and ambience is stunning. Must go!!!!  Everyone who served us that evening were so professional and prompt with our request. Love love love Carmine's at the Caesars palace!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dz1XSj7T9e0T_kJdaqMqZA.text: I did not like my experience at Carmines.  First, there was a party at the bar that kept crowding our table.  they were bumping in to our table, we had no room, nobody could walk down the isle.  I pointed it out to our waiter/bartender, who said sorry about that, but did nothing to fix the problem (which cost him his tip from me, so i hope they tipped well).  Then, because he was so focuses on this group at the bar, it was impossible to get his attention, i had to flag down someone else to go behind the bar and tell him i have been trying to flag him down.  it really soured me on the service.  I wish the food had been the redeeming experience of the evening, but it wasnt.  The Caesar salad had way too much anchovies, the fried zucchini was so salty it was barely edible, and both our pasta dishes had so much garlic that it was all we could taste.  I had been looking forward to eating there for a while, but the entire evening was a disappointment

k4VauqoSTXyR6hRwULxu9w.text: Amazing food! My friends and I went here before a concert. We ordered a salad and the prime rib special. Our meal was incredible. Allow for enough time to enjoy the food and the ambience. It's not cheap.. but great food rarely is.

3V0iHSskVamN7zlbe2m8cA.text: Ate here with a large group. The cheese ravioli was divine along with the tasty antipasto salad. Didn't love the super cheesy cheese bread but I'm not a fan of "too cheesy" food. Waiter was fast, efficient, and friendly. I'd go again with a large group.

WFDwh7JqSh7Lcn6zaVR6OQ.text: Excellent! Just excellent! It's hard to beat my Mother's meatballs but....shhh.... they did it ;). If you are in Vegas and want to have a chill, casual dinner after shopping at the Forum shops.. this is a great spot.

kaaRy9B_--iqNLyjPquRHA.text: What a meal. We thought we ordered too much when we included the 42oz steak with meatballs and chicken Florentine. No problem, we finished it all. The peppers and cold anti pasta didn't slow us down. The 7 of us left content.

TjZzNgjoMDqmg-2mt3jDVw.text: When our Italian friends who own a pasta company in NJ suggested we come here for dinner, I had to trust them! And boy did this place deliver a fine evening. The food is served family style, so coming with a group of six was perfect! Here's what we shared...  Bread Basket - It featured an assortment of three different breads with olive oil and butter to go with it. Two of the breads reminded me of focaccia - one with onions and the other with tomato. These were my favorites! They were light, fluffy and moist! The last Bread was one I didn't try, but hubby sure seemed to enjoy it!  Caesar Salad - Ever since giving birth two months ago, I have constantly craved the crunch of romaine. So this salad was particularly attractive to me. The croutons were huge, but there weren't too many to be overwhelming. There was just the right amount of dressing so that everything was covered without being soggy. A plate of three anchovies were served on the side. I think our moms were the only ones to indulge in those.   Shrimp in Red Sauce - I'm not a seafood fan at all, but I had to at least try this. The shrimp was quite firm and didn't have the unappealing fishy taste. And I really enjoyed the full sized cooked tomatoes that were in the sauce!  Veal Parmigiana - I've never had parmigiana in my life and I'm so glad I finally have! The crispy breading provided a nice texture with the melted mozzarella. I think this was the most flavorful of all the meats on the table.   Penne with Ragu - The meatballs in the ragu were probably the next most flavorful meat. The sausage and pork were a bit more simple and took a back seat to the delicious tomato sauce. And I was crazy for the past! It was cooked perfectly and seasoned perfectly.   What a wonderful evening of sharing with friends and family. This is such a great place for a special evening!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

isc2110R8xDX2oqiGRWeSA.text: This was delicious! We came with a rather large group, about 10 people that they easily sat in the middle of the restaurant.   The menus are on the walls, they do not pass them out so pack your glasses if you are near sighted. They do share a wine menu and cocktail list with the table so you do not have to squint to read the labels.   We ordered one Caesar salad to split for the table - absolutely plenty for 10 people. Then ordered two pastas and two meats for the table. Again absolutely plenty, there was even left overs. Listen to the server when they advise you on how much to order because they know better than you do, believe me.   The food was delicious! The wine was great and the atmosphere was lovely. It's a wonderful Italian restaurant that I would definitely suggest if you are looking for a place in Caesars.

3SYbXdim84He0AjE-GaowQ.text: Nice restaurant and the servers were very nice. Drinks weren't bad but the food was not worth it. Saw lots of reviews about how great the lasagna was and it was not any better then canned ravioli you get from the grocery store. If your looking for good Italian food your better off at Olive Garden.

Tw4NfX5b8KPS-180x-A6cg.text: This could have been a 5 Star review. The food was delicious, the service was wonderful, the environment was fun...this place has everything that you would want in a great Italian restaurant. The reason for 1 Star...the waiter over sold us and the management treated us like we just didn't matter. There is nothing worse than any restaurant not caring about what is right/wrong because they know they will always be busy. They are in an awesome location, full of people that come and go, and they don't need to worry about repeat business .  13 of us were there on Saturday night for a work function. Because this is a family style restaurant, and because we were not wanting to go home with leftovers, I had a plan of ordering about 4-5 dishes for the table to share. When it came time to order, I specifically asked the waiter if we had too much food in our order, and he said no, you actually should order 2 more dishes. I was very surprised at this recommendation, as I saw the portions coming out of the kitchen, but, he is the expert and I went with his suggestion. When our order came out, I couldn't believe he amount of food on the table!!!  Food was delicious, I can't take that away from them...but, how do you suggest more than what a table can possibly eat just to increase your bill and tip??!! We had 14 carry out containers when we were done eating!! Again, if we were going home, this would have been awesome, but, we were going back to hotel rooms and leaving in the morning. I asked the waiter why he steered us in this direction knowing that we could never possibly have eaten this amount of food. He simply stated that he wanted us to have a sample of each item. A SAMPLE??? These samples ran up our bill and were very unnecessary.  I asked him how many people does 1 dish serve, and he said 1 dish serves 3-4 people. We had 7 dishes, 2 salads, 1 appetizer for 13 people..you can do the math.  We asked him to take at least one of the dishes off of our bill, he refused. The waiter went to the manger, the manager never came to our table, and we paid the bill. As we were leaving, we found the manager ourselves. He was pompous, arrogant and flippant. This wasn't about money on our end. $30 isn't going to break the bank, it was about someone trying to raise the bill to get a bigger tip.  Very sad that this small amount (1-2 dishes costing $30 each) could not be removed and in the end, will cost them thousands. All of us at this table will tell our friends/family. Is this really worth that much to you??? I mean, let's get real...a box of rigatoni is .50cents..... I wish that I had photos of the food, it would have done this post justice. We boxed up everything, and  made bags for the homeless. The best part of this evening was people on the streets so happy to get FULL meals for their FAMILY ( bread, salad and 2 pastas) and not just a doggy bag for themselves.

o-nuTJyX3M22wVKFZmt3Rw.text: Holy Moly! Size does matter I guess this New York iconic place has found it way into my heart here in the heart of Vegas. With large portions and over the top type dishes I am wowed and glad to have this well know Italian Resturant in our awesome city.  If you are looking to feed lots of people with awesome family style food here it is. It is located in Caesars Palace's forum shop not too far from the valet which makes it quit convenient. The Resturant is just as big as the plate sizes. Nothing is small here.   Service was great. We had at least 4 servers with one gal being the main one. Just like any Italian dinner with a hundred coarse they were always changing our new plates for us in between each dish.   The Breezy Italian is a pretty good drink could be a little stronger though. With that said it not only looks good but it taste good. The app stuff mushrooms was good but for some reason mushy.....don't know what it was but I would've gone for something else. The garlic cheese bread was insanely huge and delicious with tons of melted cheese on top and buttery garlic toasted bread. The seafood pasta was awesome good red sauce with all kinds of seafood plus a whole lobster. Some items might have been slight chewy but non the less great. The Lemon Chicken dish was thin and tender, lemony and yummy smothered in a cream sauce and would go perfect with some linguini. The spaghetti and meat ball with big balls was very good as well.   Fun environment great prices for the amount of food you get and lots of delicious options. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone weather they are looking for a casual lunch or somewhat nice dinner without all the up tightness. Great place!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half of stuff mushroom good but mushy
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The breezy Italian vodka drink yum
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon chicken

vUE4RlU9vm5XC8IkPIq9JA.text: Ate at Carnines last year and made it a priority to eat here again on my trip to Vegas.  Hands down the best rigatoni and meatballs!   There were 3 of us and it was more than enough to feed all 3 of us.  Love this place!

rTlOTDo_AZnsblrhGax45w.text: I literally created a Yelp account solely to give Carmine's a review, and if I could give 10 stars I would! We just returned from Las Vegas and had our wedding reception at a private room in Carmine's (the Ritrivo room), and it was BEYOND our expectations. I worked with Kay Kolbo who was absolutely incredible. I am an attorney so am an admitted pain in the ass to deal with, but Kay was extremely responsive to my emails and questions ahead of time, and assured me that everything I asked for would be done. Kay allowed my Mom and other guests to drop off favors before the reception and Kay ensured that they were placed on everyone's seats before we arrived.   Kay also recommended an amazing DJ who everyone loved, and every single person who attended RAVED about the food. Carmine's pre-set menu options also give you plenty of variety to choose different types of food to serve your guests (since it is family style your guests do not select their own meal) and you literally cannot beat the price. I was also concerned about people having to wait a long time for drinks, but Kay assured me that she would not let that happen. She made sure there were at least three bartenders, and even put bottles of wine out on each table ahead of time to help minimize the bar lines - and not a single person had to wait for their drinks at any point in the night.   We had about 90 guests - almost all of whom traveled from Boston and are huge Red Sox fans. Kay made sure that game 5 of the world series would be on during our reception, and even after the Sox won and everyone went nuts - the staff at Carmine's was all for it! I was worried that we may be a bit too rowdy of a group to host a reception in a restaurant where other restaurant guests could clearly hear us outside our private room, but they made us feel like the absolute priority in the restaurant that evening and had fun alongside us. While I may be biased since it was my own wedding, every single person who attended said it was the best reception they have ever been to and we certainly have Carmine's to thank for that! I would HIGHLY recommend Carmine's - especially if you have the opportunity to work with Kay, as she will ensure that your wedding reception is exactly what you want it to be!!

lgzTIRlP1KgM3WF0VRJXaA.text: We had some family in town last week and of course they wanted to do the tourist thing and walk the Strip. A lot of the restaurants on the Strip are either super over priced or just not appropriate for a large(r) group. Carmine's is the perfect solution!   The food was delicious, portions were huge, service was amazing. Our server, Kellie, was super patient with our family & offered great suggestions. She was spot on describing the portion sizing & we all loved the wine she recommended. Even though the restaurant was fairly busy, we still felt like we were being taken care of.   Totally recommend this place. We will definitely bring visitors back here. I forgot to ask but I've also heard they have a good happy hour? So I can't wait to check that out!

cawu0sFVdqVvW7ATUG5WSQ.text: Two stars for service very good food needs to be desired. I'm a 100% Italian and never had food like this my grandmother would go back in that kitchen and smack those cooks with a wooden spoon. If you like bucca di beppo i think that's how you spell it you definitely like this  will never go back good job Carmine

yPSAEIufIavqHLZZrWuG9g.text: Had a reservation for a graduation party then got told we had to wait 35 mins we ended up going next door to the burger place and had a blast.

FjN2E8MtrAY6dzDZeKNrxg.text: The food and service are great! Family style so come with a few people and be ready to share. We had 4 of us ordered 3 things and still took leftovers back to our hotel. They made for a great midnight snack!

XV2_7EpdoajwDfjQKUCVwQ.text: Absolutely delicious Italian! Family style portion sizes. Ordered calamari, portabello mushroom salad and stuffed artichoke, all were absolutely amazing and we had so much leftover. Bring your appetite and enjoy!!!

EOTVkw25cqL7aehDFSTuKw.text: I used Carmine's for Catering. Julio set up the room and was very helpful and quick. The food was very good and would recommend it for Catering. I plan on visiting the restaurant in the future.

3llEOHuJx0JtW6TqEbV-sA.text: Great atmosphere.  Fried ravioli was a tasty substitute for fried mozzarella, which we were shocked was not on the menu.   The shrimp in white sauce with angel hair pasts was delicious.  I was expecting a white cream based sauce so when the dish arrived, I was concerned.  One taste and I was a fan!  The shrimp were huge.   Not at all a fan of family style.  Individual options would have allowed us to each select what we wanted.  Family style ONLY, forced us to compromise.  Of the whole menu there were only three dishes that worked for both of us.

riZ9eUtXn76WABOruMwC2Q.text: Celebrated a friend's birthday here last Wednesday night and all eight of us enjoyed our dinner.  Our server, Ron, was exceptional - he served each of us individually from the family-style portions, delighted us with stories, and was very attentive.    The eight of us shared:  Appetizer: Fried Zucchini Misti Salad with Fruit (strawberries & apples)  Entrees: Veal with Lemon & Butter Ragu Spaghetti Carbonara  Dessert: Titanic  Every dish was a delight.  Needless to say, we all left satisfied and sleepy.

lTQ9j9TOMqalSdnSYHy9PA.text: First time eating there was 2 days ago.  Amazing food!  Carmine's serves huge portions that will feed three people.  Delicious is an understatement.    We had the lasagna, and it melts in your mouth.  No joke.  Fantastic bolognese sauce made with veal.    Service was nicely attentive, and the manager dropped by to check on our experience. That was an added plus.  If you live in Las Vegas, ask about the local's discount.    A fellow local foodie recommended going, and we were not disappointed.  If you want great food, I personally recommend going to Carmine's before Scarpetta and Rao's.  I am looking forward to my next visit. This could be my go to place any time I'm on The Strip.

jNqMdlb2mV-88SIoi4C_Pw.text: This is a must if you ever visit Las Vegas great service great food  authentic Italian

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Phenomenal

dmdF8iCnuxK3xpMgxLtbvQ.text: Went here for dinner with the hubby. When we first walked in the hostess told us the portions were shareable portions so we were like okay well it's probably for 2 or 3 people. We got a lasagna because we were not sure of the portion size. Well the lasagna was delicious BUT that portion was for like 5 or 6 people. I'll definitely come back but with a bigger party so that we can try more than one item. If you don't eat much or are just going with one or 2 people I would recommend you stay in the area where they say they serve small portions and get your own plate. I also think the hostess should be more specific about the portions being very large portions recommended to be shared with 4+ people.

ahonKQNh2nz7hbuYcqDh5Q.text: Me and my 7 girls visited Carmine's on our trip to Vegas this week. Well I personally visited twice. The food was AMAZING. We did family style for the 8 of us and then 3 of us for happy hour the next day. I highly recommend the Chicken Parm and the spinach dip!  Our waiter/bartender experience was drastically different.  The waiter was nice at first. Then my cousin ask him if he knew he looked like John Cena, he proceeded to tell us how he gets asked 10 times a day and it's annoying.  He went on to tell us he would never say that to someone or approach a celebrity in a restaurant. He also told us a story about how he used to work with him.  True or not. Just take the compliment and move on. Then we tried to talk about dessert and he told me I wouldn't like the strawberry shortcake because I was from the south and it's not the same. We talked more and he said the bread pudding was 'ok'. We decided to leave with no dessert. The bartender was a completely different experience. He was so nice and attentive. Didn't change the TV when asked because we were watching the game. We were there for happy hour but we asked him about the desserts and he was very complimentary. Go for the amazing food and drinks...just don't ask 'John' who he looks like.

8-yQtz0OKlX0bEZepOKj8A.text: We came to eat here on Valentine's Day and it was amazing. We sat in the bar area but it wasn't lacking. The food is amazing and seafood is so fresh! Service was great! If your visiting Vegas this is a MUST! (Don't forget to tip your waiter they work hard and are half of the reason why a restaurant is so good)!!!!!

zGCaTrT1QSbkmznDFGca4Q.text: This Italian restaurant is located inside Caesars Palace and it is absolutely incredible! They do family size dinners so we ordered a pasta and their chicken Parmesan and still had lots of left overs (there was 5 of us). We also ordered 2 bottles of wine and their fried calamari (definitely recommend). Our waiter was so nice and helpful, I forgot his name, but he made the experience even better. You definitely should try this place if you're in Vegas, you will not be disappointed!

DkO_ecBMlNff_jGyGIZWqw.text: Excellent can't believe we never are there , sauce was very good and pasta was cooked just right . The sausage was very tender , can't wait to go back

8gfzTOvzNk6OeCCQfniODw.text: Dinner was amazing we had a party of 17. Food was excellent service was great everyone had a fantastic time!

SDKnUCzifXbSMk7UBlbNHw.text: Just like the one in NYC!!!  Wife & I were thrilled to come across it and they once again did not dissappoint. We sat at the bar and Jimmy took excellent care of us.  Had food for a midnight snack and breakfast the next day!  Portion sizes are gigantic! Beware of that.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The bar

6NL7e-NXD3GW35nMwmbolg.text: This place is great! Our server was attentive and friendly. I must warn you that this place is a family style restaurant so your portions are meant to be shared so order wisely these folks dont mess around with their portions.

y8liWXmSx2CUHjUJJplqPw.text: Go hungry! Huge portions, tasty and service was amazing. Our waiter looked just like Zack Galafanakas and gave us amazing suggestions. We will definitely return. Priced reasonably.

osJgPgez5RzR53hvEavMMw.text: My girlfriend and I came to Carmine's in Caesars palace looking for some good Italian pasta. At first we were shocked at the prices, but the server assured us that the portions of food are meant for 3-4 people, which indeed they were. We received a basket of assorted bread as we waited for the spaghetti and meatballs that we ordered, but the bread was unappetizingly cold and rather unsatisfying to the palate. The pasta came out within an acceptable time frame, and the pasta was served to us from the family size platter into individual plates. The pasta was very very salty. Indeed if you enjoy strongly salty pasta this is the restaurant and dish for you. I, however, left with lips slightly puffed from excess sodium absorption.   I will be giving our leftover pasta to the first homeless person we meet on the strip. I hope for his sake that he has access to a lot of clean drinking water.  Overall, I expected better food from a restaurant that received such high ratings on yelp.

rhfmfU9ZF1T1zJl--dVs5A.text: Very mid-range Italian food that is edible. No awards, but no food hang over. Part I didn't like is there was only two of us. After dinner was over I commented to the waitress that I wish they had half orders because the plates of food were so big, we ended up throwing half of it way. Her reply was " didn't the hostess tell you if you ate at the bar area smaller portions are available ?? No, and neither did you when you came to get our order. What a good feeling to pay for big portions that go to waste. We also got served white wine at room temperature that we had to have replaced. No attention to detail.

U3MomuP1lNnVUclIQ1cdTw.text: 0 stars.  Huge disappointment.  Father in law was always talking about wanting to try this place since couple months ago and was waiting for Carmines to open.  We dined here last weekend and our experience with both food and service was horrid!  Our server never came back to ask if we needed anything else once our meals came out.  Our pasta dish was undercooked.  The clam pasta tasted extremely bland and tasteless.  The meat sauce was boring.  It took 15 minutes and asking 3 different people before we got a basket of bread.  My in laws were so fed up with the slow service and horrible food.  What's going on Carmines???  We will not ever return.

8dDuytQiFGLfAR4EWH3Uwg.text: We held our Bachelor party dinner here for 25 people.  We were able to get a private room, by booking early with Stephanie.  I have to say that she made everything for our event nice and easy.  Before I start with the food I have to say that our server Michael was amazing he took care of all of our needs and we couldn't have asked for anything more.  The family style servings are great and come with large portions. All the food we ordered was excellent but the items that really stood out were the fried calamari, manicotti, and cannoli.  Thank you to everyone at Carmine's for making our night very special.

ofxFLF_UdVuiAIoufGSLIA.text: After much discussion with waitress and two others in my party, ordered zuppa di clams, shrimp fra diavolo and calamari in white sauce over penne.   Waitress told us all food is made to order, isn't it usually?  Couldn't just order the caponata, though, would have to get other cold antipasto items I don't eat. So much for "made to order". Couldn't get baked clams either since they have cheese in them (premade?) and am allergic to cheese.   Clams were ok; got more onion focaccia for dunking in broth.  Shrimp were ok. Maybe 15 average size shrimp. Not rubbery. Brought out wrong pasta dish, had clams instead of calamari. Replaced it in reasonable time.    Food wasn't as bad as it could have been, just wasn't special. Took too much effort to find dishes that three people wanted to share, rather than a lot of dishes which we could all taste.  Also, restaurant needs to have smaller tables.  We were originally shown to a table for six (!), but convinced hostess that a booth for 2 (?) would be more comfortable and conducive to conversation.  Everything is large portions; pasta can be bought in supermarket for $.99/lb.  Only thing that is not large portion is glass of wine.  Not served in a wine glass, but in a small drinking glass.  Family style like this was trendy in late 1980's.  Now people would like a small taste of a lot of dishes rather than find a few upon which everyone agrees.  More isn't better, it is just more.

Qf6z6i6NU9TYI5YGxrHuIA.text: My experience at Carmine's was pretty good. The service was on point. Our drinks were always refilled without having to flag anyone over. I recommend the chicken  parm. It was really delicious! The waiter was knowledgeable of the menu and helped us pick out our entrees, took the time to explain everything. The vibe inside the restaurant was good too. Everyone was smiling and having a good time.

hHBHLgrEnAxknYjeWHEcBQ.text: Had a great time with our group... NCA... National Concierge Association... Lunch was wonderful... Ambience was clean, colorful and service was excellent...

xt7dgvgDG0gAGhGpWENGsw.text: Had a great time! This is a family style restaurant and there was only two of us so we sat at the bar. We got lucky because it was happy hour! So we ordered off the happy hour menu and got a cheese steak sandwich with a ceasar salad. the salad was amazing!! The service was also great. She was so friendly and funny! Love this place!

9LhYibJ7lATo6CawzGMD1w.text: Having been to Carmine's in NYC we knew what to expect in the way of portion size and the general menu. Carmine's salad was very good the veal parmigiana and the rigatoni with proscuitto were just ok. Veal a little overdone and the rigatoni was the same as any mediocore Italian place serves in NY. And what's with the glasses? Small glass for water (Vegas, Dry, Hot) same small glass for wine. I know that is how it is served in Italy but dude this is Nevada. Capisce?

F_l6PVfLmZgBAzPXqPee6Q.text: Everyone said the portions were huge and for sharing but who knew they were the size of Mac truck.  Unless you live in the local area and can take food home, you really want to go with at least four people.  We ordered a salad that could have easily fed four.  As it was we ate what we could and left the rest.  It was a Ceasar salad and the waiter asked if we wanted anchovies in the salad on the side or not at all which was nice.  For our main course we ordered seafood pasta.  Again we had a choice of what type of pasta we wanted and there were several.  The seafood consisted of clams in the shell, mussels, lobster, and calamari rings.  There was a choice of white or red sauce for the pasta.  We got the white which turned out to be a very light and taste wine, garlic, herb sauce which was wonderful and made good use of the basket of bread we had on the table.  While the price seems high at first glance,, the reality is that when you consider how many people one entree can feed it's not.  Our total bill including my wine was $97 and as I said we could have fed more people.  If you too four people you could get two entrees and everyone would leave full and probably have left overs.  We would have loved to try dessert but alas, we had no room left,

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The portions are huge and can easily feed more than two

U3cDHj0okJCM7eYBLnZ-9g.text: The idea is fun and the atmosphere is very Maggiano's like (kinda of homey italian feel).   Their pasta portion size is big.  One pasta dish (around $30) serves about 4, and since we had a party of 5 the waiter recommended a salad with a past.  Knowing that we are going to need some left over we decided to get two pasta dishes.  We got the ragu with the three types of meat and this other vegetarian one.  To be honest, if the pasta was not so salty it may deserve a 3 or 4 star.  But oh my god, I have no idea who put that ridiculous amount of salt in the pasta, but I was drinking a cup of water for every bite of pasta.    I definitely do not recommend this place considering how salty the pasta is.  Not worth it.

STbF8jk4E1s2qVgvYXlpdw.text: Stumbled upon this restaurant while doing some shopping at The Forum shops. Kids were hungry so we have it a try. The Ragu with Rigatoni was so good. Don't think I've ever had a meatball so tender and tasty. Portions are huge and an app and an entree could easily feed 4-5 adults. Our Server (Jeff) was very helpful and knowledgable with great suggestions. The whole staff from server assistants to management were very friendly and always there to answer any questions. Highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ready to eat!

ynMzh8xoowN3YCT_bwR7Zg.text: HUGE portions!! The server Paul was fabulous!! Definitely try when u have a large group, food was awesome!

yRKF9RnmzEW-l65TKx0xvg.text: As a big fan of their Bahamas location I was excited for Carmine's to open in Las Vegas but to my surprise it was a huge disappointment! :(  Service was horrible (waiter took our order and pretty much forgot about us) and the dishes are cooked better in the Bahamas. Listed below is what our meal entailed: (Hope it helps)  Calamari: The best dish of the night.   Carmine's Salad: Don't waste your money on this. The salad tasted bitter.   Beef Tenderloin: This was their Thursday special but don't waste your $79.99 because there is nothing special about this plate. It took over an hour to come out and it looks like a lot of meat but in actuality they stuff the plate with a lot of potatoes and layer the beef on top. It was dry and unsatisfying.  Vodka Pasta: Good dish nothing to rave about.   I recommend if you want to eat at Carmine's book a trip to Atlantis!! :)

zWg9zrPitDd3WSlI8z7VRQ.text: Nice Italian atmosphere, delicious meal and large portions..   Bring the troops, with their appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QmQysS5sL8wPJWDxPK5HBg.text: The serving size is huge, it's served family style and definitely fills 3-5 people depending on how hungry you and the family are. I went with my parents and we order calamari and rigatoni with red sauce and sausage and definitely had to take home both. It was a great experience, minus getting up to see the menus on the walls I loved it! The service was excellent and food was delicious!

PB98lCgTrsLcyCb2Ik8uLg.text: Food was great, enormous portions so don't go just for 1 person. Larger the family the better. Service excellent as well. The special (pollo alla Romano) was a bit pricey but well worth it.

GghEliNMIkYJmd0A_H6rPQ.text: Really getting off to a bad start here.  Arrived to dine at Carmine's at Caesar's Palace and its a bustling place.  Since I'm by myself tonite, seated at bar high-tips.  Apparently normal tables are reserved for two or more and feature family-sized meals.  I'm ok with that.  Reviewing menu, got my eye on Veal Scallopini.  Turns out menu is -completely- a la carte.  Server lets me know the Scallopini comes "without mushrooms or pasta". I am like WTH?!  Any self respecting Italian diner would never serve just the cooked veal by itself.  But, hey, this isn't Italy, or NYC...it's Caesar's and apparently the owners of this joint shredded the home country cook book long ago.  Seems Prices here are nosebleed as adding simple pasta to my $44 Veal costs an extra $12.  I did notice most of their bottled wines are roughly two to thee times retail but I settled in a nice Sebastian Merlot to accompany dinner; bought the whole bottle to save money.  Then to top it off they don't serve wine with wine glasses.  Instead they use small cocktail glasses that would normally be used for drinking Grappa or Vodka but apparently is more traditional in Italy.  Portion of Veal arrives on pasta and spinach, as requested, but it's a huge portion.  Overall taste was very basic and bland.  Hardly any spice or flavor.  Normal mushroom cream sauce is noticeably absent.  Noodles were buttery but not "al-dente".  All the other menu items are priced as whole-table portions so for a desert of Tiramisu, expect to pay $45 for a big portion.  Overall this restaurant plays on the Italian lineage of NYC but the service was slow, wait staff impatient, and quality and taste of food marginal.  Good thing this place is in Caesars, where people are literally begging to throw their money away.  That promises a never ending stream of non-discerning customers.

4-EXZtDA5WbzXnA3Q1GQQA.text: We have been here several times over the last 10 year's. This year we had an 8 pm reservation and when we arrived early the "hostess" said the bar and high tops have smaller portions so we said we would like a high top. She said take a seat at the bar and we will let you know when the next one is available. We sat and had a cocktail and then watched a couple walk in and take a high top. I approached the "hostess" and she said oh no it's first come first served, I said that is not what you said, well I guess the manager overheard and they seated us at the next opening.  Servers were overwhelmed and had to ask 3 times for bread and we were sold on a side of pasta with olive oil and roasted garlic.  It came out just plain.  Never again for $200 for 2 people, not what it once was

Nh7unAlipRs34Tb50Y-acQ.text: Carmine's has become our favorite place in Vegas. The atmosphere, amazing food and exceptional service keeps us coming back for more! Anthony, our bartender and server, has made our dining experiences very enjoyable!  See you again in a few months!

Fuf7rAiK7eyvSCYVO9rKCA.text: I saw the reviews  and made my reservation, however we were very disappointed. They offer only two dressings, ceasar and house Italian. The ceasar had way too much anchovy, it was nasty. The house was very vinegary. Ordered lasagna for 3 people, it was ok in flavor, lacked mozzarella cheese seemed non existant. Our lasagna was cold in places- we didn't complain. The bread was also cold, they didn't bring butter had to ask. Thought it was a fluke asked for more bread second basket was also refrigerator cold. My lemon drop martini was excellent. Portions are large. Save your money and go else where.

t81zKsyArxec9RMu39UuYQ.text: When they say family style they mean that. Each entree was huge. It worked to order a few different plates and then we were all able to try it all. We did the porterhouse which was huge and cooked perfectly! The shrimp scampi with penne pasta was also really good. Had perfect flavor and enough flavor to cover the pasta with great flavor. Also ordered the lasagna and that serving was also huge and really good. It came with beef and veal in the meat sauce.   Our server was really nice and honest about the dishes. She was attentive and made sure we had our drinks and water in the table.   This place was a great pick for dinner even though it was a pretty nice walk from our hotel. We did make a reservation, not sure if it was necessary but didn't want to chance it and nit be able to get in when we got there.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp scampi with penne
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porter house steak medium rare

gqNsShdffqnArCSoyXJSCw.text: If you're not dining with at least 3 other people, Eat in the bar area. The food is outstanding, but the main dining room is served family style only, in HUGE portions. We really loved the muscles in red sauce! Amazing!

LNMN-BS_4ucdhXHhkbNawA.text: As I pondered what I really wanted for dinner out after Diane would return from playing poker, I pretty quickly decided that it had to be "Sausage & Peppers".  Putting in that search term on Yelp, I looked for where I could find a great rendition of this Italian staple.  And the best reviewed dish seemed to be at Carmine's, where I recalled I had enjoyed this once before.  A color photo of this entree, which happened to include onions as well, sealed the deal for me.  So when Diane returned, off we went to the Strip on a busy Friday night for me to satisfy my craving.  Even though Carmine's serves platters family style, neither Diane nor I cared what the cost or overage would be.  We could always bring home leftovers.  After finally reaching valet parking at Caesar's Colosseum, we strolled on over to Carmine's inside the Forum Shops, and secured a table for two at 10:15 p.m.  The place at this late hour was still 2/3 full.  Supplied with a table for four looking right onto the mall walkway, we were ready to get down to some serious eating.  And so we did.  To get things started I ordered a Caesar Salad, which arrived with enough Romaine Lettuce to feed six diners.  At our server's suggestion, I ordered it with light dressing, and extra dressing on the side, so leftover salad would not get too soggy.  But, alas, the extra dressing was not forthcoming.  So, I had to ask for it again, meanwhile masticating very thinly dressed leaves and a few croutons.  Finally the extra dressing arrived.  It was thick and viscous, and when ladled on the great expanse of lettuce leaves made all the difference in taste.  Strips of Mozzarella Cheese and an ample supply of nicely seasoned croutons in cube shape also contributed to an authentic and well-flavored Caesar Salad.  When ordering my entree of Sausage, Peppers & Onions, I sought to augment it with still more ingredients.  First were Roasted Potatoes, but this was changed to a side of Contadina Potatoes when Diane decided that she wanted them to go with her Veal Marsala without mushrooms, too.  Then I imagined the Red and Green Roasted Peppers mixing with Penne.  So an order for Penne was placed.  When separate platters of Sausage, Onions, & Peppers; Contadina Potatoes; and Penne arrived and were conjoined by me, I decided that something was still missing to meld everything well together.  I tried to put my finger on the absent ingredient, and soon came up with the solution.  It was Marinara Sauce!  So I asked an attentive busboy for some Marinara Sauce.  He said he would check with our server to see if an extra charge applied, and I replied, "It doesn't matter.  Just bring it."  (Ultimately I was not charged for this.)  When a hot bowl of wonderful mild Marinara Sauce soon arrived and was mixed with the Sausage, well-roasted Green and Red Peppers, nicely sweated White Onions, and memorable Roasted Potatoes, it was just the thing to make my entree whole.  An hour later I had consumed half of the platter of salad, and a little over half of the Sausage, Peppers, & Onions; while Diane was able to polish off five of seven scallops of veal overlaid with delectable Marsala Sauce.  Together we also ate most of the Penne, and consumed all of the potatoes.  I gladly paid a bill of over $150 for two, and didn't mind.  For, all of the food obtained would have comfortably served six, and I finished off a quarter more of the salad and all the rest of the Sausage, Onions, & Peppers at next day's lunch.   While the hostess and managers were friendly, and our busboy fairly attentive, our sever was not.  Besides forgetting to bring the extra salad dressing, he only asked if I wanted any more Iced Tea once, just as I was looking around to request that of him late in the meal.  So I was only furnished with two Iced Teas in the space of 90 minutes.  And then after asking our waiter if he could box up the unused Caesar Dressing to go with the salad, he said, "Sure!"  But when we arrived home, no such dressing was in our to go bag.  He also had a habit of referring to me repeatedly as "Buddy" when I am silver haired and likely more than twice his age, which I thought was not very professional or appropriate.  So, while the food was again five-star worthy in quality and taste, the inattentive wait-service this time lost a star.  What was promised was not always delivered.  I will still return, because the service was exemplary the other two times I have dined here, and the cooking here is first-rate.

PVoRo0QJPW7eUeidlkU6nQ.text: The service was okay for a fast place environment,  what was the worst is that our party of 4 people got food poisoning right after we finished our meal, one by one start running to the bathroom right after leaving the restaurant,  ( thank God our flight was delayed a few hours so we didn't have to make a scene on the plane. We called the restaurant right away and talked to the manager about the situation but he was really dismissive and not intrested in what we had to eat, we try to explain we dont want nothing more than him to check the food that we had ( seafood and veal) to make sure other people dont get sick... he couldn't care less and keep telling us he's gonna call us back.  Very disappointing

q_iSZ2UrpXaU2SnWyzzLcg.text: We had our Thanksgiving dinner here. Had Christmas dinner here... We love Carmine's in Vegas or NYC. With our reservation we didn't have to wait long, got a nice round table closer to the entrance. I think we had the same table last Christmas! Ordered linguini vongole and calamari and veal spinach. Had chianti type red wine. Food and atmosphere here is always super good. Calamari was excellently fried crisp without oil taste! But the clams in vongole were the best! Not fully cooked or too small. It was better than I had in Maine seashores. Thanksgiving turkey in other table looked super delicious also.

gxC3wujypK9vREIMj7f74g.text: Happy Hour Times: 2pm-6pm AND 9:30pm - close Happy Hour Specials: $8-11 food, $5-7 drinks  Walking in, this place looks like one of those family friendly Italian places. It can be a little overwhelming but if you're here for Happy Hour, head straight to the bar area. The bar is huge so there's plenty of room but there are also high top tables in the same area but not attached to the bar for some privacy.   We came in after a concert and were starving so we were delighted to find out there was a late night happy hour. We ordered quite a few things but the ones that stood out to me the most was the Mussels in Red Sauce and the Fried Calamari. The sauce with the mussels went great with the garlic bread but I would have really preferred it without the melted cheese on top.   As the waiters brought out food for other tables, the portions looked HUGE. Next time, I'd definitely come back with more people during happy hour so we can enjoy those specials AND order some of the larger dishes.
