Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HJN3l9iWjIpnDMohUVXYwA.text: Amazing food, great prices, friendly staff, welcoming environment, beautiful ambience, fair prices, definitely recommend! Our waitress Alycia was super pleasant and accommodating.

NAkWWBhv_3bkuu99lImf4g.text: The place serves great tasting pasta- Southern Italian style. Our large clan met up here for Thanksgiving dinner.   Let me start with the pasta first. The shrimp scampi with spaghatenni/angel hair pasta noodles is terrific. The perfect garlicky dish with fluffy great tasting pasta and jumbo fresh shrimp. For sides, we had deliciously prepared mashed potatoes, steamed carrots, brussel sprouts, and green string  beans. Ok, the specially prepared turkey was juicy and moist.   The bar service, table service, and the basket of breads receive positive marks from me. This place is memorably very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special Thanksgiving meal...superb!!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GdQFoQYaNEhD-NkLgJJQXw.text: I've been mulling over what to really say about Carmine's. I really wanted to like this place. Everything told me I should.   Located kind of around the fountain at Ceaser's Palace, this place is hard to miss. It's surrounded by an air of sophistication & a sort of simpler elegance.   I entered Carmine's due to a wedding (the reception celebratory dinner was held here). Upon entering I was engulfed immediately with the atmosphere. It has an aroma that embraces the era where men retired to the den with a glass of scotch and a cigar. I loved the amount of wood and the fact that the menu was plastered every wall. You'll pretty much choose what you eat before you even sit down.   We got sat in the back room and had a pre-fixed menu. The table was pre set with a sampler bread basket and waters in front of us. The assortment of bread was odd and many of the flavors left a sour taste in my mouth. Oh well, you can't complain about complimentary bread.   To start, we were given an enormous platter of calamari and ceaser. The abundance of the two starters alone was overwhelming. If you come, I recommend sharing a plate rather than order one for oneself. Trust me. Unless you're a competitive eater, or just have an insatiable appetite, you won't finish.   The calamari batter was was overly salty and I found myself drinking more to quench my thirst.  The ceaser salad, it was probably the best part of the meal, sadly. However, it still was too much for me. It was overly dressed and the dressing had an odd taste to it.  The gluten free vodka pasta made me feel so horribly for everyone that has a gluten allergy. The sauce lacked all flavor and the pasta itself? Odd. Just odd. The shrimp with wine sauce was horrendously oily and ended up making me feel so nauseas I couldn't even try the other dishes. To much of my dismay, the dishes that followed looked more appetizing and were raved about. Ugh. Such a shame.  Overall? I loved the atmosphere and the service was on par to what I expect Vegas service to be. However, the food left much to be desired. I would've much rather liked to go to the Cheesecake Factory that was nearby.

uh4dU_zYWbVSOBz3Ca7BBg.text: Where do I start? My best friend held her wedding ceremony and reception here. First off the restaurant is beautiful and has this vintage 1920's aesthetics. The ceremony was held on the upstairs balcony  which provided a great backdrop of the strip lights of Las Vegas. For dinner the wait staff was amazing! Mia was very helpful and kept our drinks filled. Everyone was great. After the wedding Mia even walked us through the shops for a short cut to the Uber pick up spot. The salad that came out first with warm bread was amazing. My favorite was the fried zucchini. I could not stop eating them, everyone felt the same way as well. The spaghetti was out of this world. I never knew spaghetti could be so delicious.  The steak was cooked to perfection, tender, and moist. The portions are huge and can be great for all  size groups. This is a great place for date night or family gatherings.

hMxlvjxgtJa9Y3V2UbNW7g.text: First time during Vegas! Noisyplace, old italian nostalgic ambience. Nice bar area. We have a Party of 15! Let's see how the food and service goes! Man, this is family style! Large plates!  There was lots of food and Barolo wine tonight - fried Calamarie 5/5, fresh and Crispy - Seafood Master platter! Becareful with Lobster quality, shrimp was rubbery, Clams nice. 3/5 - beef sliced 4/5 - meetballs 4/5 - desserts cheesecake 3/5, other 4/5 - steam vege 4/5 - spaghetti Bolongness 4/5ppp

QjZYzx8OXkTxkQZ0pkIuuQ.text: Carmine's is one of my favorite restaurants, and it never disappoints.  We were in Las Vegas last week and made sure to make reservations before going to a show Friday evening.  All entrees are family style, so our party of 4 ordered 2 entrees and a salad.  It was more than enough!  My favorite is the Chicken Scalloppini.  We had them serve it over angel hair pasta (slight upcharge), and it was phenomenal.  We also had another dish with red sauce, sausage meatballs, and angel hair. (can't remember the name of this entree)  It was excellent as well.  The Carmine's salad is huge, with lots of lettuce, tomatoes, chopped up meats, etc. all tossed in home-made Italian dressing.  If you're in the mood for traditional Italian food, then Carmine's is a great option.  We first ate there in NYC a few years back, and we make sure to visit whenever we're in a city that has one.  I wish they'd open a Carmine's somewhere in the south!!!

oZ9540fXYxzgLqHZ33NrUA.text: I do not reccomend this restaurant for couples. We decided to skip our favorite italian restaurant in Vegas, Wolfgang Pucks Lupo, and give Carmines a try this time. We thought we might be missing out on something really good but it turns out we weren't missing anything at all.   We had a reservation and when we arrived the hostess told us we could not sit in the dining room unless we order from the family style menu. We said we didn't want family style because it was just the two of us and so they told us we could only eat in the bar area. That is total crap and very unprofessional. Our reservation was basically pointless. We were sat at a high top in the bar and given a menu that had half the selection the family style menu had and therefore we couldn't order what we had originally intended because our choices were limited. We were served by the bartender who was not very attentive because he had other patrons at the bar. By the way, their menu items have no descriptions whatsoever. For example, the menu just says "ravioli." Is this cheese filled ravioli? Meat filled ravioli? What kind of sauce comes on it? Do the entrees come with a side salad? Do they come with bread? These are all questions we had to ask. I've never seen such a non-descriptive menu before. We ordered the "fried zucchini" and ended up sending it back because it came with no sauce, and was shoestring style. Again, there was no description on the menu so we didn't know what to expect. We would not have ordered if we had known it was shoestring zucchini.   I ordered the cheese ravioli which was drowning in sauce. There was so much sauce left over you could have filled two measuring cups. My husband ordered the bolognese which the cooks screwed up and made the family style portion by mistake (oops! could have eaten in the dining room then!) While they did not charge us for the extra large portion it was a HUGE waste of food because obviously he couldn't finish it all and we had no where to store it in our hotel room.   We could have eaten at Lupo for the same price with better food and service. The only reason we stayed and ordered was because we had a show to catch and didn't have time to go somewhere else. Total crap experience and will never come back.

2U150Gd4ighqV_kGFOcWhw.text: My wife and I have been wanting to try this place for years. We were instructed to sit at the bar area to get smaller portions, we are glad we did! We ordered the Caesar salad and spaghetti and meatballs. The salad came out and was a heaping pile, the smaller portion of pasta was three big meatballs and a giant plate of spaghetti. The food was delicate and delicious. Watching full size portions come out to the main dining room made me glad we sat in the bar.

sw9KiUbG4hC0fWZhv4F9-g.text: Food and service was great. We got the Penne Alla Vodka and the Shrimp Marinara with Linguine. The portions are huge. There were 4 of us and we could have easily split the Penne pasta 4 ways. Delicious overall!

kMQYTEDvkrb612WT-nSRBw.text: Carmine's was amazing! The food was excellent and the portions were huge. The best part was the service! Our server Ron was so kind, energetic, and knowledgeable. He knew the history of the restaurant and was able to give is a backstory for every part of our dining experience. I can't wait to go back again!

8F2X4dlM5W7kz2ItSb-X7Q.text: This place is GREAT! Feels like being in Italy! Food is Italian authentic. Large family portions worth the price. I have had several dishes and have been extremely pleased with ALL of them! A MUST try!  Waiter "BAKER"is the best!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Scarparello YUM!!!!

FgLJv-GxbUPTSZF6qalFCg.text: Worst service ever... as my family and I literally sat there watching every table have ice water poured for everyone but us... one would think that we were singled out. Tried not to let it bother me... then our food was dropped off without a word from the server. I usually bring friends and family here all the time... never again! The food was not great either... less noodles than before and our lasagna literally had the top few layers slid off onto the bottom of the oval bowl. I am so disappointed.  If your server is Martin and you want a positive experience,  ask for another server...

WAmg7PXw297lgTEnpUVsOQ.text: I love this place for the Meatball Sliders at the bar during happy hour. ALSO the Wings are amazing!!! Havent had the chance for the restaurant side of the menu yet but i look forward to it!!

4UC3SnnHb26AEihf1ogSNQ.text: Great atmosphere, food, and staff. Feels like a real Italian family restaurant- although located in Caesar's shopping mall. Best lasagna I have had in a very long time. Good prices and American type portions. Worth a visit

U1SdtP0ZVq7xERdadZv8Yg.text: Carmine's is now a favorite eatery in Vegas. After a day of shopping at The Forum inside Caesar's Palace, I needed something light, but satisfying to eat. I noticed Carmine's "Happy Hour" sign in front of the restaurant. Happy Hour at Carmine's?  A no brainier. I went inside with shopping bags in tow. The happy hour menu is offered between 12-5 pm with several food options including a breaded eggplant "roll", fried calamari, Parmesan garlic bread,  steamed mussels in tomato sauce and meatball sliders. The drink offerings were one red and one white vino selection, one beer selection, margarita and martini selection. I chose the eggplant and red wine selection, which was, in my opinion, similar to a Cabernet Sauvignon, full-bodied with a peppery finish.   My bartender was so kind, I forgot his name, and very accommodating. The bartender noticed that the server brought me the wrong order, so he immediately had him send it back to the kitchen After glimpse of the food and smelling sheer deliciousness of the "wrong plate", I decided I would take it since it was already prepared. By this this time the server was headed to the kitchen. He, the bartender, raced to the kitchen to grab the meal and brought it out to me. I really appreciate the effort. Not only that, the meal was DELICIOUS. I'm glad the server initially brought it out because I never would have been able to experience this awesome dish otherwise. I was very happy.

WemXABGF1U96Lr8Dd2pV1g.text: Food:  tasty and fresh family-style Italian dishes.  I love the house salad and linguini with calamari or clams.  Their cold meat sandwich is also a favorite.  Service:  is professional, prompt, and courteous.  They check in and do plate checks often.  Ambiance:  is classy, on the active/loud side, with good old time music, and clean.  Value:  they can be steep depending on your group size.  2-3 people can spend $80-$90 without alcohol.

jHKY2_wEY9u6R-X-g8BVuw.text: I came here with my boyfriend and his family for lunch. They had tried this place on their last visit and mentioned to me how good it was. We had the porterhouse medium done (it was a big dish with porterhouse steak cut in small slices, potatoes, sausages and red & green bell peppers) and rigatoni pasta. We had a group of 6 people. Everything here is family style. The food was definitely amazing. The porterhouse was so tender and cooked perfectly. I would recommend this restaurant to all my family and friends if they visited Las Vegas. It's definitely a hidden gem in the Caesar's Palace Forum shops.

fYmscQqCxpzQ-boL5oL8MA.text: Love everything I've eaten here so far. Delicious light summer salad with strawberries, pears, walnuts, blue cheese and cranberries with a light balsamic. So good. Also had the salmon oreganata! Dying. Yum. Love this place.

K4ug_gPMfgsF-l9Dm9nhmg.text: As a first timer to Vegas with a seasoned vacationer to Vegas, Carmine's was a must. After my experience there, I now understand why. First, our waitress, Natalie, was beyond exceptional! She asked if we had been there before, and when she learned that I was a first timer, she went in-depth to explain how the menu and their serving sizes work (FYI, everything is family style). She then continued to explain the happy hour specials for both the samplers and drinks. Natalie was extremely professional and informational, but welcoming and friendly, too. She had no problem having friendly conversation with us beyond quick small talk. The food at Carmine's is flavorful, fresh and plentiful! The entire staff takes pride in their work and wants all diners to have a pleasant and memorable experience. On my next Vegas trip, I will definitely be back.

O-h2zRRD7oZruT4k7FbuUw.text: Once again I was eating at the bar (lunch time) and  the menu at this place is really set up to be shared with 2 or more people. None of the pasta offerings for $25 & up are suitable for one person. You are therefore left with a very limited choice of sandwiches. I chose the meatball wedge- it was $19 and it  came with a small side salad. There was nothing very memorable about the food or the atmosphere. A meatball wedge like this at your local pizza shop cost half that amount. Customer's at tables were dining on platters of pasta, and various other large platters. I was unimpressed with this place and the pricing for what I got.

TcxbIh-akkIp6sk10CBHSA.text: We came in excited about eating here.  It's family style and we were starving after a long day of travel.  My wife ordered for us; the seafood with angel hair and white sauce.  It came out looking delicious!  Lobster, mussels, clams, calamari, shrimp...  all over cooked!  It started with the calamari tasting like a rubberband soaked in chum.    Next, I had to saw into the shrimp to cut it in half, to taste the crunch that should be reserved for a Snyder's pretzel, and the vein jamming between molars.  After my wife saw my face chewing like it's cud, she thought to try the lobster... she popped out a dry chewy piece of shredded meat and didn't bother with any more.    I shouldn't need to explain how awful the clams were after the rest of the mess, but I tried a mussel after all this.  For the first time as an adult, I spit partially chewed food onto my plate.  The mussel had the consistency of a sand soaked wash cloth.  I've had gritty seafood before, but someone must've rolled this thing in desert soil right before serving it.  I haven't wanted for a piece of floss like this since $2 steak at Chuck o Rama.  To be fair; they did not make us pay for this atrocity, we did not eat it either, and my appetite was shot.  (Our server did apologize several times and offer us something else)  I haven't felt this close to food poisoned in 20 years and over 100 visits to Vegas.  It got a second star because they cooked the angel hair perfectly.  (Boiled in chum)

nhDypAcvb-CT1QoxQcNNLA.text: Don't let the prices here scare you off. This place is priced high (starts at roughly $30 per dish) because it's intended that you are ordering and will be served family style (you order for the table).   The cheese ravioli is fantastic and so is the manicotti. But what really had me going (and I can't believe I'm writing this) was the broccoli. That isn't the typo but their broccoli was spot on and they even left roasted garlic in there which was fantastic.   Their Salmon is also great, just keep in mind that it comes served with shellfish so you keep that in mind fi you don't eat shellfish or if you are allergic. They can make it without the clams but you have to request it in advance.  I really do like this place and it's great to know they have 2 locations in NYC as well if I'm ever in the area. The staff there are great and accommodating each time we went there. And more importantly, we never went hungry.

qk2yxFO_-36-PxyDoPK5xA.text: The food was delicious, but the service was nearly non existent. One visit from our waiter to take our order and that was it. From that point on, we were on our own. Made the mistake of not ordering a drink and opting for water after a long day by the pool. The water glasses looked like retired shot glasses from the bar. Do yourself a favor and request a couple pitchers of water in case you get a neglectful waiter like we did.

hBlD2sTBuB7TDY_UO_5wLA.text: This is a family-style upscale Italian restaurant. Large portions for two to three people. Me and the wife ordered a couple of drinks and a cheesesteak.   This sandwich is definitely meant for two. The ceaser salad it came with was second to none. The dressing is made in house as you can taste the fresh anchovies.   Overall a very nice play to enjoy a drink and good food at the bar. Thank you to our bartender Joe for a nice time.

iCnnb1IilCKX6yUOsAPuxw.text: This place is so good !! Everything from the drinks to the food everything is excellent  Kyle our server Made our experience here way better all his recommendations were spot on  Thank you Kyle keep up your good costumer service

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Espresso martini
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea food special

n8ycgjhU-0VGuaYiGCR39g.text: Carmine's is a great place to go if you have a big group and want lots of food.  The portion sizes are GINORMOUS!!  We were planning to order three appetizers and four entrees but our waiter was nice enough to tell us to cut back on one of the appetizers.  I'm so glad he did!  Otherwise, we all would have been so stuffed with the appetizers that we wouldn't have had room for anything else.    We ordered the fried calamari and the artichoke dip which were both delicious.  For our entrees, we had two pastas - the clam linguini and a rigatoni pasta with sausages and meatballs.  The chicken dish we ordered was really good and not dry at all.  The highlight was probably the veal special but we were all too full to really enjoy it.  Be prepared to take home lots of leftovers.  You'll be able to feed your family for days =)

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clam linguini and rigatoni with meatballs and sausages
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken

DA_qrOM2lU0IP6ggAxF0cw.text: A big group of us went here after a wedding one evening. We had reservations for 7:30 (over a month in advance) and we were not seated until close to 8pm. The portions were huge and mediocre for the most part, but a majority of us ended up getting stomach cramps and/or food poisoning after eating here. The service was decent (wait staff) but the bar staff was pretty rude. I don't think I'll be visiting this establishment again.

8EcIjwjPPedsELVUwT6eWA.text: Wow - what a meal!  We were a party of about 14 in a private back room.  Our hostess had ordered several family style courses and OMG were they good but were we FULL!  Appetizers: fried zucchini strips (amazing), a mixed salad and a roasted pepper and mozzarella salad - all really good. Pasta course - Ravioli with Ragu, Shrimp with angel hair pasta in white sauce - again super yummy. Main course (which by now we did not need) - Veal Marsala and Eggplant parm.  Both super good. Dessert - really????  Tiramisu and fresh fruit.  Not sure how all this works in the dining room but I can say their food is excellent as was their service.  Check it out!

UxvADhrA_sLOsKDtS5jIOQ.text: Family style means large plates you share. We had a nice fresh salad and clams in a yummy broth. It was the light but filling type of meal we wanted. Great service. I would definitely return.

6w2OoSaiTE1xzMHaumVL0w.text: NATALIE must be your waitress!! It's not so often we meet someone so attentive, especially when it is a very busy Sunday night.  This was our first time dining here. We enjoyed the ambiance, the music , plus we sat at the bar top so we were more away from the crowd. The bar menu had smaller portions, but this was definetely enough for two plus a lot left to take with you to enjoy. I recommend the blood orange Italian soda, the fried zucchini  and the hearty  Bolognese sauce with your favorite pasta!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with Bolognese sauce mwah****
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful

4L9oLfn95MtR5FBHwWTixQ.text: Unbelievably amazing! Fantastic and fun service, great atmosphere, and phenomenal food! It was such a great experience for a big group of us and to have family style dining was absolutely perfect. Only thing I didn't like was that we didn't have food menus available other than on the wall and had to take a photo of it, kind of silly. But regardless it was a marvelous dinner!

nGyd7rJT4azcks4crh90zw.text: Large portions of consistently under seasoned and near tasteless food.  If this was representative of Italian cuisine, more Italians would have left their native land for any other country.  Waitstaff nice, but can't make up for the food.

RuVSa5yFXEXp4_uxEIvxKQ.text: Michael Baker is the best!  We ask for him every time we come in.  Great for large groups.  Fantastic food quality and huge portions!!  A must dine spot in Vegas

M97kRfYkxEeeUmZrB2qifA.text: Food was very good. I won't say GREAT because I have had better veal parm elsewhere, but still very very good. GREAT service... Our waiter Angelo absolutely made the evening for us.  Portions are family style and huge! Make sure you bring your appetite. We had 4 guys that like to eat in our group and ordered chicken and veal palm and  pasta. We had leftovers to eat the next day...  Some people complain that the menu is on a board and there are no menus at the table. I got there early and checked the menu out while having a drink at the bar. You can also take a picture with your phone if you need to...This was not an issue for me.  I will definitely be back..

usWHxwQrxX4mwX-nDHMV3Q.text: This was the second time we have been to this restaurant.  Both times we enjoyed the food - although had the same thing both times.  Salad, pasta and chicken parigiana.    We arrived a few minutes a head of our guest and we ordered a class of wine.  The waiter brought the wine and left it.  He did not offer to pour the first glass he just dropped it and left.   The first time we visited this restaurant we ordered the pasta on the side and it wasn't a problem, this time it was.  The waiter insisted that we have the parigiana placed on top of the pasta.  So we did.  No biggie just didn't want it that way.   The first time we were the the waiter was amazing.  Very helpful and offered his opinion when we asked.  This time we were told what was good and I felt that there was a little eye rolling when we did not order the $48.00 special.    Our food was delivered by a runner - no big deal but the waiter did not return to our table until we were at least half finished.  We were not even asked if we wanted ground pepper on our salad.  Our waiter did show up to tell us about dessert but again really just wanted us to order what ever the special was for the night. We declined but did order dessert.  We ordered regular coffee as well.   Around 10:00 (I think) our waiter started his side work - removed our salt and pepper shakers etc.  Did a few other things around our table, refilled our coffee once brought us the bill that my husband paid and then he was gone.  Never told us he was leaving for the evening.  We continued to sit and enjoy our conversation until around 10:45 but no one bothered with us again.   We are locals and have lots and lots of people that come to town to visit us.  After our first wonderful experience we were thinking that this was going to be our go to restaurant.  Not so sure after last nights experience.

0ldk1S6WXQ_2BWRkAPtJGw.text: Carmine's has some of the best food in Vegas. My boyfriend & I brought my best friend here from out of town for dinner last night. The food was amazing as always. We had the Carmine's salad & Ragu pasta dish. The service was also amazing. Got to check this place out when you are here in Vegas - You won't be disappointed!!

yhK9WmqJT2K4Xq1KPxDmUA.text: Italian food, family style, I am in.  It's the spouses favorite Italian restaurant in NY (she's a NY Italian), so I assumed it would be good.  She had to have the tartufi.  The food we had was all great!  I enjoyed it very much.  They waste a lot of water by putting a pitcher on each table (not wise for a desert during a drought).  I look toward to going back.

0_d2TN6SkhmgbO160cL_3g.text: Great food and customer service. I do want to note that the portions are much bigger than traditional sizes, so be careful when ordering! Overall I fantastic restaurant and would highly recommend.

PVY4by5nezXqo3af5K7Q6g.text: Kept us waiting for 2 hours after making a reservation then having to speak to the manager...who still didnt make it clear to wait staff....omg...seriously sorry that carmines is based in new york...they wouldnt have stayed in business....celebrating bday pre marathon....DO NOT COME TO CARMINES

WGsxO71tDnt8UFvQUXJ9aA.text: Wow... You go for lunch and you get a meal... It was superb Italian.. The only reason I only gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is one of the dishes had a little too much garlic for my taste, but everything else was perfect, service, atmosphere and food.

w9fBqVmCZww_sgMk6sFG8w.text: Event planning sucks. Earlier this year I had the brilliant idea to bring my sales team to Vegas as part training, part reward trip for the awesome job they've been doing. Little did I realize the number of things that could go wrong when planning a small event.   Most frustrating is that we lost our meeting venue at our hotel.  At the last minute, the hotel event staff sent us a laundry list of restrictions, including no outside food or drinks.   Nothing says "great job team" like shoving them in a windowless room for 10 hours with no food and water.    I frantically turned to any local source I could find, and a friend on Facebook recommended Carmine's. I'm not going to lie, we were a little dubious; images of us sitting in a room with whiteboards surrounded by noisy eaters and screaming children came to mind.  Fortunately that was the furthest from the truth.   The atmosphere was perfect. They put us in a quiet room in the back.  Music, air temperature, and lighting were under our complete control.  We used the 40" ++ flat screen monitor for presentations, and the staff was attentive but not intrusive.    The food was incredible. We ordered a constant stream of appetizers, entrees, and desserts throughout the day.  Some were better than others (as you'd expect) but on the whole we were happily surprised and unanimously agreed that the food was delicious.  Note to self: the garlic bread was amazing, and the Titantic is quite unstable if you eat the bottom crust first.   In short, they made our event easy, literally attended to our every need, and the food and atmosphere made for a very productive day.  And they saved my bacon by accommodating my last minute request for a meeting space ... or more appropriately my "prosciutto".  ; )

g7BmMjZIyTdqU6ZPSAg5vA.text: Cut one star for the huge sizes. Have you seen any reviews without the word huge? Food is so good and if you cannot take leftovers you really feel guilty to leave behind such a good quality and taste, not to mention the waste.   We were two people and warned in advance to chose the same meal. Meat balls we still talk about how tasty they were. Salad is also fresh and can feed a table of 6-8 easily.   Why not some consideration for smaller portions?

vDlJkGlY80UGG1fJzUlEhQ.text: Hands down the best meal we had while in Vegas! We stopped in here while passing by, looking for somewhere to stop for dinner. We were seated promptly and greeted right away by several people. Our server was fantastic! Very friendly without being annoying. We ordered the vodka penne and the cheese ravioli. It was amazing! Some of the best Italian food I've ever had. Even the bread basket was great! My only comment was the menu on the walls thing is a little difficult.

OaAs0xXsOvVY1xkGUSs67w.text: We had lunch today and was greeted promptly. The hostess explained the menu was on the wall....which is hard to see! Prices will shock you until you realize these are family size plates.....not that our waiter offered that info until we asked. The Calamari was the best I've eaten.   So, if you wonder why only 2 stars. It is for the service! We ordered our drinks 3x with different wait staff before we got them. Then a manager came by to ask how was everything? We told them not good. We didn't have our drinks and still haven't ordered. All they did was send someone else over!?! My son ordered chocolate milk which was Powdered Hot chocolate stirred with milk. How do I know? The waitress told is when we complained about the chunks and taste. Really?  Just say you DON'T have Chocolate milk. Oh, and we still got charged for it. I will only get take out IF we ever return.

EkTpW9QaklQiV9KjZahylA.text: Great food and ambiance. Every time we go to LV we have to eat here. Big portions to share and great service

GJnFrWGH-KAqBHbHSWh1BQ.text: The portions are huge!!! Warning myself and my aunt shared a meal, and we're both big eaters. The food was very tasty. We had Penne Alla Vodka and the sauce was good and the Penne was perfectly Al Dente. I would recommend to anyone who comes to Las Vegas.

OJPkv1poCefUcc20qxD3nw.text: Had a fantastic meal tonight. The waitress was one of the best I've ever had and I eat out frequently. I'm normally not a desert eater but 3 of our party shared the bread pudding. The waitress asked why I didn't want any and I told her the only desert I ever eat are peanut M&M's and she went back and couldn't find any but came back with mini twice bars. I'm a firm believer in service making the difference between a good meal versus a great meal and the service shown at this restaurant was top notch.

oJhn3kOppHUoUDnkAq1kjw.text: Can't say enough good things about our experience here.  Went for a family celebration of my son's 21st birthday.  Showed up early for our reservation and they accomodated us right away.  Plenty of servers to take drink orders, bring us water and reccomend the right amount for our group of seven.    We had the Carmines salad and stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer.  Both were fantastic.  then we split three entrees : Spaghetti and Metaballs (the meatballs were large but so tender), chicken parm (awesome) and lasagna (excellent).....all of my sons favorties.    We didn't finish everything as it is a lot of food, but we'd come back again.  Thanks for a wonderful experience!

-DYF2XK0HP-dIU9uO5qPMw.text: We went to Carmine's on a recommendation from a friend and are so glad we did. There was just two of us, so I am so glad we went with only one dish- easily big enough to feed 4. We got the rigatoni with broccoli and sausage and while I prefer the dish at Buca di Beppos, this was still really good. We also got the blood orange marg and the white sangria, both of which were fantastic, albeit pricey. Keep in mind their dishes feed 3-4 people when ordering.

EeadJ3TLAGCpvXQurTJ-CA.text: Another drop at the bar to enjoy a cocktail and quick bite prior to a show.  Jesse was the Manager on Duty who greeted us.  Again I had to dive into the meatballs that are Out of This World!  So tender and juicy, can't have enough!

Im92FiiAZRq3HZo0LVHaVA.text: What can I say about Carmines Las Vegas? Thank you for being sob old to open a restaurant in sin city after all these years you've been feeding Crazy Bernie in NY's theater district. I have been a faithful customer in the city all these years and now you've made me a believer in Vegas. Chicken parm and meat balls are awesome.

2B8M9Xc0n90051Y6WNqVFw.text: Good family style Italian dining. Just know going in that this restaurant is better with at least 4 people otherwise the price of everything prohibits diversity. 5 of us shared a Caesar salad, chicken part and a pasta dish. Perfect amount of food. The quality is very good, but more chain style than high end. Certainly a fun place and not our first time at a Carmine's.

LVNfZWqayBmP37kLAHge9w.text: Our table of 6(2kids) had the Calamari and it was a generous portion. Pieces were light and crispy. We also shared the Mixed Seafood linguine in red sauce. Portions were huge and plenty of seafood. We were hoping for a little more flavor from the red sauce. We needed up using red pepper flakes to spice it up a bit.

jP8u6BBzpDWzraLOCMe5aA.text: Service was great.  Mussels with red sauce ehh not the greatest. Meatballs with angel hair pasta good. Portions are out of control and just a plain waste of food even when two people are sharing an entree.

Q-neSO3-0CsiyqxAyoDAnQ.text: What a great experience!!!  My husband and I knew about Carmine's in the city, but we've never gotten around to eating there. We took a trip to Vegas and found a Carmine's in the Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace, so we decided to stop in. Great decision!  The wait staff was friendly and attentive, and made sure we had a great experience. Everyone made sure to emphasize that Carmine's serves family-style dinner- no less than 3 people told us. We went with the penne alla vodka, and resisted the idea to order anything else. We were hesitant about the size of the dish, right up until they brought it out. We ordered the junior portion that was available at lunch, and we did not need to eat for pretty much the rest of the day!  It was delicious- perfect seasoning and the vodka sauce was awesome!  Their Montepolciano was wonderful, as well, and my husband was thrilled at being able to have as many sodas as he could handle with no extra charge!  Definitely worth a visit wherever there is one, particularly with a large group!

ZemwMKGkMgpeDFNoT-8IFQ.text: Their calamari fritti was surprisingly good!  I also really liked the broccoli and had seconds of it.  Some of the other dishes we had (lasagna and manicotti among others) were good.  Not spectacular, not really good, just good.  The bread they served was weird and cold, and no olive oil.  I think my perception is a little colored because I couldn't drink.  So A-OK definitely describes it... I would go back, but if I were specifically looking for Italian and didn't have a large group, I know I could find better.

MsBg7uDxt9NKKArz3uVL0g.text: LOVED THIS PLACE! Our waitress was great! The food was so awesome! We only dropped in because of the smell. The plates are HUGE! One plate is enough for a family of four-five. Would absolutely recommend

oRQRxg_kLxhV86K86ocl0Q.text: I have been to a lot of restaurants in Vegas and ate wonderful food but tonight I can say that I had the best service from Kyle D at Carmines. He was funny attentive and always had a smile. If you are looking for great food and even better service come here and ask for Kyle D! Props bro!!

rbFwiMW7g9PYjDF-7-LNuw.text: Huge portions. The shrimp scampi lacked a sauce. The wings and lasagna were some of the best I've had. This was True Italian food with the scenery to match

EujtFs3LB1nhiO57LcJYuw.text: Good times good food. A little slow on the service but the size of the portions kinda make it that way. If u want a True Italy meal come stop by. And it's not too pricey.

tBdqsL0RN7pGTpqiyOswQg.text: What a GREAT place! We had our Thanksgiving dinner here and it was truly amazing! The whole family loved it and will go back again!

-P1MGNSeOjGeY5fIvBCmUw.text: Huge portions, family style dining. Caesars salad and the muscles were great. Also had the chicken Parmesan and the bolognese which was a bit watery.

zzhSij0wSXqgxRmyP7Zl1w.text: Definitely one of my new favorite restaurants. Excellent food and huge portions (especially refreshing after a bunch of small plates at other LV fine dining restaurants.) The lasagna was great! Pre meal bread included!

3E0fWZ1ZJbGdhG29b_UDHw.text: We've walked past this place a ton of times and finally decided to try it for lunch. Lunch portions are even huge. We had lots of leftovers. Caesar salad was ok, but the angel hair pasta was delicious and so were the meatballs. Would recommend large parties going here. I would go again but try different items next time.

AZunJMR6_SMAUIduDJ7vnQ.text: The food at Carmine's was amazing. But unfortunately I will NEVER return. The manager wasn't nice to the staff.

GxIqw_VnU1b2UHf4-n_rmg.text: My husband and I came here for dinner while on a long weekend in Vegas! We shared a seafood pasta (waiter recommended linguini). It was AMAZING! One of the best we've ever had! Service was great and so was the atmosphere! We have also visited the one in NY and this one is comparable. They serve draft IPA which is a huge plus for my husband. Looks like a great place if you go with a large group as well.

mMWB7Jkr0XLz3BZGiROCLg.text: We arranged a dinner for my family this past weekend.  It was reasonable cost and a ton of amazing food!  Very easy to arrange - the event coordinator, Stephanie, was a dream to work with.  They even put our family crest on the menu cards they printed for us!  The waiter, Michael, was patient and extremely helpful!  They even called security to get a wheelchair for my elderly uncle so he didn't have to walk as far when leaving.  And they were able to get a four course meal served and get us to our show in time.  I would highly recommend to anyone that wants a great dinner!

T1WYqM7cAe5NFqvJ2JpHTA.text: The food here is decent. We had the ravioli with meat sauce. The ravioli was very good, however, we regretted the sauce choice. We were charged extra for it and it just wasn't great. I really loved the atmosphere and the service was exceptional. I would eat here again, but I would make sure the party was larger and I'd try a different sauce. We couldn't finish the dish with just 2 people. The dishes are decently priced. The smell is what drew us in while we were shopping at the Forum Shoppes.

L_qCB70WEpDfTfQHfPbmMg.text: I really loved this place and I am recommending it to everyone I know that is going to Vegas!!!! The restaurant is in the "mall" at Cesar's and it is actually pretty large restaurant! They have a full bar and the drinks are yummy! Very heavy handed bartenders!!!!  the menus are on the walls which is a little different but easy to see from where we sitting. I went with a party of 12 and I made the reservations through yelp which was super easy and awesome!!! When we checked in the table was ready and were seated within 2 minutes of arrival!! The hosts greeted us promptly and checked to make sure our table was set then we were off! The food is served family style so very large portions and if you add pasta to a main dish like the chicken Parmesan it's an extra 12 something but it will feed about 3.5/4 people!! See my pictures we added the angel hair pasta to our chicken Marsala and we did not finish it! We also ordered the stuffed salmon which was the best salmon I have ever had!!!!!! It was pretty pricey but well worth it! Chicken Parmesan was super cheesy and cooked so well! The lasagna was really meaty and had an excellent amount of cheese! Another item I was impressed with was the shrimp scampi!!! The pictures do not do it justice!! The shrimps are almost the size of prawns. I did add a little lemon to the pasta (which we also added on the angel hair pasta) We also has one dish I was not super impressed with but I did not order it and would never have ordered it was a broccoli and pasta dish with a white wine sauce it was pretty bland and nothing too great about it. But everything else was amazing!!!! I can't wait to go back to Vegas just to eat here!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna super meaty!!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala we added angel hair pasta
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed salmon best salmon ever!!!

RTChDuOuA9bgvXp34_frFg.text: Sabrina was absolutely amazing! She catered to everything we asked for plus more! All the food was very good. Large portions so make sure you bring a group! Definitely recommend this place!

eF_-FvELOiufjSQC3wVn2Q.text: Came here one night for dinner with friends and my husband. I really love how it was very convenient and inside of the forum shops in the Caesars Palace and how generous their portions were. I myself am not a very big eater but we had a party of 7 and even had a little food to take home. The menu was a giant menu on their wall which was super cool since it was my first time ever seeing that in a restaurant. I thought that the prices were fair for the amount served. We chose 5 dishes all together and the food was good. Some dishes I didn't enjoy as much but other dishes I wanted to keep eating. We ordered the Caesar salad to start, spicy scarpariello wings, penned alla vodka, shrimp scampi, and the carbonara. My favorite was the carbonara and the wings!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carbonara
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne alla vodka
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp

0r2hUtPnYWlIeAKv6fyZGQ.text: We've been coming to this restaurant over the years. It never disappoints. For birthdays, friends visiting or just craving for some good Italian food! Service is really good- our waiter was super accommodating, attentive! Calamari is my favorite  appetizer - they never disappoint!

YH1i6ebCP8NCLTrSWgn39g.text: Amazing appetizers, drinks and dinner. Server provided excellent recommendation to start dinner with meatball sliders...I am still thinking about them! The caesar salad was fresh and perfectly dressed. Our pasta was fabulous. I highly recommend Carmine's. My only regret was there was absolutely no room for dessert.

Ct0awtukuIk9Tl3jp9Hrpg.text: It is family style with plenty of portions. I always make it a point to eat here while I am in Las Vegas.

C0wXB7BEy8aQC473xxtKIQ.text: We eat here everytime we are in town. Some 2-3 times a year. This place just gets better and better. If i were to complain about anything it would be all the promotional crap they provided with our bill. Just thank us and let it be. I get that they owned a BBQ place but refran from the promotional pitch at the end of our meal at Carmines. Still live you tho.

ipZZHSwNq6Vo2yQLpzELbQ.text: have been going to carmines for over 20 years in new york. had many many dinners and hosted holiday parties there. moved to vegas recently and gave it a try.  had clams, veal parmigiana and lasagna plus desert. got home and my wife and became sick to our stomach. clearly a reaction to the food or perhaps food poisoning? called the manager twice and was told, he would look into it??  what's to look into??  if you have a verified customer for over 20 years who has spent thousands of dollars at carmines, do the right thing and offer a complimentary dinner!! not even the courtesy of getting back to me. no class, terrible customer service.  they lost a great customer.  will stick with sinatra when i want great italian food at the WYNN!

y5wyYdWLz9P7HCoEEs9PGg.text: Absolutely delicious! I have lived in Vegas for almost 3 years and this was hands down the best Italian Restaurants I have been to! Natalie was our server - also the most attentive and kind server I have had! Really... best Italian food in Vegas (coming from a Sicilian)

R60J2pCfPkx-eT6UA3SVBA.text: If you are a party of two do yourself and favor and sit in the bar...unless you want leftovers for weeks. The bar offers smaller portions ( which are still huge ). The bread basket here like the portions is huge and comes with about 5 different bread choices. The menu is hung on the wall which is pretty hilarious so don't forget your readers.  We love to walk around the form shops and catch this place at Happy Hour. They have a food menu and drink menu for Happy Hour which are very affordable. Ive been to this location mid day and dinner time both get pretty busy since it is a strip restaurant, but for a party of two we always get a seat quick. I would highly recommend a reservation if you are bringing the whole family.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in red sauce

LwK1vy6NFBwmDjpQpU5CZA.text: This place is okay. Portions are way too big for two people. Our waiter was very nice.

szNxqlVw8WTpj5Lyc6vQgw.text: My husband and I recently got married at Caesars Palace and we decided to have our reception at Carmines.  This was one of the best decisions we made on multiple levels. 1) We were lucky enough to work with Cassy, the events manager at Carmines.  From the very first encounter with Cassy when she walked us around the venue to her accommodating the ten extra people that ended up joining us for our tasting at a different date to ensuring that everything was exactly as we asked for, she was the consummate professional.  In addition, her candor and the rapport she made with us was much appreciated.  I felt like I was working with a friend and she shared in the joy of our special day while making sure every detail was met. 2) The food.  Oh my, the food.  We had a whole table of hot and cold appetizers.  Everything was delicious and exactly as it was when we had it at our tasting.  The three pastas we chose were a total hit with the guests.  Cassy gave excellent advice about which pastas would hold up in the warmers and she couldn't have been more accurate.   3)  The staff that was on the floor was incredible.  We had servers that ensured the food amounts were always full and replenished quickly.  We had to do a last minute two-top table for my husband and I (we forgot to ask for it in our original plan) and they were able to accommodate us immediately and without an issue.  We had two bartenders that were spot-on and worked their tails off to ensure our guests didn't go thirsty.  Overall, it was the reception I had been wanting and dreaming about and I couldn't have been any happier or satisfied.

i6His3UAKsEbtEKuIFUPBw.text: The Food: Huuuuuge portions and yummy! Hits the spot every single time. Very fair price too.  Atmosphere: The place is big with very comfortable seats. In Three words this place is Classic, Authentic with Soothing music in the background.  Staff: Friendly, accommodating and on time all around.

T-P71L24IGLnq3houEuBHQ.text: Great ambience and food for a resturant plopped in the middle of the forum shops. Pro tip. If this us date night like ours was, opt to go to the bar where you can get one or two person size serving entrees! We wanted to sit at a table to this meant ordering from the regular menu which means all the orders are family style size. It was cheat meal time and we ordered the calamari and the penne alavodka. The calamari came out crisp and the sauce for dipping was fantastic. The pasta dish was cooked to perfection and the sauce was so rich and filling I could only eat one serving from it. We didn't opt for the to go box because I know we would over eat. Ugh such a shame to throw out so much delicousness. Bring 4+ people if you want to sit in the main area to dine in. That way you don't have colossal amounts of left over grub.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne alavodka. This is all the damage the two of us could do!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari. Gotta get this
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahh the view

3CWdbkVeeUb7UP1Eykq05A.text: My girlfriend and I absolutely love this place. The portions are HUGE. Bring an appetite and friends. One order of lasagna weighs about 5 or 6 lbs and can feed 4 adults easily. When you consider the portion size, the prices are quite reasonable!   The ambiance is that of 1950s Little Italy with a mix of big band and crooner music always keeping the mood chill. The wait staff is attentive and professional, while keeping the environment relaxed and delightful.   The manager Terry and bartenders Natalie, Anthony, Peter, Michael, and Andrew are always on top of keeping our visits special. The happy hour deals are out of this world. The meatball sliders and fried ravioli are our go-to's. I can't imagine a better Italian restaurant in Vegas. This puts "neighboring" restaurants with some alliteration and others in the Fashion Show mall to shame! 10/10 will return.

VPJfIVKwcv2AiSnlrGnPTw.text: Great food.  Great Service.  This is a family style restaurant so don't be scared when you see the prices.  Each item you order at least 4 people can eat from it.  Couple that was with us in Vegas ate here 2 days in a row.  If I had more time I would have come to visit one more time.    The next time I am in Vegas it will ne on the top of my list of places to visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Titanic Dessert
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parm + Pasta
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried Calamari

Pcii_g-Uz7mbA1O8oLKlRA.text: I'm pretty sure every other person to review this place has said this, but the portions are MASSIVE. Eating at Carmine's is truly a feast and good enough to be your only meal of the day. Surprisingly though, our portion of the clams was pretty tiny and just enough for 2-3 people. However, the ravioli and fettuccine compensated. We were full to the brim with a ton of leftovers even in a group of 5 people. The prices are pretty decent for the quantity of food you get, and it may not be the best Italian food you've had but it is still pretty good. The ambience is super nice and the place is in the heart of Caesars too.

zkCfntwJ-KcQvqwg-2Tcmw.text: Came here with a group of 13. We got the Caesar salad, Carmine salad, penne a la vodka, spaghetti bolognese, and eggplant parmesan. I wouldn't recommend the eggplant parm, but everything else was pretty good. The plates may seem expensive, but they can serve a lot of people, so per person, it's pretty reasonable. Definitely come here with a big group. Anything smaller, you would only get to try like one dish.

_VkXaNNAVryG7G-oILcvXA.text: Such an eloquent establishment. Very beautiful staff, with great service. Started with Meatballs and Calamari for appetizers, I could honestly say this place is better the Buca Di Bepo. We had Lasagna  And Seafood Linguini with Red sauce. Amazing and such huge portions. It's can be quite pricey, but well worth. A nice place for dates or even just a family dinner.

M8ePX27C34KLPOUwJlCUhQ.text: You can find this spot in the heat of the Vegas strip , tucked away in the Cesar's hotel.  Expect Good Italian food, Family style ambience but still elegant and our service was one of the best . Our waiter "Michael B" made the experience memorable. Make reservations and ask for him. From greeting us he went out of his way to Inform us about his favorite dishes  and made our party of 8 very comfortable and happy .

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qlH6IITYAt5b5lkd-EiMA.text: I cannot out into words how amazing our experience was. We had my daughters wedding reception here during a holiday weekend and they did not miss a detail. Flowers, cake, DJ, everything was carried out perfectly. The food..more than we could eat and it came out hot. Service was impeccable. Drinks were full and our party was a huge success.

_KJjC9ELoyaUsvCfYRrOMQ.text: This place never disappoints. I've eaten here many times and always leave satisfied. Country style rigatoni is amazing..

FWfSNfisBBgc_TkhmG4cEw.text: We made a last minute appointment and when we were running a few minutes late, they were super accommodating. We told our waiter we were in a bit of a rush and he gave us great recommendations. Family style portions. Salad and one plate of pasta filled 5 of us up.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ragu (Assorted Meat) Bolognese Meat Sauce

IiwBz5-lDKf1tH6wnECXtw.text: The establishment is well run and is welcoming. Food is abundant with family size portions which you share with your group.  Make sure you ask how many a serving will feed. Caesar Salad with anchovies is rare. Service was prompt and friendly. Food was substantial. This is not authentic Italian. The sauce was edible and penne alla vodka were not the traditional penne alla vodka. Veal park was plentiful but again the sauce was more RAGU style than what it should be for the mentioned dishes. If your not finicky about your Italian cuisine this place will suffice.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar Salad.

J_AHF_YG7hZH9xxruRwDVg.text: Had a great "small lunch" at Carmine's in the Forum Shops.  Everything in the restaurant is served family size (4-6 people) so we opted for bar service where you can order smaller appetizer portions.  Peter was our server/bartender and he could not have been more knowledgeable about the menu.  He was great about directing us in what to order for drinks and food.  Not only was he a great server but he was very friendly and when he found out it was my husband's 50th celebration he was so gracious!  The food came out hot, fast and delicious! We shared a ravioli with ragu sauce and the portion size was perfect for the two of us.  I am not a bread kind of gal, but Carmine's was delicious.    We love to shop at the Forum, but we are making Carmine's a must visit next time we are there!

HhRX8Cn7ak1Jx4iXL76cig.text: Happened to be at the Forum Shoppes and figured I'd grab something to eat from here. Ordered spaghetti with meatballs and shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was ok. Nothing spectacular. They were oversized which seemed cool but they just didn't taste so great. And I've had better cocktail sauce. The meatballs had way too much garlic. My daughter ate some of the spaghetti. This place is way overpriced and the food isn't great.    The hostess and our server was very nice. I'd give them 5 stars. The restaurant decor was great. Loved some of the pictures.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Obese shrimp

QQYjpF3MrWmlb2iWH8HACg.text: Had a great time and amazing food at Carmine's. We have been to the one in NYC. And this one is everything the NYC location is. Amazing food and service. We were celebrating our friend's bday and somehow we ordered the "Titanic" ice cream cake dessert. The name says it all. 4 of us did our best to put a dent into it. Amazing!!!

E4a7DNhvO1vd0eTtDszDsw.text: The caesar salad was the best I ever had and the meatballs were amazing along with perfect sauce and pasta.  Attentive service by TJ made this meal a perfect experience.  I love Italian food and this place delivers!  I will be back!

yEz-kb0p49xYYaslAi1REA.text: The Cesar salad was the best thing I had next to the water, everything else was below par...I ordered the  shrimp with white sauce pasta which was more like a white soup instead of sauce, aside from that it wasn't flavorful just tasted like the water the pasta was boiled in. I'm no food critic or chef but have tasted better for way less money and could have made something better than what I ordered.

ccFu_CI3vMWKT6b7l-KwJg.text: Amazing family style dinner! Here for our BHHS convention and our company dinner was here! The service was impeccable.  The food was extremely delicious. Everything was delightful.  From the appetizer to dessert, there wasn't one thing I didn't sample, and it was all so very good! I highly recommend dining here!  We had a very large party and not once did it feel that way. Excellent service. Amazing food. Great atmosphere. Convenient location in the Forum Shops.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu was heavenly.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta and entrees!!! Veal parmigiana, shrimp parmigiana, salmon parmigiana, spaghetti with meatballs, rigatoni with Italian sausage.

yAH-ud05vA29IQa0lxBM2g.text: Everything here is served family style. HUGE portions. Kinda like a buffet at your table without having to get up. You get to bring lunch home for tomorrow as a bonus. When you come here request Kyle. You can have the best food in the world, but we always remember poor service walking out.  For pics I offer the Before and the After. (Didn't take any in between)
