Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Antipasto

wRlrQsZ7eP3PcPJMGwnRIg.text: Enormous location. Enormous family style portions too. The service and quality of food is good, with the setting being more high end, but I really wasn't WOW'd by this place at all. This place is clearly massively popular, and again, a nice setting, but I feel like there are better Italian places in Cesar's and Vegas overall that are better choices than here for options and better quality of options. I guess if you are in a group but looking for a smaller scale of options for a group share, this would be a good fit. Just MEH in comparison to a large group of similar options in Vegas.

J8YnpH56OC8qY2kCZKMPeQ.text: I'll get straight to the point. The three stars are for the food. The restaurant was recommended to me by a friend, who obviously likes the place. I'm thinking I didn't order the yummy items that everyone else is raving about, but I'm not a beef, pork or lamb eater- chicken and fish are my usual, so with that said, here's my review.   The staff was super friendly and helpful.   We ordered the chicken parmigiana that feeds four people, green salad (that'll feed five people) and a side of (child's portion) vermicelli pasta w/butter and garlic.   Glass of decoy cab wine was very good. The complimentary garlic foccia bread was not good but loved the fresh sour dough. Yum!   It's definitely a family kind of restaurant with no frills. The food is good, not great. The menu had great options to choose from; but frankly I was SUPER surprised they had veal on the menu. I usually don't eat at places where they serve veal due to the way they're treated. They should really consider taking it off the menu. ;(  Not sure I'll be back, lots of other great places to try.

_TC3aUF5cvOxm-Wu90aJTA.text: I love Italian Food so this was a Vegas treat for me and the Mister! We grabbed the in laws and headed out for a stellar dining experience! The vibe was different but cool because it ranged from the scantily dressed to the upper echelon! Great food! Huge Portions even with a party of 6... three of which were men! Nice wait staff! Excellent Service! Atmosphere was busy but then that seems to be the tempo in Vegas!... We enjoyed ourselves! Check it out when you are in Vegas! Be prepared to wait...in my opinion.. it was worth the wait!  It is great place for entertaining LARGE parties!

2B9m3h9nntMCVK80ITC00w.text: IH MY GOD!!  If I die tomorrow it's ok cause I've had Carmine's!!! This is the best Italian food!! I am fortunate to have visited all 4 locations!

Y3DJMgDFsy16JTO_aYyFGg.text: Outstanding. If possible, request Michael as your server! He's the best one in the game it'll make you experience more enjoyable knowing that you'll be treated good.   HUGE PLATES, HUGE HUGE HUGE. This is a "Family style restaurant" meaning all the plates are shareable. Average price per plate is $30-45 but one plate can easily serve 3 people.   I will definitely be coming again because this Italian restaurant is really on top of things. I have nothing negative to say... great, great, great...

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5UO5A9zYaXBM30pLNhaluQ.text: Family style Italian restaurant. Reminds me of Buca di Beppo from back home. They give you a ton of food, which is great if you are eating with a lot of people and don't want to spend much. Definitely more Americanized and most dishes are just tons of carbs with sauce and a little bit of protein. I was a little disappointed in their basic spaghetti. Nothing mind blowing. I really enjoyed the shrimp cocktail. The shrimp were huge and very fresh. for dessert we ordered the titanic. It was pretty good, the chocolate cake on the bottom was rich and almost the consistency of a truffle, freshly made whipped cream, a few nuts and ice cream.

2rD1rb7EcQB0yVyR2OhPYg.text: I've never been to Carmine's in NYC, but we ended up here for dinner when a group of us were in Vegas because nothing sounded better when it came to prepping for a long night than heavy pasta. So we made our way here around 9 PM on a Saturday night (early? late? It depends on your alcohol intake day-to-date), and with a reservation we got seated easily, although even without one, we would have been totally fine. Service was pretty solid, particular in providing us a refill of bread to satiate our appetites while waiting for the rest of the food. As for the Chianti we ordered...there is an extensive wine list here, but it tasted a bit like they are expecting tourists to frequent (aka overpay).  Despite the lowered expectations I had, the food was pretty good here. The bread in olive oil was as expected, but the pasta did what we wanted - filled us solid while being pretty flavorful. The veal parmesan was quite good, even if the meat was dry from being a bit overcooked and subsequently bathed in tomato sauce. The lasagna was a bit better, mainly because it was so dense and prototypically / stereotypically prepared that is was decadent (if a bit soggy). We also had a bolognese dish (with rigatoni, I think?) - very standard and hearty, but not necessarily worth the premium that Carmine's charges for everything on their menu.  The ambiance is nice, if a bit forced and overdone (kind of like everything in the shops at Caesar's Palace) - they go the extra mile to make you feel like you're in an old-time NYC pasta hole in the wall, albeit it with tall ceilings and air conditioning. Nonetheless, the food was admittedly better than I expected, although you should be prepared to pay the tourist price for it. There are worse places to dine in Las Vegas, but there are better options as well, particularly if you expand your view beyond the Strip.

bl4DUZS8z3WTUgKuDCcx9Q.text: The restaurant and the food were horrible. I made a reservation for 830 on Sunday night. We arrived on time and checked in with the hostess. Then she asked us if we wanted to sit at the bar. This was after she set a couple that were walkins from the mall. I said no I want to table because I made a reservation. Then she got an attitude and seated us next to a pole across from the kitchen. I asked to be move which the manager accommodated. We never got bread until we asked for it. Our drinks were horrible. They're signature salad was the best part of the meal. We shared the lasagna. It tasted like cheesy bread mashed potatoes. I'm not sure it was fully cooked and I couldn't eat it. This was our second visit to the restaurant   within the last two years. The first trip was delicious but I won't be back as the service and food quaintly is decreased. The first time was phenomenal this time it was a waste of $100.

hll2kBpN1pI-76k1PMDCvw.text: I've been here once before a couple years ago and I remembered the food being good so we decided to try it out again tonight.  We were not disappointed!  ROBERTO WAS FABULOUS! Very friendly and attentive. My water/wine glass never reached empty and he helped guide us through the menu so we didn't order too much (because the portions are huge!).  Incredibly positive experience, this place runs very smoothly, and we can't wait to come back again. Maybe tomorrow night?!

UHCl68rLsAAB7TvzHdcHxQ.text: I wish I had known everything here was served family style! The portions are ginormous and service is top notch in this old school Italian restaurant.   After wandering for what seemed like hours, I landed here for dinner and sat in the bar, since they serve smaller portions there. My server was so sweet and helped me navigate a few options since I was dining alone. I ended up with a huge side caesar salad and the chicken parmigiana. The caesar was probably one of the best I've ever had. It was so garlicky and delicious. The chicken parm was also on point and bathed in a nice red sauce.   Menu is loaded with all the Italian favorites and each portion is designed to serve 2-3 people. I wish I could've tried more dishes, but I guess that means I'll have to come back with a group!

68xPpJyIavR8dUi0UG3Eaw.text: My experience at Carmine's Las Vegas was absolutely terrible. As a frequent visitor of both locations in NYC, I was expecting fun, good service, yummy drinks and awesome food, however I got the exact opposite.   My friend and I visited around 5:30p on New Year's Eve before the rush so the restaurant was relatively empty. We sat at the bar and immediately were greeted with an attitude by the bartender. When we asked for bread a second time (because he didn't respond or acknowledge us the first time) he barked "when I get a second". He never offered us water, served me a watered down drink in a dirty, sticky glass and we had to flag him down (despite the bar being pretty empty given the time) for basic things such as forks and plates. When our entree came, it was ice cold and he suggested we scrape the food off of our plates (please note, my friend and I were sharing a dish as this restaurant is family-style) back into the serving dish so the chef could warm it up instead of preparing us a new dish and apologizing for the inconvenience.   I have to wonder if we were treated this way as the only black and gay couple at the bar because he was completely pleasant with other guests. Additionally, he asked us if we wanted the check TWICE during our visit once before we even ordered food and the second time was before the food we ordered came out ice cold.   I recommend you stay clear of this place and I hope if you do choose to visit, you're treated better than we were.

4Z5sel5uMU9iAG-b413rJw.text: Our first choice was to go to Il Mulino but their dress code turned us off and Carmine's seemed more our style -- casual but a quality experience. And we were happy we made the switch. First off, our service was exceptional. The waiter was friendly and super helpful.  Since Carmine's is family style we were quite pleased we hadn't eaten all day and were ready to eat for 2 (each)! And we did. We went a classic spaghetti and meatballs, as well as as a Chicken Piccata. Both were delicious. Both were delicious, we were stuffed, and still able to take some leftovers back to our room -- which we needed to soak up the remaining wine they packed up for us from our oversized bottle.   The waiter also brought us complimentary after-dinner drinks that were an unexpected surprise. Definitely worth the trip!

Td6Z2c2xUAsKipuKDCHDsQ.text: Huge portions and an even bigger waste of my time and money. Myself and nine other were looking forward to a family style Italian lunch.   Things started off great and then took a nose dive after the salad course.   Two pasta dishes and a chicken entree took about 40 minutes to come out. One of the pasta dishes was wrong and had to be redone, took another 30 minutes. We thought we had ordered the chicken saltimbocca  but couldn't find the prosciutto. After asking our server about it he assured us it was there, we just couldn't see it. I'll tell you what, I couldn't taste it either.   Carmines ended up being a disappointment. At least there was a decent gelato stand down the way.

MTHj2FdDPa4UvlXgItsMIQ.text: In town for a conference and took a customer to dinner.  He actually requested Carmine's in lieu of some gold standard restaurants in the area.  I was very pleasantly surprised!  We started with the calamari.  It was crisply fried and not greasy at all.  Four of us ate the whole platter.  We then split the Porterhouse steak and penne pasta with a rose cream sauce.  The pasta was very good if simple.  The porterhouse was outstanding.  On a cut that size, it is usually tough and difficult to prepare properly.  It was med rare and sliced into thin strips with a little drizzle of garlic butter over the top (butter, no wonder). It was very tender and flavorful. We all commented on how good it was.    Definitely a solid 3 1/2 stars!

AeZ-QOvwNS0UqjqTXC4w7A.text: Where do I begin!  We're from the NYC area and my boyfriend loves Carmine's. always talks about it. But I had never tried it, so we finally did yesterday in Vegas and it was amazing. I mean the decor was very neat. I'm a total food, wine, hospitality junkie and I had never seen a wine rack so tall! The photos on the walls were authentic and really told a story about the place. We were greeted by a nicely dressed host who welcomed us with a warm smile and brought us over to our table. A few moments later, our waiter Frank introduced himself. He had a ton of knowledge and answered every question we had about the mouth watering menu. Frank was the ideal waiter to have, at my first time at Carmine's. we were lucky to have gotten there a little bit after lunch time because we were able to  order from the lunch menu, which had smaller portions, which were still big! We ended up getting garlic bread, half with cheese. Which I thought was cool. Most places don't offer you the option. And then we shared a lunch size Penne Ala Vodka. And we still had left overs!!! Perfect Italian cooked pasta. None of that over cooked mushy shit. The food was excellent. The place was organized and beautiful. The bathrooms were clean. And the service was awesome. Our waiter was friendly and fun to talk to! Although he did tell us he was a Raiders fan. Ha ha. Recommending Carmine's to everyone I know! I also can't wait to dine at the NYC and DC locations! High expectations! Keep up the good work and hospitality, Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I thought this was neat! In the women&#39;s restroom

17IpQSBeQ9KS5RjLBaBAFQ.text: Chicken parm was ok, the lasagna was pretty good  Lemon chicken was probably the best

bQmEy4eRi0uULKJ4vXWrcQ.text: My family and I celebrated birthdays, last evening, in Carmine's Restaurant in Caesar's Palace Las Vegas.  Truly a food coma delight!!  We live in NYC, and have eaten in Carmine's in NYC, several times. This is the first time we have eaten here in Carmine's in Vegas, it just opened Fall 2013.    The penne with Bolognese sauce, meatballs and manicotti were magnificent.  For our appetizer, we ordered Spiedini Alla Romana, pure heaven.   And for the grand finale, the Titanic!!  A huge replica of the ship made out of chocolate fudge, bananas, pineapples, strawberries, real cream and chocolate shavings; not to mention, the three Italian rolled cookies, Pirouettes,  shaped into smoke stacks with candles emerging from each stake.Soooo Gorgeous to eat!!! Outstanding display of food beauty, not to mention the charm and efficiency of the wait staff.  Our waiter, Mr. Baker, sang and danced for us (formerly a performer), now a church choir singer and coordinator.  He made the night extra special with his talent and charm.  Yes, the portions are humongous!! One portion for a least 3-4 persons, and the Titanic dessert serves at least 4-5 persons, and that is still too much. The next time you visit Vegas, take a trip to Caesar's and enjoy the epicurean delights at Carmine's!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE TITANIC DESSERT AT CARMINE&#39;S!!

59lT7lb5xg3JvkJ9SHOWJA.text: A very nice atmosphere! The hostess was incredibly kind , the food was good but beware the portions are extremely huge. Just the Caesar salad was almost bigger then the whole table but the best dish in my personal opinion and also a very popular dish there was the lasagna it was extremely tasty and I absolutely recommend it! Also the prices aren't bad there but  actually rather decent. Pretty affordable for a family on vacation in Vegas!

RLcp4XYg6nXedHmgs8ZrYA.text: Four of us went out to eat and it was better than expected. The food is reasonably priced and there was enough for everyone to take leftovers. We had the upgraded steak that comes with the potatoes and sausage. I forget what its called, but its worth the extra $20.   We didn't need to order any sides, so we had the calamari and salad as appetizers. This was my first time here and I definitely wouldn't mind going back. The atmosphere was awesome, and they brought out a giant banana split for my wife's birthday.   Definitely worth checking out.   My only complaint is that I hate having to valet, but that's a personal pet peeve of mine and nothing to do with them. Other than that I enjoyed.

gu04DBtcwqxwOvwCWq_DMg.text: Perfect for big groups and the food is so good! I went with 13 people but the wait staff suggested way too much food. The servicing a are huge and family style. We got 4 appetizers and 6 entrees for 13 people and we had so much food left over. It was ridiculous. But everything was so good! Highly recommend the Italian salad and penne!

Yc5VkCDxV6o46mnvRMj1Nw.text: Carmines was an excellent choice for meeting some friends I haven't seen for over a year. Ron was our waiter and he was excellent. They had a veal special Wednesday evening that was simply delicious. Service was great, food was great, hanging out with friends was Priceless!

ILSUtFJLnc4oMetE_SlMQQ.text: Great place for a date night or to celebrate a family occasion. Plenty of room for large parties. Be prepared to enjoy a conversation with your party because the food is served family style. Lots and lots of food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Sopranos are just waiting to greet you.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great dinning area

t0yMNYb7WrVXl9bbN3Fneg.text: The bar happy hour is amazing. Very generous servings and happy hour prices. The meatball slides are the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xdr7bXHakb0iiiQAbl75Mg.text: Not sure why there are so many negative reviews. Carmine's has always been one of my favorite places to eat in NYC so I was excited to find one in Vegas! I had a picture of a pasta dish I had at the location in Times Square and this location took that picture and made something even better! Our server, Michael Baker, was accommodating, funny and entertaining! Please give this location a chance if you're reading this!! We had a FANTASTIC experience and really enjoyed ourselves! The food is, as always, AMAZING!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING!!

1AQdhBp9uaq5T5UW4uXS_A.text: Now this is what an Italian family style restaurant should be. Generous portions of delicious Italian food served in a cherry atmosphere by attentive, welcoming waiters. The Caesar salad was properly dressed and served with anchovies in the side. We had the spaghetti and meatballs and shrimp scampi. Tomato sauce was thick, rich and generous. Meatballs were moist with just a hint of garlic and cheese. Mama would be proud. Highlight of an already fantastic meal was the scampi. Not the butter and garlic drenched monstrosity served elsewhere. These were succulent shrimp seemingly baked in garlic, butter, white wine and parsley, with a seasoned bread crumb crust. This was the kind of dish that makes you smile. Simple Italian done right.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad done right, with anchovies on the side
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs. Shrimp scampi.

jsfJ2uWwZWd-_thhJdrqsQ.text: I've been to so many restaurants in Vegas over the last 15 years, I can't keep track.  This to me by far is the best Italian restaurant, and it was surprisingly reasonably priced.  I reserved a table for 6.  The server was very informative, and let us know that 2 or 3 family style plates will be enough to feed our whole table.   Being that I'm 6'3" and 205 lbs with a big appetite, and I happened to be the smallest guy at the table, I was skeptical.  When we ordered a Caesar salad which fed all 6 of us, then started to order 3 plates, he stopped me after ordering 2, and said "That will be enough".  Sure enough it was.  The portions are huge, which in my past experience means the food is mediocre, but not here.  The food tasted amazing.  We had lasagna, and Chicken Scaloppine w/ lemon & butter, and I'd order both again.   For 6 people, which included 2 dinner plates, 1 salad plate, 1 mixed drink, and 4 glasses of wine, the tab was $180.  Not bad at all to fill us up with great tasting food. Nobody had an appetite when we finished there.

_V1rtuR1FYV8p4cgQGHodA.text: We went to Carmine's after passing it several times over the last few weekends. The price is kinda deceiving. While the price I paid was $32 for the ragu, it was a huge portion. My girlfriend and I shared and we still had a lot of food to take home.  Definitely family style portions. And the waiter was very informative with the menu because I was ready to order three things. The food was very good. I'll repeat again and again and again. Total cost was $54 after (soft)drinks and tip. Very happy with this dinner selection.

xaGhuo4mFkhSNNWUq-5Bew.text: Very large family style portions.  Spaghetti and meatballs large enough for 4-6 people.  Meatballs were tender and succulent, among the best I've ever had.  They serve Duckhorn Cab by the glass, which was a pleasant surprise!  4 stars because it's a lot of food for 2 people so not very conducive of couples dining.

t62Zz12K7obWV0E8jje4Qg.text: Looks just like Carmine's ny!  I felt like I was there.   First thing, the bathrooms were disgustingly gross.  Clean them !

s1r4dA90MK_bxOxN1H1cXg.text: Carmine's- "NYC's legendary family style Italian restaurant."  It's the perfect description. From the moment you walk in, you're transported out of the Forum Shops and into Carmine's. I loved the ambience, great music and a family feel. I really did feel like I was dining in an old school New York Italian restaurant amongst good company.  We arrived Friday night with a large group and we came ready to eat.  Carmine's had us covered; their portions are HUGE!  My favorites were the cold antipasto, fried zucchini, and porterhouses contadina. Everything is cooked to perfection and the servers really do treat you like family. I wholeheartedly recommend this restaurant for those in search of great Italian food.  I'll definitely be back to try their calamari and spaghetti with meatballs.

r9HYJXYA-_Xl4qLkE2bCZQ.text: What's not to love? Pretty restaurant, busy, large menu and excellent service by Antonella!  She was fast, informative and worked hard!  Seated at a table towards the front, we could watch the hotel guests pass by and wish they were eating inside with us.  Great Italian menu!  The meatball was delicious as an appetizer!  We enjoyed the chicken parmesan with rigatoni family style as our entree.  Dessert?  The Tiramisu is gigantic like a pie and heavenly.  Our eyes did catch our neighboring table celebrating a birthday with The Titanic dessert!  Now, that was enormous and a work of art.  We may even decide to stay at Caesar's next time so we can frequent Carmines several times.  Thanks Antonella!

KoZT6doNP2nRNgib3jk7yg.text: Came in with a few of my good friends. The restaurant is traditionally southern Italian family style so the servings are served just as you were to be at home with your family on a Sunday evening.  We ordered the scarp wings with a delicious butter lemon rosemary sauce (omg definitely did not expect them to be this delicious!), hot antipasto (what a great deal for a sampler), large shrimp cocktail (these shrimp were the biggest shrimp I've ever seen!!) and for our main course we ordered a few pastas and entrees.  The pomodoro with spaghetti and prosciutto is to die for! Super fresh with large plum tomatoes with just enough spice to set it apart from the traditional red sauce.  Also the garlic and oil with ravioli is to die for, cheese heaven!!  For the cherry on top, Marcus provided us with the best service!  Answered each of our questions with absolute certainty and passion that had us at the edge of our seat anticipating the next course with excitement. Water bottle service, wine service, fresh new plates between each course and great suggestions for each plate.  Thank you for the endless amount of smiles and jokes throughout service!   This dining experience has truly been remarkable and I will definitely be back and telling my friends about it along the way!   Cheers for a great job well done guys.

1cJ5panJhOJnu66BeLeqaA.text: My wife and I were on our way to another bar/restaurant in the Forum Shops when we walked past this place and made a mental note to come back and try it sometime. It just looked inviting.  Turns out we got our chance sooner than expected when our plans at the other restaurant did not go entirely as planned. We had show tickets at 7:30 and had sat at a table at the other place from 5:30 to 6:15 without getting served so much as drinks, so we politely took our leave and ran back to Carmine's. Could they possibly accommodate us and get us to the show on time with such short notice?   We were seated straight away with no wait. When we explained our situation to our server, Ryan, he had our cocktails out within 5 minutes. Once we'd decided on our dinner items he talked to his manager and they bumped up our service order and had our entrees out about 5 minutes after that. We couldn't believe it! When they brought it to us we actually said "that can't be ours".   Did getting it so quickly impact the quality of the dish at all? If it did, then they should be charging more, because everything was fantastic. For drinks I had the Espresso Martini which was just spot on and my wife had the Sicilian Mule, which was somehow actually even better. We ordered Angel Hair Pomodoro and Veal Saltimboca for our entrees, which was way too much food for two people, but we ate every last scrap of it anyway because it was amazing. Oh, and we ate most of the bread basket too because how else were we going to sop up all of that delicious sauce that the Veal Saltimbocca was covered in?   Head to toe, beginning to end, Carmine's impressed the heck out of us. Not only will we be back, we'll be back with friends.

Prh-BD-mQYxdE-XWvETMJQ.text: We had a group of eight and it was perfect. Got the mixed greens salad, meatballs, chicken Marsala, penne with vodka sauce, and a pasta with bolognese meat sauce. We finished everything off and loved it all. Had great service and enjoyed the atmosphere, too!

mjxRfFOWKGgKWLL6vOwcWA.text: I came here the other day for my 21st Birthday and I just want to say Kyle was our waiter, he was just fantastic!! He was so attentive to us and that was great!  We couldn't have had a better experience here, we will be back to this location every time we come to Vegas ! Thanks Kyle for such an amazing experience!!

x-SipYw3kBMkcRjBufC8iQ.text: I could not find one thing I didn't love or wrong with Carmine's (wait, no gnocchi on the menu) well, ok there's one thing. But Wow! We were blown away with the portions, variety on the menu, presentation, service, taste and quality of the food. Great time, we had so much left it was two more meals. When at Cesar's, dine at Carmines. This place is made for large groups for sure. Love it!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The menu is great
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good size
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasagna and meatballs

sl4hwBRIB8XuExv4MxlYFg.text: I went here with a group of six and everyone was pretty bombed after a fun afternoon on the strip.  Dinner suggestions popped up, but options got slimmer when a companion meeting us was sporting a Randy "Macho Man" Savage t-shirt.  Giada was undoubtedly out of the question.  Carmine's welcomed us with open arms.    My jaw dropped as the hostess walked us to our table.  I gawked and commented out loud to no one in particular on the enormous portions at other tables.  Yeah, it's family style, but who's family??  The Brady Brunch with Alice?  Joey Chestnut's family???  The Klumps????  Monstrous plates of pasta were everywhere!!  The spicy wings were a fantastic appetizer.  $32 got us 24 wings, sliced fennel as opposed to celery, and their homemade bleu cheese dip.  Carmine's isn't a typical place to order wings, but these were some of the best I've had in recent memory.  The tomato based sauce had nice spicy kick and went so well with the thick dip.  The fennel grew on me bite after bite as it kind of worked as a palette cleanser.       Then all the main entrees came out.  Good god!!  The chicken parmigiana had ton of cheese on top and managed not to be dry despite being hammered super thin.  Ragu with meatballs was suggested by our server and he didn't steer us wrong.  I overheard someone else say the meatballs were "tender as fuck".  I agreed.    The main event was the "Four Pasta Special" which is only available Sundays.  If you have a chance to check out my picture, just look at how small the server's hand/wrist looks compared to the dish.  It looks like a child brought this dish over!  We barely made a dent in it.  I enjoyed lasagna and gnocchi the most.  My wife and I could never eat here by ourselves unless I cleared my car trunk out to make room for the leftovers.  The ones I did have on this particular evening came in a large aluminum buffet pan (no joke) and weighed at least 5 pounds.  If a full on Italian pig out is what you're looking for, look no further.

jfbZSGN9PD6_IlRTSIusPw.text: Fabulous dinner with wonderful friends. Our waiter was amazing & helped us determine just the right amount of food & beverage. He even talked me into the second lemon drop. Yum!!  The food was delicious & it was great to have family style so we could all have a little bit of everything. We left happy & stuffed.

FBL0U464BZWbYmGaMKuiCg.text: Excellent food and service.   I recommend the Veal.  The service was outstanding!  Don't miss this place when your at Caesars!

-QfjZnBksAk0QiZHFoXW2g.text: The food is very simplistic. However, if you're craving basic Italian food then this place is definitely your jam! The pasta and garlic bread were pretty good but not amazing. I didn't like how they don't have menus and instead there is a giant menu on the wall...bad day for me to forget my glasses. The service is very fast so not to worry about that and the servers are very nice.

7t4m8onXay4sgbSEVewvIw.text: Every time we visit Vegas we make it is an absolute must to visit Carmine's for their amazing happy hour.  I recommend the meatball sliders and the eggplant dish.  Also the frozen cosmo to go!

_Pqw_Hgf4mCiCcMma_Ctrg.text: I normally like Italian foods and restaurants, but I don't think I'll likely come back to this place again.   To begin, they don't really have any individual menus for you to view. Instead, they have a giant menu placed on the wall for EVERYONE to view. It was quite hard to see what was on it, especially when your table is far away.   Regarding the food, it is quite good. The servings come VERY large so it's acceptable to have at least a group of people when you come here.

WR1GOMWDHgieDkn8-pwIvA.text: First timers and will for sure be back. Fantastic service, great for families (kids or not) and casual or dressy. It shouldn't matter if your a local or not but the manager heard we were and he made sure our experience was fantastic. I recommend this place because they did an all around fantastic restaurant experience!  I gave four stars just because the special was way too $$$ for what we got.

_en8P2dciRVhvI8mZtGiKQ.text: My husband and I ate here as guests of a wedding reception. There were roughly 120 people eating dinner at this reception. The service was great, the food was amazing!!! I highly recommend the Italian ice drinks from the bar and the Penne alla Vodka. However, the women's restroom was in poor condition. It was not clean, one of the sinks was clogged and had standing water. The toilets were dirty, and majority of the  soap dispensers were empty. Now keep in mind this was a Saturday night at 7, at their busiest hours. If the women's restroom was this unsatisfactory I can only imagine what the men's looked like.  In all I would say this is an amazing place to eat, but the cleanliness was poor.

RImU06JmgTlwHvycY2RK5Q.text: I like how they give you an option to dine in the main dining room and eat large family style meals or sit at/near the bar and have appetizers and smaller plates which are still enough for 2. Meatball sliders are OUTSTANDING, garlic bread was delicious as well. The Italian sandwich had lots of flavor. Came in for a small bite but got tons of food, everything looked good and we kept hearing great things about this place. Will be back!

87rU8b2saDseRXNisB_AUw.text: So talk about catering to a BIG party. It was over my nephew Vegas Cup soccer tournament weekend. The team wanted team dinner before the tournament started for team bounding but also just so the kids all be together. My nephew mom was in charge of finding the restaurant. She decided Carmine would be great spot! It very similar to Buca De Beppa the whole family style concept and really perfect for bunch of kids. It was my first time dining at Carmine's. Truth be told not much difference between the two from the concept or the food. I think both are very good italian food. They do your basics well from chicken parmesan, spaghetti with meatballs, caesar salad, and on on. On this night had preset menu started with caesar salad that was good. Nothing that blew me away but solid refreshing salad start. The spaghetti and meatballs good. The meatballs were decent size not over the top size but nice juicy, cooked on point, and tasty. The tomato sauce could have sue more flavor in my opinion. Still overall good pasta course. The chicken parmesan was good. It have nice crust on the outside . The tomato sauce brought it all together. The dessert if there was anything food stood was the dessert course. It was modified strawberry shortcake. Instead of pound cake they used more banana bread. The fresh strawberry not skimpy about and the sauce brought it all together. Talk about finishing meal on high note.  SHOUT OUT that well deserve Catherine not sure if she in charge of parties or her role in the restaurant. She was the main person dealt with setting up BIG party as in over 40people. Number that was constantly changing at the last minute adding more since some families not sure if make flight in on time or what not. Each time called the restaurant it was never big deal and she was more happy change it. Not sure if it was timing but they opened up back (talk about deceiving but keep walking back back back separate dining area for parties) area since we had over 40people. It was awesome for the kids that they had extra space. It not as loud so everyone could talk stories and just relax enjoy before the tournament. Catherine came out when we first got sat make sure everything was good, and very grateful brought big group into the restaurant. Our server she did amazing job also sorry not remember her name. Big parties it chaos comes to bill. She did great job and deserve shout out. The service was FIVE stars without doubt.   Yes first review without pic! =(((( They should add that to firsts on Yelp. LOL!!!

VQYV0sx8muUAuYHFRcckhg.text: My husband and I stopped here for the happy hour specials. We ordered the bread, zucchini and mussels. I noticed something strange poking out of the mussel, i pulled it out and OMGGGG SO GROSS it was a CRAB! I showed the waiter and he looked horrified. The manager came to our table and said it was a crab, it's fresh seafood and that happens once in a while. Hmmm I was so grossed out i totally lost my appetite. I don't think I'll eat mussels ever again. I feel the manager could/should have done more.

XA4AqsNFZiog9HB5pYO2JQ.text: Had a long day at a trade show wanted a good sit down restaurant so I picked Carmine's. Bad idea! I feel bad for the servers because they do a good job but can't make up for the average and overpriced food. You're better off going to Olive Garden if you want average Italian food.

nlrG06X7X43xhnyV4EgtYw.text: Came here last year with family, and we loved it.  The portions are huge, and meant to be shared family style.  This time it is just my wife and I.  Fortunately this place has a smaller portion menu, but you have to sit in the bar area.  The staff are friendly and attentive, and the food was awesome.  We still had a little leftover, good thing we have a fridge in our room (late night snack :)  If you are going for one of the House reds, I recommend the Chianti.

Zx4bMZeRORX4TPbyfF40gQ.text: Never go to this restaurant the food was so salty, I try to just sucked and eat it but it was no way eatable so my server was kind a pissed and then I asked for my free dessert he made me wait and come back. The coupon said show this to your server but whatever. The main reason I came here is to try their bread pudding (my fav) but noooo! It's ok it my be sugary anyway!!!!

P-A7pK8GWt9QJauT_67cbg.text: We stayed in Caesars Palace for 3 nights, and we ate here 2 of the nights. This place was great, located in the mall at Caesars Palace it was about a 5 minute walk from the room.   We tried the Mushrooms, Caesar Salad and the Penne Vodka. Everything was delicious. My only complaint is the food portions, if you go there as a couple plan on having left overs. The typical plate feeds 4-5 people. They do have a small bar menu but I found that it was a little bit limited.   We will definitely be back on our next trip!

2auo0j6GKCQq_tYyZl9kIg.text: Amazing! Great prices on bar food and tasters menu. Doesn't have Alfredo sauce though:/

5wcTfsv8PcE-ABd8Vmoaiw.text: Came here with a large group of people and was pleasantly surprised. Unlike most restaurants, Carmine's serves food family style so each dish is a huge portion that can serve multiple people. There were 11 of us and we had for appetizers: salad, wings, and calamari. For dinner we had, the stuffed fish special, veal, pasta bolognese, pasta alla vodka.  All of the food was absolutely fantastic and we were beyond stuffed at the end (and even had leftovers). If you are a lover of garlic this is the place for you, they use a healthy amount in each dish. I would recommend the wings for an appetizer. They are garlicky and delicious. If you are going to choose any entree, it must be the bolognese. It was one of the best I have had and is quite filling.  The sticker shock of each dish can seem daunting but if ordering as a group, you can most likely get away spending less per person than most restaurants in Vegas due to the portion size.   I wish they had one close to me since I would definitely go. I highly recommend it if you are traveling with a small or large group in Vegas.

Zz9d2F-DgZ5GgJvaMtxbmA.text: Carmine's Italian Restaurant has excellent service and you have to plan on sharing meals since they are so large and taste amazing. The restaurant is clean and neat, friendly staff and a large bar with planets of options. I'm visiting Vegas from Santa Monica for the weekend, and stopped here for a quick bite. I had the spaghetti pomodoro and it was delicious.

RzqBAUeLvcR_umgLvq1rBA.text: I LOVED Carmine's when we lived in DC. Me and my husband used to go and get the chicken saltimbocca and an app of calamari at least once a month if not a couple times a month. I was  so excited when I saw a Carmine's in Caesars. The day after I saw it I brought my sister here talking it up. The chicken saltimbocca was good. My sister ordered the greens salad. Eh. I didn't care for it. But our service was AWFUL!!! I was so excited and talking to the server and she just failed in every way possible. It was extremely disappointing. I won't go back to this location. Idk if the one in AC is still there maybe I'll try that one next time I'm there.

jSEPfvNoE5rA0ZiZnRbybA.text: Had a room for a wedding party of 22 guests. The service and food were amazing. The staff is great and the food is plentiful and delicious. Great value as well compared to other Vegas restaurants.

R142YXqL0Dy7MqmlrZDESg.text: Better bring a ton of people and your stomachs to Carmine's!  This is in my opinion the best "Family Style" Italian restaurant I have been to.  The atmosphere has that home old school Italian feel, and right when you walk in you get hit with all the good Italian aromas.  The food is all family style and each item can literally feed at least 2 people.  To start you have to get the Cold Antipasto.  When this thing came out is was like a 2 foot long plate covered in meat, cheese, and bread.  Once that is done start running down the menu.  For the beef The Rack of Lamb would be a great choice which is a house specialty was super tender, juicy and melt in your mouth goodness.  Next if you want to go off the menu you can get the Carbonara for a pasta.  The Carbonara noodles were cooked perfectly they you get the creaminess of the sauce with the saltiness of the Pancetta.  One word Phenomenal.  Then if you want to go with an Italian staple you have to get the Lasagna.  The lasagna is doused in tomato sauce with the right amount of meat and cheese.  This this was dense and will fill you up fast!  If you have enough room for dessert you can never go wrong with the Cannoli's, but for some odd reason you are not human and still can eat a horse you have to get the TITANIC.  The TITANIC is literally the size of the actual ship.  It is The Titanic at Carmine's is a gigantic sundae made with six whopping scoops of ice cream, whipped cream, caramelized fruit, hot fudge sauce and an entire Chocolate Torta.  Overall, the food is amazing the service is good but sometimes it will be awhile before the waiter checks on you which is the reason why Carmine's is down to 4 stars but whenever I am in Vegas I always visit Carmine's.    BrandonFitFoodie

FKqq-Nozb2UH9D-oZc957Q.text: Not bad  but the food was standard American Italian chain type to me . I am of Italian ancestry from  NYC so I am picky The restaurant was nicely decorated the staff great etc but I was not wowed by the food

TkPBMkmCU0ZgVe71YRpyvg.text: I hate when restaurants only offer happy hour in their bar but do not offer regular seating. I am fairly short and find barstools awkward to get on and uncomfortable to sit in. Still we decided to give it a try. We finally ended up leaving after being ignored by the bartender.

GX3p3zV-jy7NnqWg8orK8w.text: Our bartender was incredibly short and curt with us from the get-go. He asked us twice if we wanted the check when we were clearly not even close to finished. He never offered to refill our drinks or asked if we wanted coffee, dessert, etc. the bar was loud, so when I said a second time if we could get some bread, he said "yeah can you gimme a minute?" with a very rude tone that I did not appreciate. He also was very polite and respectful to other patrons and we were the only gay/black couple there. I don't know what his problem was but it did not meet the high standards I have come to expect from Carmine's in NY. I would never want to return to this location again and hope no one else experiences the awful service we encountered.

pMSLp7LEk823a3IwryxpRQ.text: Bring a large group of people because the portions are HUGE and the price is STEEP. Our server was good but the food wasn't. Because of him, the hostess, and the fact my work paid for the dinner: they are the only reason I didn't rate it 1 star.  We ordered caesar salad -- which was actually delicious and make sure you get extra anchovies,  2 different lobster dishes, chicken cachatorie I believe, cheese raviolis,  a mixed green salad, calamari, fried zuchinni, and bolognese.   The bolognese sauce was decent, calamari was ok, and that's about it. The drinks weren't worth mentioning,  and nobody touched much of the pasta at the bottom of each dish.

mm-GN2MLseAe3m5HvHht5A.text: Amazing food that is family style. Amazing service and hospitality. Highly recommend for any family or friend event/ celebration. You will not be disappointed. Also don't forget to get the titanic dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I2NTpkUKKPYKCUStYF7Jnw.text: Happened upon Carmine's while wandering the Caesar's Palace. The seductive smell of fresh Italian food was so very pleasant.Brought back memories of Mulberry St. in NY. The place was packed but we were seated immediately. Our server Natalie was right on top of things. She wasted no time getting our drink and appetizer orders. Carmine's is a family style restaurant so the portions are HUGE. I had the Penne ala Vodka. Oh man....was it delicious.Truly the best sauce ever.My husband had the ravioli. He said it was wonderful. We both ate more than we usually do.We asked for a basket of bread which had various types/flavors of bread. I really liked the fennel bread. Fresh and full of flavor.  We had enough leftover for the next day. And it was just as good! A lively and loud place but  so worth it. We are locals and will go back.

RU0KbTwiR3RdiWrVBbKBEw.text: Ugh, I wish there was one closer to me! I'd be a regular. Carmines salad is delicious and so is the marinara sauce and their meatballs.

ACP8xqEQjpZbWxMFpHX65g.text: My family and I were in Vegas for my bday and asked the concierge for good Italian food and they recommended Carmines... and they were right on the money! The service was amazing! We had the seafood pasta in linguine and one of the best I have had! They also brought one meatball for me since I was the only one in the mood for meatballs. Great good and the titanic ice cream was more than we can handle! Will definitely be another stop for our next Vegas trip!

-JPgkIFt9Db2qBSzDYAzZw.text: We had a large party if 15, and they were friendly, efficient, and the food was surprisingly good even though everything was family size and style.   The Sat steak special dish was fantastic, as was the seafood pasta. The rigatoni with sausage and broccoli, and chicken Marsala was solid.  The antipasto salad and combination appetizer dishes were just okay.  The salad was huge, so we wished we only order 1, and same with the appetizers cu they were only so-so  Overall though it was a great place for a large group meal, with extremely reasonable prices for Vegas!

N5DiJnFSkYXxLeNR6LibWg.text: True Italian food at its best. Feel like your in the movies is place. We will be returning next trip. Some best food I have ever had...

C6Pej4rg_Thu7S3wuacUkw.text: If in Vegas and from MIDWEST to the west coast there's not much family Italian that tips this place. Coming from the northeast, it's simply good. For Vegas, it's great.

rPle5tdY_WCzSQu5W6GwGA.text: This place is delicious...huge portions but Wow!!! So worth it.  The lasagna was to die for. Totally recommend Carmine's.  Bread basket is great too!!!!

MPb8y7BhNtwo5GzV1nIv0Q.text: If you want a massive meal at a great price with awesome high quality food, come here. ... And ask for the server, Carl. He is the best!!!

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta pasta and more pasta

nO8eTEljEnusMRNy9GPQSQ.text: Some very reasonable, large format, Italian wines... so that was cool. We got the lasagna and spaghetti with rigatoni - both safe dishes in mixed company. Both were served family style in HUGE portions. There was so much food that we ended up having left overs even after only having ordered 2 dishes for 4 people. Think Maggiannos... only bigger.   The lasagna was pretty good, the spaghetti, not so much.

9ioyW9n7McRd14Hu9g9bMg.text: As soon as i land this is the first place i run too. Service...amazing. Food ...delicious. Doesn't matter if you are at the New York or Vegas location, its like going home!

MvZJq0GvS6907gkCh4EIYw.text: Took my little sister here for dinner on her 21st birthday .Ron are waiting was amazing only mistake he made was not asking us if we were celebrating anything special.  We forgave him with the great service.  Best Calamri EVER people, the pasta was delicious, wish the sausage were bigger. We don't like cold bread so we didn't enjoy the bread. Wish it was nice a warm from the oven like we prefer. We decide to return the next day for another great experience bad idea .The only reason I am not giving this restaurant 5 star is because my second visit was not great  the waiter was horrible on October 10th . We waited forever for him to come say hello never gave us his name . We left without ordering because he just ignored us. I didn't want to bother, the sad part the girl at the front hostess di dnt even notice we just came and left 20 minutes later. I will give them a 3rd chance and speak up next time if I receive the same service.

0kRm994ENncsJtqz8FVxBQ.text: I've been to Carmine's with a large group and was pretty excited about the whole family style thing they had going on. I was so disappointed with it. The food was far from good and the restaurant was overpriced for what it was. I was served overly salty plates, burnt broccolis and overcooked pastas. The price made it that much worst, as I had much better food for a lot less on that trip (come on... It's Vegas! There is good food in that city). My one star goes to the service, that was pretty decent.  If you are looking for good food in Vegas, skip on that one.

hc0K6afZCYbRvIdEbLrILw.text: So there are a ton of places to eat but we had reservations at Carmine's after the Elton John concert. Long line as we walked up and they seated us right away.....make reservations!  Large portions, great wine, and a wonderful environment. Everyone was very festive. Ryan our server told us we didn't need menus and asked us what we wanted to eat.  He just ordered for us....what a blast!  Great times, thanks Carmine's!

7YUBHOkk3jNO8yOapG2Jqw.text: I've been to the original Carmine's in Time Square NY.  This one is just as good.  I still think it's the best Italian restaurant I've ever been too.  Just be warned, their portions are huge.  I would not plan on coming with a group less then 4.  The ceasar salad alone is like a small mountain.  2 people probably couldn't finish that.    I highly recommend the lasagna, it's delicious.  Just too bad they do not offer anything with alfredo sauce.

wgJ9zn9WXo-ITJXZSyBOtQ.text: Excellent service, food, wine, and atmosphere for a reasonable price. Chances are high that you will over-order and will not be upset about it.  Highly recommend "The Titanic" for dessert if you have a few people and some room left. You won't be disappointed.

XWXXfLvW9WstpnRgxZ3Evw.text: Carmine's in the Caesar's Palace Forum Shoppes is a terrific evening for you and friends, couples and such.  It epitomizes Italian cuisine served in family portions.  The ambiance is unique, friendly, kinda sexy/cozy and well worth a night of dining.     While with 7 other friends we went without a reservation on a Friday night (8:00PM) and were seated in under 10 minutes.   Drinks came quickly after a great server gave us a rundown of specials, one of which we ordered (read on).     Ours was a semi-business dinner so as drinks were being served we were going around the table in discussion.  Soon after I was provided a second drink service by the manager with the server saying, "Our manager didn't believe you were having a good time by the non-passionate look on your face.  Enjoy."  Now readers, when was the last time that ever happened to you in a nice restaurant.  Carmine's went way up the charts for me on that one.      We dined on a special which was breaded chicken filets covered in provolone cheese coupled with pasta.  Another entree was lasagna.  The third was a fettucini in a white veggie-based sauce.  Each meal was delicious, huge portions that would easily feed 3 - 4 people dining.  And the total bill was manageable for 8 guys.      I highly recommend anyone in Vegas pay a visit to Carmine's - big time good food and fun times.

A49WeAQLXfeI-TUmfyDsLw.text: Never has so much good food at one restaurant. The portions are huge, you should share.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super portions
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed salmon

Kea5O5WoD_0LY588ynLjng.text: We went with a very large group... Over 30 people. We had three tables. The food was delicious. The service was spot on. The portions were huge! The prices were more than fair. Great place for large group.

8zHUjkD7OLvdniUA_7A9BA.text: Stopped in for a quick lunch. Family style spaghetti and meatballs was great. I splurged and had a cocktail - Sinatra Tea - which was wonderful and incredibly strong. Unfortunately I did not realize this until I tried to walk through the mall.

CubLw1Nz6O4KNcX8eyaXXA.text: Horrible experience. Groups SHOULD NOT COME HERE! We were in Vegas from out of town. Made reservations for a large group, celebrating my aunts bday. I've never been to a restaurant that doesn't have food menus but had drink menus instead?!   To order our food, we had to take a picture of the menu board on my phone. Then go back to the table to order. Most plates on the menu averaged between $20-$30 which I was ok with since the servings were big. I normally ask waiters for suggestions at new places. The waiter, (not friendly) tall Hispanic guy with black glasses, suggested a seafood plate bc it was great (according to him). I took his word for it. At the time of the bill, that dish was $70!!!!!!! After reviewing the "menu board" I had taken a picture of on my phone, that dish was not on the menu!! What was supposed to be a nice dinner turned out to be a horrible one instead. I felt mislead by the waiter. Why would he suggest something that wasn't on the menu or even mention the price? If I had had a menu on my hands like you would at most restaurants, I wouldn't have ordered that dish. I felt he was trying to add to the bill to increase his tip percentage. Not only that, but the seafood made me sick with food poisoning.   I will never recommend this place to anyone. I did tell all my close friends about the bad experience I had and now I'm sharing it on yelp to warn others who plan to have group dinners here. Worst experience, bad food and I didn't appreciate getting screwed over by the waiter. They need to have menus like all other restaurants do. Only reason I'm giving them one star, is simply bc I have to.

mUVW6ju4dIBzKk4WCFA-IQ.text: Fantastic. Oh how we miss New York's Carmine's. To have it in Vegas is great.  Great food, great Flavors and not costly for what you get. Go hungry and expect to go home with left overs.

cpNVmxzV2w8y42-8CRKOBA.text: Yet again another amazing visit at Carmine's. This has now become our Vegas trip tradition. During this visit, we were so glad to see Anthony (general manager) and Chef Michael-- they both are the best!! We yet again had an amazing meal and service. This visit we has the gluten free pasta with shrimp! Thank you Carmine's for another amazing meal!

KjjhfPW2YkSnELATGsWQyw.text: This place is great for family's but not for two people. Lucky here they have half orders of certain pastas!   My girlfriend and I walked by and immediately got drawn in by other people's pastas on their table.   We sat at the bar because that's where they only offer half sized pastas. Which is perfect for two people! We ordered the Penne Al Vodka and it was delish. The sauce was felt homemade and the pasta was cooked al dente.   They even give you a pretty good bread basket with assorted breads to eat from.   I didn't really like our server that was the bartender. He wasn't very inviting and kept trying to push the large pasta to us when you know we won't finish it. After we even ordered our pasta, he kept wanting us to order a appetizer but we can't cause it's HUGE.   Other than that, the pasta here was great and will come back for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half order of penne al vodka

yz997-8yLNcpLsXn6ZeKXA.text: The restaurant itself is stunning, with cool decor throughout the place. Our waiter was kinda blah but watching other tables waiters, you can tell they are on top of their work.  Our food was amazing!!! We orders penne alla vodka, white seafood mix and chicken Marsala. Each fish was very good. The only thing I would change is the stupid menu on the wall.... if you can charge $30  a plate, you can afford menus each for your guests... I don't care for people walking closing and hovering over my table because they can't see across the restaurant to look at the menu.

mE-9l33CbjZ_r3KPb24f-A.text: LOVE this place! Big portions, delicious food and house wine is great! I probably come here with spouse, friends and family at least ever other month or so. Definitely my favorite Italian place in town!

TBGxpkVfpqYj0K9Z7Nb1WQ.text: I come here because they have the best Tom Collins I've ever had! The sad part is we also got some of the worst service. I had never eaten here, just had drinks at the bar and decided to give the food a try. We sat at the high tops in the bar. The waiter never brought us bread, forgot to bring our salad and our entree was barely warm. Got the salad after the entree and had to ask for the bread. Never offered us a drink refill or did anything for the inconvenience other than "sorry about that." Eon't eat here again.

Gp_WlBX1ZjbcrG9k_0Xjxg.text: Carmine's offers their food in the family-style.  Most of their dishes are so huge that they could feed two people.  Their prices seem to add that notion in there because it is expensive and not worth the price if you were ordering a meal and appetizer per person.  Sharing, maybe; individual, no way.  We were here for a party so they had dishes prepared for us and they were passed around the table.  Therefore, we tried many different dishes so I was able to experience a lot of their dishes.  We began with calamari, mushrooms, and salad.  The calamari was very good and cooked perfectly but the others were not worth mentioning.  The main meal consisted of a few types of pasta and some meat accompaniments. I did not think any were exceptional or worth mentioning either.  The sauce was solid on the spaghetti, however.    The atmosphere at the restaurant, located in the Forum Shoppes, was nice, but the food underwhelmed unless the only reason you are coming here is to have leftovers for the next day, also.

A0X4s5udPE7QkOEdC4vQZA.text: Great traditional, east coast Italian food.  Very large portions (2 adults and 2 teens shared the chicken parm with pasta). If you are looking for solid southern Italian, this is a great choice.   Solid service, small but adequate wine list.  Restaurant has great ambience.

38540pAJy5TAR0xYKBM8Ow.text: To say anything less than great would be an understatement !!! I would recommend you show up with no less than 4-6 ppl cause they have large portions of food !! Great service and the food well I don't want to comment because it was greatttttttt!!!! There you have it folks ...

utttWHBRB-Xu_fq8TVavRw.text: So to start, the ambience of the restaurant is lovely. This place is HUGE, so the large portions and ample seating is great for parties. Our waitress was a little spacey, and I would say her performance was a little less than average. We started with drinks, and she definitely poured my sister's Hoegaarden poorly, but I guess it's not too big of a deal. The bread basket given contains a mini variety, but unfortunately both baskets had really cold bread. Some were topped with cheese, so it would've been nice to have had it warmed at least instead of it feeling like it came from the fridge. We ordered Carmine's salad ($22.95), mix seafood pasta (I forgot, sorry!), and chicken parmigiana ($34.95). The salad was good, and the portion was more than enough for our party of 7. I was really disappointed with our main dishes. Both the seafood and the chicken were just extremely bland and dry. We ordered our pasta with white sauce (choice of red and white), but it was just flavorless! I really expected more. Even the chicken parmigiana was tasteless.   Overall - I miiiight give this place another chance, but it's not likely. It might have been the food we ordered, but I was not impressed at all with our dinner. I would rate it 2.5 stars if I could.

Zzm2z4iP7SDvy6W5V3NYxA.text: First let me start by saying there's so much more that goes into a yelp rating besides the food. The food at Carmine's is okay...not the best Italian but it's a decent option inside the Forum Shops.   Now, the reason I gave them 1 star is for service in the restaurant and management's lack of caring about their guest's experience. I'm more willing to understand so so service if the restaurant is packed and you can tell the waiter/waitress is working their butt off. However, this was not the case.   I had lunch here during the week and there were only about 5 tables occupied in the whole restaurant. (This place is huge!!) I was surprised by how slow the waitress was to check on us and even get refills. Now my biggest complaint was when I asked how long their strawberry shortcake would take to make (since I was on a lunch break) and she said 5-7 minutes. Okay, 7 minutes...that's fine. It actually took 20 minutes and the waitress was no where to be found in the meantime. When she finally came around, I asked for it in two boxes to go...so my friend and I could take it with us for later. We waited another 10 minutes and had to speak with a manager. Besides being late, the worst part....later on when I went to enjoy my dessert, I was shocked to find that my box contained whipped cream and strawberries, and later found out my friend's box had the shortcake. Hmm. I asked the waitress for two boxes so we could each take one home...and this is what we were given. :(   Obviously, I was upset so I called in to speak with a manager, I was told to leave a message and no one ever got back to me.

Lxwl8rbVLFrOQMfYtpJktw.text: I thought the food was wayyyyy overpriced and just mediocre.  We ordered chicken parmigiana and it was ok did not really have a lot of flavor and does not come with any spaghetti. add $10 if you want a side of spaghetti..

AkrXkAfu6kE_eLbt7xR71A.text: Came here for dinner during a work trip; last minute reservation but they were able to get us a table. Everything from the service to the amazing Spaghetti Bolognaise was wonderful!! HUGE portions (family style). I recommend the Stuffed Artichokes for an appetizer (they give you 2 HUGE ones). Will definitely go again the next time I visit.

udNp1lnyA9_d3sO4aK9O9g.text: Good food but I got the nations worst waiter. Ignored and then sarcastic comments. This was my second trip and first was better. I can't remember the last time I didn't tip and I'm still steaming at the poor service.

_Wncn9eh_vIm82Cuj5SoQw.text: I wish I took pictures of our food.  We got calamari, fried zucchini sticks and eggplant parm roll.  FANTASTIC!!  I have wanted to try Carmine's for years, I have two of the cookbooks and they are great.  This Vegas location did not disappoint!!

Tx6R8AGCC2jCUtqJP8O1Kg.text: We came here to celebrate our wedding. The food and service were amazing. Can't wait to go back.

t5gnsY-5Y0vBHPawT1Xl2g.text: Love carmines and have been to both NY locations, Atlantic city and vegas before. But they changed the penne ala vodka!!! Does not taste like the penne vodka that they made me fall in love with!!!! The mixed green salad is so huge and refreshing and delicious and i cant wait to have it again!!

27aGSJxDR1m_uIhB37h3eg.text: My family and I came here yesterday for thanksgiving and got 2- thanksgiving family fest .. and omg it was really good, my whole family loves it ! There was 16 of us and our waiter was super nice and attentive ! We will be back for the food and I recommend coming here !!

-9-WtWxQvslj2twu1k5lkg.text: Wear your sweatpants! They have huge family style portions! I highly recommend their calamari, Carmine's salad and tiramisu. And you can't go wrong with any of their entrees. This is my new favorite Italian restaurant!  Scott, our waiter, was superb and made sure we ordered the right combination of flavors. He was also not scared to tell us that it was too much or too little food for our party of 5 (loved his honesty!) Try to get a table close to the front of the restaurant so you can feel like you're dining outside under the painted blue clouds of Ceasars Palace.

DhL6zxewpLPfZwc_ZfSh7g.text: Been here several times and each time has been pretty awesome. The food is fantastic and so are the drinks. But better than the food is the service. The manager was wonderful coming up and striking  conversation, making everyone feel welcome. Frank Sinatra playing through the speakers is pretty sweet too.

wjK-W4POhCeLFBBahrJ0_Q.text: Holy Moly, the portions here are REDIC!  You best come hungry, nuff said.  Located in the Forum Shops at Caesars, Carmine's is an absolute delight.  The restaurant itself is large and can easily accommodate a group of any size.  Don't expect your server to bring you a menu as their menus are posted up on the wall all around the dining room.  There you will also find what the current daily special is.    Your server will bring out a basket of bread and, while you may be tempted to snack on it while waiting for your meal, do so at your own risk!  As I stated above, they offer "family portions" (ie: large portions) and that is a gross understatement.  We are talking pounds and pounds of pasta and food.  Yum.  We got three plates to split between the five of us and suffice it to say, we had plenty to take home.  The ravioli was incredible, I mean, it was easily our favorite thing we ordered, so do yourself a favor and get it.  You're welcome.    Our server was fast and tentative and even asked if we were sure we wanted to order three items (we told him we live dangerously).  They also take reservations so feel free to add this to your planning itinerary.  Carmine's acted as a last supper of sorts our last trip to Las Vegas, and I must say, it was a perfect ending to a perfect week.

bhN8xFNs2A9cMfa4HP7Srw.text: Worst cheese ravioli I have ever had! The sauce was just as bad! Guessing people go there for the huge family style portions! The only reason I gave this place two stars was because the service was good.

5TGnKngPWUzyhwmAkO5bJw.text: Deliciousness! A mouthful of bursting flavor. This is my new found glory for when visiting in Vegas! Everything from the service, atmosphere, location and most importantly the food all was on point. Thank you Italiano! =}

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hzsqkcGS0-vQduyV7IQmbw.text: This restaurant is in Caesar's Hotel shops and malls. We have dined previously at Carmine's in NYC so we know they serve more food than we can consume. We did not know they serve smaller dishes if you sit at a high top in the bar area. My wife and I split a "smaller" order of spaghetti and meat balls with a (huge) side of fried zucchini. The service was great, the place was hopping, and we didn't spend a fortune.

9AMrPBf8lQ7oA0tNT8kHng.text: Wow, what a place. It's big and loud and the menu  has lots of choices. I would say if you wanted a quiet, cozy spot, this would not be the place. The food is served family style and therefore the portions are huge and great for sharing or for having the next day for lunch. It's pricey, but what isn't in Vegas for a good meal? For instance, if you would like a salad or a vegetable to accompany your meal, the Caesar salad (which is enough for 5 or 6 people) costs $29 and some steamed broccoli, served in a huge bowl is $17, again, enough for multiple people to share.  My biggest problem with our dinner last night was the service. DAVID was our server and although he was polite, he was not enthusiastic and didn't want to spend one extra minute at our table helping to answer our questions. Maybe he was having a bad night, but when you're out in Vegas and are about to spend $150 for 2 people to eat dinner, you'd like to think your waiter would be personable and seem happy you are there. I'm not sure if I would go back because of the service; however, the quality of the food might make me reconsider.

D1yYtzjAwkS4y5EemP6vpw.text: Food is better than average but the service is what gets them to 5 stars.  Our waiter did a great job with our table of 8.  He gave us some history of the restaurant, Italian cuisine in general and vegas restaurants.  Food is served family style.

dv0XC2P3cYx52VXOJtWplw.text: My two friends and I came here a couple of weeks ago. We realized it was family style but did not realize how big the portions were. Very impressive!   We had the best caesar salad to begin then calamari and for our main entree, we had the mixed seafood with linguini and red sauce. It was seriously one of the best meals I've ever had.   Also, our waitress was so nice!

3v8x1E-l66OLzbxmxS0cog.text: Excellent restaurant!   Seafood Linguine is amazing. Best if you have 4 or more diners.  Family style portions.

qVVPfsnobC3I6_1OvqJxwA.text: What an incredibly fun place to dine! It's an awesome place if you've got a big group of folks to feed. All of Carmine's entrees are served family style. We had around 20 in our party and the staff took care of us with military precision. We were never rushed and were taken care of perfectly. All of our entrees were delicious and very ample in their serving size.

Nn5yD4tLxreoD3IEJNsLyw.text: Amazing!!!!! The staff was awesome. Very friendly, helpful. They took lots of time to explain the menu and made suggestions. The spaghetti and meatballs were the best I've ever had.  There were six in our group. We got 2 entrees and a salad and we had plenty of leftovers. I look forward to visiting again.

IQ9_ccSTNfgbKaU9Tujiag.text: Our memory is from Times Square. This is really close. The waiter had attitude. We love that. The food was excellent, huge portions, but we knew that.  If you are not from NY/NJ/PA you need to experience this. It's a great time and great food!!  It's excellent food!!!

YR99zjxvg3zomF7F59y6xg.text: Reasonably priced Italian food. (For Vegas) the bread is probably my favorite as they give you a variety and it's free with the main course. The atmosphere was very warm. My dad and I ordered the rigatoni with the red sauce. At first when I saw the portion size I thought oh I'm going to scarf that down so fast- but the sauce is soooo rich and sweet that I didn't eat nearly as much as I thought I would. Overall nice place and genuine staff.
