Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9d1o1bouWp3BtabFY4m3hA.text: Quick look: NYC's famed Carmines in the center on the Forum Shops Mall delivers  traditional Italian fare in MASSIVE family type portions. Couples / single diners beware - this is a lot of food and I suggest groups of 4 or more for ideal proportions.   In depth review: being from NY we were well aware of the Carmine's reputation. Was excited to FINALLY get a chance to try their fare here in Vegas. Ate there this past Monday night and the massive space was pretty full at 7pm for dinner. Nice casual setting with high ceilings, a freakishly large bar with flat screens showing the football game and large menu boards and classic Italian pics decorating the walls. Felt very warm and comfortable even though the room was gargantuan and located in a busy mall.   Server was a nice Serbian fella and he was very attentive. Made some good suggestions and explained the portions and the menu. We kept it simple and ordered a mixed drink, a glass of wine, calamari appetizer and the veal parmesan with penne pasta. The calamari priced at $17 was the largest portion I have ever seen. Was a mountain of fried squid and way too much for two people. It was good, breaded well and not too greasy. We almost filled up on this and had to stop ourselves. The bread was also very tasty!  The veal parmesan came out with perfect timing after the appetizer. The serving dish was piled 4 inches high with penne pasta and it included two giant slabs of veal parm on the top. Wife and I looked at each other in disbelief at how large this dish was. The waiter served us and we started to eat. It was very tasty and the veal was prepared perfectly. The red sauce was also delicious and was glad to see that they did not use sugar when preparing it. We ate till we couldn't eat any more and we had a lot to take home with us in doggy-bags. Was it the best I have ever had, no. But it was certainly one of the better traditional veal parm dishes in the city.   It's a lot of food. Too much for less than four people. We actually had enough for two more additional meals!!  My advice would be to add a "couples menu" to their menu. Many couples go out in Vegas. It's a different market and I feel like the large, massive portions alienate couples who want to eat there. Who would want to carry doggy-bags around with them on the mall and on the all night? A lot of people do not have refrigerators in their hotel rooms as well. Price for two of us was about $130. So the pricing is not exactly cheap.   Was a solid meal and w/o a smaller, couples menu - I will only return when I have family or friends in town and they want to eat traditional "red sauce" Italian.  I have also had lunch here - the submarine sandwiches are also MASSIVE! I had an Italian mixed and a tomato and mozzarella sandwich and both were tasty and well made. The bread is super fresh and they don't hold back on the meat. Two people can split one and have more than enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan Family Style, Penne Pasta, Red Wine
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmesan over Penne Pasta (Family Style)
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari Appetizer (Massive &amp; Tasty)

rD0ipRiHBwEB6-YDiAOPRw.text: My wife and I came here after a show.  We weren't hungry enough for a whole dinner, but wanted an appetizer or desert.  We ended up getting the stuffed mushrooms and chocolate cake.  The place has a nice ambiance.  Our server was very nice.  He did disappear for LOONGG periods of time, and we spent a fair amount of time waiting.  (The restaurant was empty.)  But he was very courteous and friendly other than that.  The food was not great.  I love stuffed mushrooms, but I was not impressed with these.  The stuffing had a mushy, porridge-like texture.  It was kind of gross.  After one bite, I scooped most of the stuffing out and just ate the mushrooms themselves.  The word "goop" sums up the stuffing, and that's not a word you want to use with stuffed mushrooms.  The chocolate cake was quite good, but very rich, and my wife and I could only handle a few bites.  I have no problem with having a rich dessert that you can't eat a lot of, provided they bring you a portion size that reflects the fact that you can't eat more than a few bits.  But this was an enormous piece of cake, and a price to match.  That doesn't work if the cake is so rich that you can only stand to eat a few bites.  For goopy stuffed mushrooms, a large piece of super-rich cake, and two cokes, we spent about $60.  The food (especially the goopy stuffing on the mushrooms) was not good enough to make us return; the price makes it a "definitely won't be back."

qJurdBWCCGjf7itwAHuYWg.text: Came here with a large group to celebrate a birthday and we were seated upstairs. We were seated about 30 minutes after our originally scheduled reservation which was a little bit off-putting, but we were greeted warmly by a waiter as soon as we were seated.  We ordered several salads and fried calamari, all of which were tasty. We also ordered several pasta dishes, none of which were that impressive in my opinion, with the exception of the meatballs which were pretty delicious.  I tried a couple of their blended drinks and was very underwhelmed and disappointed, especially since this a restaurant located in Vegas.  Overall, the portions are big, the prices are high and the food is decent, but nothing to write home about.

p5rlCKcp1EFYvitpfoggng.text: In the Old Planet Hollywood in the Forum Shops I had believed no place would ever succeed.  Transplanting the Carmines of NY / Atlantic City to the Vegas strip would be a challenge as so many cookie cutter type places exist and so many high end unique places open satelite places and fail.  Carmines delivers all of the expecations.  Large long bar and huge seating area adorne this Italian retro look with huge billboards showing the family styple type offerings.  After a drink with the ever pleasant Nicole at the bar we sit 9 for dinner tonight.   Bread is presented which is OK and wine list is perused.  Really a fairly weak wine list to be honest but a couple of value $50.00 Italian and Sicilian bottles are located and were off and running.  Note glasses are like my grandfather used to use and if you watch the scene in the Godfather where The Don is talkling to Michael with a heart to heart you will notice the glasses used are the same here.  Nice touch though I doubt many will remember.  Asked for some recomendations and we are offered a special Cold Antipasto and Hot Antipasto.  The cold was a mix of Italian Cold cuts / Procuitto, olives, eggplant salad, salmon on mozerrela bread etc.  This was fair nothing to write home about at $37.00.   The Hot Antipasto was a Small Calzone, stuffed bread, stuffed mushrooms, ground sausange and brocoli Rabbe, Clams Oregenato, Mussels in red sauce, and a few other things.  This was again OK but the Mushrooms were absolutely to die for So much so that we ordered a separate platter of stuffed mushrooms, a platter of meatballs and a very good Italian Mozerella and parmagina baked bread to complete the appetizers.   all and all Meatballs, Mushrooms and bread top scores.  We take a break here to see how much more we should order as we have hit it pretty good right now but on we go.  Platter of Chicken Marsala, Platter of Veal Parm, Platter of Shrimp Fra Diablo and platter of linquini bolognese with extra side of Bolognese sauce.     Veal Parm a near perfect 10... Delicious, chicken Marsala good but not my favorite, the Shrimp were absolutely incredible clean tasty perfectly cooked while the hot sauce was just the right amount of spicy and declicious as well.  Didn't need the 3bls of pasta in Red Sunday Bolognese Gravy but have to say it was dam outstanding.   NO coffee or deserts tried as we can't walk at this time but 9 guys 4 bottles of wine tax and Tip (Not included automatically) we walked out for $630.00   As far as I'm concerened a tremendous value and really for the most part tremendous presentations and food and taste.  Service was spot on all night and would not in any way hesitate to return here in the future.  Big Thumbs up handling 9 Hungry Hombres. Congratulations forum shops think you found one to stay awhile.

eVRADBda9iiyubJn3--_qw.text: Staff-wonderful, knowledgeable about the menu, attentive & good teamwork  Environment- Italian singer, not too loud, sat at the bar which had sports on tv but was also a nice dining experience  Food-yum, large portions, had the chicken saltimbocca with angel hair pasta which was delicious, the sauce was perfect  Would definitely recommended!

c1zbB0Bte1eD3BpOX1Zl9A.text: Nice. Good food. Italian on US style. Good service. We will come back. In the shopping area of Ceasar palace

0m1BvkktoRXdFhAAnQxi5A.text: This has been a bookmarked place to try for the longest time and sadly we finally tried it and not a fan of it. Service was great but food was mediocre. Calarmari was a bit over cooked. Meatballs had a bitter after taste and the clam linguine was a bit under seasoned. Sorry to say but there are better Italian places.

1CaIKaisNq3l2XE5L3vPXQ.text: Yum!  Very very large portions... Lemon butter chicken breast with angel hair pasta is soooooooo good!  They didn't get 5 stars because their menu is on a projector screen on wall which mad it difficult to order.  Service was great!  Just hate that I couldn't see menu on wall!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Titanic!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!  Family style Italian!  Wonderful ambience, delicious food and great service!  Will be back for sure!

uF_AksoVK8_BOl0gv67sGg.text: Not sure how to rate this restaurant.   There was good and ok.  We were with a group of maybe 20 so had a reserved space upstairs.  We had a fixed r ate of 35 pp which is very inexpensive for vegas.  I did not have great expectations for the food.  We got there an hour earlier than our reservation as our meeting ended early.   They could not accommodate us earlier.   Not because of space  but more wait staff.  We got seated exactly when we were supposed  to.  We all got our own drinks from the upstairs bar, there was not drink service for our  group.  I had ice tea, no charge and very good. An assortment of bread  was brought to the table.  No butter, no oil or vinegar.  We were famished and plowed through the bread.  This is a family style restaurant and that was kind of neat.  2 salads, ceaser and house chopped both very good with generous portions.  At some point they brought oil and vinegar for the  bread but no plates and by then most of the bread was gone.  Dinner came, 3 choices of pasta, chicken  and aalmon.  I could not repeat the Italian names of the dishes- we were  all looking words up on our phones.  It was comical.   So the food was amazingly good, almost  perfect.  Not much for service. If you have a large group on a budget this was very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just outside the restaurant but inside the mall.

Zm_R_3Qu137Mru-bl3syTw.text: Service was great but food was just okay. Huge portions for big parties but I've honestly had better Italian food. Great location inside the forum shops.

iXC87U_NAhpKfyU0tY7Ibg.text: Family friendly/ great food / huge portions.. can't wait to go back . Definitely 5 stars

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red sangria was great

QgD6HQpKG4pAKw2XCcLTSw.text: There are plenty of the same reviews, so I'm getting straight to the point. Massive portions served and only come if you're with a big party. Otherwise, there's really no chance for variety or you'll have some expensive leftovers for another week. Really, it just felt like a more upscale Buca di Beppo. The place is loud and fun, so it's not the best spot to catch up with old friends. The pasta is cooked al dente and the pairing of the bread, along with a bottle of red wine and ending with dessert was just an okay meal for me. I wasn't too fond of the lady fingers, even though it was made in-house. I felt like my food got cold way too quickly too.  3-stars for the food, but a whopping 5-stars for the excellent service we received. I can't remember our server's name, but he was good.

q2a43tndOhup6iOp-YbOiA.text: A gem of food, mood, and service.  On a busy weekend where we were surprisingly disappointed with other restaurants this place knocked it out of the park.  Keep up the good work and we'll see you again real soon.

1SOMsEbc-8mZyiLiM_Pl1A.text: After weeks of waiting for this to day to finally try carmine I have to say I was pretty disappointed. I wished that I had went to Olive Garden instead. We had the very popular spaghetti and meatballs and our pasta was still raw it wasn't cooked thoroughly and still hard and the sauce didn't really have an flavor. The bread they give you is really good however the spaghetti wasn't a hit for me. It's pretty pricey as well but if your coming with a big family the price and portions work out well. Our waiter was very quick to attend to our needs. Also me and my bf are pretty tall and have long legs and they tried to put us at a small table and when I requested a bigger one they said we couldn't because there was other reservations with bigger parties. That's really stupid because I made a reservation for a reason and you would think they would be willing to accommodate better.

kCVhzm16tQlkgEQoK9Ofnw.text: Best restaurant stop on a four day trip to Vegas. Had a fantastic waiter named Lewis. Food and drinks were great. Get the Chicken Scarpiello!

UuWyGSujnrbo4ZSkWstM5Q.text: we stopped to have lunch while shopping at the forum shops at Caesars Palace. The front hostess was able to seat us promptly. Our waiter was fantastic. We had not been to Carmines before, the serving sizes are massive.   My wife and I are both vegan and the waiter was able to accommodate and prepare our food specifically for us.   The food was very tasty. We ordered a half order of salad and pasta and the two of us were not able to complete our meals. Again the serving sizes are large.

VVn451ozMd8a77JOr-zy-w.text: This is our favorite happy hour spot in Vegas. Amazing small plates and deals on peroni or cocktails. You will spend less than 40 bucks and have a great time. The bartenders are friendly and super funny too!  (Thanks Joe!)  Get: Eggplant Rollatini Spinach Artichoke Dip The best!

Q2w0uGZtZEfCuZzsDRROcQ.text: I was part of a large group of about 30 people. We had a nice private area upstairs. It included a balcony where we could get some fresh air and see the Vegas lights. There's a restroom upstairs which was convenient.   We started at the bar upstairs. In hindsight, we should've just ordered in our dining room. The service at the bar was a little slow and not that friendly. On the other hand, our dining room service was great.   We had a preset meal and everything came out family style. There was so much food!  Very good.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9zs-cX7NX7x71vv9hNjBbg.text: This place has a great concept but lack the flavor. We started off with a giant Caesar salad which was the tastiest part of the meal. And by tasty, I mean it's super garlicy.  We ordered penne ala vodka which was a box pasta with a sauce that store bought Classico vodka sauce puts to shame. It was so bland, I put chili pepper on it to add some kind of taste & even that wasn't working. The pasta wasn't even al dente. It was nearly crunchy & it took forever to get this super basic part of the meal.  I was truly hoping for this to be good. I was starving, the bar to succeed was low.  The servings are giant but what does it matter if you feel so let down by the quality? This was one of the "favorites" on the menu as well.  The service was fine. The restroom was dirty. Toilet paper all over one of the stalls in the women's room.  I just can't recommend this place overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HBA6x22GjssT8B8aIil0YA.text: How Management Handles Obnoxious Guests - In my opinion, your total dining experience is 50% quality of food and 50% ambience and service. Restaurant managers are accountable for 100% of that and Manny, the MOD tonight, was not taking responsibility for the latter. Our party of 4 was seated next to an obnoxious party of 20 seated at one table. The entire experience took a dive listening to these obnoxiously, overly-joyous (putting it mildly) group hollering and competing for each other's attention with their jokes. Other guests were just annoyed and were joining us with their look of disgust. I approached Manny with my complaint and his offer was to move us to the upper level. It wasn't going to solve the noise problem as it was directly above the source. Wait! Who was being inconvenienced here? My expectation was for Manny to approach the group and respectfully and kindly ask the large group to maintain some decorum as they were not in a private room but in a room full of other guests who are trying to enjoy their dining experience. Our server was so embarrassed and felt helpless. No support from management and it put him in an uncomfortable position. Manny, you left your staff to fend from themselves. Be there for them! It affects their tips and affects their morale. Our receipt showed a portion of our meal had been "comped". Too late...our total dining experience was already affected. :-(

iIOgZTKOZ8OZMt2OraKlXA.text: Wonderful, wonderful...did I say wonderful food? First, they are more than happy to accommodate a gluten free diet and even found they accommodate vegan and dairy free diets too! Carmine's serves family style so big portions with enough food to serve well...a family. We had the cold antipasto appetizer which came with seafood pasta, olives, prosciutto and bread. It was all awesome and fresh. Spaghetti and meat balls was the main along with gluten free shrimp fra diavolo. Both were beautifully presented and tasted fantastic. We didn't do desert because the portions were so large, we were quite full. I have to add that the service was phenomenal and it was very helpful to have a server who knew the menu front and back and could answer questions about it in detail. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold Antipasto

MngdwuYE_xx7vnmWF1skNQ.text: The food just wasn't very good. I shared a lasagna with a friend. It was just lacking in flavor. The sauce felt very bland to me. So did the meat. It could have used some more salt, maybe some spice, overall just more flavor. I also thought that the noodles were too soft. Mushy would be an exaggeration, but they definitely felt soft to me.  One pet peeve of mine is when nice Italian restaurants don't use fresh ingredients. I like to cook Italian food at home and sometimes I splurge and get fresh pasta instead of dry pasta, fresh mozzarella instead of the normal kind, good olive oil, and San Marzano tomatoes instead of the store brand. I can definitely notice a difference in taste with the better quality, more expensive ingredients, and I don't think that Carmines uses those ingredients. There definitely wasn't fresh mozzarella, I'm pretty sure that the pasta wasn't fresh, and the olive oil didn't have any flavor to it and just didn't seem high quality. If I'm going to be paying $$$, I want the good stuff.  I was pretty happy with the price and amount of food actually. Dishes are $30-40, but they feed multiple people. The waiter said that the lasagna feeds 3-4 people, but I think that that is a pretty big stretch. My friend and I had the lasagna and a ton of bread, and we both felt satisfied, but definitely not full after the meal.

ka2iCy9F9kLAPbQyR5O5Qw.text: We came here for happy hour to give our feet some rest during a crazy shopping spree at the forum shops. Liked the vibe of the place with such eclectic chandeliers, we got the spritz, zucchini fries and eggplant appetizer for happy hour. I believe since the spritz was happy hour priced it had soda instead of prosecco ,but still tasty. The eggplant appetizer was amazing - I could eat more. Zucchini fries were good but the quantity was a lot for 2 people and it didn't come with a dipping sauce which would have elevated it tremendously.  The restaurant is HUGE , can seat hundreds of people. We saw many  large groups enjoying a meal .

K_PAlRtviYt3-H3Xr-qqBQ.text: I was extremely disappointed. I'm from New York, so we know Carmine's well. We've been to the restaurant chain several times however this Ceasars Palace location doesn't live up to the service as the original. Here's my story:  On vacation, we booked a late dinner. We were seated at 1030. If the restaurant doesn't want to treat the customer that is seated at 1030, as they would treat the customer seated at 5pm, they shouldn't seat so late.  Firstly we order a bottle of wine and an appetizer. Prior to, my wife and I were discussing what our entree would be (in the presence of the waitress) though we never actually ordered it. The appetizer came out and then (prior to even having a bite from the appetizer), the 70+ dollar entree comes out. So now, we are meant to eat our appetizer and have our enteee get cold. This is a big no no in the service industry and should especially be followed by a higher class hotel and a higher class restaurant.   On top of this, the bread they brought us was ice cold (not hot, not warm). Lastly, with all our food on the table and before we started eating our entree, that waitress asks us if we will be having desert.   I get that we seated later in the day and the restaurant was set to close at 11, but the restaurant shouldn't seat people this late if they are going to rush them and give them heartburn so they can close on time. There were other people around, still eating. It was completely uncalled for.  1. Waitress should have waited for us to actually order the entree and not assume that's what we wanted  2. She shouldn't have told the kitchen to start preparing it  3. The bread shouldn't have been ice cold 4. Don't ask me if I was desert before I've even started my meal, how am I supposed to know  This was a big let down for me. Management has to change or people are going to get upset. Carmine's in New York and even New Jersey in Atlantic City are busy from open till close. This Carmine's was pretty empty, and I can see why.

H5PKPvvbJcXyt4UjMl1pVw.text: I absolutely love  this place! Their HH is amazing with food & drink. The service is impeccable which is a great compliment to the food which is TRADITIONAL Italian! They even have a few items non-Italian like their spinach dip which is hands down the BEST I've ever tasted.  If you like a nice Italian  red wine, you have to have their house Montepulciano because it's out of this world, with a nice fruit forward balanced with a dry but not woody finish.  Thanks Bradshaw for a great afternoon celebrating my girlfriend's birthday.

QRDLD8tmu5kCzw227lxGlg.text: Great food, drinks, and service. I absolutely love this location, in The Forum Shops at Caesars. They have a nice happy hour menu with a couple of unique appetizers such as the eggplant rollatini (fabulous).  Expansive dinner menu with everything served family style.  Come hungry

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggplant Appetizer
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Mushrooms

Q_u3ZHTREU1SfomORkTFSQ.text: Excellent Italian food! Huge portions!  Great service! Bring your appetite!!!!!!!!!!!! Great staff. Beer a little spendy

kSLOlWtJHWIhAtH6ydJHng.text: Fantastic!!!! Some of the best I had in a long time. Understand that it id southern italian style.

yvI_QlkeJZJki_SVa-0IXA.text: Carmine's is a heat destination for family-style Italian meals near the strip. Nestled among shops at Ceasar's palace, there is plenty to see and the place is deceptively large.    The Carmine's salad, chicken masala, eggplant parmigiana, and tiramisu are my recommendations. You won't go home hungry and -- while it ain't cheap -- it's downright affordable by Vegas strip standards. Food is dependably good and if you've visited the original location in NYC, it'll feel familiar.   A perfect pairing with a show at Caesar's.

7A5u0DvrpfqlCtOrkB-dNA.text: Food was good -however portions even in the bar are enormous! Service was just ok - ordered a drink a never received it. Definitely felt like the waiter had no time for us. I mean it is a mall restaurant (although high end mall). If you're in the mall it's definitely an option - if not many other options out there! You're in vegas!

E4rVhiHvSa9gU9HiQUPCKw.text: Wow! Had my son's wedding reception at Carmines on 4/22 and the food and service was outstanding!! Angela the server was amazing, she was there for us for every request and had a smile on your face the whole time. Courtney was my contact person and was terrific to deal with. This was the first time we had been there, I highly recommend this restaurant for your special events!!

IeW_noYyU6R_TeyYvgA34A.text: An awesome experience across the board. Bread to start is insane, Peter behind the bar whipped up a solid dirty martini and suggested the Seafood Mix Bowl, our of this world, huge pieces and chunks of lobster and crab. Great ambiance and inside Caesaer's forum, definitely worth the stop!

9cPRJ5x4rQzcBTtc3h6jdg.text: Food is good, server Marvin was awesome and friendly.  However when their bill came, the pen burst, got on my shirt, hands, etc.  Marvin did everything he could.  The manager did NOTHING!!! 130 dollar shirt, down the drain and the the manager did Nothing!!!  Marvin offered to have the cleaning bill covered but the manager was having none of that.  Probably because she knew I live out of state.  We loved this place, came here every time we are in Vegas, and tip well, always (even this time because it was not the server's fault).  Now, never again, I expect better when you pay 150 dollars plus for a family style meal, not including the tip.

C5ihz-TGTn7Arzc-Olrl3A.text: My family came here as a group of 7 before our show at the Mirage. We all shared caesar salad, lasagna, & lemon butter chicken. It was all delicious!! Great service, we weren't exactly sure if we were ordering too much or too little since we had never been here before, but our waiter helped us decide on what would be the perfect amount for everyone to share, and he was spot on! There was enough for everyone and we didnt leave with a bunch of leftovers or OVERLY stuffed before our show. Ceasar salad is always good but I highly reccommend the chicken and lasagna.  Also very affordable prices when you divide it between every person. Would love to come back again.

ljsEokgd2Fa4mNFmip7KIg.text: This place is fantastic!!  The food couldn't be better, but it would be nice if you were able to order a portion for two instead of 15, lol . I know it's meant for family style, but we only are two.  My friend and I make sure to visit every year during our girl's trip. We always have left overs, and feel awful about not being able to take them with us since we do not have a room with a place to keep the food cold. Hate being wasteful.

x8CqGsbwymeMezt2C2fvmw.text: First I have to say that this place is primarily for what is called family style which was a surprise after reading the reviews! Since we were only two they would not sit us at a table so we had to sit in the bar area and order off a smaller menu!  It was interesting to watch the huge plates of food being served to the large tables of people. Unfortunately what we wanted was not offered on the limited bar menu but I will say what we did get was outstanding! We started with a great waitress who gave us good advice and  took our order but she never came back, a bit disappointing!

fWcU6g1cqJ7NIm_0EWIQ3A.text: A great place to do family style. They serve huge portions. We had calamari, rigatoni, spaghetti and meatballs, chicken parm. My favorite were the calamari and chicken parm. The meatballs were delicious as well. The rigatoni was nothing special. Overall good service and the only complaint I had was the menu may be on the walls but the text is too small. And the prices aren't listed as well.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-TnNdHAr8Zhw5V70QZyyfw.text: This is located in Caesar's Palace and we had Thanksgiving dinner here. The dishes are pretty pricey but they serve it family-style. The calamari is to die for and so is the steak. We ordered it medium but it end up coming pretty well done. Think of this place as a nice Maggiano's. We also ordered the salmon which came out pretty plain and the Carmines salad is really delicious and chock full of a lot of goodies like ham and salami. I enjoyed the rigatoni and meat sauce as well. that was the perfect amount of food for six adults and a child. We were too full to have dessert but the Tiramisu looked delicious. They do half sizes of the cheesecake.

djy-hfJdkbPzmlEOGE_mTA.text: Food was great, make sure to come hungry. This is all family style, so be ready to share! Surprisingly busy for a Monday Evening, but service was still good.

SRWT1trOLACUQlzaBzS1iQ.text: All I can say is Thank You to Carmines for an awesome wedding reception dinner! Everything was wonderful from beginning to end! The staff was outstanding, and patient with a nervous and excited bride, the service was awesome. The needs of our guests was #1. Everyone, and I mean everyone went out of their way to compliment the menu and the food! Everyone loved it! Portions were huge, no one left hungry! Drinks were never empty, and the Terrazza room was perfect! I really couldn't have been happier! I'd recommend Carmines Las Vegas to anyone who enjoys delicious food and outstanding service. Thank you for making our wedding a huge success!! From the new Mr and Mrs Gray.

1Vok92y70FbqE8rDIlKjbQ.text: Great place, the staff is magnificent. The food is magnificent and large portions. Great place for larger parties to share food served family style.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PJCK1MnKTuIsyl1ETWEY2Q.text: The best steak we've EVER had. Went for V Day, wanted to try something new. Found Carmine's on opentable. Great atmosphere and service. Everything is family style. The wait was shocked when we ordered calamari (yummy!) AND he 3 lb porterhouse w peppers and onions RARE. Not sure why he was so excited by that but that's how my husband and I like out steak. The steak was beautiful tbh and tasted even better. Only complaint, I would ask for all red peppers instead of green and red. Otherwise, amazing! Next time maybe we'll try the porterhouse contadina. I don't like sausage but I'd be interested in trying theirs. We didn't get dessert bc they are huge and for sharing. Will def be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 48 oz porterhouse w peppers and onions.

dNkdS7wjPKMuJOqxzLwYmQ.text: Had dinner last night a party of 12 Portions are huge ! Everything tasted pretty good except the shrimp scampi. From reading the reviews I asked for extra garlic and added angel hair pasta.  It was so watery, watered down and lacking flavor. The half shell clams were great, I loved the Cesar salad !!!! Meatballs very tasty & the porter house with sausage onions and peppers was cooked to perfection!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QxBYbR1k7JpkUHIDMp7G7g.text: Love Love Love Carmine's. Have been to 3 locations and this LV spot is right up there with the NY location. The food is enormous so bring a friend or two. The bread that comes to the table is fresh and warm. We like to get oil and vinegar to dip but the always bring butter too. The meatballs with rigatoni is our go to fave. The house antipasto salad should never be missed. It's amazing. The cheesecake and cappuccino are the perfect end to this meal.  Service here is not as good as NY hence the 4 star but maybe our server was having a rough night. It happens. Will definitely be back every time we are in LV

WRuxt4AAdaSuLeBYA-OhEg.text: Delicious! Giant portions! Great service!  We went with a group of 6 and got seated upstairs, which was great because there were way less people and it was much quieter so we could talk. I started off with a rum runner which came in an individual punch bowl and it was fantastic. (Another perk about Vegas is that you can take your alcohol in a to go cup!) We then had the calamari and Carmine's salad. The calamari had a great breading and came with red sauce. It had the hoops and the tentacles and was devoured by our group. The salad was also super full of flavor and ingredients. From olives to peppers and the dressing was creamy and flavorful, highly recommend!  For dinner we had shrimp scampi, chicken Parmesan, and angel hair with oil and garlic. Everything was flavorful and came with a large portion size. We had plenty of food for our 6 and even took some in a to go box (we found someone to give it to outside on one of the bridges--better than wasting it!!)  Overall I would highly recommend this place especially for a large group!!

KJS_d0yNkRH5EATcwNpbcQ.text: Came by for dinner the other night and the experience left much to be desired.. Ambiance was tad above regular and the staff were dressed in pretty basic white outfits...  Started off with the salad that didn't taste too fresh and seemed like it had been staying in fridge for too long...portions were way too large...  The highlight of the meal was the fried calamari appetizer which was edible, although the marinara sauce tasted like it came out of a can...  Moved on to the tube pasta which tasted like it was dried pasta that was blanched... The sausage was rather salty and the broccoli was okay.  The ravioli wasn't special..merely filled with cheese...  The chicken dish was a complete disaster, overcooked, dry, and too salty.  The eggplant Parmesan wasn't tasty at all..  ...the tiramisu was way too sweet and wasn't super fresh...

sXP2t8QgOsYoxp2GTzOOhg.text: Brought clients in for lunch. It's best to valet park at the forum shops and walk over to the restaurant.  I invited clients here since the entrees served family style. I arrived early, secured a table and my waitress started me off with a brewed ice tea. I started us off with an order of Carmine's salad followed by Portobello parmigiana, and lastly sausage broccoli pasta. The quality of food was superb and the portions are massive. My clients and I ate like mob bosses but bosses and they still  took leftovers back to their office.  This was my second visit  here and I'm already thinking about my next visit and trying different  entrees of their wide range of menus items.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausage and broccoli pasta
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Portabello parmigiana
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carmines massive salad - delish!

diGeuy26aw8KVSzB7TfIXQ.text: While browsing in the mall, my best friend and I decided to stop at Carmine's for happy hour/dinner! The happy hour menu was a hit for us! The drinks, calamari, and those delicious meatballs! We left stuffed and happy! I highly recommend this restaurant !

PRKgLvQeMAmUbJsIzz8hhg.text: I was at the Forum shops doing some shopping, and stopped here during one of our shopping breaks. I had always wanted to go to the one in New York but was never able to, so I was ecstatic to see this one. The food was delicious specifically the blood orange margaritas, meatball sliders, the calamari and the spinach artichoke dip we only stopped in for happy hour and it was delicious! I can only imagine how good a full meal would taste!!

6ANKY1iwOCgQyqmqYV28tA.text: We would NEVER return here.  The pomodoro asked for was a vegetarian version as we got 6 meatballs on the side.  The first version had pork tongues or something in it.  It was sop gross.  The service is POOR.  It is very inconsistent and we had no idea who our server was.  The $8 Costco bottle of wine was great but they are selling it for $48!  There are better places in Vegas and on the strip for Italian.  Too bad, Carmine's.

LazKwQqgLhddhSa5GCXgCA.text: By far one if the best chicken dishes I have ever had.  The waiter Jeff was extremely good in helping us pick our dish.  This place is simply fantastic.  I don't understand why it is not a 4.5 star on yelp.

-YXLZnRHco-WNWD5t8Q-XQ.text: Ceaser's salad was super salty, pasta and shrimp dish had no taste. Huge portions, no taste.

g-9CqLd3doY8FQTf2cRHXw.text: Great food a lot of food great service New York Italian atmosphere highly recommended we loved it 10/28:16

1thvXiBqu1qI1JwSyP2SWg.text: I had Carmine's in NYC a few years ago. Up until recently I hadn't realized it's become a chain. I'm extremely weary of chain restaurants, but we figured we'd give it a shot because my boyfriend had never tried. In short, service was straddling the line between mediocre and poor. Our server showed little interest in making an impression- come to find it was the end of her shift. After our food was brought out she whisked by us saying "I'm leaving, so and so will finish up with you." Gave us a brief smile and left. No thank you, no asking if we needed anything else. My boyfriend sat with an empty drink for nearly the remainder of our meal before replacement server came in to check on us. Nice.  We had the vodka penne...it was good, in an Americanized Italian sort of way. I'm also weary of "Italian" labeling like this, because they are seldom authentic Italian. No exception here. The draw is portion size and I get it, like Cheesecake Factory. I guess we're just not people who like to sacrifice taste for a heaping pile of bland food. I will also add, like many reviews have done before me, the bread was cold. Like...not a hint of warmth to it. Yuck.  If you're not feeding a family, opt for Trevi instead. Much friendlier service and better food- can't argue with that.

JkJ-koo6fwjeOL403TnZ9Q.text: Good food but ultimately very poor service. I've been to Carmines in NYC many times, was always amazing but this was the first time in Las Vegas and won't be going back. The waiter was just awful.

n2ea0eLjKGQ5exaVAgkK5Q.text: The food and service is great. We had the Eggplant Parmigiana and it was the best I've ever tasted. It comes thinly sliced in a meatloaf like form. I'll be back with a bigger group next time and indulge in more of items on the menu.

-NOcgVpGpDJJiAkI5STkZg.text: This was my first time here but my uncles who were visiting go to the one in New York often so they wanted to get together here. It is a beautiful layout with an amazing wine wall in the bar area; there is an upstairs for larger parties.  This is family style much like Bucca but this place puts Bucca to shame!  The eggplant parmesean was incredible; not super fried and a lot of it! We also got some chicken wings in a lemon and butter sauce which were incredible! The food is fresh, the staff was amazing - aside from a holiday party with a DJ that was a little loud the atmosphere is perfect inside Ceasar's Palace. I will take this place over Bucca any time!

1h27-K5XMHeJuV3P07j4ig.text: I was really expecting much better. The service was quite mediocre. The food was lukewarm when it arrived. The lasagna was tasty, but I want my lasagna to be bubbling hot and gooey. This was not. The center was cool and parts of the cheese not melted. The chicken parm was somewhat dry and the cheese on top was barely melted. Our server was pleasant, but inattentive. She never checked on us after our food arrived otherwise we would have told her then and there that our food was not hot. We were considering having our wedding reception at this location, but sadly our experience tonight leaves us continuing our search for a good Italian restaurant. My fiance and I are not overly picky diners and almost never send anything back to the kitchen. Had there been an opportunity to do so tonight, we would have. I tried to give the benefit of the doubt that they may be short staffed or something, but we observed many wait staff standing around not looking overly busy. It's a shame. We were really hoping this would be a great spot to treat our wedding guests to a memorable Italian meal.  At the end of the meal our server asked us how everything was when she brought the check. My fiance told her that the food was cold.  We assume she didn't hear what he said as she took the check and cashed us out.

UgnwMEyuyQXhpSQKXFBROA.text: I am never disappointed with Carmine's. Bring a large group because it is family style and portions are huge.

mcMWgiVTbVEg2uyYh_Ke7A.text: What a fun time for Super Bowl! They charged $50 per person for all you can eat buffet. They had large tv's set up in every room. Everyone with reserved tickets had a table to watch the game and party. The food was really good. Service was very good. They had a little trouble with tv sound at first, but got it fixed quickly. The only bad thing about the party was that Denver lost. We bet on them and couldn't believe that outcome! Oh well, next year. Great job Carmine's!

LlLcjnc9QTWap3ehTFdOwg.text: Our dining experience started off to a bit of a rocky start as they didn't have enough chairs to seat our group.  The manager  kept coming back and forth to me giving me updates and ended up giving us some apps complimentary.  The food was very good and i am glad we waited to eat.  The plates are family style and so we ordered several things off the menu and we all loved all of them! i would definitely recommend!

VmYVfp1Ya9q-DyXpePqdGg.text: Caesar salad was great. Everything else was ok. Wait staff is excellent. Disappointed in the food. Rigatoni ala vodka was bland. Chicken parm was very salty.

-N8uA1BjuJkZIlYcgM0SYw.text: What a wonderful experience. Portions are HUGE so come hungry - very hungry! Our service was amazing. Michael Baker was amazing!! Truly a gem for the place. Not only was he extremely attentive he can sing. Yes, he sang to us - Carmine's is very lucky to have him on their staff. Food was AMAZING!! Cannot say enough about this place.

Y1XGcVcjMtmue1GtrwGR-w.text: Excellent food, superb service, and a great place to celebrate birthdays. I especially want to thank Michael Baker for making it a memorable 50th b-day dinner for my father.

EFNVlurca0lV4-005TWu-Q.text: Maybe this is a step up over Buca deBeppo but it's not up to the Olive Garden par.  Service was lacking for dinner on a Saturday night.  We were served bread with no fat.  Had to ask for evoo and vinegar (or butter).  The stuffed artichoke was stuffed with bread crumbs and Parmesan.  I hate bread crumbs!!  UGH   The lasagna was ok, but no veggies...just cheese and noodles.  No whole grain pastas available.  Very frustrating.  We won't be back.  They changed servers on us in mid-stream.  Too pricey.  Seemed like a sports bar setup.

WpByOEhQfPr2A9mOpCijPQ.text: So two of us came into Carmines to eat on a Tuesday around 4 (so very weird hour, not a ton of people). It always smelled delicious when we passed by so I wanted to try it. The portions are huge for two so I'd recommend coming with groups of five or more. What was the most disappointing though was that the lasagna we ordered was completely bland. It was tasteless to a point I had to sprinkle salt on it myself. There were no hints of oregano, basil, or really anything for that matter in the food. Not only was it tasteless but the huge portion came out in a matter of seconds. It wasn't hot in the middle and the cheese was not melted on the inside. When we complained, our waitress completely disregarded what we said. She also told us spaghetti and meatballs and lasagna are not made to order, which is why those two come out so fast. The one waitress we had was just terrible. Other servers had to relay our messages to her because she was no where to be found when we wanted to pay and leave. We left the entire dish there, missing just two servings (which were also half eaten) and were clearly unhappy. Yet there was no discount, no offer to get us something else on the menu, also no apology? Just shocked that a restaurant on the strip can make such terrible food, treat their customers so poorly, and still get paid in the end. Left hungry and feeling robbed of our money.

PcV1wN_GipZrrQ419GVT8g.text: Just as great as the one located in Times Square! A nice respite from all the buffets!  Family style platters so best to come with at least 6 in your party.

LwIRXD0cNUWVfnSkb-7z-A.text: Dined here a couple days ago and it was AMAZING. We didn't quite get what family style meant so im glad our server talked us into agreeing on one dish. One of the managers im guessing, Dani stopped by our table to check on us and make sure everything was going well, she suggested cannolis for dessert but we were way to stuffed!

P6PFbgKtUYE7DAoLtm1M7A.text: We had a very pleasant lunch at this place. For a group of four, we ordered a plate of stuffed mushrooms and a lasagna. The portions are family style and humongous!  Everything was delicious. Between their yummy bread of three or four kinds, the one appetizer, and one entree, we were very full. Most of the group had peroni beer. My white sangria was delicious.

H1c0rYtHRiChxxu3edYHqw.text: The food and service was impeccable! We had the house salad, and shared the angel hair pomodoro. Everything was cooked perfectly! I would only hope that they might think about offering a couples portion because we had so much food left over and felt bad because we couldn't even finish half of it. Absolutely delicious though

eqjV-QY5V3PsOt2xZHhMtQ.text: We were not treated equally here, and we will never return to be subjected to such poor service. Other tables around us were set with appetizer plates, but our table was not. After being provided with bread, we still had no plates. We waited so long for service that one of us was heading over to the server station to grab plates ourselves at which point our server saw us and finally introduced himself to give us plates and to take our order. Other tables were given a pitcher of water, but our table did not have a pitcher of water; and our tiny water glasses sat empty for a long time. Other tables around us had their plates replaced after their appetizer, but we were not given fresh plates after our appetizer round. Other tables around us were served their main courses onto their individual plates, whereas our entrees were placed on the table, and we had to serve ourselves. Maybe we were not treated equally because we were Asian, or maybe because not all of us ordered alcoholic drinks. The food was okay, but I'd rather go to Olive Garden.

2GZXapze-C_3XgCipDgRlw.text: I finished up my conference and had one last night in Vegas.  I'm Italian and wanted a no nonsense dish of pasta and salad.  I came across Carmines in the Caesar's Forum shops so went in.  Since I was by myself, the hostess recommended I sit at the bar.  She informed me that the portions were served family style but I could get half portions there.  Ok, no problem.  After I sat, my bartender confirmed I was there for dinner then pointed out that only certain items on the menu were served in so-called half portions.  Ok, so the pasta part was simple.  I was willing to pay $17 for a two serving dish of pasta pomodoro.  I noticed the sub selections came with a side salad so I asked if I could get one with my pasta.  Simple enough, right? Well, no.  I couldn't get a side salad with my pasta.  I informed them I was expecting to pay separately for it but "No, we can't do that".  So If I wanted a salad, I would have to pay another $17 dollars for a very large (serves 4) salad.  So needless to say, I left. Honestly, I don't think they cared.   With all the competition in Las Vegas, you would think Carmines would be a little more accommodating.  (By the way, the gentleman sitting next to me ordered a dish of rigatoni with no meat and got served a very large dish of rigatoni with a large amount of sausage. I guess he didn't like the explanation from the same manager who denied me my side salad.  Because, he left, too.)   I walked through the casino, sat at the bar at Rao's and had a lovely single serving of pasta, with a single serving of salad, one meatball and a glass of wine.  Oh, and I can't forget about the one cup of cappuccino.  It was excellent.

AcswKAoHt8AKGOplhpRhBA.text: Huge portions. Family style. Fried zucchini was heaven. Best food I have had all week. If I'd been a local would order more to take home. White calamari, Ravoli and another penne dish turned out to be more than we could eat. Great choice for large groups.

dsROoKWNv5vcdFsO9u7d6w.text: I think it's impossible to not over order!!!  Warning:  the lobster Fra diavolo easily feeds 8 people.    The restaurant setting is very nice.  Low lighting. Rich wood grains.  Comfy chairs.   We had a very attentive server.   Even though we had a party of 17, he made it feel like it was just two of us.    We all tried not to order too much.  I think we order 5 entrees for all 17 of us.   We still had tons of food leftover.   We started with appetizers: Caesar salad, stuffed artichokes and calamari.  All 3 good.    Entrees: both of the lobster offerings, spaghetti and meatballs, lasagna, prime rib chops, and some kind of vodka pasta.   The vodka sauce pasta was not enjoyed by anyone.   Everything else was delicious and prepared perfectly.   If it says P.A. for price .... Ask!!!!  Lobster entree was $130.  We finished with the titanic ice cream dessert.  Yummy and pretty.    I can surely say it was a very memorable meal.  I'll never forget.  The food was good but the highlight here was the overall gluttonous experience.      Plan on a long leisurely dinner with some  friends who don't split hairs.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Signage
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Titanic dessert
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster oreganota

JEBlt96oSJO-XiYxzFZgmg.text: Food was very good and the service was great. It's a nice family style restaurant. Huge portions. The only problem is that because the portions are so large, it's hard to try a few things. Definitely recommend going with 4 or more people.

s9vQItR319Ts7kjb8H0U1w.text: All of the reviews are True: 1) Enormous portions 2) Old-world Italian/NYC decor 3) High prices  Now, this doesn't mean that it was a bad experience. To the contrary, it was pretty good.. A-OK, if you will. My mom and I visited Carmine's for our pre-marathon carb-loading meal. We walked right in at about 4:30 without a reservation. We were seated at a small table, with little room between us and diners on either side of us. Even the waiters had a hard time getting between them. Now, this could be seen as a positive thing, because we got to know our fellow patrons over the course of our meal, but if we'd had something private to discuss... well...  Anyway, onto the food! The food was served "family style" in a large party platter. One entree is easily enough for 2-4 people, depending on the size of their appetites. We ordered the shrimp with angel hair pasta ($37), with the "white" sauce. Be forewarned, the white sauce is not a cream based sauce, it is an oil/wine/garlic sauce (and they don't skimp on the garlic). There were a decent amount of shrimp in it. The taste...just okay. Nothing extra special. In all honesty, I think I prefer Maggianos as far as flavor goes. Nothing to complain about, however.  The waiter was obviously disappointed that he couldn't up-sell us on drinks or dessert, but he was pleasant overall. If you happen to be in the Forum Shops and a group of you are super hungry, sure stop by.. But there's better (and less expensive) Italian food to be had in Las Vegas!

soXexscPn7KY-FT4kToGRA.text: Got duped into ordering too much food for the four of us (2 kids). We originally wanted just some bolognese (2 stars) and some spinach (3 stars), then got talked into ordering the Caesar salad (1 star, super sized and soggy) and calamari (it was also super sized but decent @3 stars). Food was meant for 8 people. Paid as if it was for 8 people. Ended up giving most of it away.

oUb0Bf7n4MsynLyytd_kCQ.text: Came here for lunch.... my first time at any Carmines portions are huge I need a nap, delicous  and great service

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

McVHT8FCoS0V4jKxyksb3A.text: Man ol man!! Prepare yourself if you go here because they severe BIG portions of food!! Def. a great place to go with a big part for big servings. We got the porterhouse meal and OMG it was amazing!!! We will be back!!

0ayt73qh8MXqpF3W9b_WSw.text: Food and service were excellent. Ambiance was great.  Portion sizes are large and should be split.  Everything we had was delicious.  Cannot wait to check out another location.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Q01ECW6Y84N30adpWSo14w.text: Went to dinner there with some friends busy place!!! Recommend call first make reservations you will get seated faster otherwise 45 min wait! Big place clean and great music and friendly staff ready to help you and serve,we sat and ordered some angel hair pasta and meatballs family size and chicken pecans with a nice gravy on it looked great and was served fast we also had the red dry sangria which was ok not great but ok and we sat and enjoyed our food and it was great our server was quick and on the spot for got his name but he was ok and gave us great food choices to try!!! Love this place so far but half way threw the meal a real strong fish oder came threw the whole place and stayed and was making me almost taste the fishy smell it was nasty had to go to the bath room and throw up it was so bad!!!!! So that kill it for me but everyone else noticed the smell but never said anything so I kept it to myself and drank my sangria and talked to my guest who just flew in from Tampa and they were having fun so I went with the flow and didn't make a seen so thought I would put it in my review and hope the get rid of that smell!!!!! Bad calamari smell threw out the whole place..... bad  fish smell but great food otherwise..... steve

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers....... great food stinky fish smell you get pass the smell hopefully you can finish your meal sorry but had to let you know the truth

ttpNcGP9_Gs5FuanaYbVtg.text: Terrible food. Extraordinarily salty. And I'm fairly certain they put salt in my DRINK. If you want Italian Food, stay away from Carmine's. If you want edible food, stay away from Carmine's.just. Stay away.

fgcPL_A18kiBQb2s0OHXBw.text: We have been to this Carmine's a few times... And we have been to the ones in New York multiple times.   The hostess stand people greeted us with a very friendly reception and set us very promptly.  We started with a female server, and we were taken over by male server who could care less what was going on with our table.  The other tables around us were getting excellent service by two different waiters.   We ordered chicken Parmesan and added penne pasta, as well as an order of meatballs.  The pasta was undercooked, even by Italian standards. We never had a waiter come back to tell this problem to.  We were able to eat the chicken parm & most of the meatballs, but none of the penne.  When we could not find our waiter, I asked another waiter to please get a manager for us.  I saw the waiter go get a young lady who was in a black blazer and a dress.  He talk to her, but she never came to our table. Then our waiter finally came around and asked if we were able to finish our food, to which I told him that the pasta was undercooked and we could not eat it.  He brought us a bill, that still included pasta. I asked again for a manager so that it could be taken care of. No manager ever came but he tossed the new bill on our table but would not verbalize anything to us.  We stopped him think the hostesses for the warm reception, and reiterated that the food was good other than the Pasta.  We told them that we had asked for a manager and never received one. She did tell me that the lady that I suspected was the manager was, in fact, the manager.  She never bothered. Normally a perfect experience, but they missed the mark on 3-13-18

gqo750oQCBly9BCnDCPonw.text: I recently celebrated my birthday here. Although I was late to my own party, my family was able to be seated and wait for me. The staff were awesome. Our waiter was Logan and he was great too. The food was delicious. My uncle even loved the food--and he is picky what he eats. High compliments to Carmine's Italian Restaurant!

EqGo1nwkp1Av0hlF-BS7fQ.text: Carmine's is a great place to unwind and enjoy good Italian cuisine after winning a few hands on the floor. The concept is family style, which is awesome- you get a TON of food for a reasonable price. The entrees are served on a huge plate, and you help yourself until you can't fit any more in your belly. We didn't get dessert, but we saw the Titanic (giant ice cream/Sunday plate) pass out table and second thought our third helping of pasta. The wait staff is really nice, made for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs with Linguine. Meowth.

LF3YkyGzGefG0EvwRYPAdA.text: Very bad experience. Food is huge! Cost is ridiculous. Can't sit in restaurant unless you want to eat for 4. If your a couple forget it. Caesar salad was $30!! Ugh! Chicken parm was so garlicky I gagged! Don't do it!!

BxFwzr0NU27IzRwvTRQWMw.text: This review is based solely on he food.I can honestly say that this has got to be the absolute worst Italian Meal I have had in my 41 years of walking this earth, and that's including frozen pasta dishes from the supermarket & even a meal from Olive Garden. I have eaten Italian food at 5 star establishments so I'm not your average inexperienced customer. We ordered as an appetizer the fried zucchini. The zucchini came piled high and looked kind of like shoestring fries . This appetizer OMG simply made my stomach turn. I could not taste Zucchini at all!!!!! I could only taste old burnt oil and breading. I love Zucchini a lot and this was a huge let down and a complete waste with the quantity we did not eat. For our entree we ordered Chicken Saltimboca because it NORMALLY would be my husbands favorite thing to eat. The chicken was pounded so super thin and over cooked and lacked flavor despite the prosciutto and cheese on top. The only flavor you could taste in the entree was the brown gravy like sauce/substance that completely overpowered the entire dish. We also ordered Spinach as a side, this was not entirely horrible it was rather nice in fact I would have liked it to be served hot however rather than room temp.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eTI5GTY3a_rzRuHuj4mu1g.text: I could see myself eventually giving this place 5 stars. It's overpriced, but if you know me, I don't mind spending extra on stellar food. Please, read on to see why it's only a 4, maybe 4.5 star review.  My boyfriend and I went here on a random trip to the Forum Shops due to the closing of one of my favorite stores. I have been lucky enough to dine at the Carmine's in NYC, so I had high expectations.  First off, the dishes are huge, and if you are not familiar with Italian food, get ready to do some smart phone googling. There is no explanation of the food on the menu, which is also plastered all over the wall. Classic, homestyle, dishes served in portions enough for 3-4 people. We decided on the chicken scallopini, spaghetti and meatballs, and roasted peppers and mozzarella. We easily had enough food for, four, hungry people. The meatballs were melt in your mouth good, and gave grandma a run for her money. The chicken was beaten super thin and had the most succulent lemon glaze. I would honestly pass on the cheese and peppers again. The mozzarella was indeed fresh, but the peppers needed more. They were just cold and bland. Next time, I will go for the zucchini, I kept drooling watching it be served to others.  The only downfall was the service. Little things like not telling us the refills on the lemonade aren't free, or keeping the water full. The lady who was our server was clearly still in training, but I won't lie, I don't think shell make the cut.  She seemed confused on why two people ordered 3 dishes. I hate when people question how much we order. It happens too often, maybe we just eat too much.   On that note, I will give this place another shot, when I have about 4-6 others with me. Any takers?

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Roasted peppers and mozzarella
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken scallopini
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spaghetti and meatballs

sCbuHAtAu5xE3-BJuiRF_g.text: We had our wedding reception here on February 21 in the Terraza private room, which has it's own balcony that looks out to the Strip.  Everything was amazing!  Appetizers (calamari, stuffed mushrooms, and Caesar salad), Pastas (shrimp with white sauce on spaghetti, Italian sausage on penne), Entrees (Salmon Oreganato, Chicken Parmigiana), and Desserts (chocolate cannoli and fresh fruit) were all amazing!  All 48 of our guests could not stop raving about how good the food was and how full they were!  Our waiter, Michael, did an amazing job and made sure we were taken care of all night.  He also surprised us with 2 songs and his amazing opera voice!  I have to give a special thank you to Deidre Kennedy, our special events coordinator.  She was such a delight to work with and made our day as seamless as possible.  She even met with me earlier in the day to go over exactly how I wanted the room and our wedding items set up.    Awesome food!  Awesome service!  I know we will continue coming here on our frequent trips to Vegas and whenever our guests return, they will as well :)

FBnpZkG9KOk2pi7ek2YKCA.text: Family serving size dishes makes this place good if all like the same dish, otherwise expensive for families where everyone likes something different! The sauces and fallacies were amazing. Waiter David was great with our 12 & 13 year old boys. Would DEFINITELY RETURN!!!!

C6xhdtfXqGNHfqQcmNvqzw.text: I'm giving this a 2 star review based service: We visited Carmine's on Mother's Day to treat my Mother In Law to a nice late lunch at one of her favorite Italian restaurants.  She's from the NYC area but recently relocated to Las Vegas.  She's dined at the original Carmine's in NYC probably 100's of times over the years.  We were greeted and seated promptly.  The server, Antonel came over and asked if we would like to get drinks started, we felt a little rushed but brushed it off.  We ended up ordering a bottle of wine and water for the table.  We placed our order, starting with the fried zucchini as our appetizer.  We also ordered a chicken parmigiana, veal parmigiana and a penne with bolognese.  Their portion are huge and served family style, which we knew before ordering.  We were looking forward to leftovers.  After 15 or so minutes our entrees came out.  We asked the food runner where our appetizer was so he took the entrees back and asked.  Antonel, our server came back and told us they were out or zucchini today.  When we asked her why she didn't tell us before firing the entrees she said she forgot.  Her entire attitude changed, like we were a bother.  We wanted an appetizer and specifically asked her if the entrees went back would the kitchen remake them or were they just going to sit back there.  She said oh no, they'll remake them.  Fast forward to when the entrees came back out and sure enough the kitchen piled a ton of cheese on the chicken and veal, threw them under the salamander and sent them back out, DISGUSTING!  When we asked to speak with the manager he tried to cover saying it was against health code blah blah blah but there was no way to get around what they did, literally a pound of melted/old cheese. They re-fired our entrees and they came out as they should have the first time.  It's not a cheap place to eat and some people I'm sure save for long periods of time to be able to afford those prices.  When you choose to dine in a restaurant like this you except great service!   We're locals and won't go back and won't recommend to our out of town friends!

GU_B3xGMgFgnKoWd2q__JQ.text: My friends and I were trying to figure out a place to eat so this was recommended by the security guy at Ceasars and he mentioned that they offer family style servings. I must say, the food was amazing.   Our server brought us complimentary bread right away and it was delicious with the balsamic vinegar and olive oil. We orders a couple of appetizers. The calamari was huge and was able to feed 6 hungry women. We also ordered the Ceasars salad with anchovies which was so delicious. It had the perfect amount of dressing. For our main course we ordered chicken parmesean and the seafood linguini. They were both huge portions as well. There was a generous portion of seafood in the linguini which again was evenly split between 6 girls. We were all able to have a good portion of each type of seafood in the pasta.   Not only was the food amazing but we did have an awesome server. He was very knowledgeable and attentive. We also had another server actually served our food for us evenly.   The only thing I didn't like was the bloody mary. It was honesty the worst I've ever had. I had asked for it to be extra spicy and it was not spicy at all.  Overall, I'd rate this place as 4 starts bc of the amazing food, portions and great service. I'd definitely come back here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The worst bloody Mary I ever had.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They served it on our plates for us!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari

Jh11gL1NwV6Ky7hIOniUyA.text: For a chain restaurant, I liked it.  The food, service and decor was nice.  The family style portions are enough to feed a small army and the salads are amazing.  When in towna nd you have to take your team to dinner, this place is high on my list!

cOi9BFbhyAOUoO-MQU4Yiw.text: Family style - so expect super tasty comfort dishes of extra gigantic proportion, nothing fussy or molecular here.  Service was friendly and knowledgeable.    Not a miss - all good.  A garlic/lemon roast chicken scarpariello had the perfect crispy skin and succulent meat that makes you eat too much.  Our rigatoni with broccoli and sausage was big, lively and nicely al dente.  A nice variety in the bread basket, and my limoncello martini was totally foo-foo but I have to admit I liked it a lot (I accept the shame).  I asked if they offered affogato for dessert, no. But our waiter was right on it, brought some really good vanilla ice cream and a double espresso on the side.  Nice.  Seriously, you should bring four hungry people if you're going to order two main dishes.  You still may not finish.    Carmine's is doing a great job even if they are big and corporate.   It's in the Forum Shops, the epitome of simulacrum.  But somehow it all works and you feel like you had a nice break from whatever conference you came for.  Mangia bene, mangia tropo!

Tu7BFjG_mQrF-oiRYgPE3A.text: Their food was fantastic. The bread was awesome and the drinks were perfect. Our waiter was awesome and one of the waiters even started singing opera to all of their customers while we were there and received an ovation. So why only four stars?  They only serve their food family style. My wife and I got one order of the their chicken penn vodka something or another (which was great) but we had to waste half the plate because we couldn't eat it all.   I understand that family style makes sense in NY but lots of couples travel to Vegas which means Carmine's must be wasting a ton of food.

5Hfo-CZzHdULkovsFl_dqg.text: Best place in the Shops at Caesars Palace. Great food, atmosphere, drinks and service. Thanks, Martin!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

swUpisPTZQaar1A3D-5hpQ.text: This place had delicious delicious food. Everything is served family style, so isn't the place for a date night, but really great for groups of 4 people or more. We had carmine's signature salad, spaghetti and meatballs, carbonara, and prime rib. Everything was fantastic. The meatballs especially were really fantastic - best meatballs I've ever had. The prime rib was cooked perfectly and was wonderful. There was a ton of food - the three entrees + salad was way more than enough and we had a lot left over. Will definitely come back next time we're in vegas!

VyXZx_J9uImrTHQjyS8l4A.text: Great open atmosphere, family style potions/serving, food was traditional Italian and we really enjoyed the time with our family and friends.

HPLBdYyMYC8NP3AuNF9NPg.text: Let's keep it simple... We had 4 ladies. We ordered the calamari and the Chicken Piccata Special...along with a pitcher of the White Wine Sangria.  Service: Excellent Atmosphere: Fun Food: Excellent! Very large portions ($37 calamari/$39 chicken piccata) Sangria: Tasty and strong! We got about 9 glasses out of the pitcher ($48) Noise level: A little loud, but not as loud as Hard Rock.  My only complaint is, there are no menus at the table. The menus are on the wall on TV screens. We were seated on the "patio". The furthest from the wall with the menu and none of us could see it. So we had to pull out our phones to look at the menu.   Would I go back? Oh yeah!!

txpo1NosBEhxgXwhR_Tt0Q.text: Tale of two experiences.  My wife and I came here twice on the same trip because we liked it so much the first time.  The first visit was phenomenal.  We ordered half a caesar salad and half a ravioli entree.  The caesar salad was fresh, crisp lettuce, great flavor, just outstanding.  The raviolis were hot, oozing cheese out as you cut into them, and simply amazing.  The service was top notch.    The second time we came we were told as we were sitting at our table that we were not allowed to order half meals unless we accepted eating at a high top in the bar area.  I was ready to walk out at such an asinine request being that it is the same restaurant here or in the bar and we just ordered half meals the day before.  My wife was also pregnant so sitting at a high top bar was going to be uncomfortable for her.  As I was ready to leave my wife suggested we stay as she was having hunger pangs and needed to eat soon so I agreed.  We ordered the exact same thing from before after we complied to move seats or eat elsewhere.  This time the salad was soggy and not fresh.  Anyone who has made a caesar salad knows you must serve it as soon as you put dressing on it or it will go wilty.  The raviolis also tasted not fresh.  They weren't hot and the cheese wasn't oozing out of them.  They tasted reheated and stale.  It really felt as if the food we had the day before was now being served to us again today.    I'm not sure what to think of this place now.  I went from writing a five star review to a 1 star.  I am averaging it at 3 but I don't think i'd even roll the dice to come back for a tie breaker.  Very disappointing food and policy.    The rule that you can't order half meals basically means you can not come here as a couple but as a minimum of 4.  I'm not sure if the owner is purposely shunning couples or accidentally shunning them but the amount of food served is just way too much for 2 people to share unless you order a half.  After thinking of this policy, now even the menu being on the wall also seems like a pretty dumb idea.  Why do I have to stand above other diners to read a menu on a wall when you could just put the darn thing on my table for me to read like a normal person?  Carmines is coming across as bipolar and slightly insane.

YB56iMG3Dv3Lt8F1_FyiJQ.text: I have been to Carmine's 4 times with a group of 10-40 while working with Caesars.  Is it good?  Yes.  Does that warrant 4 stars?  No.  I mean... I'll go back, but the food seemed to be normal Italian food with super-sized portions.  I expected to get some better than average dish.  I wasn't really amazed, but I did have a ton of leftovers.  Honestly, not as an indication of the food, I always gave the leftovers to some homeless people on the Strip.  One time I had 5 bags!  Carmines packages the leftovers up with great care.  The dishes had utensils, napkins, and great containers.  It just wasn't enough to warrant 4 stars.

P6S8MdVBo9PNN8h5NX-jig.text: One word:  Forgettable.  It's only been a couple months since I was in here, and already I've forgotten what we ate... I remember the group we were with... I remember the service was attentive to our large party... And I vaguely remember the interior. But the whole experience was just, very, forgettable.  I even had to double check to see if I've written a review of thyet, is place or not.

DwJmPOEOBJ13sZ35-GM8lw.text: My husband and I came here in November 2014 to re-visit one year before we had our wedding rehearsal dinner there. It was a great experience so we wanted to come back and load up on carbs before our half marathon. My husband is gluten free. They have choices for the allergy. We had a bolognese with gluten free noodles and a salad to begin with. These are huge portions but that didn't stop us to try and stuff ourselves of food. It's a great atmosphere and we had excellent service again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love the atmosphere
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy and filling salad
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten free noodles with bolognese sauce

e3rtrUS-vLUcI4BZseLgPA.text: Came to Carmines for a business dinner. We had a large group and the hostess was really great about changing our table as our party size increased. We sat near the back and could watch as the staff brought out the dishes for other diners and man just like the reveiws say - portions are huge!   I've been to other family style italian restaurants (bucca or maggianos) and I think Carmines is way better than both of those. We ordered the Carmines salad and anti pasta dishes to start. Then our mains were meatballs with pasta in red sauce, veal parm, and broccoli and sausage rigatoni in white sauce. They were all really tasty- i especially liked the veal parm. For dessert we had the titanic and choc bread pudding.   All in all a great meal - had wine flowing and good fun.    I do have to mention they have a waiter there that sings italian opera -- AMAZING.  He was singing happy birthday to a few folks and came over and sang our group a different song. He was super nice and he's really good! Go see him for yourself!!!

SkIeiVAizFF85KloyIRNNw.text: Food was fantastic and one plate would easily feed 4 adults. No need to order more than one dish for a couple and you'll have leftovers for a full meal. My issue was with the menu. They project it in on four or so walls. We could not see the menu from where we were sitting. We told our waitress (blond tall no makeup) we would like a paper menu. She got snotty and put out and said that they didn't have any paper menus that it was supposed to be "interactive" and that maybe we could find it online!?? Okay....so had to get up from booth and stare at stupid menu in the middle of the restaurant glaring over a poor couple who happened to be sitting underneath it. Felt sorry for them having to stare at random people's nose hairs while they ate when people went to look at the menu over their head. Sorry but the restaurant left me no choice. Our waitress was consistently snotty and put out through the meal (yes you, blond-no-make-up Miss snooty ) we were laughing that she said the menu was "interactive" because there was no interacting  except showing my nose hairs to random couple at table. We said we could keep things interactive and take a picture of our cash tip instead of giving our waitress a paper version! Ha ha! Maybe she could find her tip online! Anyway, great food stupid menu concept!

O5U8I_5aZ3Pe33u1BUnadw.text: One dish can feed an army... really... it can... The portions are enormous! Look at the menu before you go, and if there are only two of you try to find something that is going to be great for you to share... like one dish to share... because, believe me... if you each order a dish, you will be eating leftovers for two weeks...

QsFC57ZWJVV5aYp2L9a_pQ.text: Definitely on the pricey side. I can't say that if it wasn't for a work meeting of I would've gone on my own but the food is good and I would come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wine

ITHelsoHvXYQJO0ePi7ETQ.text: Came here with my husband, so we only ordered 1 item from the menu (spaghetti and meatballs), since we knew the portions would be huge. I really was not impressed with the food but then again we only tried 1 thing. I guess you come for the "italian family style" experience so I would only return with a large group. We had enough leftover for 2 more meals. Which was not bad since we paid about $35.  They do bring out a basket of bread that was pretty good. The basket had different types of bread some which were new to me.

G9Y2rioX1FGm5RHNTzw6Kw.text: Just had a very unsatisfying meal at Carmine's--enough to compel me to write a Yelp review.  Upon the waiter's recommendation, my boyfriend and I ordered the pasta special, which happened to be the Carbonara.
