I was initially hesitant because I wasn't feeling like a heavy pasta kind of meal but our waiter insisted that the sauce was very light and he preferred it over the Pomodoro, which was what we originally had in mind.   I really wish I wasn't so easily swayed by others' opinion because the Carbonara, as I expected, turned out to be incredibly nauseous. I could only stomach 2 fork-fuls before I started to feel nauseous. My feeling of disgust was only exacerbated by the harsh reality of having to spend $40 for a dish I barely touched and did not enjoy. Seeing as I am in Vegas and all, I guess I could elude this meal to a gamble that did not go in my favor...  The only saving grace of my experience today was the calamari. It really is as good as my fellow Yelpers suggest. But then again, don't let me sway your decision.

hesEwqsa6vYpoPgsOOyicQ.text: The bar tenders were absolutely amazing and good looking. One was a gentleman that looks like Jason stathom, another like Alexander scarsgard. And a beautiful woman with silky hair and great skin tone. All three were so hospitable as well. Constantly checking in on us and filling our drinks.  The food was so good. We had the calamari and the penned alla vodka. Highly recommend.

CyRGJRvw_bxzwYFRANLBDQ.text: Was just so-so. Brought out a basket of 5 or 6 kinds of bread & none of them were memorable, actually pretty blah.  I got ravioli with Bolognese sauce.  The sauce was pretty good but the cheese ravioli were boring.

h4uS-8cUCUVqyotPCoXfMg.text: When we arrived our entire group was excited, the smell and appearance had us watering at the mouth, however it went down hill from there. The service was very slow, we had to ask for a basket of bread a couple of times while waiting for our drinks. The pricing is high and the food was bland and to top the evening off we found something "foreign" in our food and when we brought it to the mangers attention he attempted to avoid responsibility, to go as far to say it could have been put there by "someone else" , who else had access to our food?. He excused himself from the and we he returned he had reconsidered responsibility for the foreign object in our food. He comped the food on the table at the time, not the check. All and all the food was fair but overpriced, the service was slow and not knowing what else may have been in the food, we wont be back.

pUNYUZPAjnlh6BN_zEGOoQ.text: Where to begin. My fiance and I love food and have been to a lot of amazing restaurants . We were very excited to try this place out but unfortunetly the service sucked. Our waitress looked like she didnt even want to be there. Didnt help us at all. I had to keep waiving other waiters down just to take care of us.The food was not even hot.  The whole expierience sucked. It was WAYYY OVER PRICED for the service and food we recieved. We will never be back.

sywH3EyslEBnXczTM9B-lw.text: We had the sausage on Angel hair pasta, Carmines salad and the eggplant rollatini in the bar area. Our food came out in a timely manner and the team service was great. Everyone treated us great front the minute we stepped up to the hostess stand.

diwmmZqZWON15RE7YxR9SQ.text: We are avid fans of Carmine's in New York and just went to the Carmine's at the Forum in Las Vegas. The food was the same, portions enormous as always and the decor definitely felt the same. We especially loved 2 things. We were able to get in without the reservations having to be made weeks in advance, and it was not as noisy. We had a wonderful waiter (Joey V) and will definitely return.

4j8oCr8tuazzWzaqQKdpbw.text: I am a Las Vegan and it was my first time there. With a business group with high profile foodies. Let me say I felt like I was in the Best Old School Restaurant in NYC let alone one of the very best Italian Family Eateries ever. The atmosphere is dynamic, exciting and energizing just like the staff from the front desk to the bar to the table. There was eight in our party drinks, bread and fast appetizers in a NY Minute. The server was fun, engaging and attentive even the floor manager brought refills and made the evening wonderful. To top all this not a empty seat in the House. From 8 pm to closing the food, drinks and attention was nonstop. OH YES THE FOOD...." Forget about it............sooooo very good.....Family Style great.....a authentic feast....in every way."  Carmine's is a special place worth you making it the place for a milestone occasion or a very hot date.   Tom

XOzh3xqDcxfAALWXFcNjow.text: Great food. Huge portions. Family style Italian. I recommend getting the 4 pasta special. Will feed 4-6 people easy.

9t9dKrO3o97wLL9H-r6TVQ.text: Really good place. Food is large portions. I really enjoyed the atmosphere! I have been here twice and both times the food was very good and consistant.

zzT5PNY2IwVpf_5KOXFs0Q.text: We had seen Carmine's during our recent shopping trip to The Forum Shops at Caesar's Palace and decided to give it a try for dinner prior to attending the April 30 Elton John concert. The ambience is casual and New York Italian (as am I) with a lot of energy in the air. It was prom night so there were several groups of prom goers who as an aside looked great all decked out. To say Carmine's serves "family style" is a little misleading unless you come from a large family. The portions are huge. Our waiter advised my wife and I to stick to a single entree and order it over pasta (for $12 upcharge) rather than ordering a separate pasta dish for twice the price. We took his advice and had the chicken parmesan over spaghetti and really enjoyed it.One note, Carmine's has a Food Valet service, at no charge, which was a new term for me but what they do is box up your leftovers, keep them in a refrigerator and deliver it to you when you check back in at their front desk when you return after whatever you're doing after dinner. We tried it out and it worked perfectly so tonight is a repeat of last night's dinner. The couple next to us ordered a Caesar's salad which looked to be 1 1/2 heads of Romaine lettuce. They each had two or three dishes worth of salad and hadn't made a dent in it so after repeated offers by them I tried the salad. It was quite good; stronger on the anchovy taste than garlic but really pretty mild. I saw their spaghetti and meatballs which like everything else was huge. Given portion sizes the prices at Carmine's are very reasonable; cheap by The Strip restaurant standards. The service was excellent and everything we tried tasted very good. I will definitely return but I'd like to have two other couples with us so we can try a couple more entrees. Three couple with three entrees will mean leftovers for all.

NoJDDpQKJxQYPVxnrWO29w.text: We booked a reservation for a large soccer team party of 40 people. Carmines had the best service from the group sales to the waiters and staff. They accommodated every need and the food was amazing. The spaghetti and meatballs were such a crowd pleaser. We had a set menu and there was not one thing we did not like. Great job and we will be back.

VBmi-6AlbQqPMU8y2bgqxg.text: Excellent meal and excellent service from Mike P.  His recommendations for food and appetizers were spot on. This is one of the best Italian restaurants and the portions are huge.

Wh2WEfEZK6_IM0_vRddEMQ.text: The food was good but I wasn't impressed with the service. Upon arrival last Saturday the hostess's were talking amongst them self then finally acknowledged me. I decided to sit at the bar. The bartender who was my server did not get me a menu after ten minuets brought  me one after I asked. She also took a very long time to get my food order. She walked by my friends chair and bumped into him and didn't even say excuse me. She didn't come to check on us even once. The gentleman sitting next to us said she took forever to take his order as well and he thought she was rude. Another male bartender was nice enough to comp me and my friend two drinks because he saw that we were having a hard time with the other bartender. That was nice of him but I had asked for hot coffee and it came out lukewarm :/. Then when we were leaving she said oh I accidentally swiped the guy's card sitting next to you for your meal, and his was $7 cheaper so here's his bill. Ok?? So we paid and left and of course the hostess's didn't even say Thank you or Have a good evening. They were too busy talking to each other.

uFUH7R6VJKQT9UhVEWFcCg.text: Hosted a private party upstairs and everything was amazing! The view from the balcony made for very cool photos, and the food and service were on point!!!  Big thank you to Stephanie, Cassie, and the rest of the staff for making such a fabulous night possible

FqWIAET4Rr6RUXb73d-TSQ.text: How's the food?  Couldn't tell you because it never came out of the kitchen.  We stopped here in July to get some appetizers.  We came in after 9:00 PM and the place was not busy.  After being seated, our waiter pretty much forgot about us because it was about 30 minutes before someone else came by to take our drink orders.  We ordered our food at the same time and, just as we were ordering, our original waiter came back to the table to take over.  We told both waiters that we wanted the portabello mushroom appetizer (they have two mushroom appetizers, the other is stuffed caps).  They both went away and the original waiter came back again to confirm which mushroom appetizer we wanted.  We repeated - portabella.  30 minutes later (we've been here an hour now), out comes someone else with mushroom caps - not what we ordered.  We told him those weren't right and he didn't seem to understand what we were saying.  We called our server over and he saw what was wrong, apologized and took away the food to get the order right.  We're now starving and eating the all the bread at the table - which is grocery store quality by the way.  Spongy and not crusty at all.  After waiting another 30 minutes (now 90 minutes waiting FOR AN APPETIZER), and several visits from our waiter who kept making us feel uncomfortable by being over apologetic, we decided to talk with the manager.  She was nice enough, apologized for the inconvenience and said that we didn't have to pay for anything - so we left.  Over an hour an a half there, no real food (other than bad bread) and bad service.  Our first trip there was our last.  Hope your experience is better.    Oh by the way, if you like GOOD Italian food, this is not the place for you.  You can tell by the bread when a place is good or not (it's not good here) and we could see what others were getting.  This place looks like mid-west American style Italian food.  On par with Olive Garden.  Good luck!

Lftf_58eQssCx20YVR3G1w.text: My favorite NY restaurant from back home comes to my current city?! Hell yes. I havent had good Italian since moving here 4 years ago, inexpensive, great for groups and you ALWAYS leave with leftovers! Highly recommended for anyone looking for that east coast TASTE thats impossible to find here. (also some really cute hostesses)

pyROxLIsUh1nLCa70XKgZA.text: Family style dining. Each entree feeds 4-6 people! E add a group of 4. We ordered a salad that would do for 8. Some lemon chicken, cheese ravioli and a side of spinach. More than enough food. Next time is same room for their dessert called the titanic.

z9picukQSsMKvZr3Pb7dvQ.text: As someone visiting America over Christmas and missing my nonnas cooking, I was absolutely delighted to stumble into Carmine's for dinner during my Vegas trip. We had made a reservation (luckily as the place was packed) and were seated quickly as a group of 7. We were introduced to the menu and informed that it was share style with plates that would feed 3-4 people, and with prices of around $30-35 for pasta I thought that was a complete bargain. This place is a True Italians heaven and really showcases what Italian eateries are all about, huge served and sharing a meal with your family. We decided on the lasagnes, penne all a vodka and a Carmine's salad as well as some wine for the table. The food was incredible and we had plenty left over after eating our body weight in pasta and at a grand total of $40 each I was incredibly impressed with the value for money! I will definitely be returning again on my next trip to Vegas!!

KImVHxNhD_2rYXztgtD6Ag.text: Outstanding food and service Michael Baker's singing is excellent Highly recommend for the family

rVuMq9VNULkd25L__doiBQ.text: Terrible service from everyone.  Food was bland and average. Waited forever. Not worth the money. Not by half.

wXZp7kLry5qsJj6awu6P5A.text: Food sucked !!!!  Overpriced   What a let down!! Don't eat there. Meatballs with spaghetti.

2gccxIPTQF714UxnHx1mbw.text: So my family and I were looking for an authentic Italian restaurant because we've never been able to find a decently priced one. So we tried Carmine's after reading reviews and seeing that it was averagely priced compared to other restaurants. After eating there it definitely could use some improvements  A major negative about the restaurant was that I was surprised at how they don't have menus and they looked at me weirdly when I asked them about menus. I mean 99.9% of restaurants have menus so I don't why it's weird asking about it. I don't think any Italian restaurants that I've ever gone to don't give out menus. I suppose it was meant to save costs but I just don't get the logic behind this strategy especially when new customers who come here can easily be turned off by this weird lack of menu experience. Now you can say everyone doesn't mind, however when I went there I saw at least two tables sit down and leave after walking back and forth to look at the menu on the wall. I mean when I go into a restaurant I expect to see menus that way I can converse with people i'm eating with about what to eat and such, especially with dishes that I have to share. So once we sat down they said that menus were on a big screen at the wall and If I wanted a menu I needed to take a picture of it with my phone or stare at it from my table or go up there and look at it. Problem was that the menu on the wall only covered certain portions of the restaurant and certain tables couldn't get a clear view of the menu and my phone was almost dead from a day full of sight seeing. When you make a menu on the wall make sure everyone can see it from a table, that way people can talk to each other in what they want to eat especially since all dishes are shared. That way customers don't have to keep going back and forth and risk higher chances of collisions with waiters, staff, other customers or even cause accidents on spilling food and drink on other people who were all dressed nicely. There's a higher risk of accidents occurring when you have that many people moving around a finite spaced environment. Their menu wasn't even that overly complicated so it could easily be a page or even used as a place mat for eating. So many ideas available when deciding your menu. Then they have certain tables not occupied near the menu wall, because I imagine it obstructs the view of the menu or that people would hate the idea of people walking back and forth around you while you're trying to enjoy a meal. Kind of a waste of real estate for a restaurant and loss revenue when those tables can easily be filled. So a lot of problems could be solved if they just created a menu.  Now another minor negative was the food. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't amazing either. The pasta, meats, veggies, and even seafood were all exceptionally fresh. You can taste it. Nothing feels mushy, dried or like it's been sitting in the fridge for months. Everything is exceptionally fresh. The only problem was that the food wasn't really hot. It was warm. My family ordered the Prime Rib special on Saturday and it was warm. It was delicious but it was warm. If it was hotter the food would've easily been a 9/10. I mean if I'm paying that kind of price for that food I expect a certain level of quality.   The prices were insane. Just ordering two dishes you can easily top $150. We ordered 3 dishes so you can imagine how expensive it was. The prime rib special on Saturday was $95. But they said it could feed four people. If your family are big eaters like mine, then 2 people could easily finish that. Pastas start at the mid $35 range but adding substitutions adds another $15 to it. Portions are average for that price I would say,   The major positive about Carmine's was our waiter. He was decent and was constantly helping us probably the only decent staff member of the whole place. Especially when we wanted a new table because their typical 4 person table wouldn't have been able to accommodate 3 full plates of food. So remember to ask for a bigger table if you're a big eater.  And like I said earlier some tables have absolutely no view of the menu and you could really tell which were the good tables and which were the bad ones.   Would I go there again? Maybe. It wasn't anything memorable, especially for that price.

2EC4oveYVKvWAAL96YfOTA.text: Came here with my family and my girlfriends family as we love the Carmine's in NYC and love family style Italian.  Food was good but not comparable to the Carmine's in NYC.  Tempted to give this place two stars for the terrible service, but the manager was very nice and took 10% off our bill.  Server brought out our food and then disappeared for 30-45 minutes and did not return to table until I brought it to the managers attention.  Unacceptable!

BYCdFdeL4P8xaBRagxvNPA.text: Was having a tough time deciding, but Mike P. steered me towards the Carmine Salad (I'm a vegetarian and wasn't in a pasta mood for some reason) and it was awesome. Always appreciate a server who will take the time to help guests navigate the menu and how it relates to their likes/dislikes. Wish I'd had room for dessert, the strawberry shortcake sounded delish!

FhTkxf-vWPRsjQTbfLddRA.text: They prefer to keep their tables empty all evening anticipating phone reservations to show up. Stopped by at 3 PM and were turned away, we went to Trevi and had dinner and walked by after we finished little before 6 PM, I saw 7-8 tables empty by the outside. One would wonder why some food businesses complain about lack of revenue and later shutter their doors.

vkedMNFZfjSATTsxAKRzOg.text: Kyle did a great job serving! Friendly and recommended the penne a la vodka. Delicious!

9DNEgdNZPBBl14rU7FxxBw.text: Just had a large party for my daughter's wedding. The food just kept coming and coming. I have never had a better evening of fun, food and entertainment. One outstanding person, Michael Baker, kept everything moving along with wit and song. Not only was my daughter's wedding party a success, but we even had a toast to my nephew's birthday.

OnPxBBMB6aA8Q96dP3X7Ww.text: My family decided to dine at Carmine's this past Tuesday evening for our last meal while in Las Vegas. There was no wait, and we were placed at a table in the very back of the restaurant. The restaurant itself looks like Buca Di Beppo, and has an extremely similar ambiance. The hostess sat us down, said nothing, and walked away. About ten minutes later, a waiter was serving the table next to us and we asked if he could grab our waiter because we had not yet been seen. Our waitress arrived, did not introduce herself, and quickly asked what drinks we would like. When we did not order alcoholic beverages, she was clearly disappointed. About ten minutes later, she came with only one pitcher of water for a table of fifteen people. We asked her several questions about the menu, and she did not seem to know the answers to any of them. In fact, we were never handed menus, but were expected to crane our necks backwards to look at the large, light-up menu that was directly behind us. She first brought out our salad, and some ice-cold bread. Soon after, she brought our food, and because the restaurant serves family style, we were all leaning over each other trying to gain access to the dishes.   About fifteen minutes after finishing the small portion of pasta and breaded chicken I ate, I began to feel a stomach ache coming on. We left the restaurant around 9 p.m, and I was back in my hotel room by 9:30. I packed up my suitcases and went into bed, but then I started to feel terrible pain in my stomach. I THREW UP ALL NIGHT. I have continued to have terrible stomach pains through Friday evening and went to Urgent Care, where the doctor confirmed that I had FOOD POISONING!!  There are many great restaurants on the strip, but Carmine's is NOT one of them. Treat yourself right and go anywhere but there. The food quality was poor, the service was bad, and the atmosphere was busy.

gpvirzAYYd9nAPvEy9QPaA.text: Blah! Ordered the Linguini with clams. No good. Smelt and tastes like burnt garlic, too much crappy oil used to cook the dish and waaaay over priced. Wine is served in a cocktail glass instead of a wine glass ghetto!!! I get it that its "old school Italian" but if were keeping up with "old school Italian" why did they offer me Cheese with my shellfish? This place should pack up and retire.

IYKPapKyCymyZi7UhWKpVA.text: The portions were True family style, but that was where the excitement ends. The service is slow. Don't be prepared to get in and out.  I was with a single colleague and it took over an hour to see our meal. The food itself was more on the bland side leaning towards dry (our chicken parm).  I would advise anyone to avoid it. As a Tri State area east coaster it was a big disappointment.

pZWYCNZoNarDVJYmn5YwPg.text: Had dinner here and it was amazing.  Family size portions so we ordered two entrees for the four of us and it was more than enough.  The portions are enormous.  The rigatoni with sausage and broccoli was delicious.  The sauce was as good as it gets.  We also got the Carmine's salad which was also enormous.  It was a tossed salad with salami, ham, and cheese, oil and vinegar and it was seasoned  perfectly.  We ended up here because we couldn't get in to the restaurant we had planned to dine at even though it was late at night.  This was a great find and we will surely be back again next time we are in Vegas.  They also have a few other locations in various parts of the country.

wutK8XxJpxmfefGkTG6JOg.text: OVER-PRICED.  PERIOD.  Sorry, but cheesecake for $25.00!!!  Chicken parmigana $33????  Outrageous!! You'll do better finding an Italian restaurant that's not so famous.

oftcAUuwV5BYFwbZtLdyUw.text: Came here for dinner last night with my family for my husbands birthday . Usually service is great and I leave impressed . Unfortunately a football game was on while we were dining. So we didn't get the usual attention . Our order was wrong and while we asked for food to be packed our servers response was " that doesn't travel well" well we are actually local so we have a fridge at home . The icing on the cake was when the server asked if we wanted dessert . We said no thank you to which he responded with " we have a birthday dessert for you " with that being said who turns down free dessert . $329 later that dessert was $30 . Which I probably would have not gotten being my husband prefers the strawberry shortcake . Lesson learned Carmine's , to not come in with football is playing because then your employees would have to work . Thanks to our server for making sure we would probably go to Rao's spend the extra money but it would be worth it .

pdfDtyxliJZSHc_zZpoyaQ.text: My husband and I were there celebrating my birthday.  The food was excellent....loved the surf n turf!  Our server Mike P was awesome, very friendly, and made sure everything was to our liking!  We would definitely come back.  Good time was had by all!

jXODbWe4gBME9faoQT4r4Q.text: Was in Vegas for a nice gamblers getaway when me and my friends stumbled into the restaurant for a quick bite to eat. Food was tremendous ( I had the surf n turf because its Vegas baby!). But being a server myself I am always particular of the service and must say that Mike P was awesome and even recommended some great dishes for my friends. If I ever find myself in Vegas again we will most certainly return. Five stars!!

Y9BZwTRjGs9nGbZyn42HsA.text: Update on my previous review - we went back for our rehearsal dinner and it was PERFECT!  The food was amazing, we got tons of amazing, positive feedback on everything,  especially the shrimp parmigana - including some raving reviews from a very hard to please relative who usually doesn't like anything. Thank you so much to all the staff and our planner who made it such a memorable night!

_xzyY4NJKiESC95YXtTneQ.text: Overall, Carmine's is probably a 4. There are certainly dishes at Carmine's that are nothing special. The calamari and shrimp fra diavolo are two that come to mind that are just OK in my book.  But this review is about one menu item and one menu item only. The chicken scallopine. I've been to Carmine's in NYC many times, and the Las Vegas location is no different. The chicken scallopine at Carmine's is easily one of my favorite meals of all time. The lemon butter sauce is just amazing. The perfect blend of creamy, zesty, and lemony. It's so good that I even eat the spinach that it's served with, and I usually won't touch spinach. It's so good that I can eat an entire basket of bread just sopping it up. There's a recipe floating around online (from Carmine's directly I believe), but it's impossible to really replicate at home. It's never quite the same. Since the chicken is so thin, this is the one menu item that a very hungry person can probably tackle alone (if it's all that you order). I have a few times and I'm usually not a gluttonous eater. I just can't get enough of this stuff  Over $50 for an order of chicken scallopine and a glass of Chardonnay, but it's so good I don't care. Bonus points for the focaccia bread with tomato sauce on it. Goes perfectly with the lemon butter sauce.

X67l4J2bLcJD8aBSbckqig.text: Hello. Let me first say that I have changed my mind and my opinion. My hat is off to the staff at the restaurant ant to the manager, Anthony. We ate there on Wednesday before thanksgiving as a family meal. My wife, ex-wife and daughter and my son and his wife. We enjoyed an antipasti prepared for us by the chef and sent out with the complements of the restaurant. So, what happened. The general manager and I spoke after my last review and we agreed that I should try one more time. I let Anthony know when I was coming and that I was bringing the family. We had an enjoyable table out in the mall, the patio area and the noise level was MUCH reduced and we could all hear each other with no trouble. Which for a guy who is starting to loose a little in the hearing area, was great. We enjoyed a Caesar salad and ordered the stuffed mushrooms. Neither of which disappointed a single guest. We then ordered the chicken parmesan and the cheese ravioli. There was food for all and it was all great. If I had any complaint, which I do not, it was I kind of expected a side of pasta with the chicken parmesan, but trust me it was not needed. There was plenty and I do not think anyone missed it at all.   Everything went as expected and we are and were impressed with the service and the food. It just goes to show you that every one can have a bad day. Strike my first review and go with this one.

2Sh1FhPXSS8O58evmh_hvw.text: This was the perfect spot for 6 of us to enjoy a birthday dinner. The food was pretty good, portions beyond large, our server was great. I would go back if I visit Vegas again. It is like Bucca de Peppo, but the food was better. The one thing that sorta made me almost in a bad mood was. My husband and I were meeting 4 others for dinner. When we sat at the bar to have a drink, I realized I had not eaten since breakfast. I asked the bartender for a slice of the stick bread I saw another patron at the bar eating. He said something while turning his back to me and slid a menu my way. I did not see just bread on the menu. So I said to another bartender the same thing and he said (in a curt way) we are family style and there is the menu. The least exspensive item was $19.95.  So i said to him, really you can't spare a piece of bread? He grabbed a basket of bread and through it at me.

XOJjgg3KhZbUFVCTY8x0LQ.text: We had dinner reservations at 745 and since we were running close, my husband dropped me off and then went to park.  While waiting for him I ordered a bottle of water and a diet coke.  After 40 minutes of my husband circling thtee different parking garages, we decided that I would leave and we would go somewhere else.  I put down what cash I had, roughly $8, and left.  The waiter cane running or if the restaurant too tell me what I had left "didn't even begin to cover my tab".  Really? A bottle of water and a coke? I explained the situation, but was told I couldn't leave until I paid.  I gave him my card feeling like I really had no other choice.  Way to go!!  I will never attempt to go back if this is the way they treat their customers.

vtsc4Nuwy7xYzvtqgYO8ng.text: Out with friends ordered the Carmine salad had to use a magnifying glass to find the meat and cheese. The calamari was great but I made a big faux pas when I asked for more marinara. The waiter neglected to mention that there would be an extra charge for it. This took me by surprise and it embarrassed me as the other couple ended up treating us. We also ordered meatballs with rigatoni and everyone loved it. Service was only fair far from outstanding. Will have to think hard about returning.

R9SwwP9Gnugm5qc4J9PMhA.text: Never disappointed at Carmine's. Our go to place when we have a group of people. Love the family style service.

TaDF-AFsV2wf6EQSaZ0JZg.text: Absolutely fantastic. Staff is attentive and professional. Food is delicious. Best Caesar salad ever!

ggs4YhfKEZnrecuLyvTeLA.text: Our waiter Michael was super fast to aid our requests for napkins, refills, and more! We didn't even have to wait at least 10 minutes before he came speeding to our service, even though it was packed inside the restaurant. I totally recommend him. The service wasn't the only thing that was amazing. The food was delicious! The chicken and beef were tender and the sauce had unique flavors that tasted like heaven. Don't even get me started with the noodles. They tasted spectacular as well. Michael is awesome!

tTJGfjM6I7xPx3wNSrD_hg.text: The portions of food the serve is huge. This was my very first time in Vegas so I was very impressed with the quality of food at Carmine's. We ordered the calamari as a appetizer and there where three of us with healthy appetites and we couldn't finish it. Along with the calamari we had the Ragu it came with lots of different meat with a very tasty red sauce we couldn't finish that either. Followed by a huge strawberry short cake for dessert. We took the left overs back to or room to eat again later that night but we were still full from dinner. I worked at a restaurant  that was Italian in St Louis on the hill called ''Mama Campisi's  It is now called Mama's on the hill. Sadly Mama Campisi past away. Carmine's has it beat by a long shot. You won't leave hungry when you eat at Carmine's if i get to come back to Vegas I'm eating here again.

RpsHLw7_kQoPWrBxeLt81g.text: We were working an event across the walkway from Carmine's and were initially drawn here because of convenience, but came back the next day and will probably come back tomorrow too! Since we were working, our team of three was planning to come eat in shifts however Carmine's is family style. I was worried this would cause a problem, but the wonderful ladies in the bar (Gina and Colleen) in addition to their awesome manager Anthony were completely willing to help us out! They let me sit at a table in the bar to order and eat before I had our other two girls filter in one after the other.  The food is fabulous and the service and willingness to be flexible was even better! So great. If you like Italian food and great people, come to Carmine's!

cu9WzM4BbKdCvWfWjGyX-w.text: Very good service -gave us water and soda even before we asked. Waiter came by often and asked how we were doing. Food was great. Great calamari appetizer. We had Spaghetti with meatballs. Pasta was cooked perfectly -not too soft, not too hard. Meatball was tasty -very soft and flavorful. If there was an issue, the portions were huge and we couldn't order any more than basics for 3 of us.

2PI7tyn5-eEoTxe96rnTpw.text: We come here quite often.  My family loves this place so of course it was the place of choice for New Year's Eve dinner.  We thought it would be a hassle but it was quite easy getting on the strip through the back streets and getting into forum shops.  The shops were closed but restaurants open.  At Carmine's, we were seated upstairs in a private area with a balcony.  The view of the strip was AMAZING.  wish we could've stayed there until midnight to see the fireworks.  Now I know where I want my bday dinner!  Food was amazing as usual. We ordered the spicy wing scarpariello, something we always get because it's so good.   And the portobello Parmesan.   Both were delicious.  It was a total of ten of us and we only Ordered 2 entrees and we Have left overs!  We ordered the lobster fra diavolo..its huge and the chicken scarpariello.  I'd say of you get the wings, don't get the chicken. It's very similar...even though the waiter told us its different.  We got the Italian cheesecake for desert and it was delicious!!!  Again...leftovers.  We love Carmine's. Loves it since NY. Glad they have a location here in vegas now!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For the spiked lemonade. So delicious
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spiked lemon aid
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rum runner

PlusX_m5hsutVqJ4TiUNWw.text: Went to Carmine ' s again. First stop when we got into town. Same great experience and food as last time! This is now one of our go to restaurants when we are hungry. one thing to remember....everything is served family style! If there are only two of you, eat at the bar. They serve JR portions in the bar. By Jr., they mean more than enough for 2 people! Every time we come, we order the same thing: Caesar salad with grilled shrimp and penne alla  vodka. Delicious! The food reminds me of what I would eat in college on Arthur Ave. In the Bronx! Also, don't forget to add anchovies to the Caesar salad! To top it all off, they serve Peroni on draft!   Oh, be sure to taste the different bread options! The onion rolls and pepperoni bread are great, too! Just make sure when you head to Carmine ' s that you are hungry!

m-aWnfFTfzJEDWgvf8DKQA.text: Went for a business lunch.  Service was terrible! Staff seemed barely coherent, got orders incorrect. The electronic menu over had a lower price then we were charged,  and the server said they meet to update the menu...  Which is fraud. Dessert (strawberry shortcake)  wasn't very good.  Surprisingly bad overall and a huge disappointment !

ocxz_ZHfPOIou1Pbq9Jf-w.text: Very good service and all dishes were served family style. Very good taste and a large quantity of food on each dish.

Gj3_RpeyYWy8g0JY7S4VdA.text: Wow! Great food in large quantities. I went with aa party of 8. We had two salads, two chicken dishes, lasagna and the garlic and oil pasta. It was all amazing. I would definitely come back but this place is definitely meant for a decent sized party.

Ysep04eBUAwzxVPvoicMdg.text: Randomly chose this in a pinch. The service was ok, the restaurant had a lot of workers, but the water took a while. The food was fast, tasted good. The bread was ice cold, I thought it was just one piece and then I tried another and all were ice cold. Would not try again. Experience was meh.

FTrcc8vjT5U5u-9eSlaMqw.text: GLUTEN FREE AVAILABLE.  But dang they portions big!!! We sat in the bar area so we could have the smaller bar portions and they were still huge.  And a huge plus is that they have gluten free options.  I had the vodka sauce with a side of sausage--yep side of sausage.  It was very good.  I would go back just because they offer gluten free.

VzAPaqwCxYqhcUzykOyUvQ.text: Food= Amazing, Big portions yes but if you have left over take it home for later! Iv had a verity of dishes here and everything is very well prepared with tons of FLAVOR.  Service= Every time I visit Carmines the service is great! Our server last night was on top of it. He was friendly , easy to talk to and attentive.   I made reservations 2hours before just incase they were busy to insure no wait time.

tx8F69nq6KZ-hCWIT7ID7Q.text: This place wasn't anything spectacular for me. The pasta was a little bland and not really what I was expecting. I like the idea of family style as it allows you to try multiple dishes. The chicken parm was the only thing I really liked. Skip the white wine seafood pasta as it had no flavor whatsoever. I was with a large group none of which really enjoyed the food much. The atmosphere was nice and inviting and the service was fabulous. I am giving 3 stars for the service only. I would probably give the food 2 stars. I would say skip this place and got to Joe's which is also in the Forum Shops as well.

cisVLA8AC30bjw86rLv_kQ.text: I had tried Carmnes a few years ago and remembered it was good, so of course on our most recent trip my family and I had to try it again. We were only 3 people, and it was happy hour, so we grabbed a table at the bar, ordered some wine, and some happy hour specials. We loved the fried calamari, and the meatball sliders were so good my son and I had to order a second round! The garlic bread parmagIana was huge, and loaded with mozzarella cheese. However, the mussels in red sauce was the best yet! Black mussels swimming in a garlic and basil tomato sauce were out of this world! Needless to say, we were very happy, and full, when we left. We will be back, again!!

SgslI6fYbeywaktB7sEqUw.text: We had gone here a couple of years back, and decided to stop on our drive through to California. We are so glad we stopped because this was just as good as we remembered. We ordered the Giardiniera (no peas), and it was soo delicious and hearty. The fresh parmesan on the table is always a plus in my book. Too bad we didn't have a larger group; because the portions are so big, we could only order one item. The pre-dinner bread selection is always good, and we love their onion focaccia. The service was awesome, and they packed up the pasta for us in a very road-friendly manner. They've got a pretty fresh strawberry lemonade to boot.

cmBaHwIaj9180uR9nh1ogw.text: First time here and loved it!! Michael Baker was our waiter and was awesome. Really was helpful on selecting our dinner

BEzHqQlAkT94BRP1Ut4a0w.text: I'll give it a 4 only cause I can't do 31/2. Its good food. Huge portions. Good service, very attentive staff while we were there. Their wing appetizer was good if you like rosemary which we do. The main entree was OK but my teens didn't eat and they usually aren't picky.  The prices are high, three entrees and drinks for 150.00. They did remove the main entree because we didn't want to take leftovers home. That brought price to 125.00.

joJniSAzRHrgSrBJrtB6Qw.text: Designed for family style dining. If you are a party of two order only one dish 'entree' because the portions are quite large. But I must say that for a place that serves large numbers, the food quality was really great. Quite tasty and our waiter was very attentive. I'm ready to go back now.

sCxoYxoKwoZvTYAOiDovGg.text: Came here during Happy Hour after a long treacherous walk on the Strip and needed a leg break. Came in by accident and never read the reviews. We sat in the bar for Happy Hours and the portions were more than enough for two hungry girls. The restaurant is family style serving and portions are big so make sure you order concisely. +=Must try the mussels, listed as an App, which were very soft and melts in your mouth. The sauce was great for dipping bread as well. Portions at Happy Hour were still very generous even for just two people to split.  The appetizers of Calamari rings were also scrumptious! -=hidden inside Caesar's Palace, quite a ways to walk to get there.

ZwyxTDW3I8RtU80IBBNCiQ.text: Great place to take a group- huge portions, everything made fresh. We had the calamari and zucchini fries, huge appetizers. We then ordered the broccoli rigatoni with white sauce- oil and garlic,not cheese. Very satisfying meal, nice refueling after shopping at forum shops. The pasta is almost al dente, just cooked enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Zucchini fries and calamari- these are just the appetizers!

vXU8PK34XYR5hXN83iejkw.text: Authentic Italian food. Tasted just like the one in NYC. Would highly recommend this spot.

cw-8v6zAY_fQWLShofhw4A.text: This place was great!! It was recommended to us by a friend but when we looked at the menu online we realized it was family style and plates were enough to feed large groups. Almost decided not to stop by because it was just me and my husband and there was no way we could eat that much food. Walked by there on a Wednesday around noon and my husband decided to ask about the menu. Turns out they told us we could eat from the bar menu and sit at a regular table. Bar menu has smaller options for 2 people. Since we were planning on trying out other eateries while in town we decided to just get the penne alla vodka which menu said was enough for two. They brought out a bread basket with a variety of breads as well. Being that I'm currently pregnant I ordered a non-alcoholic cocktail, Pineapple Mule. It was probably the best non-alcoholic drink I have ever had!!! It had fresh pineapple muddled in the drink! I will likely be back just for that! The pasta was delicious and my husband and I devoured it! We ended up leaving stuffed even though we were trying not to eat too much. The size would have been good for three people, especially if you try other things. The other thing I should add is that the waiter was great and friendly and really knew the menu well. The other staff filling water glasses, husbands wine glass, bringing bread were all great as well!! I will definitely be back to try other things!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pineapple mule! Probably the best non-alcoholic drink ever,!!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne alla vodka

GqPxIVkGeLQl073bZKgDQA.text: Bad service, our server ended up talking to his coworker while we been done and wasn't attentive or checked on. Food portion was hella big, great for groups and sharing. Food wise was a bit tasty but I wouldn't come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Server talking stories!

rfHmpoqMbl9aTKaGY8cEew.text: We had walked by Carmine's the day before and decided to give it a try. It is a family style restaurant. The portion are large enough for 3-4 people. We had the fried calamari and garlic bread parmigiana for appetizers, both were excellent. Our main course was chicken parmigiana with pasta which was very good. We had no room for desert. The waitress and staff were very friendly and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. AMAZING FOOD

vHq-IV-DadzZyp9GNw8jRg.text: We have eaten here about 10 times already. Taken big groups with us each time knowing how much food we always get and the high quality of food. Until last night when we were very disappointed. We order the calamari , broccoli and the LOBSTER FRA DIABLO. the price on the menu was set to MP which means they can charge whatever they feel like. Too many possibilities with that but we accepted it. When the meal arrived it looked to be amazing and very promising. See pictures. But once we started to dig into it we found that for $139.95 we have very little Lobster and looked to us like the tail of the lobster was cut off and we had only been provided literally the tail end of the tail where most of the lobster meat resides. For the amount of meat we received this was very grossly misleading especially with the cost. There were no where close to enough clams and muscles. Overall I have to say this was a a HUGE disappointment to us all.   That will be the last time I can tell you we come here and pay over $260 for dinner and feel like we got raped.!!!  Buyer beware. !!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Z0rhNlFB5jkovIK54dHfRA.text: This place was just awkward! We couldn't wait to leave!   So we only sat down here because of the happy hour sign and we wanted some food.  But guess what...happy hour does not apply to those of us who are seated at a table and will be eating. Huh? Say again? Yet you let us bring our 32 OZ yard cups full of booze from outside and we are sitting here drinking those...but I can't participate in YOUR happy hour?  The waiter...Mr. Personality 2015! NOT. I could have had better service from a log. Quicker too.  We ordered the big multi-appetizer thing.  It had some fried raviolis, some muscles, some sausage, some gross cheese thing that was sweet. Not impressed. Especially for the price.  Again back to the waiter. The guy was horrible. That on top of the happy hour ordeal and the food - Carmine's will only get the mandatory 1 star from me. I do not give out 1 stars lightly, this is maybe my 2nd or 3rd?  That pretty much tells you our experience at this place.  Wish we hadn't have wasted the time during our 4 day stay in Vegas. So many places where our time and money could have been better spent.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wasn&#39;t too pleased.

ym2NnGoRhTyvNfS_nqVcLA.text: excellent restaurant good was good service above average Highly recommend

Uq-7fJvjMvi_vlvn36Vp0w.text: It was almost 2 days a go we stop there with my 1 year baby ,but we waiting almost 1 hr after that they serve us with bad attitude,food and service was horrible I don't recommend anyone going there waiting time and money .  We ordered sushi with pasta ,but the food look like soup and doesn't have good test .

0dF_T2gz3n7aACO3C0FkFg.text: This place is family dinning, so go with a group! Portions are very large. The aroma from outside pulled us in. We ordered from the bar as it has a much smaller menu and portions were much smaller. We started with a Ceasar salad very tasty but a bit more dressing than I prefer. Then some calamari and meatball sliders. Both were very good and fresh! Try this place if you go to Vegas!

9W34YVr1An2J3-651rE2LA.text: Wow! This is THE place for groups! Hands down! Need somewhere to go with 15 people in a pinch... Here is the place. It is just absolutely enormous, and beautiful to boot. We were given a private tour of the place and I couldn't believe all the rooms that this place had!   We were here last night so it was also nice to see some of the beautiful Holiday  decorations that were up.   Since it was only the two of us the manager (Jesse) recommended a sampler platter. I forget the name but it had everything, and it was more than enough. (This place is used to catering to larger groups, and family style dinners, it can get quite hard to order for just two people, recommend splitting everything.) The favorite on this dish were the baked calms, absolutely amazing! The least favorite of mine was the cheese ravioli, I thought it was just a bit over cooked. Other items in this dish is sausage and peppers, fried polenta (soo delicious and unique!), mussels, eggplant, stuffed mushrooms and calzones. We also ordered a couple of medium carafes of wine which was perfect.  The manager (Jesse) guided us through the entire menu including our wine selections and everything turned out more than amazing! It was so nice to see a manger take pride in his work, not to mention his striking well groomed appearance! We will definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The platter we shared between the two of us.

Bn9FciA8fx_L20tniDNQlA.text: Stopped by on a Sunday night, close to closing time (big mistake) ... Waiter seemed annoyed, we ordered penne Bolognese ... They brought bread ... Chucked it on the table as they walked by ... Went to the bar and asked for balsamic vinegar and olive oil ... Annoyed waiter brought it to us without a plate to put it on ... Got the pasta ... No mention of parmesan ... No mention of drinks or wine ... Went back to the bar ... Couldn't get anybody's attention ... Finally asked for two house reds and parmesan ... Nobody checked in on our dinner ... WTF?!  Girlfriend's birthday dinner, and this is how they roll? Zero tip.

kfio20yPqtdynSr8oSaG6A.text: Horrible place !!!! They have no menus at the table , servers messed up our order twice , food arrived cold , server wasn't friendly , a nightmare !!!!  Really did not enjoy this place to say the least !!!

Ag56kgD7vkeQ0LCJcsj17A.text: So I need to write a follow up review that is long overdue since my first visit back in 2013. I was back here in May of 2016 and not because I wanted to, but because I had clients that happened to enjoy this restaurant because their children love the calamari here.   I didn't interact too much with the hostesses because my party was already sitting down.  I can tell I was dealing with a whole new group of host and hostesses! This was already a plus since I had an issue with their attitude. And this was just by them greeting and welcoming me in the restaurant!   I was quite impressed with our waitress; very attentive and was always checking up on us. The drinks were generous pours (I was drinking whiskey on the rocks) and my clients were having wine.  The kids loved the calamari and the food was good!  I only had one calamari tentacle and one bite of the lasagna.  I was not hungry at all that evening but I can tell from one amuse bouche size bite was sufficient enough for me to count it as an okay place to come.  The food however is heavily catered to an American palette.    I would love to give this property five stars just for the service that I got from this specific waitress, however I use this place for catering during the holidays and I can't seem to shake off the inconsistency in miscommunication when ordering via email or phone. However, great improvement since they opened.

XB5-BfotPAy-GQr9KQDYnQ.text: Fabulous place for a group dinner! I was able to make a reservation via opentable for my bachelorette party of 13 with no problem. I had been to the restaurant in NY so I knew the portions were good size. They were very nice to us and accommodating! Only bad thing is we ordered 2 salads, 2 other apps and 6 entrees which was WAY WAY WAY too much food. We could have all split one salad and maybe 3 entrees tops. All things considered, the meal was an incredible amount of food for the cost.  I docked a star because the waiter should have told us not to order so much food and it would have been way less money per person. Overall, I would def say thing place is great for groups. Big bang for your buck.

vGnJPcmCa1A41bS-iPDw0A.text: Great place for lovers of Italian food. Prices are built in a way for sharing with a group, many of the pastas ranged around 36-40$. Most plates of pasta can be finished by 2-3 people. Meat portions were big although the veal was very thin. We went with 6 people and were pleasantly stuffed at the end. Coffees/espressos weren't the best, but the food was good.

0batsr4IG3fU6s8-cs7NYg.text: Just sat at the bar for over 15 minutes was never acknowledged and it was not busy...walked right out. When you have an endless amount of dining options right around the corner it's important to provide excellent and consistent customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Would give them 0 stars if I could.

I-2YXdsHUBW9Nh6DkowhLA.text: Overall was a great experience ! 4 of us shared the spicy chicken wings, penne vodka, and shrimp scampi . The food was very good the service was impeccable Michael Baker made the night for us and the food was a plus!  Great ambience, good bar, and comfortable seating. Absolutely good for date night and Fantastic for families, or any occasion!  For locals is worth the drive , Ceasars Forum valet does not charge to park ! Definitely going back to try out the menu!

exDzoMjz6tiMHSL_xLZKew.text: Nice place BUT the food is regular, not good. Just like Olive Garden kind of food.  Not worth the price at all.

6YGufhSOIiOdbSvYFfD13g.text: We had a great time here tonight. It was my daughters birthday and we decided to have her birthday dinner party here and it was so amazing. We had a waiter named Mike, great entertainer, kept all the girls laughing and singing so fun. And don't want to forget to mention about the food, excellent. My only very small complaint, drinks were very slow both cocktails and normal drinks.  But overall great time and will come back for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nr3GgSGH84PqbJytF_sJdA.text: The food here is delicious. We ate here several times on our trip. The Caesar salad, spaghetti, and lasagna are awesome. The prices are pretty good too. It looks expensive, but when each plate serves 4-5 people it actually breaks down to be pretty cheap. The smell while walking around the forum shops drew us in. Only thing I don't like is that they wouldn't let us add chicken to our Caesar salad. Waitress told us we would have to order a separate chicken dish, which doesn't make sense. Although you can add chicken to Caesar salads if you sit in the bar area where portions feed 2-3. I also would like the option to order single portions, and not only family style.

l7RWja0RkTKtO2HIMVxBxQ.text: Went on a Monday for lunch and sat at the bar. Bartender was very nice but sick...manager should have sent her home! Had the meatball here and it was huge but juts warm and not hit and cheese not totally melted. For those prices you just can't give huge portions food needs to be quality too!

hkUy0Z_r4IQNgG6LIz7ekQ.text: This place is NOT FOR COUPLES. This restaurant is designed for families or at least a group of four. Each dish is a little less than $30. The pasta comes in large plates and is shared so everyone has to agree to the pasta ordered. The salads are large and meant to be shared as well. The food is ok. The pasta was not el dente. We had veggie angel hair pasta in a cream tomato sauce. It was acceptable but nothing special. The one plus was our waiter Michael. He was attentive and pleasant.

HEw56E0_w_AnpQEOF6gENA.text: Disappointing service and food was below average.  Stopped here because I have the cookbook and I like the recipes. There were less than 10 people in restaurant and food was slow. It was a late lunch. Beef Bolognese tasted like some had burnt on the bottom of pan. Also did not seem like it was cooked low and slow.  Bread was ice cold and not good.   I would not go back.

j9H8SEtHPQrNP6yEgmZ7fw.text: Stumbled upon this restaurant with my boyfriend and the hosts suggested we sit in the bar because of the bar specials!!! We ordered vodka penne and we LOVED it!!!!! HUGE portions even when you order the smaller sized platter at the bar!! The bread basket was amazing as well with the wine! We just wish the bread was warm, but hey I still ate the whole basket..still amazing!!  We live in California and want to go back just to eat here again!!!

nO0bcEnfr_TUGxxeLv3Scw.text: Had a great experience here. Walked in during a holiday weekend with no reservation and a party of 14. We were greeted warmly and got seated right away with no wait! Our server Joey was kind and accommodating even though we had 5 kids with us and were constantly getting up to attend to one of them. Love the family style meals, as this suits our family perfectly. We ordered fried calamari and Caesar salad for apps, prime rib chops special and rigatoni sausage and broccoli country style for entrees, and tiramisu. I also got a red sangria. Despite dishes being so large, we did not wait long for food, a couple of people in our party waited a while for drinks. None of the food disappointed. My mom seemed to have a great birthday meal. The only thing I would recommend for them is to put bigger lady fingers in their tiramisu and to not let people stand near other people's tables to look at the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s tiramisu down there. Tasty as well, but wish it had bigger lady fingers in it.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime rib chops special and rigatoni sausage broccoli country style. So tasty!

0Jsgaw6aW_IUKRLsVdJEHg.text: This location is in the Forum Shops down toward the Mirage.  We made a reservation, but arrived early and there was no problem seating us before our time.  The staff was very helpful in letting us know when they thought we had ordered too much for two people - they could have just let us over-order, so we appreciated that. We had a salad and the veal parmesan (for the two of us) and it could have easily fed 4-5 adults.  We will certainly add Carmine's to our list of restaurants in Las Vegas to visit again, but will try to bring a few more people with us to get a better value for our money. The food was delicious!

kzcLm4LDLz8gP4vj2O4nnw.text: A big disappointment. My brother and I went here to see if they are as good as they claim. Nah. Go somewhere else. They say they serve large family style portions to feed at least 4 hungry people, Italian "generous family" style. We ordered the Spaghetti Bolognese, about $38, and while it came on a big plate, there obviously was not enough pasta. So after two small portions each, we were left hanging. There was still some meat sauce, so we asked if we can just get some more spaghetti. The waiter said the manager said it will be $12.50 more. Since we were unsatisfied, we had to bite the bullet and order it. But I felt ripped off. If they had given enough pasta to begin with, there would not have been this problem. My brother and I always eat at Buca di Beppo and we never ever had this problem. And, my big complaint is pasta is cheap. In my opinion their True hospitality and good business sense to make the customer happy would have been to just give us the extra portion of pasta just to be satisfied, as opposed to being reamed. PASTA IS CHEAP. Or, if they wanted to charge, max. should have been $6.  The waiter was also not a very pleasant guy. He was always hurrying, he had no genuine interest, he was perfunctory. Proof: we had to ask for bread. We had to ask for the olive oil and balsamic vinegar to dip the bread. And though we still had not finished the bread, he swoops away the olive oil and vinegar. We had to ask for it back.  Finally, this place is really a joke. When you call a place LEGENDARY, it's reputation is vaunted, by its length of it in business, at least, arbitrarily, around 30 years; it has served actual LEGENDS, this being Vegas, it should have served and has documented patronage by Sinatra, Elvis, etc. And to be a legend, it really should be respected and renown; Carmine's IS A LEGEND IN THEIR OWN MIND, ONLY. Look at their sign: ESTABLISHED 1990. THAT IS HARDLY A LEGEND. Overstated, just tooting their own horn, with nothing to back it up. With all the great Italian restaurants here in Vegas I am sorry we even went here. Appropriate descriptions would have been "Famous Italian food", or "Celebrated Italian Cuisine". LEGEND? Since only 1990? Have you noticed True legendary places? Vacheron watches, depuis (since) 1755. So give me an effing break Carmine's.  I also politely told them there, and through their comment place, at their website, of my utter disappointment. No reply. In other words, they don't really care about customer service. All they want is $$$$. This place may go on for a while due to foot traffic. But you can rest assured I DO NOT AND WILL NOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE AT ALL. I'd rather go to Buca or the many other fine Italian restaurants here in Vegas.

27gpozGGMWgBgU4zXMsG4w.text: We had a great time Carl was awesome scenery great and menu also outstanding-enough food for 4 more. A credit to the NY location.

2b9E4XXnP-JxwTxIP-eUAA.text: There were just too many things about my dinner that I didn't like - from subpar food to surly service.   The style of Carmine's itself may appeal to some people, perhaps large families, but for me much of it seemed contrived by some "idea man" that wants a gimmick and sets that as a higher priority than anything else. To start,. three of us were seated and given two menus.  When I asked for another my server explained (with a little too much exasperation, as though this happens too many times) that the restaurant is family style and there are menus on the wall, so they only give every other person a menu.  When I just smiled, she gave me a menu.  Thank you. The menu didn't have descriptions below the items.  I love Italian food and can be equally happy with authentic Italian or with Americanized Italian food.  But some of the dishes, like Chicken Scarpariello, I am not familiar with.  If you purposely print a menu designed to make your customers ask for details, then employ servers that are friendly and willing to describe things.   Family style dining isn't a bad idea, but what happens when the salads are $23 and only 2 of the 3 people are in the mood for salad?  Well, my friend, you are out of luck.  The salad is easily large enough to serve 7 people and is piled so high on the plate that when the food runner plates it up for you several pieces fall all over the table.  You could splurge and just order far more than you could eat, or somebody gets shorted. Main courses were also easily able to feed 6 people or so.  We tried the pasta special of 4 pastas on a platter.  They were all very mediocre.  In fact nothing stood out as being even marginally better than something I could buy frozen at Trader Joe's and reheat in my microwave.   We shared a bottle of wine and here the server actually anticipated a problem that probably occurs often.  Apparently their wine glasses are the same as their water glasses - a very small juice glass.  She warned us of this as soon as we ordered and offered to bring stemware. Yes, please.  The wine was nice, but BIG PET PEEVE: Some wines need decanting.  If you are too casual of a restaurant to do this, fine.  Just don't sell wines that need decanting!!  Do you know how unpleasant it is to be caught up in conversation only to take a final sip of wine and fill your mouth with sediment???? UGH! And, since I am on a roll...why use water glasses that are so tiny?  Whoever made that decision should have realized that directly corresponds to needing more staff available to refill.  Nope, in reality it means sitting without water for a good part of the meal.  Hello, it's a desert out there! Dessert choices were confusing.  Again, no descriptions on the menu and now no prices.  This I really do not like.  Why wouldn't you have prices??  Oh, someone's brilliant idea of forcing our surly server to have to explain.  Well, this one you can order 2 or 4, but this one is only one size and big enough for 6 and this one is sold individually....Seriously?  Why make it so confusing?  Even with all of that disappointment, I would have considered at least one more star if there was even anything in our copious leftovers that I would have bothered taking home to reheat.  Nope, it was all blah.  Even the bread was ick.  Big Italian sin in my book.

4AaQutgVr8H5OOxM8zfxbA.text: Wow is all can say about both the food (quality, presentation and portion size) and the service (Make sure to ask for Angelo!)  We started with the chef antipasto platter which yielded many flavorful Italian classics.  Simply a joy for your taste buds.  Angelo was a very knowledgeable server making excellent recommendations and served a small portion of each meal making sure each diner had a sample of everything that was ordered.  After all, Carmine's is family style dining!  It is a long meal so make sure you have good company and plenty of topics to discuss but your mouth will be full most of the time savoring each delicious bite!  Along with the server, bussers are attentive refilling water, dropping off dishes or clearing the table.  I would tell you to save room for dessert but I think that may be an impossible task!  Next visit might be for dessert only! Great Job to the entire team at Carmine's...give the cooks a kiss from me.

RrDTDv89KP9HvzB2wHiUfw.text: Mostly love the idea. Great memories of food and drink in NYC. This one in Vegas lacks that but food and service was good, not great.

mzvrfr4hrJo_rDS67eT3ig.text: Still craving the ceasar salad.  Had penne ala vodka and chicken parm.  True family style large portion meal.  Server was great.  The mango mojito was worth the trip.  Definitely will go to Carmine's in NY now

Gthg2g4kFlIGPoRtfLlPKQ.text: Excellent food!! You will not be disappointed. We have been trying to find the best place to eat in Vegas and I think we found it! Can't wait to go back!

XgCp9FKUq-T0oAxYaNWCUQ.text: One of my fav spots in Los Vegas! You could never go wrong with the spaghetti meatball! Portions are family style so $100 took care of 6 people!!

3bWSgYdjRuG34JXNJ9rWyg.text: The best Italian ever! I ordered Caprese salad which is not on the menu and it was amazing! I also had the Shrimp da Viagioli...it was so spicy and delicious!! The plates are enormous family style!

esgIpjmThbvWFjYgGswMIw.text: To start off, I don't like that you have to look at menu boards on the walls, no physical menu. Definitely a family dining experience, not good for just 2 people. Service was poor. Food was ok

_OXvsaS5wXi1trIgxg7oQg.text: This was our wedding anniversary and we came here after seeing the Rod Stewart show at Caesars Palace. We weren't sure what to order and asked for suggestions from the manager, Brett Bode. Even though the restaurant was packed, he took his time with us, and explained the features of several menu items, to which we were very impressed. We had a wonderful dinner with a huge salad, shrimp scampi, and penne pasta with vodka sauce. All the portions are huge and served family style. Our server Kyle was very attentive and provided exceptional service. We ended the dinner with a fabulous ice cream dessert and cappuccino. We will definitely be back.

dz5-lQIlVyy7BTfDgvoHgQ.text: My wife and I were seated between 2 other couples who had just ordered before us. One ordered calamari and the other couple ordered caprisi salad as apperizers. We didnt order an appy because the portion sizes are MASSIVE. When there appy areived they were huge too. They actually offered us some of theirs too. So we tried both the calamari and the salad. They were the BEST i have ever had. We were both stuffed from what we got from our neighbours. Then the spaghetti and meat sauce came and it was the best we ever had. And i eat spaghetti and meat sauce every where. This place is awesome.

WXzdGWilpRrbWj1-gOzpOQ.text: I love the food here! Love it. We sat at the bar and got a smaller portion, which was still enormous. Meat sauce and penne, with cesar salad. I felt like the server was intentionally annoyed with us because we were not drinking enough or spending enough for his liking. I found that a little bit rude and icky. For Vegas, it's perfect.

F_jCjnjiwB4vkHGjIHuHcQ.text: When I heard this restaurant had opened in Caesar's palace I was SO excited!!   I loved eating there in NYC and now it would be a little closer!   The EGGPLANT PARMIGIANA and Spaghetti with meatballs are my absolute favorite!  I love that everything is family style and there is such a large amount of food to share.   The service, ambience, and food are all stellar in my book!   I love coming here whether it is in Vegas or NYC!

D0682jw-O9uly-lmQX_llw.text: In my previous life as an East Coaster, I used to go to the NY location. When I saw they had a place in Vegas, I was intrigued but never went until this past Saturday night. It was great. With the family style dining, it is super reasonable as far as price goes. We ordered Caesar salad, Calamari, Spaghetti and Meatballs and Chicken Contadina. Everything was perfect. Exceeded expectations. Chicken Contadina was my favorite from many years ago and it was as great as I remembered. Great stuff.

PM11VuEbMEpjXUEh-2OBPw.text: Loooooove this place ! Stopped in here tonight for my birthday dinner with my wife and I gotta say, Carmine's didn't disappoint. **please keep in mind that Carmine's is set up as family style dishes and everything else is a la carte. My wife and I made the mistake of ordering garlic/mozzarella bread as an appetizer and was given an enormous portion that could've fed a small village! For our main dish we ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. The meatballs were probably the best I've EVER eaten, and their marinara sauce wasn't too shabby either.   The food runners were fantastic and the hostesses were super helpful and friendly! The ONLY not so positive was our server. She was polite and friendly at first, but towards the end of our meal it felt like she was trying to rush us out of there. The restaurant wasn't even close to full and there wasn't a wait so I didn't understand what the rush was for? Oh well.. Overall, our experience was amazing and we will DEFINITELY come back when we are in Vegas in March. To my foodies out there, make it a point to stop by here, but make sure you come with more than 2 people or you will have a ton of leftovers. TWO THUMBS UP for Carmine's!

Wrcs9lGJkXEiT11BPZvASQ.text: Bad service, No one came to the table after 10-15 minutes waiting. The restaurant was not full and still not enough people working.  Do not recommend at all. Plenty of other great restaurants in the area.

Np5RT0_LYQN2e8D9I0CNgA.text: Great service and food. The portions are NO JOKE. They don't play when it comes to getting you stuffed. You'll definitely have some leftovers to take home for later! Must have when in Vegas.

zZy-RsbjtSLd-eacODqbxw.text: I've visited Carmine's in Atlantic City, NJ and honestly my experience was far better here in Vegas. Customer Service is quick and the quality of the food was much better. This is your white table cloth traditional family style Italian restaurant.   By Family style we're talking about extended family! HUMONGOUS portions delivered to your table to feast on. A menu filled with a plethora of pasta, salad, meat and dessert dishes are displayed on the wall of the restaurant for patrons to choose from. My party of 4 opted for the famous Jumbo Shrimp Parmesan and spaghetti. This meal was perfect. Pasta was cooked to perfection and THE SHRIMP! I don't even like shrimp. The shrimp were HUGE, fresh, and succulent.. Lightly breaded to give it a crisp texture. Not overly cheesy or salty. Our party could hardly finish the platter after over indulging in the bread basket.   If you are traveling with family or a group make this your 1st dinner destination.  This is a deliciously cost effective way to dine.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jumbo shrimp parm

jy0gTjAvsAWwxPHJX3LErg.text: Excellent and every-time I am in Vegas I must have the wings... typically my first stop when I land.

SgxiS6QFuxGJfIRgSEUyUA.text: Very good service but food quality was less than desired based on several recommendations. We had the rigatoni with sausage and broccoli. The pasta was not aldente and the sause very salty. The eggplant appetizer was above average. We drank the house wine and the Chianti was surprisingly tasty and affordable.

hMX_wYYv5hJiWQ3ymtt4KA.text: We came here for dinner and it was very nice but quite expensive. It's family style though so if everyone wants the same food then not so bad for cost. You need your glasses to read the menu because it's on the wall. The food was ok. Not fantastic nor terrible. Nice atmosphere c

o25uEdvNI8bc4UEyrUOxgw.text: Have to say the entire evening was a real downer. Went with a party of 5 to celebrate my Sons 21st Birthday. Service was horrible. Our waiter ignored us the entire evening. Never once checking in during meal. Waited 20 minutes to have him clear table and offer dessert. Spoke to manager about the experience and he just looked at me and didn't say one word. Not an apology or we will try to do better next time. Coming from the restaurant industry I have never experienced such poor customer service. Will never return.

kghDHh5QgD3JlqDYtKAS2g.text: Aloha, Carmine's is a classy bar/restaurant traditional design with heavy dark woods, nice.  We sat at the bar for a quick cocktail before meeting the group - really good happy hour prices and great calamari to go with, yum!  Would love to come back for dinner.

UlmJFfvi6qhHlnuIHxo4Yw.text: We come to Vegas 2 times a month and we always have dinner at Carmine's every time,tonight was so off,the waitress we had was the worse waitress we ever saw our table was a party of 10 , it took her 20 min to get our water which didn't come to the table we had to grab it and serve our selves, the other waiter that wasn't our server was more help then her , after everything we asked to see the manager he comes out saying he has a great staff and if we had said something earlier to him, we'll we didn't want anything off our bill,just an acknowledgement that he's aware,so he gives a half ass sorry,I can't believe how he conducts  his staff but that's what you would expect from a shitty manager anyway he doesn't know how to run an establishment like Carmine's that's why the waitress is what she is , we will never eat at this restaurant again.

OxiXi_4fd-nyU_IWg258Ng.text: Went here for dinner with my husband and a group of colleagues from his conference. We were split - some vegetarians and some meat eaters. We ended up getting a bunch of dishes, my choices being the veggie dishes of portobello parmigiana and the eggplant parmigiana. OH MY GOODNESS. Obviously as a vegetarian I loved it, but even my husband who is a big meat eater said he liked the eggplant better than the chicken parm! I seriously dream about that portobello parm, with its crispy breading, fresh mozzarella and delicious tomato sauce!

BeXyoEuL2DMX0DxsuPE2CQ.text: I've been to the Carmine's in NYC many many years ago, and more recently to this Las Vegas location. I have also have come to learn that the Chicago Carmine's has no relation to either of these which may be the reason I don't seem to care of Carmine's in Chicago... yet I digress. Carmine's Las Vegas can be best described by three words: large, hearty, Italian.  We ended up here with a huge group of friends a couple months back when in Las Vegas and of course did everything family style. They serve all the Italian classics you can possibly dream of and are not shy at all with the portions. My favorite was the rigatoni! Their red sauce has that nice deep and rich flavor to it. Yums!  Anyways, would highly recommend making reservations ahead of time as it does seem to be quite the popular spot. No issues with the service here. Very prompt to grab you another drink and refill your waters, which is always appreciated when you find yourself drinking on and off the entire weekend in Vegas. I'll have to say its definitely a bit on the pricier side of the spectrum, but with the large portions you'll definitely have leftovers to take home. So all in all you do seem to get what you paid for.  Not sure I got much else on this one. 'Til next time, cheers!  100/365

yA3buDv19yW4G3Rv9ljx0A.text: I don't know why they put my group all the way in the back but the server we had was very accommodating. I believe his name is Daniel?   In any case, the portions are huge. They're legitimately family sizes and I suggest ordering only three items if you're five in a group or two items if your group doesn't eat a lot. We had the calamari, lasagna, and the shrimp pasta with red sauce and angel hair, and a Cesar salad; we didn't finish any of it.   The salad and calamari were decent and I had more of the salad than I should because it was so cheesy and the dressing was just so tasty. The shrimp pasta just had a simple red sauce but it was satisfying. According to my mom and sister, the lasagna was meaty and also very tasty.   Overall, we had a satisfying meal and our server was very attentive. Also, shout out to one of the cute waiters out there, kinda looked like John Oliver from afar LOL!

7sBrdB9IOPACg-F63NiGCg.text: I don't know what the hype is about this place. The lasagna had no flavor . I agree with one yelper, a high priced bucco di pepo.

pYHwVBo1JONKBxLqQFy60g.text: No words describe my amazing experience I had in this restaurant,, I'm traveling all way far from Saudi Arabia to visit this restaurant each time I can ,, the only disappointment I had the orders was too big and you guys had to share it's really big and delicious

AWb-Vtd-DJC2Om2IM-NMDA.text: Excellent for family dining and team building.  The food is delicious and the staff are welcoming and hospitable. Bring a crowd and an appetite.

4p3A0ldShTS_6e6vB3EezQ.text: My parents and I were shopping and stopped here during happy hour. The food was great and we got great service from Joe at the bar. He was very friendly and talked about wine with me dad. Definitely a do-over the next time we're in Vegas!

QZSurbUOxG5eP5QOFi5lgg.text: Great food but you better bring lots of friends to help! All the food is family size and more than two people can eat. Funky menu on the side wall only, no hand held menus, what's that about

mq3ouK3ou58q2dSJwKjjtw.text: Chandler displayed excellent customer service. He was a lot better than the server we had. Great Customer service is always appreciated. Hopefully the skies the limit with your company.  Thanks again for your wonderful customer service service Chanler!

4WFa46dYs_6wV0g5AUK9lA.text: As always, great food and wine!  The atmosphere is so charming with a lil Vegas flair!  The food portions are family style with every bite deliciously prepared. The shrimp parmigiana is my fave with linguini. I also recommend 'patio' seating...you can dine and sip well while people watching.
