fMqV2waXiZisvhjT7QFmlw.text: My first time and the food was very good. HUGE portions and I'm a big man! The feel was old Chicago or Brooklyn. The  and the size of the shrimp inside the dish brought a smile to my face.  Happy Hour drinks 6 dollars and I had a mix green salad.

tAdiVns4fPQ-MSS3xYC4YQ.text: It was our first time in tonight. Host was sweet and recommended that we eat at the bar because my wife is pregnant and wasn't super hungry for those crazy large, family style dishes (though they looked awesome). Ravioli was good and the atmosphere seems fun, but the young boy who served us in the bar didn't treat us very well. He socialized with all the tables around us, but blatantly ignored my wife and I. He never brought water, never brought bread, never checked in on our food, and didn't offer us dessert. It was bizarre. Not sure what rubbed him the wrong way, maybe the smaller ticket on our table? It was obvious and pretty uncomfortable. It's the only poor service we had on our trip. Won't be back.

LpRYLukW4Yc8jzMJTRo8WQ.text: Excellent..Excellent..Excellent.  I was ecstatic to see a Carmine's in Las Vegas.  Inside is identically decorated to match NYC.  If you've been to Carmine's and miss NY you will not be disappointed.

dV65FVsX6MctZZr2K0gMfg.text: Made a quick stopped for happy hour to take a break from shopping. My friend and I had a great time by the bar. Everyone was friendly and helpful.  We had a few cocktails and small plates at very reasonable prices. Everything was good. I truly enjoyed my Campari Spritz.   The restaurant is very cute and gives you a feel of Italy. Nice atmosphere and great location in the middle of many nice stores. Good times!

ZCLruix3_pN6gVXo9D4P-g.text: This has quickly become one of my favorite spots in Vegas. Located in the Forum Shops, it's very convenient when staying at Caesars Palace. The staff is always extremely friendly, quick & attentive. I've sat in the bar each of the 4 times I've visited. I believe that's where they have smaller portions & the other seating is family style if I remember correctly. I've had manicotti & cheese ravioli, both of which are beyond delicious. But can we please talk about the bread? I mean, it's the best bread I've ever had! It comes in a variety basket with oil, vinegar & fresh grated Parmesan. There's a specific piece of bread that has sort of a tomato crust that I could literally eat 20 pieces of! I've seen the manager in action and he is on top of things. I appreciate the great service and yummy food! Can't wait to come back!

1EzKZMTyRqQOWE8nOyuGPw.text: Wow!  We came for a big family Christmas Eve dinner and we were told not to eat all day so we would have room... man he wasn't kidding!  To say the food was amazing is an understatement.  This is a family style service so the portions are huge. You need to come up with a plan before hand because there is no individual sizes that I saw.   We ordered the Caesar salad, baked clams and Calamari for appetizers. We ordered the special chicken dish, the Chicken  Parm and angel hair pasta with meatballs.   Way too much food for 8 people but all so delicious.  We finished the night with The Titanic dessert... OMG is all I can say.  This was an expensive meal but so worth it... it is an experience with incredible food!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The chicken special... Chicken Romano?  It was everyone&#39;s favorite
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Titanic!  No words can describe this.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angel Hair pasta with meatballs.... amazing

HKi_Wx8nDpfHXFp7RPN1Iw.text: A group of us came to Carmine's to celebrate, as many of the guests were visiting from Hawaii.   We ordered family-style for the table since the portions are very huge. We ordered the Portobello mushroom appetizer, which was fantastic. I highly recommend this dish, if you eat at this restaurant.   We also ordered a few pasta dishes, including two orders of each of the spaghetti & meatballs and the penne pasta with marinara. The spaghetti & meatballs were good. Nothing particularly special, but it was still satisfying. This review is mainly for the penne pasta. We ordered two orders of the penne pasta. One was good. The other, though, was terrible. The pasta was practically crunchy still. We told the waitress, and she called over her manager. He said that, "We were just American and pasta is supposed to be like that in Italy". He took it and had it remade. The same thing happened. It was under-cooked. We called over the manager again and told him. Again, he told us that we just didn't know how pasta was supposed to be. I have many friends who are from Italy, so I texted them. They all said that our dish was under-cooked. I really do not recommend any of their penne dishes. Everything else seemed good.   I was disappointed in the service, especially the remarks about us not knowing what pasta is supposed to be like because "we are American," which was even more mind-boggling because he was American too. Anyway, I do not recommend the penne. See attached photos for pictures of the pasta.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Under-cooked penne pasta (Dish 1 - Remake) Still Under-cooked.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Under-cooked penne pasta (Dish 1)

LbjKmaz-ZBUQ_kA-ur8BhA.text: Tried Carmine's in Las Vegas for the first time yesterday evening. After reading all the rave reviews we had high expectations. As others have noted, food is served family style and are very large (and somewhat pricey) portions.   Ordered Caesar's Salad, Spaghetti with Meatballs, and Chicken Scarpariello for our party of four. Also had beer, red wine, and Sangria.   The food was quite disappointing. Extremely average and pedestrian. While many have complimented the Caesar's Salad as being garlicky and tasty, ours was somewhat dry and bland. The Spaghetti and Chicken were also very average.   Truthfully, a member of our party correctly commented that we could have had superior food at half the price by going to Buca Di Beppo. I would not recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt

mHQG05KzRH23yXQJ0IQLTQ.text: Went here for my birthday dinner in nyc and decided to go to the one in Vegas because it was so good. I got the banana drink, it was soo good but a little pricey for the amount you get. The portions looked like they were bigger lol. Got the lasagna, and the stuffed mushrooms. The mushrooms were so creamy in the middle we almost ordered more. Our waiter was super nice.

ALBPz8r7TnUyxoVcPtJCTQ.text: We were looking for a last minute group dinner at our last night in Vegas, and we really wanted to go to Buddy V's. But, their online reservation said that they were all booked, and they did NOT pick up their phone!! How rude!   Well, Carmine's to the rescue!  I was able to book a table for 7 via Opentable and we were haangry!   The restaurant is located inside of The Forum Shops at Caesars, so it's a bit hard to find.  It's also VERY loud inside the restaurant, and our big table had a hard time conversing.  Yet, the service was friendly and the food was outstanding!!!!  We started with the Carmine's salad which had loads of veggies and cold cuts, and the Clams on the Half-shell were so fresh and only $20!  We also got their Shrimp Scampi with Angel Hair and Balognese with  Linguine. We ended with the Chocolate Torta which is a flourless chocolate cake, and even though we were all stuffed, we ate that whole thing up!    We heard that Carmine's was like Buca di Beppos, but the Carmine's food was 10X better than Buca with regards to quality and taste. We all said that we were definitely coming back the next time we were in Vegas!   Just know that it's a family style restaurant, so the food portions are huge (meant to be shared) and it's loud (family gathering).

w_c5Sl5NiBhVbHe711LQ_g.text: If you're a party of less than 4, i don't recommend coming here! I was aware that the portions are family style but my gosh they are huge! The prices are fair for the portions which is a plus, but it's difficult to finish and everything was really salty.  The service was fantastic, no complaints there. The drinks were too sweet, i couldn't enjoy any of them.   I wouldn't come back but i guess if its your first time it could be a nice experience.

F6ODJP3EvLl2Q9x02FdTsQ.text: Huge portions, good pasta and complimentary bread. I don't know how "authentic" the food is but it had great flavor. Entrees and appetizers are big enough to share between at least 3 people. We got the zucchini fries (which I wouldn't recommend as the zucchini was cut to small and all you could taste was batter), and the pasta with vodka sauce (came with vegetarians so we didn't order anything with meat), which was delicious. We actually split the meal between four people and it was enough food (we also had a few beers).  Prices are actually good for the location, and Carmine's usually cost $30+ for entrees, but again the portions are huge. Definitely recommend this place if you're with a group.

e3G2lLu0_e1vdqDNbLSZ9g.text: My family and I loved the food. Ken gave us excellent service. He knew everything about the menu. Cesar salad was yummy. The portions were literally enough for us 5, per dish. The steak dish was sooo good. It had sausage and peppers, twice fried potatoes, garlic, onions and a huge delicious steak. We enjoyed eating here.

SC6hNQ_R_4P2hl9xBOUBZQ.text: Came in for an early dinner. We ordered drinks and then spaghetti and meatballs, stuffed mushrooms, and chicken picatta. Food is really delicious and served family style. The spaghetti with meatball were made to perfection.  The red sauce is light and savory. The stuffed mushrooms also were delicious! The chicken dish was so on point I wish I could have eaten it all. The strawberry shortcake was to die for. So much food just try not to over order. Staff came and sang HB to our friend, nice touch! Our waiter, Ken, is so polite and respectful of us. He cared for our table as if we were in his home. He is a gem to this establishment! Thank you Ken for your awesome service!

Most visitors do not come with a large family so the restaurant should accommodate small families for dine in. The bar is not appropriate for small group of 3 people and kids. Would not come back.

xjmB8nAInBiVOHMz47JTIA.text: Family style food was good but I was unimpressed by our waiter. He only recommended the most expensive items on the menu. For example, I asked for a red wine recommendation and he suggested one that was $155. When I said that was a bit more than I wanted to pay, he just stared at me. So I eventually said "could you recommend something at a lower price point?" He said something vague (and with distain) about how they were all decent. Just rude.

kXztsRhPY-bHw6IHN62c4g.text: I loved this place it was so tasty and the portions are great if you enjoy left overs!

CMVVnNEfW9OiIoCP2Z_o-g.text: Wow, Olive Garden quality food and wine at 2 1/2 - 3 times the price!  The Chicken Parmesan was just OK, it tasted like everyone else's except if I remember correctly it was $35.00!!! We let the waiter pick a good wine and it was so bitter neither of us finished our glasses.  Asked to see the manager and we were told he was busy...

x59G_wwprpQjT2xTjZsukA.text: Ask about their chicken scarpariello. It was fantastic. Their service was personable and responsive.  Note: when they say large portions, they mean it. One pasta can easily feed five of me's.

NjBpDaSjAW2y9taadPx_hA.text: A GREAT PLACE TO GO! I went with my family and we had an amazing time. our server was Martin and he was a excellent server, made us feel like we were at home. Food is amazing and the restaurant is beautiful. I will be returning.

yr_aSMqzXBknsbOUE6eBbQ.text: The food here is amazing!   My favorite dish is the Chicken parmigiana with the penne a la vodka. A great mix of tomatoes, garlic and herbs! (And alcohol...)   This is a family style restaurant with portions that can feed a group of 4 maybe even more, depending on how much you eat.   The service is good, but the only downfall is that they don't have a menu to give to you. The menu is on screens located on the walls of the restaurant. It is big enough to see, but if someone walks by the table you lose your sight. It's hilarious when you're looking at other people trying to read the menu. I've seen a few people sitting at the tables bob and weave through people passing by. (It's embarrassing if it was you doing it)  The atmosphere is a little loud and can get hectic sometimes, but It's a great place to try if you're looking for Italian food.  I hope this review helps!

ZY45FBlbUBpBj7x8OPbxBQ.text: Two stars for the following reasons:   1) when we walked in, the greeter was totally rude to us. Didn't even look at our faces when she talked and told us that the place is full for next two hours. When we checked Open Table, they had openings every 15 min so she was totally lying so that she didn't have to do her job that she is actually hired for.   So I was able to make a reservation within seconds that would allow us to get seated within 15 min. However we were able to find a seat at the bar which allowed us to bypass dealing with her again.   2) Food was incredibly cold! We ordered chicken parmesan and some pasta. After waiting for 20-25 min, I was expecting to be at least a little warm! Who serves cold pasta and chicken?!?!

LHl9Nzvj5oaF-5NCiaeIxw.text: Well, it's not the Carmines in New York, but it's pretty darn close. Like many New York, LA or celebrity owned restaurants in other cities, when they come into Las Vegas, sure it's the same menu they usually even look somewhat similar but there is just that "it" factor, that vibe, that's missing. One part is maybe even just the staff. When you're at Carmines in New York all of the staff has that New York attitude that is just so amazing and fun. One things that did make me really feel like I was in New York, was the fact that Carmine's is inside the Caesars Forum so there are no views of palm trees or the desert to be had. The other thing is that the place was decorated for Christmas, there's just something about Christmas in New York that is very special and inviting.    So if you are wondering around Caesars looking for somewhere to eat or craving some good ol' New York style Italian food, I highly recommend popping in to Carmines. Hey, it is Vegas after all, it's all about excess; whether that means spaghetti or slot machines!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now this is where to grab a cappuccino when shopping the Forum!

4Ao5kiVuhdg0pnV-AP0uMw.text: Hits and miss. We came here with a party of 12 after we couldn't secure a desirable time for Bacchanal. First, easy to get reservation at anytime so that's a plus but indicative of what's to come. Ambiance is great. 20+ foot ceilings wonderfully decorated for Christmas. Now the food. It was really pricey even with the large portion. Most of the dishes were over salted and the complimentary bread was COLD. It wasn't even room temperature. Asked if they could heat it up a bit and said they couldn't. You have a whole freakin kitchen back there and you can't toast bread just slightly??  Stick with Bucca. There are several around the area on and off strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8uXk-pY0KOEJaAhtRJZf6w.text: Checked out Carmines with my fellow Yelper Amar B. this Halloween. I've heard alot about this place so I was pretty excited to see what they had to offer. Carmine's occupies the former Planet Hollywood restaurant spot inside the Forum Shops. My first thoughts walking in were "wow this place is huge and empty." The restaurant is massive, vaulted ceillings, tons of pictures and sizeable bar.  The food here defintely gives 'family style" dining a whole new meaning as the portions here on the are massive. I have never seen a restaurant regularly serve up so much food. The appetizer and two entrees we order were more than enough to feed the seven of us. Unfortunately, Carmine's failed to follow the common mantra of quality over quantity.  We started with ordering the Garlic Bread Parmigianino as a appetizer. The huge texas toast style slices of bread totally caked with a thick layer of Parmesan cheese and garlic seasoning. After about half through the slice, the oil from cheese and spread became overwhelming and I had to put it down. The Chicken Contadina was OK at best, huge pieces of bone-in chicken got cold too quickly and the sausage that accompanied it was surprisingly lacking in flavor. The last dish we had, Rigatoni Bolognese, was the best out of the three, the meat sauce and the pasta complimented each other nicely and dish was full of flavor.  Service was a bit below average for this type of restaurant. Our server came around infrequently to refill our miniature glasses of water and didn't even offer us a wine list or dessert menu. Not sure if he was just having a bad day but he came across as very uninterested, hurried, and unhospitable.  Carmine's is certainly not cheap, most entrees run anywhere from $30-$50 but keep in mind that they are meant to feed a large group of people. The place has a lot of potential and I would love to come back and check out some of their other offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Parm garlic toast... we ate 1 before the pic.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Theres alot of stuff on the wall.

ct3b704M3YNqbXoCYCCxjw.text: The service here was great. Leo was personable and attentive. Wish I had a large group with us so that we could try more. The portions are huge. Each dish that came out of the kitchen looked amazing. It was my first time having portabella parmesan, and I'll definitely have it again. The pasta was perfect. The cheesecake was divine.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The titanic dessert. Not for the faint of heart or groups smaller than four.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Italian cheesecake made with mascarpone. So delicious!

N84u33Au4hdUqveQlSWvwA.text: I used to work here in the Forum Shops and was one of those anticipating for Carmine's to open and finally got to try them out last week. I came here with a party of 11 to celebrate my aunt's birthday. I must say my aunt and her family are from NY and have eaten at the Carmine's there, so the expectations were set pretty high. I do love the inside of the place especially how the high raised ceilings have all sorts of pictures hanging on the walls. If only the restaurant was in a stand alone building then it would truly give that Manhattan feel. Before anything was served we noticed that the plates were at the end of the table, my aunt expected the server to place each plate in front of us because that's what the server did in NY. It didn't happen, so I guess here it's more of a self serve concept. My beverage of choice was the strawberry lemonade since another review mentioned how good and tart it was. She was right I did enjoy the tartness(tasted similar to Red Robbin's Freckled Lemonade), too bad it's not free refill because I sure did finish that drink before the food was served.  So here is the break down of the food:  Carmine's salad- I liked all the additional toppings in this salad like berries, nuts, and salami if I remember correctly. We had 2 salads and assumed they were the same because they looked very similar. After tasting both we realized the other one was a mixed green salad. I prefer Carmine's salad and say it's worth the $3 difference.   Calamari- pretty standard, wasn't too greasy and the breading was like how I've had it at other Italian restaurants.     Zuppa Di Clams (white)- I am not a fan of clams but my brother convinced me to try the last piece and I was pleasantly surprised. If you enjoy clams I definitely would recommend this dish, pretty delicious I must say. The sauce for the clams was so good we saved it to put on our pasta.  Broiled porterhouse steak- this was really delicious and I thought it was perfectly cooked with various pieces being rare and medium (refer to the picture). One of the better cuts of steak I've had from a restaurant. Warning this is pricey, costing $80.  Chicken Scarpariello- I read from another review recommending this dish and when we ordered it the server said they were out?! I was shocked at first because I've never heard of a chicken dish running out at a restaurant. Thankfully she came back and said they still had it. It was cooked in a buttery sauce, probably my favorite dish of the night and reasonably price. I will definitely order this the next time I come back.   There was a pasta dish we ordered but I can't remember what the name was. Next time I come, I'll also order the Rigatoni & Broccoli as recommended by another yelper. According to my aunt and her husband the food was a little on the salty side, but still a good quality in comparison to the one in NY. However the service was lacking. I really want to come back but it probably won't be any time soon. This place was pricey so I'll have to find a special occasion to come here for.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Scarpariello, must try!

5JOluz4mPqbaWSZ1YN7Vbw.text: This place has amazing food and service. KYLE D is the best server ever!!!!!! Big shot out to him and his sincerity.

F0iujeVr7UsRXB3sHOe9eg.text: Carmine's is a family style Italian food place located in the Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. The portions here are HUUUGE.  I would def say that this is more of a group type of restaurant than a 'bring a date' place. But if there are just 2 of you, they have open seating by the bar with "half portions".  We sat at the open seating pretty easily. The service was fast and the food came out pretty quickly. I recommend the rigatoni bolognese.... mmmmmmmm.  But all the food we got here was really good, even the bread.  I waddled out of this spot  content and full feelin like Fat Tony.  Go to Carmine's with a big appetite and bring some friends to help you eat.

US6GIUopUBc-iHlG1gv_Sg.text: I took a risk on this place on having my wedding dinner held here without tasting the food first and never been here before. My best friend recommend this place I trust her judgement good thing I did the dinner was great family orientated style big dishes and a lot of food. It has been a year later my family until this day still talks about the food and tiramisu cake.  On our one year anniversary my husband and I came back to celebrate we tried porterhouse steak it is the best steak I have ever had it just melt on your mouth it is pricey but it is so worth it.

yTpFV2r0SHvEOmkB_vAytQ.text: Family style dining. Great for large groups (5+) to share the large plates and to allow for variety.  The large plates are definitely for family style.  Spaghetti and meatballs were fabulous!  Kind of noisy because of bachelor's party upstairs, but they sounded like a fun time up there. :)

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread basket.

P5FH-ygy8eZv-Vwg_u5vmA.text: I visited Carmine's NYC during Thursday Oct 31st (Halloween,) for dinner and this place was pretty empty. We had originally made a reservation for 7 people for 7:30pm, but when we arrived a little less than half of the restaurant was still empty. As we arrived the restaurant had a very interesting layout but you could still feel the Italian roots. There are no elaborate walls or breaks in the dining area its all one large box covered with pictures and a massive ceiling. Carmine's offers a list of authentic Italian dishes, including but not limited to Antipastas, Rigatoni, Chicken Contadina, Garlic Bread Parmigianino, and not to mention their 20ft wine rack in the front of the restaurant.  During our visit, our party had ordered Garlic Bread Parmigianino for appetizers, Rigatoni A Bolognese and Chicken Contadina as our entrees. The garlic bread seemed a bit too authentic for my taste; it consisted of large cuts of bread caked with Parmesan cheese which I thought was icing at first. The Rigatoni Bolognese, which was essentially Rigatoni pasta with a meat sauce, was much better in taste and quality, the pasta was a bit cold but the meat sauce had a good consistency and flavor. Likewise the Chicken Contadina, was served with a similar pasta however the chicken was bone-in and got cold quickly. Two things I didn't enjoy very much.  Overall the service was a bit above average, our server was definitely very knowledgeable of the menu and had proper etiquette when it came to serving us and maintaining the cleanliness of our table.  The ambiance was about what I expected, as I mentioned earlier the restaurant is laidback and has a very spacious layout with a high ceiling, which I like. There were picture of random Italian figures all across the walls, which contributed to the new world Italian roots feel. I would say this restaurant was a good representation of what to expect from authentic Italian restaurants in the US.   In a nutshell, this place is a more expensive Buca de Beppo with moderately better quality food. I was definitely not impressed and would rate my experience average at best. Unfortunately family style restaurants don't really do it for me as the food always ends up cold less than halfway through the meal. Overall, this is a great casual restaurant to get the authentic feel of Italian family style dining. There were no service failures or defects with the food, however it was a one-time experience for me.  *Tip* order cautiously! We had 7 hungry guys at our table, 1 appetizer and two entrees were enough to fill us up! Portions are HUGE... hence why they cost as much as an arm and a leg.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back corner of the restaurant.

FMT-Fn7mq0vyl5X4zDYVBA.text: The staff is great and attentive. Unfortunately, the food is marginal. Very oily greasy Italian food. I can't say I would eat there again. Service is great though.

BXvs-hqkbCSkR8T_Gpfy0A.text: Excellent food, great ambiance, very good service.  Reminded me of the Italian restaurants in NYC.  Very authentic Italian food and plenty of it.  If you are in Vegas and want Italian this is a must stop.

PAual7C2TBdDFKvd8fIi3w.text: We had a wonderful time at Carmine's in Las Vegas. We were in town for the Rock N Roll Las Vegas Marathon and this was our pre-race carb-loading meal. We were a party of 8 and were seated and attended to very quickly. The food was amazing and even though we ordered only 3 dishes, with 8 of us, there were leftovers! However, we did find room for dessert. The Titanic requires some skill to plate, but is worth every bite. Service was wonderful, the cocktails were well made, dinner was delicious and dessert was divine! We will be returning!

QAV-kamryPv7AWs7s5zbiA.text: Service was the worst. Food was ok but it took at least an hour to get to our table! So I asked them to box it! Bad experience and will never come again.

w9tIXetOnLm7kMCgHkTUBQ.text: Good flavors, huge portions, had family of 6 and could not do 3 dishes.  Decent value, mixed seafood pasta $50 that had tons of fresh seafood including a whole lobster.  Kids killed the lobster, dad gets squid.  Kitchen a little slow to get plates out.  Server was busy flirting with hostess but kids liked him so I could not deny decent tip.

1dC-jJVL1N0i12Mb3dgQlw.text: First Timers at Carmins and will Never go back! We had made reservations for a very special occasion with our friends from out of state. The waiter was friendly and took our order and than when the staff came out with the 3 Hot Plates of Large Portions of food. He drop one of the plates on my husband lap burned his lap fucked up his expensive dress shirt and brand new leather shoes and the food was all over his white dress shirt and the floor. We felt embrassed, upset and lost our appeite. Everyone in the restaurant looked at us it was just Awful!! the waiters moved us to another table along with the 2 plates. while we waited for about 17 minutes for the manager to come out with claim papers to fill out and told us that the staff person was a new dad and  that he was sorry but if the man was tired he should of called out sick or he needs to realize these plates are steaming HOT!! and it could be dangerous to them and the customers its been 5 days and we havent heard back from the corporation office yet.  For the price they charge on the food they should at least  the decently to call to see if my husband is ok. We left very upset and he had to go back to the hotel with pasta all over his and clothes & shoes how embrassing!!! it ruined everyone night. I hope they call so we can file the claim and get our reimsburment for my husband clothes. The night was Ruined thanks to Carmins!

MWuzsRLhL4vxKkXkN7eL5Q.text: The service was ok- a C or 2.5 , the food was quick to arrive after waiting 12 minutes for the order to be taken-   Carmin'e Salad- only the house dress provided-- wanted Ranch on the side, not possible...ok... I get it. but if the dressing lacks flavor give me an option...  The Chicken marsala - flavorless  and incredibly enough dry and the Seafood Linguini- lobster overcooked, which is hard to do, there was no white wine sauce, hardly any shrimp, and mussels , and clams, a few calamari and squid. Again flavorless, pasta not al dente...Again dry and flavorless...  The desert , Strawberry Shortcake, had a different twist, not for the better was like a marble cake, applaud trying a twist on a standard but recognize that the change was not for the better!  Overall experience a 1 star...Like a spaghetti factory...Would I go again definitely not would I recommend it to a friend or enemy - NO

EMV0PAq_KxuBwt5DjnOUaw.text: The service here was terrible. Our server was incredibly rude during the entire meal. Probably the worst service I've had from a restaurant in a while. The food is very salty and drowned in sauce.

YXGObRG8S9WUxKKqAIoHCg.text: Booked a table for 1 through Opentable. When I got there, I was told they would seat me at the bar because the tables were reserved for family style dinner and the portions are designed for sharing food. Ridiculous argument. If I book a table through Opentable, I expect a table, not a barstool.

5axZdnHCNtqxqGCnfM9_EQ.text: I have not had a chance to test from previous Carmines in New York.This restaurant really perfect for family.Too big and hearty portions.The service and atmosphere was excellent.

4kELa7VxX8Sp83OwnfcBOQ.text: If you are taking your honey for a romantic dinner skip this place. I lived in NYC my entire life before retiring to NV and use to eat at the one in the theater district. The quality is the same. The place serves family style. One dish will serve two people. Most waiters will guide you through what to order ie quantity. The food is very good. This is Sicilian style Italian food. Good for families and four or more.

uKEZk0M0irSUo2dKKJDZMw.text: I brought my girlfriend to Carmines for her birthday dinner. I've been to the NYC location and was blown away that i had to bring her to the Vegas location. We ordered the Carmines salad and shared the chicken marsala. Keep in mind that this place is like Buca de Beppo, family style plates so the portions are huge. What can i say, the good is amazing! My gifriend loved it and stated she would definitely return. Outstanding service as well.

wd36HoUimPdnuah2i7A3-w.text: A very good family style Italian restaurant.   Make reservations.  No matter what, you will order too much.  That being said, try at least one salad, the meatballs, and any pasta dish.  We had ravioli and a seafood bonanza with angel hair pasta.  It had lobster, calamari, mussels and clams.  Would definitely come here again.

qG_yt2BT5qbQALdKvOFavQ.text: Las Vegas Carmine's is as good as the location in NYC... Must haves include the mozzarella cheese topped garlic bread, chicken parm, penne vodka, and most definitely their chicken wings as an appetizer. My waiter suggested the carbonara dish special, and it was phenomenal..... I see another yelped mentioned it was heavy. From my experience it's a little lighter version of an Alfredo sauce with the best additional ingredients added on. If you still have room after the big 'ol portions feel free to enjoy their ice cream tugboats! Disclaimer: definitely needs a larger party to finish it. Overall, I go to Carmine's regularly and have NEVER been disappointed!

KzAaXVx0_9d-CZbaG7ulYw.text: Just had our wedding reception at Carmine's Las Vegas. We picked Carmine's because it was the only affordable choice for 80 guests and could accommodate dancing. From the start, their event coordinator (Tara)can't be beat. Friendly, efficient and detail oriented.. Complete full service and accommodated my various arrangements that I made. (The entire reception was easily planned long distance solely through email communication..my preference.) The reception was perfect! The facility is welcoming and classy. And comfortably accommodated 80 guests, showgirls, Elvis and DJ with dancing. The servers and staff could not be beat.. I'm pretty sure none of my guests were ever left with an empty glass and the chef even prepared a special meal for my brother who has a garlic allergy. And the food.. well, True to the reputation of Carmine's was over-the-top abundant. The amount of food has become a funny highlight from all my guests. All this at an affordable price. I could not be happier that I chose Carmine's for my wedding reception. In fairness, I don't like weddings .. particularly the kind in a banquet hall with "lovely" flowers, small piece of chicken for dinner and bouquet tosses etc..(boring to me) so gauge my review accordingly. If you're in it for a party and good for guests then Carmine's should be a consideration.

BX2d9-IQhiStLB_9KAkmGg.text: The slowest service eeeeeever.  My family and I stopped by ready to eat.  I can only attest to the other reviews about the menu for every other person and for you to look at the wall menus.  But with the nearest menu was behind us and over our heads; the others out of viewing range.   C'mon give us menus!   We promptly ordered the garlic bread with our drink order.  Thirty minutes later still no garlic bread and the main courses were alread ordered at this point.  Finally our waitress came by for us to ask the status on the order.  I could tell by her facials expression something was wrong (like our order wasn't being processed)  We saw other tables seated after us  with their hunger being put to rest with great looking and smelling food.  When the order of garlic bread finally arrived we devoured it and shortly after the main courses arrive.  Wait staff didn't apologize for the long wait and even charged us for a drink we didn't like.  To say the least we won't be back.  To many options in Vegas.

adTN6cCsFjMmPInHI6LeQg.text: Fabulous meal little too loud at times however we were there celebrating my father's 80th birthday and Michael Baker was unbelievable absolutely made the experience unforgettable with his singing in Italian Happy Birthday and then singing to my parents  can't thank him enough it was great!

vC6m_CbZ5dHfNvYT3S4NQA.text: Love Carmine's! It's very very close to the ones in NYC. It's festive with good food and a fun atmosphere!  Check it out!

S2YsmZmWBH1fb_Drp_cp7g.text: Food was good but a bit heavy on the garlic in every dish for me.  Enjoyed the family style service.   The chocolate torta is THE reason to go again.

7eFqjEWnkfEz4M_NwZhrWQ.text: Loved the old world Italian atmosphere! A bit loud but reminds you of a normal big family gathering. Excellent food and service was top notch. Enjoyed waiter who sang a few Italian songs and did it well. Will definitely come again.

tx6Bl5QIyCzITm5C6Nz3iw.text: Great place to have food with your group. Prices are reasonable and quality is consistent. Try the Espresso Martini and Chocolate Cherry Cordial martini. If you're an eater figure one entree for every 2 people.  Salads are huge.

H30SUsPm21571hT22EyAtg.text: Very good lasagna!! Huge portions, crowded Restaraunt, very loud, exactly what you would expect from a good Italian Pasta house. The entertainment for the dinner was the fact that there were about 200 guys in drag. It was apparently, Diva Las Vegas at the Restaraunt that evening.  The Brunello paired nicely with the dish, and a cappuccino ended the meal.  If you are shopping in the Forum Shoppes, it's a great place to go.

NlTKaO7nonFSo9U1oAog9w.text: Carmine's has an awesome atmosphere.  I really enjoy the service that they provide and the unique dining experience it affords.  Before deciding to eat here, understand that you are going to spend at least $35/dish.  All of the dishes are family-style, meaning that the portions are large.  If you're curious what that mean like I was before eating here, you should know that a single item can feed about 3 hungry people.  Also, if you are going as a group of guys, plan on getting 1 entree for 2 people.  If you are going with women, typically a single entree can feed 4 people.  Thus, with a mix of people in your group, plan for 3 people per entree.  The restaurant will tell you otherwise, but you will be hungry if you don't plan accordingly.  All-in-all, the food is quite good.  I would say that the individual dishes at Maggiano's are a little bit better, but the price is a little higher for a group to eat there (since eat dish is about $20 per person or higher).

S8dSFXVtLIJLKPAH5TaLvA.text: What a wonderful experience! The good was delicious (absolutely HUGE portions that feed 4-5 people each) but the service was even better. We celebrated a 91st birthday and a 34th wedding anniversary at Carmine's and couldn't have asked for anythingn better. They were attentive, friendly and made the special occasion more special in their own way. I would absolutely recommend this place on these two qualities alone. Adding in there were 15 of us and for everything we ordered it was more than reasonable!

RK7_IdULAq8dhjbiK0fnaA.text: Great place for a large group. Excellent food and they are used to large groups. Fast service. Took care of the kids. Will defiantly be back!!

-ThtQMvI1F4NuFM7Tv8_0w.text: We came with a large group, and we had a good time.  I know others love the food, but I thought it was too greasy and overdone.  I'd have preferred smaller portions that are more well executed.  The waiter was overdoing it, but it's Vegas, so he gets a pass for that.  That said, it's a fun way to bring a big group and have fun.  I wouldn't come back for one or two people, but for a large group, it's fine.

_Yh3w6ygVG8fqWxmKiDkXQ.text: If I could give this place ZERO stars I would.  Some of the worst service, with the rudest management that I have ever encountered.  My wife planned my 40th birthday dinner there with some very close friends.  We were supposed to get a private room, a 4 course meal, a specialized birthday menu, all for a group price.  Instead we got NO private room, a 4 course meal with the WRONG food that we had pre-ordered, TYPOS on the specialized birthday menu, and we were then overcharged.  When I tried to dispute all of this with the manager - BRETT BODE -- he said there was nothing he could do about it except offer to take a few drinks off of our bill.  He was rude, aggressive, and could care less about customer service.  When I tried to dispute the fact that they overcharged us per the contract we signed he blatantly ignored it.  When I said I will contest the charges with my credit card company he threatened to call security in to escort me out.  After spending A LOT of money there for a milestone birthday with some of my closest friends, I can honestly say that this is by far the WORST service and the WORST manager of a restaurant I have EVER encountered.  While the food is okay, the service is poor and the management runs the place like a factory shuffling people in and out.  I caution you HIGHLY before bringing a large group into this restaurant, especially when Brett Bode, the manage is overseeing the place.  The ABSOLUTE WORST. If i could give it 0 stars I would.  They ruined my 40th birthday, and I am sure I'm not the first person they have done that to.  BEWARE.

z0ltMKZMYhKUYJBPNG3iug.text: Got married in Vegas and came here for our wedding dinner. Very large portions allowed everyone to share and taste multiple dishes. The calamari was a huge hit. Caesar salad was the best dressing I have ever had. Everyone enjoyed their meals and all dishes were cooked just right. Even better, there were left over's for everyone to take home. Staff was very friendly and efficient and best, the chef went out of his way to come out of the kitchen and congratulate us on our wedding. Truly a night we will never forget.

9y6Sxa5f6FuBRZ2FXxLb8Q.text: Best Italian food I've had in Vegas.. probably because it's from NY!  Went here when my inlaws were visiting (there were 8 of us total)  Started w/ fried calamari and zucchini apps.  The zucchini was like zucchini french fries which was not what I was expecting. Still good though! Would probably get something else instead next time.  We went on a Wednesday when they had a veal dish on special.  It was $62 for a huge plate of veal...even the salad that came on the plate was amazing!  We also ordered eggplant parm (my fave and it was amazing), chicken parm, and angel hair and meatballs.  Since my husband and I live in town we took the leftovers home.  I ate the rest of the eggplant over a few days and froze the rest for another time.   I can't wait to have visitors again so we can go eat here.. again!  Makes me miss NY even more but I'm glad I can at least hit up Carmine's when I want real Italian food.    Our bill was close to $400 and we had ordered a bottle of wine, the rest of us had regular drinks.  We probably could have gotten away with 1 less dish and been fine.

KEUupXO0gBCmmsf0zKt_CQ.text: I hosted my wedding dinner at Carmines and can not say enough great things about them!! The service was excellent, food was delicious and our private room overlooking the strip was awesome.  We were even serenaded by one of waiters!! Highly, highly recommend this place for weddings and/or group dinners.  Thank you guys for making my wedding dinner so memorable!!

5RIwaT1-GYaBKNz9AQ4Arw.text: Ate there last week.  Food and service was so good that I just made Thanksgiving reservations!

jRf6iXybRgcLH_Ed3t_M7w.text: Had a great dining experience. Can't wait to come back to LV and go with a large group. This spot is perfect for large parties to share in the "Family Style" portions. Carmine's is the new bomb Italian spot in Vegas.

7jzkoPe0E3bAvGOsSHaYVA.text: We were lucky enough to book our wedding reception at Carmine's and received service beyond or best hope or expectation. It started with the excellent communication during the planning process with Sabrina who went out of her way to make our day special. She made sure that every question was answered and every little detail was taken care of. Kudos Sabrina you are an asset to Carmine's. On the day of our event we arrived and were immediately introduced to our head waiter, server and comedian extraordinaire. First he started in the most professional manner making sure that all our guests were taken care of and as the afternoon unfolded and he became more comfortable with us he was a total joy to be around. He laughed with us, danced with us and sang with us as the celebration was a total success. By the time we left Michael was a friend and not our waiter. Michael we are deeply grateful and honored to have had you work with us. Carmine's is the place to enjoy a celebration in Las Vegas and you will not be disappointed with anything they do. You can turn your special day over to them and from that point forward your party is one thing you will not have to worry about. They are all about service with a smile at a reasonable price.  And the food is incredibly delicious. If any of your guests walk away hungry it's not because of your decision to call Carmine's Las Vegas. We can't say enough about the service the food and the all around atmosphere. We gave them 5 stars only because yelp won't let us give 10 !!!!!!

aZGlONwxzNT98EEkQM8DxQ.text: So happy to find our favorite New York eatery closer to California. Fantastic service, I saw examples of team service over and over again, large portions and the food was absolutely delicious.

lFgWeyoXlJcKegDn1TY86w.text: Waiter was not attentive or knew how to answer questions about items on the menu, instead he'd print out what ingredients are in the dish and walked away without coming back to ask if we wanted to order that dish. Food was disgusting on top of the disgusting service.

EXXUknGnQ43QYakzbrb5hA.text: Came here for dinner on a Friday night.  It is a big restaurant with big portions.  Everything is family style and their were only 2 of us so we got appetizers.  I had the portabello mushroom appetizer and it was cheesy fantasticness(--- good enough to make up a word).  They brought out a basket with 4 or 5 different kinds of bread that were not disappointing.  The waiter was really helpful and nice and took his time with us.  The manager even came over to welcome us at one point.  If your in the area looking for Italian then you should check this place out.

t-H9tW0Nwe14HLSu0HEXrg.text: Sadly I had a two star experience here last night so needed to update. Had horribly salty dish and was unimpressed by the overall experience. Even the good is sometimes horribly bad I guess....

VpJMzdghlNCbp0wgl0uFGQ.text: After walking around for close to an hour trying to find a dinner spot we would like, we came across Carmine's and decided to give it a try. The decor reminded me a little bit of Maggiano's, as did the family style menu they have. We ordered an appetizer and a pasta plate to share amongst 4 people and it was MORE than enough food and both items were very tasty! The prices were real steep, but that's to be expected on the Strip. The service was pretty attentive, except for having to ask for water refills quite often. If you're looking for a solid meal on the Strip, I would recommend Carmine's!

nlomm6cWRADtgcnRKoPGdg.text: Just had a private party here for 25 people and from start to finish...AMAZING!! Event manager Krista rocks! Food is top notch and service superseded our expectations! I would recommend this place for your private party! Our family was very satisfied ! The food and drinks just kept coming! Thanks Carmine's for making my mother in laws 50th birthday so special!

hBDDcmET-9y2QljJnjZFkQ.text: don't get me started. chef boyardee if i ever tasted it! the caesar salad looked like it had been rescued from the dumpster. the chicken marsala looked like it was Marie Calender's at best! the penne alla vodka was so over cooked - we couldn't eat it.  save your money! this is not even edible for a free meal on an airplane!

UViTA4LSmufksNcZmBpqrg.text: Family style restaurant with a family-like feel. Lots of great options and the prices are fair. We had no wait and were seated right away. The service was incredible and they were on top of everything. Food was very good and so was the sangria! We picked several dishes and enjoyed every one of them.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sunday Four Pasta Special
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Scampi

w-F_7CtHoDQImYFZ1IiVmQ.text: I first went to carmine's in new York and wow, I was blown away! They had a carbonara that was beyond amazing! It was hands down my favorite dish. They also have a delicious bread pudding that is nothing like the typical bread pudding you would expect. It's like a light and fluffy cake with flavorful chocolate in it topped with high quality whipped cream and strawberries. Truly blown away.  I passed by this carmine's expecting the carbonara and initially the employees greeting everyone said they had it. We just ate dinner so we left and came back the very next day to have some and our waitress tells us there hasn't been carbonara since about 2 weeks because it got taken off the menu. What?!?! How disappointing.. I almost wanted to leave but I know it's a good restaurant anyways and I tried the pene al vodka which was very good. Not a carbonara but very good nonetheless.   Something to note are the family size portions that they serve so don't be too alarmed when you see $35 for a plate. It's large enough for 3 people or 4 even depending on how much everyone eats.   Overall a great restaurant that I'd suggest trying but I'm just sad my favorite plate is off the menu which was the whole reason I went in the first place.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread pudding!

pMSMPhyId3UK4tPeKIoxbQ.text: I love this place for the late night happy hour! You would think more places in Las Vegas would have this, but it really is hard to find. We've been here a few times already and will definitely be back again.   The meals at Carmine's are served in family style portions, but the happy hour menu has small plates- perfect for 2 people. Our favorites are the meatball sliders and fried calamari. Such a yummy late night dinner after a show in Vegas. Would highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LEE7q7LU59fRy3yAYqWFBg.text: Absolute disaster, the recipes seem to have been tarnished beyond repair, at least at this location. The pasta was stuck together, slightly uncooked (apparently, that's what the cook's definition of al dente is perhaps!), watery sauce (no taste of extra virgin olive or garlic), under-cooked broccoli and overcooked shrimp! Terrible service - the servers seem severely nonchalant. And to top it, a side of "marinara" sauce (sour tomatoes) costs $5! Sadly, this restaurant has certainly no Italian in it, let alone "southern" Italian.

RvwSidaCgxNjnN2w04h82A.text: Went with a group of six. We ordered 3 dishes and it was the perfect amount. My favorite was the chicken parmigiana, but all three dishes were excellent. The bread was good as well. If you are in Caesar's Palace, it is a must. If you are anywhere else, it's worth going to Caesar's Palace for.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

K9y-bBF0V5SIYzkjhDyQvg.text: He standard of family style Italian food. The menu has all the classics of anything you want. The wine list is not very wide but has a good selection of reasonably priced wines.  The garlic bread parmigiana is excellent and a must!  The veal parmigiana is excellent and plentiful. The shrimp fradiablo is tasty and not too spicy. The penne a la vodka is cooked to perfection. 3 entrees for 5 people is plenty and with take home.  Deserts are not homemade so we didn't have any.

ui_iAL4uB0y0mC7KLN-n7w.text: Good old family style Italian.   Such a fun place to go. Everything is intended to be shared so the portions are HUGE and it's really a great deal price-wise if you split everything with your table. Service was awesome and the atmosphere was fun and lively.   To be honest, I don't remember all the different dishes we tried (there were so many and I didn't even get to taste them all, I was so full!), but here's what I remember most:  Antipasto Plate: Fun, nice variety. Although, they don't really give enough of each item for everyone to try them all so you kind of had to dive in first in order to get what you wanted. But, all the things I did try was delicious. (They had octopus and smoked salmon!)  Fried Zucchini: Super fun! It came in a gigantic tower. I think my jaw dropped to the floor when I saw just how much zucchini we were getting. Haha. It was tasty, but it basically tastes like a french fry.  Chicken Parmesan: Delicious. I liked this one a lot. Definitely recommended.  Titanic: Whoa, was this dessert a monster! It was so big!! Made of ice cream, strawberries, pirouette cookies, etc. it really was a titanic beauty. I thought we were never going to finish it, but I'm embarrassed(proud?) to say we did...super quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The titanic!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold antipasto - super fun!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried zucchini - it&#39;s a tower!

UN3VWxU2XLQ2aNb_m5_8yw.text: We loved the experience! We seat at the bar area, we were only two, and thought it would allow to try a few more items than if seating on the tables. The waitress was very helpful and didn't try to push anything! Not just the food was good but the drinks were also excellent! We will definitively come back! Note: this isn't a fancy place it is a family style place.

YcFOpoNkcCkp5rfDzt98_A.text: We chose to celebrate our daughters 23rd birthday. Dinner was good however desert was a bit of a disaster. We chose to have the Italian Cheesecake. The flavor was good however we wondered why it was chewy. We soon found out why, there was a large rubber band in the cheesecake. The waitress was very apologetic. When the manager did not come to our table apologize or at minimum address the matter we requested to speak with him. He was unapologetic, smug and arrogant we were obviously inconveniencing him. We are locals and could have visted any other Italian restaurant like La Ventana, Maggiano's, Mezzo's all of which are amazing. We chose to dine at Carmines. I wish we hadn't. Unfortunately you don't get do overs for birthday  celebrations, needless to say we were extremely disappointed.

BAi8-Df-wmzUnD9GJolRUw.text: We had walked by Carmine's earlier in the day when we were walking through Caesars Palace. My girlfriend  had heard about it before and wanted to try it. After our show, we decided to head back over to give it a shot. It was maybe 11 or 1130 so there was no wait to get a table.   The seating is a little unusual because where you sit decides what type of menu you can order from. We were suggested to sit at the bar because it was just the two of us. I guess if you sit in the main restaurant, you can only order from the regular menu that is all served 'family style' in huge portions to feed many people. Even the bar menu had notation that the portions would be large enough for 2 to 3 people.   The last couple hours before close are included in Happy Hour and you can get deals on appetizers and drinks. We decided to try the Calamari for an appetizer and then ordered the Rigatoni with Sausage and Broccoli to split. Both our appetizer and entree were served fairly quickly and not surprisingly, both portions were huge. The Calamari could have fed 4 people and our Rigatoni would have easily fed 3. Everything we had was great and fresh. Everything from the red sauce to the Italian Sausage seemed like it was made in house. We ate as much as we could but could have fed another person or two with the leftovers. Seriously, don't let your eyes get bigger than your stomach.   The staff were all friendly and the restaurant was clean. The prices are on the higher end, but the portions are enormous. Try to come during the Happy Hour times for a cheaper meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni with Sausage and Broccoli
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread

ah0uTnbe9PTdF9BK_j-52A.text: Two words, Meatball Sliders! Happy Hour is from 2-6pm and that's when these little bites of heaven are available. The juiciest most delicious meatballs I've ever had! qvJPvsqXo4MRleiF-OTDlw.text: Went here for a birthday celebration. We had a private dining room which was awesome. It was at the back of the restaurant very secluded. Our waitress was good. She made sure we had drinks and that our plates were cleared in a timely manner. It was a set menu and the portions were huge but it's known for being a family style type of place. The dessert was absolutely amazing and the presentation was beautiful. Carmine's made the birthday very special. Thank you!

LHgm2o3MSGaKgcnmqGXzsw.text: Bigger IS better.... And bigger is what you get at Carmine's. This restaurant is perfect for a group outting. The meals are HUGE, but the quantity doesn't compromise their quality.   The appetizers were delicious, and to be honest I was already full after appetizers, but once I saw dinner, my appetite was back.   Appetizers:  -Spicy Scarpraiello wings - fried Zucchini--- a must  Dinner  - Penne Alla vodka  - Country style Riggatoni  - Chicken Parmiagiana - Porterhouse contadina  Dessert  TITANIC- a must (and they have a gluten free option)  Highly recommend this place for birthday parties, group dinners, or if you're really hungry!!

SyMkqbRGnwmfZnR4MGfqrw.text: Carmine's  What else can be said!!!!! Amazing restaurant and food, and the service from Kyle was even better. Dunes with Kyle a few times now every time I'm in Vegas and come to Carmine's and it's always a pleasure  The calamari and chicken parm are to the moon  10 stars

mzr8LSehzbkUBeUfmsJdXg.text: We were with another couple, having a great Happy Hour experience until a little plate of $6 Eggplant Rollatini was brought out and served late. What transpired after that was not the fault of or any reflection on our Bartender/Server Anthony. Matt the bar-side manager is a piece of work. We watched him systematically berate the server after accusing us of eating the plate of rollatini still sitting atop the bar back. Suffice it to say Matt's unprofessional, abusive treatment of the server was on display for us all to see. I asked for a manager (above Matt) to let him know our otherwise positive experience at Carmine's was tainted by what we witnessed and how Manager Matt chooses to abuse his sense of power. What a shame and what an embarrassment for Carmine's if you allow this type of lowly, managerial behavior. Thank you Anthony for your gracious and kind service throughout our meal.   My review would be 4 stars without Matt's lack of foresight in view of paying customers. I hate to see this poor side of management.

9MJU3hJjEfAA1kLjejfONA.text: Whoa. That was a lot of food but I wasn't all that impressed. The carmine's salad was delicious. It had all the right stuff in it and dressed well. The spaghetti & meatballs was ok, it was super simple. I wish it had more garlic or herbs. The penne was better but still not very memorable.  The sausage and peppers was different than any sausage and peppers I have had. The sausage actually had too much herbs and seasonings and It wasn't to my liking.  I didn't have the chicken parmigiana.  I was already too full from the amount of food that had come out.   We also had tiramisu and strawberry shortcake for dessert. I wish I had saved room but after the first 4 courses I was stuffed to the brim.  The service was excellent, I wish I was better prepared for the amount of food and maybe had my own selection of food.

GVZtpkV9m60H7cxRN_lJag.text: Good food. Excellent service. I had the veal APRN with Caesar salad. The veal was sliced thin and very tender. Portion size is generous. It is family style however they will go easy on you (including adjusting portion size and pricing) if you are dining alone and sitting at the bar or high tops.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veal Parmigiana

sW_FhpcaucWe_sSPUlyGxA.text: Went to the one in New York a couple years ago it wasn't to bad and wished I tried something else off the menu.   So we got the garlic cheese bread. So good and cheesy. The bread is a bit hard. We got the salad with like every thing cucumbers, radish etc. it was good. We also got the cheese ravioli and chicken parmigiana it was delicious. The chicken parmigiana comes in 4 pieces so u need to cut them to share, wish there were more pieces. I thought we couldn't eat all this food but we did.   The portions are family style. The hard part is to choose something everyone wants to share.   Our waiter was really nice.   There's complementary bread with sauce on top. It's good, ask for butter.   Also there's a water pitcher on the table which you pour yourself water and they fill up the pitcher for you at the table.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside

vrIuJVRzW5ZQiusmV_Q4qg.text: I went to Vegas with some friends and family. My charge to them was "I want to eat where tony soprano would eat!"  I don't want no fancy overpriced veal chop with fiddleheads and beurre blanc and that jibber jabber. Enter Carmine's.   The only drawback is that your going to have a hard time diversifying without a large party. We had five and definitely felt we didn't experience the full breadth of the menu.   The meatballs in red sauce was something of legend. I only regret not getting the full order. Our waiter told us we might have ordered too much since the dishes are family style. The meatballs were amazingly tender and flavorful. You know forget family style. I'd order it just for me.   The prime rib was the daily special. It was amazing. Not sure if it accompanied the price tag but definitely a solid dish.   The seafood pasta had all of the seafoods in there. Lobster mussels clams shrimp. It's a feast.   The country style rigatoni was pretty good. It reminds me of something my wife makes (she's vegetarian) I don't know how I feel about beans in pasta.   Helpful professional service and lots of space. I'd definitely come back for more!!!

ISUh15vZ19i8p1FuVy1sjw.text: Had the carmine salad, salmon, lobster, as well as a side of broccoli. I usually come here and go with the porter which is by far their best dish. This time the experience was not the same. All dishes were good except the priciest one which was the lobster. There was barely any meat from the actual lobster, it was mostly for decoration. I would not recommend it, you're better off have a pasta instead. Also the service was extremely slow as we waited over an hour for our first main to arrive. At this point we wanted to get up and leave. I'll be back for the porter but hopefully the service and quality also improves for other customers as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Fra Diavolo

NCs236nMpGObe-eY2GCJdg.text: For our quick July 4th getaway, we decided to go to Vegas.  Took the kids to Ceasar's Palace to see the interior setup.  And to also enjoy good food.   We were a party of 6. We decided to get some Italian cuisine for lunch.  As most Italian restaurant, the tables are usually good for families or larger groups.  The food is no also in bigger servings, to share.  I like the seafood with pasta. It was a LARGE bowl stuffed with Mussels, Lobsters, Squid, etc. in white sauce on a delightful white sauce.  It went very well on a bed of Linguini pasta.  We were not able to finish all our food. I wish we had room for dessert, but it was just impossible.  So we settled to just pack our food and continue with our Vegas adventure.  This is a great place for good food, good service, and good value.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Antipasto

lHGw8YFahUNnNbcQQ5cnrw.text: Carmine by definition is a vivid red color, but this Carmine can be defined by heart warming Italian food at its very best!  Whether you go lighter at the bar with the smaller portion of what will turn out to be any favorite or dive into the family style portions in the dining area either way wear sweats or extremely loose pantalones for this dining extravaganza.  With two visits now under my belt and a Vegas outing around the corner I had this on my mind so figured the review was long overdue. Weighing in after the meal? Well maybe that's where the line gets drawn. Haha!  The initial introduction to Carmine's came in the form of their famed rigatoni w/sausage and broccoli. I admit the kid in me scoffed at having veggies thrown in for lunch, but the broccoli itself was beyond tender and surprisingly mixed very well with the main attractions. What stuck out were the rigatoni noodles themselves. Massive in nature, but soft as a baby's fanny. I'd weap like a wee tot for another plate of this actually. The sausage was literal chunks and abundant as if meat was raining down from the heavens.  The other outing consisted of actually stepping out of my comfort zone and trying manicotti. I was on the hunt for lasagna, but had a healthy friendly wife I really wanted to share a meal with so we went with this despite my hesitancy. Happily it blew me out of the water and I wasn't even missing meat in it. WTH? Yeah yeah I know, but when you do it well you do it right. There is well beyond enough to split amongst two people, but I guarantee after the first bite you won't want to. What I appreciated most was the ricotta filling itself. More than enough to not leave you just eating noodles, but it was so creamy and made me purr like a cat. Can't beat that?!?  When the strip strips you down literally and figuratively head on into the forums find Carmine's for some well prepared Italian cuisine and mangiare until the sun goes down. Perhaps comes up too if they managed to stay open that long. Someday?!?

jew_-ZPEPICvlWqNKdREgg.text: We were a large party but the service was fantastic.  It's family style so we shared so many fabulous dishes. Too much food for our group and we really couldn't pack up the leftovers because no where to store in our hotel. That was a shame.   We ordered so many wonderful entrees...meatballs, chicken masala, veal and chicken parmesan,  Caesar and Carmine salads, fried calamari,  fried zucchini, chicken wings, pasta Bolognese,  pasta with vodka sauce, incredible porterhouse to die for, sauteed broccoli. Unfortunately the bread basket did not have any crusty bread and Caesar salad had no croutons. They said they had none. This was July 4th and they weren't prepared for all the tourists. We ordered tartufo and tiramisu for dessert.   Way too much food. I was ready to burst.  Loved this Carmines though. I like the food here better than the one in New York!

kLhHND_Fv_LSk4JhMkKafw.text: I made reservations for a large party of 12 for a 50th Birthday. Large crowds make it hard to often get good service - however - I can't rave enough about our waitress Stephanie. She was a doll, outgoing, very attentive, gave us perfect t recommendations and the right amount of food, she made the process so easy.   Then the food came...and it was fantastic. Meat cooked perfectly medium rare, chicken was moist, pasta was cooked aladante. Food was fresh and hot. Everyone chowed down.  I had ordered a cake from a local bakery and they brought it, sang happy birthday, then went back and cut it up and brought us each a piece and wrapped up the leftovers.   I was blown away by the food, staff and experience. Thank you for making us feel special!

rQhABE_V5aoL8e2Pzpv-SA.text: Delicious Italian family style food. I wasn't expecting it to be good at all, but it was very good Italian. I loved how rich the flavors were. Well it was and my fav part was the mushroom mozzarella parmesan appetizer. These are humongous plates of food. Their marinara was extremely delicious. I couldn't stop dipping the bread in it. The flavors were authentic and left a great impression on all of us. This is the perfect restaurant to bring starving bellies. Guaranteed you'll leaving feeling more than satisfied. Service was outstanding too!

EPjeEZ_K6ysk1e0yCwgK5w.text: This is my first trip to Carmine's. It is located In the center of Caesar's Palace Hotel Casino. The theme seemed to be the size of the proportions and the focus was right on. We had the calamari for appetizer and it was certainly enough for five and arrived hot and crispy with a tangy Italian gravy.   The lasagna was huge and came on a large plate that weighed liked 3 pounds. The chicken parmigiana was a large serving as well.  This family style restaurant is a plus for families and large groups and you are served quickly  I wouldn't necessarily call it fine dining but a solid 4 star family style place that will not disappoint.

dXD70o6eaYdeUzofb8iKpA.text: We had a pleasure dining at Carmine's at the Forum shops at Caesars Palace during a recent visit to Las Vegas. Our group included 4 people. We were seated promptly and the server explained the concept of "family dining". The dishes ordered are served in large portions.  We ordered Shrimp linguine in white sauce and mixed seafood pasta and cheesecake for dessert.  The food was delicious, the ambience was very welcoming, which was surprising for a big establishment. The prices were very reasonable for what you get. We are big eaters but they provided more food than we could possibly eat. This would be a great place for family dinner party or for a large group of friends to share food.  I love this place, great service too!

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood pasta is the bomb! We&#39;ll come back for this.

DN7SfGsILIciw0dfmpS4wQ.text: Today was down on the strip and decided it was the day to come in and try this restaurant.  Upon arrival we were quickly greeted with amazing customer service. I let the hostess know I was ordering alot of food, so she sat us at a table to accommodate my plans.   We ordered the cold antipasto, chicken marsala, chicken parmigiana, hot tea, bottled water, and of course their signature Titanic. The table comes with complimentary bread as well.   All of the food was family style, so there was more than enough to take home. The portions were completely shareable and then some.  Our server Laszlo was truly wonderful. He made sure I was very well taken care of throughout my entire experience.  All of the food was fabulous. We tried items we've never entertained before and it was definitely alot of fun. The Titanic is enormous. I have such a salacious sweet tooth. Def try this, it will not disappoint you at all.   There is plenty of table seating and booth seating. There is an upstairs as well. They even offer happy hour.   The price point is a reflection of quality and presentation.  Location is Ceasars Hotel & Casino - ample parking via garages or valet.

sb__zVRw4z408Et5BDy5PQ.text: Tourist trap beware. The food was fine but this is an ala carte venue. We had the Carmine salad which is like a garden vegetable salad mixed with anti-pasta and red wine vinaigrette. Each dish serves 3 to 4 people. As the entree we had eggplant Parmesan. It was good. Not earth shattering but when asked if we wished for additional red sauce, which I always do because I'm addicted to it, it came in a teacup. They do use fresh basil and what I assume was fresh plum tomatoes.   It's the nickel and dime mentality that means we won't go back or refer it to friends. When the waitress asked if you want still or carbonated water, say tapwater unless you want to pay $10 for a bottle of Panna. The sauce in the tea cup? It was five dollars.   If they ask if you want something, make sure and ask how much it is first. We should have known better.

r8zbN5b1ya3xypZnM66dgA.text: Their Pasta is too good...Mamma mia..  We were in Caesars Palace in Vegas and decided to dine in here. At the entrance, they said' we serve a huge portion and unless you don't have a big party ( I was with my wife), sit at the bar. Fair enough.  We got the small couple table near the bar. We saw the menu, even the bar menu has entree starting from $30. We ordered only 1 entree PENNE ALLA VODKA knowing it 'll be enough for both. And yes, it was more than enough for both of us.   In fact, we even packed the left portion and ate it the very next day. Pasta in red sauce was really great, I added chicken in it and they charged $8 extra for chicken. Nevertheless, you are eating one of a good Italian restaurant in the USA. Our server from the bar was very quick in everything. Excellent service, Ambiance was good too. Great atmosphere Kind of retro touch.  Would recommend.

ND-B_9tUhhyJHel7t9XBPg.text: We were staying at Caesar's as a staycation to celebrate a birthday with our family and see a show. We felt that Carmines would be an ideal place for a family meal. Almost to soon as we sat down, Sasha, our server, came to our table to answer questions and get our drink orders. The special chicken dish for Friday nights is chicken Romano. We added a pasta dish, penne alla vodka. Needless to say, the portions are huge. Hard to say which dish I like more since both were excellent. With really tasty food and excellent service, why only four stars. Because my daughter, who is a local, drove here and had to pay $18 for parking in addition to the price of the meal and the show. Frankly that's outrageous. There is no restaurant that is going to rate five stars when there is a $18 surcharge just park you car so you can eat a meal.

8qbCh1MHK1NQ5vAsxAaW4Q.text: Excellent food, great service, and a perfect spot to grab a quick bite to eat before heading to see Beatles LOVE at the Mirage next door.   Based on recommendations and feedback I saw on Yelp, we decided to grab a quick bite to eat in the bar at a high top table before heading to the Beatles Cirque show next door. The restaurant was pretty easy to get to from the street by going into the Forum shops at Caesars. It's on the 2nd floor.   We arrived about 5pm and ordered from the "Bar Bites" menus that featured some select drinks and appetizers/food for happy hour. For $6, I enjoyed a terrific crisp glass of Trebbiano (white wine similar to sauvignon blanc) and my husband had Peroni beer. Both were perfect and went well with the calamari we ordered. The portions are huge and even this "individual" portion was plenty for the two of us. We followed this with an order of linguine in red clam sauce. It was pretty outstanding and would be worth going back for. The sauce was nice and thick and rich, not watery like some places serve it. The clams were shelled too, which is my preference. I don't want to work THAT hard for my dinner. The serving was generous and plenty for two of us to share.   Our service was great. When we got to the restaurant it was pretty much empty (but it was also just 5pm). By 6pm the place was packed. One thing to note is that they have USB chargers along the wall so if you forget a charger cube, but have your cord, you can charge up your phone while you enjoy dinner.   Definitely a great spot for a quick dinner before a show or otherwise. And with the special Happy Hour bar menu, it was very reasonable too.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hour hour plate of Calamari

M-3zVraH_WtSgV7aR0mp5w.text: Portions are not just huge here - dishes are oversized! Definitely a must share with others. Great tasting Italian food. Stuffed mushroom with sausage seasoned well. Manicotti oozed with cheese and sauce did not drench it. Broccoli was prepared with some seasoning and garlic. Super tasty. Side order meatballs (6 pieces) was super moist.  Best to make reservations. This spot is busy! Located in Forum Shops at Cesars. Friendly staff. If we had more people definitely would have ordered the porterhouse (45 ounces!). Leave that for a challenge next time...

W_Bk_eRjdCZ4eTKKnf59bA.text: As I've written before it's The BEST NY Italian food in Las Vegas. Food is Family Style so portions are large...the Chicken Parm can feed 4-5... No one leaves hungry! Staff is wonderful, usually need reservations & is a bit noisy so if you want a business dinner or romantic dinner it may not be right spot. Overall we can't wait to come again!

P_75uszSXuJZfzgYK7_vAQ.text: I'm so happy Carmine's is closer to home for me! Loved it! Food was just a great as it was in NYC!

hyaWWaCR5IbHIKEbs6yRKw.text: We went on a trip and stopped by since we were fan of Carmine, have a good experiences in New York and New Jersey so. Good food, good service, big portion, good selection of wines. The noodle came out a bit mushy, over cooked, well maybe it too busy but our wait said if anything didn't cook right we send it back and they will cook a new one for us, Well it was a good favor, so hope next time will be the remarkable meal to talk about.

NmXIDoupjlRmWDc00OB0Lg.text: It was a good restaurant crowded but it was a Saturday. Went with my sister and friends to celebrate her birthday. The portions are huge!!! And very. Beware the white sauce is not creamy.
