2X3m8VWe60u989_60sfXQg.text: Lousy service, cheap wine but it tastes cheaper.  There are far far better choices in Vegas.  Cross the street and try anywhere else at The Venetian.

MssCzxbyl0_C8oYgJGgZxg.text: We arrived for dinner around 7pm, and decided to sit near the bar for smaller portions. (TIP: main room is for family size portions 3-4 people, the bar seating has junior portions 1-2 people, which you can seat yourselves).   We ordered the broccoli and sausage penne pasta (~$18) and the chicken combo sandwich (~$17) for the two of us Definitely WAY TOO MUCH FOOD for 2; probably could feed 3 or 4.   The chicken sandwich was huge (about the size of a foot long), and came with a side salad. The flavor wasn't my favorite so I stuck to my pasta. The penne was also huge, cooked perfectly al dente, and though there was way too much sauce, it was delicious with the broccoli. We probably ate 1/2 of both entrees and had to wave our white flag to surrender.   Our server/bartender was awesome, and was probably one of the highlights of our meal.

RZzgsQCTpuTVAKFTqW57cQ.text: Did not disappoint. Service was outstanding and the food was amazing. Get the baked clams... so delicious.

g8xOwA9vajvqxKuOT_XAJg.text: Carmine's completely exceeded my expectations! My group of 5 stopped here for dinner before the Beatle's Love show and decided to keep it simple to avoid leftovers. We all shared the Caesar Salad and Spaghetti with meat sauce, rather than ordering one pasta entree and one meat entree. We still had a bit of food leftover, but we were completely full from just these 2 orders. The food seems expensive at first glance, but all the options are served family style, which actually makes for a less expensive dinner. Carmine's is perfect for groups of 4 or more and is great for celebrating. Will definitely be back soon!

NVuZGZcGI2CgeF-8KWlSzw.text: We stopped in for happy hour and decided to stay for dinner as well.  The happy hour red wine was very respectable and the calamari was excellent.  Our server was Dorian and she was a delight.  We did the meatballs w angel hair and left totally satisfied with food quality, service and price point.

Gz1ljvAt6BJ58pelelesqw.text: Service and food were amazing . Frank was our waiter. His service was excellent and to top it off the food was excellent. I had the giant stuffed raviolis and my friend has some rigatoni dish. Portions are gigantic. Top it off the manager Dani checked on twice to make sure that our dinner was to our satisfaction.

kN-m6Hi0yWkU0Wvo0chGPg.text: The bad: The service, particularly the hostess stand.  They are all young and seem uninterested.  When we went to put our name in, and again when we went to ask a question, the feeling we got was that we were bothering them.  Not friendly either.  This is the only reason for 4 stars, and not 5.  The waiters were nice enough.  James was great and really friendly!  The good: THE FOOD.  Everything is family style and the portions are HUGE.  For a party of 4, we only ordered one salad and one pasta entree and had difficulty finishing it!  We were only in Vegas for 4 days, and we came here twice! The bread is good; be sure to ask for olive oil and balsamic vinegar! The Caesar salad was amazing.  Not overdressed and the croutons were just right.  The dressing was great too; you can ask for a side of it. The spaghetti with bolognese sauce was amazing.  The pasta itself was al dente and the sauce was pretty freaking good. Wish there was a Carmine's in California! Will definitely visit here again the next time we are in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. spaghetti with bolognese sauce
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caesar salad
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. bread basket

orNyjP3fVZNx-E0VFb6hNw.text: My wife and I were not all impressed with this restaurant. Everything is "family style" and while this is great for families and large groups we found it did not work well for dinner for two.   We ordered pasta with sausage and were very disappointed with the portions. As it was family style it was a big plate of pasta but only two sausages, one each. The food was nothing fancy but a simple plate of pasta and marinara sauce, with two sausages added. It was very plain, simple, and underwhelming. Cheap food without a price tag to match. Also the food was barely lukewarm when we got our meal and quickly turned to being stone cold.   Overall our impression of Carmines was that it was overpriced and poor value for money and not at all suited for smaller groups or couples. The food was plain, flavorless and cold.

lXYw-b6CTkDk-9uSfdIsqw.text: The food was delicious. We ordered family style and left very stuffed. The portions were more than enough for all  4 of us.  We would definitely come here again.

5vY7HYsSdG4kBRcAVpvpOQ.text: I chose this place for my birthday dinner with my family and I don't regret it at all!   Our server was awesome; even as busy as a Saturday night is, he was very attentive to us. We ordered the Caesar salad, Lasagna, shrimp scampi on top of angel hair noodles and the titanic for dessert (this was just for my family of 4!) The salad was so good and to top it off, the had anchovies like a True Caesar salad! When the lasagna & shrimp scampi came out, my kids were shocked at how big the dishes were!! We ate probably only half of each dish, which was perfect because we wanted leftovers! Our server even warned us about how large these dishes were...but we knew we'd want it for home later :). We ordered their infamous Titanic for dessert, although we were pretty full already, we had to! it's one of their famous dishes! Pricey but worth it! It's a mix of a sundae, a banana split & the bottom has a fudge like brownie... HEAVEN!! we ate all the ice cream and whipped cream & saved the brownie for home. I woke up this morning already excited for my leftovers!! If you go, bring your appetite!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Caesar salad, Lasagna, Shrimp Scampi over Angel Hair pasta &amp; the Titanic... yummy!!!

-8YCT5IxX0Exuyttdw4yhA.text: We came here to celebrate our anniversary and my wife's birthday. Service was out standing and I must say the quality of the food always on key. Thank you

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best sangria in town
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Chicken Saltimbocca with pasta

66n8PPu5RCC1QCFCAuZZew.text: Huge portions. Each plate feeds 3-5. Excellent food. Nice place. Highly recommend if you want to get stuffed and go take a nap. ;-)

qv7NkspveE86MnH36nNrvg.text: Amazing! We just had dinner here for a group of 50 for our wedding in fabulous Las Vegas on Friday. It was absolutely incredible. Stephanie was our event coordinator and we did not have to worry about a thing! She was insanely quick to respond to any and all of our questions. We came to Vegas with a group of 5 a year prior to do some recon and after enjoying the food and service at Carmine's first hand, there was no question this was the place!   We booked the private room with the balcony overlooking the High Roller and everything was awesome! We had so much delicious food (and booze) that everybody was fat and happy at the end of the night!   The ONLY bad thing I have to say, is that it sucks that we didn't have time to come back for lunch and try some more food! NEXT TIME!!!  Love you guys! Seth and Danielle

Rrhdf2vT4vRI5_MHacJ-0Q.text: Place was probably legit before it became a chain. Poor quality food, huge portions but not good.

70CWkPRmNa2KAW2XHWUS7A.text: So good I went twice, had Kyle as the server night 1 and Michael night two really great service and food consistently delicious - family style so bring your appetite they serve big plates, it was my bosses bday and man did Michael make it special what a great entertainer and server on the side

YPCDA0dlVyXF5kJ3SrEk8g.text: I booked a client dinner at CES. They told me to come back when I had all my party. Of course clients don't show up exactly at the time booked. They told me I could sit down if only one of the party was absent.  It was obvious they totally overbooked the restaurant with reservations and could not accommodate all the bookings they took.   I understand CES is a busy time. But this restaurant is doing a totally unacceptable job of managing a busy Trade show.   I do not recommend this restaurant for client dinners. Unless you want to piss your clients off

ahT-6c4lXFfO_eoktdp7qw.text: This is my go to while in Vegas. Family style servings of superb food and excellent service! Can't wait to visit again.

XUjZOOLyfBuA9EuGCntnEw.text: Great food and service. Shrimp cocktail was fantastic. Portions are huge and food is served family style so order to share! Even the salad is large enough to share.

ukpuhj06DsQD5s2Y_dRpjA.text: I used to love Carmine's in NYC.  As a college student, and an Italian, it was a treat eating at Carmine's in the City.  The portions were HUGE and the food was delicious.  However, going to Carmine's in Las Vegas was not the Carmine's I remember.  We ordered a few appetizers.  The stuffed mushrooms were probably 4 stars, while the mozzarella and tomatoes were at 3.  For entrees we ordered Penne alla Vodka (4 stars), Angel Hair and shrimp (2 stars), and Chicken Parm (3 stars).  The Penne was al dente and the sauce was good.  That is the only dish I would recommended. I love all parm dishes (chicken parm, veal parm, eggplant parm).  However, this one was OK. The chicken was tender, but the cheese was not melted throughout the piece of chicken.  While the edges were nicely melted, the center of the pieces still had unmelted cheese.   With so many restaurants in Vegas, I don't know if I'll be back to Carmine's.  For italian food, there are def better choices.

KlJdsPrJ0lIqKCTFvjf2vw.text: We're from San Francisco and selected Carmine's for our destination wedding reception venue.  Carmine's was excellent throughout the entire process.  From the beginning planning stages, they worked with our budget to the day of they were involved the entire time.   I hadn't seen the venue in person until 2 days before the event and it exceed my expectations.  The Revitro room was huge and more than comfortably fit our 150 guests and a full dance floor.   The food was excellent and there was a lot of it.  It was great value for our money.  The best part was of the event was the staff.  They were beyond friendly, they had plenty of them to cover our party and they made you feel at home.  They went above and beyond.  Our waiter Mike was incredible.  So courteous and fun and he even sang for us!  The coordinator Stephanie was so nice and helpful throughout the entire process.  We had an amazing experience at Carmine's.  All of our guests were commenting on how great the food was.  It made our wedding day stress free and memorable.

94O-xmSRKf_CfaCsKRSoUQ.text: Story goes a little like this.. it was about 12:30 pm and we had attempted to get a table at Joe's but we failed miserably. My family were a bunch of starving raging lunatics (we missed breakfast) so we wondered around Forum shops looking for a place to eat (hoping we wouldn't have to settle for The Cheesecake Factory) and then this placed appeared out of nowhere. Hostess was very kind to explain the concept (family style, huge portions, menus are giant screens on the wall) and we just said: We're very hungry.  So we all stood up and stared at the menu on the wall and we ordered the Caesar Salad, fried calamari, shrimp parmigiana and garlic and oil linguine.  And yes, portions are HUGE. We could have done without the Calamari (don't get me wrong, it was very good, but it was too much for a party of four)  Everything was delicious but we had a lot of leftovers. So, to sum it all up. By all means go, but don't arrive too hungry cause you'll order like crazy and then wonder, what was I thinking? Or do arrive hungry, just get a bigger family. Whatever works for you.

vSeDauMNEuGL0mrJ1q2tQA.text: Huge portions of great food, 10/10 would recommend. We came into town and when my wife found out there was a Carmine's, she told me what had to go. Had the chicken parm and it was fantastic.

eogKRFu5SsoH9nLiwWo-qA.text: Loved this place. Great food in big portions for fair price. Due to high lease charged by Caesars Forum Shops, it's unusual to get a fair deal there. But when I left I felt I got a great deal.  The big boost in my great experience was the outstanding guest service we had. Not only from bartender/waiter that served us, but also from the operations manager that checked on us throughout and incited fun conversation.   Then when throw on the best music played anywhere with lots of Sinatra, Dean Martin, Frankie Valli, Keely Smith and an occasional Motown hit. I love the DJ.  I also love the wide array of photos on the wall. I wish there was a directory. But I did recognize many of them.  Total home run!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great food, price, fun, service, portions, music and visual.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside Caesars Forum Shops. One of my favorite places there in, right up with The Palm.

v0I34P4mxSj_8Tme9o35ZQ.text: This place is as good as it gets. Family style servings with wonderful service Carmine's is headed in the right direction. The food was fresh, hot, delicious. Mother's Day had a special with salad, pasta, chicken, stuffed salmon and the Titanic for dessert. It served 9 people and we had leftovers. We added fried zucchini and I highly recommend it, it was so good. We had such a good experience I am looking forward to going again.

m3BCqmmTc7kRjzlOLziAEw.text: Twelve hungry Italians can make for some serious caloric debauchery and yesterday was no exception.  Our doll of a waiter actually laughed at the amount of food we  ordered!! Here's what we had (keep in mind, there were five kids and seven adults and everything is served family style):   --mixed green salad--delicious, every morsel was devoured  --Caesar salad --broccoli--yummy --eggplant parmesan--incredible --spaghetti with meatballs --rigatoni with Bolognese (my fave)  --Porterhouse--kids liked it (didn't love because it came with some garlic rub on it) --chicken scarpariello--ok, could've used more sauce  We left happy and it goes without saying that we took a long walk and skipped dinner!!!  All and all, it was delicious.

qFsYwwoaUhfUZElkJrfi5A.text: 9 hungry adults ready to eat!! let me tell you, hands down, #1 on my list!!   All of the servers are very helpful with one another, if it's 1 table, there are 2 servers. 2 tables, there are 3 servers & so forth.   Last minute decision but we had just enough time to put in a reservation and I am so thrilled we did. Entrees are huge, just enough to serve 3 hungry people. we got 2 appetizers, 3 entrees, & 1 HUGE dessert named the titanic. we all shared everything. I highly recommend the salmon platter. everybody dug into that one within 2 minutes & it was gone. they are ALWAYS refilling drinks, but I will remind you they are not free refills. Very nice atmosphere but don't go here if you are planning a date or somewhere quiet. this place is very up beat & seems to always be busy. I forgot out servers' names' but from the look of it everybody here is nice & guiding. it is a bit pricey, our bill came out to $400+ & a tip so if you're planning on going, have some money ready to spend. recommend this to everybody!!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The titanic dessert. YUM!!

Cq9mJweKYOECN84W8ZcUQw.text: Visited during our trip and really enjoyed our meal here.  Since it's family style, we only ordered chicken parm and pasta for the 3 of us. We saw other dishes walk by that looked awesome though, including the chicken scallopini with lemon. Service was excellent and the waiters here are clearly professionals.

MzgzkrDI3EQu___h-ERF1w.text: Quality of food is good . We actually would have rated it a 3.5 star if we could. We had the chicken parmigiana and angel hair pasta. The food was a little salty. Other than that it was pretty good quality  Italian food. Very big portions so for a family this is a great place to go but not so much if there are only 2 people.

SwOixfm3mGMyffvGOAMdBw.text: First time here and it was great! Our waiter, Matthew, was splendid from the start. We where on the side where the portions are more generous and he recommended us to get a 4 cheese gnocchi dish that was beyond this world!!!! The Caesar salad is the best I've had no joke!!!!! The service was professional and attentive. On the higher end but it's totally worth it!

Z97raoXQjGNNY1T19VD3EA.text: A Las Vegas location of the NYC Carmine's!  Huge portions of perfectly executed Italian classics.  It's family style dining.  Classic upscale Italian decor.  The porterhouse steak, with a mixed green salad was enough food for 6, American adults!  Check with your server before making your final order.

NYPKPYWVMaoAqboboPWdvA.text: Came here for our anniversary and couldn't have picked a better spot! The food was some of the best Italian we've ever had and our waiter was amazing. (So sorry I forgot his name!)They even brought us out this insane dessert to help us celebrate. Definitely would recommend this spot if you want some really yummy Italian food, a great atmosphere and exceptional service!

kO0OyVl5N0gru9bLGBRsNQ.text: Not the way nyc one works. Right next to our table was a birthday person. They sang very well even the manager came in to sing. I went upto the manager and he was rude to me. Said are you buying a dessert? And the just said ok.   I then asked the aited who was helpful, and 3 ppl came to wish. Like they were forced.   Coincidentally, the table next to us was white and we are brown.  Pretty sure that was not the case, but the manager was rude. I'd still like to mention this kind of stuff during current times.

EiT88nlTElUiTX4E56jgTg.text: My husband and i went here for dinner. The portions are enough for eight people. Our meal was awesome, service was great! I would highly recommend Carmine's for a large group or family gathering!!

etXAqsv2z0F6rwWtUdOvGw.text: Carmine's is the best Italian restaurant in NYC! Now it is the best Italian restaurant in LV!  They are in Shoppes at Caesars Palace(by the smaller fountain) in the middle section of the mall.   Everything is made in house. I personally love their sauces. Fresh flavored marinara, a thick meat sauce, creamy Alfredo and one of my favorites the Marsala.    The bread basket is fantastic, it has 4 or 5 types of bread which is extremely fresh since they bake all day. The meatballs have an old world flavor that most restaurants can't deliver. I had the veal parmigiana this week. The breading was crisp and the veal tender.    Carmine's has family style meals which is best enjoyed with multiple friends. However this year the staff told me they have a limited menu with smaller portions.   I come there whenever I'm in Vegas. Make sure to make reservations. But they will do their best to fit you in when possible.  Enjoy!!

pXjF-Dw9TpYtbHL965GkFQ.text: Our favorite casual Italian restaurant in Vegas.  The food is unbeatable.  The menu is unique.  The service is among the best in Vegas.  Ask for Lorena, she's a True professional with experience.

58TiZrTFmNWKLhXahBq3jw.text: This past weekend I made my way out to Vegas. I tried Carmines a few months ago in NY I loved it. So was excited to finally have it again on the West coast. The food was excellent and just how I remember it from New York. The only downside I had was the service in the beginning. We were sitting for almost 15 minutes with no service. I understand if they were busy but it was not at all. Finally our waitress Yvette came and took care of us. She was awesome. Thanks again Carmines Vegas,

e-L6R3vYIGDBQUhlQaIIdA.text: I went there and then I ordered food. Then I ate the food I ordered. Then I drank a beer and ate more food that I previously ordered. The food that I ordered that I ended up eating was really yummy. The waiters who took my order for the yummy food that I ate were nice.  Quick Recap:  Ordered food. Ate the food I ordered. Food was yummy. Drank a beer. Nice waiters.

0pNMtHDMBphhvZNDHmU9cg.text: I'll start with the things I like.  1- Italian food. The prime rib was delicious.the italian sausage was great. The onions were sweet. The pasta was a bit salty.  2. The cheese cake was delicious.  Now for the things I wasn't inpressed with. Keep in mind we were a party of 16.  1. We had 2 people more than we had reserved for when we arrived. They bumped us back 40 minutes.   - A friend and I sat at the bar and, although it wasn't busy, it took 15 minutes befor a bartender even said Hi.  3. He wasn't polite at all. Had a negative attitude actually.   4. We get our table and we get two menus. 2 menus total for 16 people. Yeah.  5. We get an explanation that the check cant be split at all   6. Our chairs had food on them. They weren't cleaned.  7. We ate family style. They brought the food out on one plate. On a long rectangular table, separating the food and putting them on two  plates on each side would have been nice.  8. I didnt like the interior. They had Random chandeliers and giant menus on the walls yet they were trying to be high end?  Honestly, i think this place is overrated. I'm not motivated to go back. The food wasn't any better than most decent Italian places and a bit over priced.

w-b2tuVzLoyOtv71K_v8Uw.text: I shall start with the service, we bit on the slow side and not very observant. When the glass is empty refill it, it's a simple concept.  The garlic cheese bread gives it the one star. But I truly believe that someone needs to explain to the cook what veal is, that poor milk fed baby calf lived in darkness just to be over breaded and over cooked, should have just let it grow up and become a steak. For the person that is in charge of that kitchen you are a cook not a chef, a chef would never do that to a cut of veal. All in all take the money and hit Olive Garden and have enough left over to hit the movies.

auj_nJFwKJubbctRAyWnOA.text: Save your money! Don't go here! If there was a negative star, I'd give that. A cold can of Chef Boyardi would get more stars. I've eaten a lot of Italian food and there was a spice in this sauce that shouldn't have been there. It was inedible and for the first time in my life sent the dish--spaghetti and meatballs back. I couldn't fathom eating anything else. The lemon drop was not a lemon drop. My hand was so sticky from the glass. My sister hand a drink that tasted like an old cigar. The service was slow. The ONLY plus was they took the food off the check. We still had to pay for the candy bomb they called a lemon drop. When a nearby table's order of seafood came out, I nearly vomited. It should not stink like that. I was sick the rest of the day and the server tried to tell me it was allergies, that's when I told her the food just wasn't good.

2yAej_z4m-c3uqmBmKd4Rg.text: Let's begin with awful. Went here with my family and was originally deterred by the price, but they said the sizes were family and they are. But they messed up my meal TWICE. By the time my family was done eating their overcooked veal and ravioli (the only redeeming part of the meal), they had brought my food out for a third time. We had them box it up because I wasn't about to make my family wait for me to finish. Did they comp the meal in anyway? No. And don't get me started on the service. Unattentive and didn't even ask how the food was, we had to tell them they screwed up. Will NEVER return and do not recommend and wish I could give them zero stars. Thanks for ruining the end of our Vegas weekend.

Qfb4P9h8s5DXDwPSGLHyOQ.text: Came here with a group of 5 near closing time. They were happy to take us but I could tell they weren't ecstatic. My friends are also crazy and decided to order a lot of food. We started out with calamari and stuffed mushrooms for an appetizer. Then, ordered the lobster, steak, and a pasta dish. My friend intended to order a second pasta dish but the server recommended us not to. My friend has been here before so he was aware that he was ordering a lot. He wanted variety, not necessarily quantity. A few minutes after she took our order, she came back out with her manager and she told us that what we ordered was ridiculous and warned us against it. It was nice that they did that but kind of annoying too. We already got warned the first time.   Anyways, the food was great. Lobsters were huge and the steak was cooked perfectly. The only thing that annoyed me about eating the lobster was that it was so messy. I was wearing a white dress and got red sauce splattered all over myself. Do not wear white. We also weren't given lobster shell breaking utensils. They brought it out but left it sitting at the table next to us. We didn't realize until halfway through our meal. Oh well.   Needless to say, we had a crazy amount of food and ended up taking home boxes of food that fed my family for the next few days. I definitely would not have changed it though. It was a lot of food but each dish was huge. I'd rather have variety cause I know I definitely would have gotten tired of eating the same thing the entire meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge plates!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huge portions!

ftRnApzX08Z6UIh3tLAOzQ.text: When I came in, I ate in the bar area. The atmosphere and food were fantastic. Anthony, Joe, and Miguel were the bartenders working. There service was excellent and there recommendations were also great. Overall, it was a great experience and I will definitely recommend it to everyone coming to the Vegas area!

Eln3k8sIbli--poKd4nHLg.text: A group of 8 of us walked into here and looked at the menu on the wall, first in shock over the prices listed next to the dishes. However, we found out that these were family sized plates to share. After the shock subsided, we decided to sit down.  We knew we wanted a salad, so the waiter had suggested getting 2 salads because each salad would feed 2 or 3 people. We got the mixed green salad, two of them. As for the main, we all decided to share the Eggplant Parmigiana and the Rigatoni & Broccoli. Again, the waiter suggested we get a third main dish as he didn't think it would be enough for the 8 of us, but we held off this time.   When the salad came out, boy did we feel the waiter kind of misled us. The salad was HUGE, it probably could have fed 5 of us comfortably. I don't know if it has to be said, but there was plenty of salad uneaten by the end of the meal. The salad was average, I think the only reason I enjoyed it was because I was craving greens/vegetables. Again, when the two main dishes came out, we were really glad we hadn't ordered a third main as the waiter advised. These family sized dishes are no joke. Nothing memorable popped out for me for the mains, I was hungry and I was full after I ate, the dishes were neutral to me - they weren't particularly bad or good.   If you want a place to just eat a lot of blah tasting carbs, this is the place for you. However, there are a lot of other options in the area. Plus, the per glass wine costs were a bit steep. Plus, the waiter was not friendly at all. That is all.

Tapg7QimsXTfMnkHjtYKeA.text: If you are considering hosting a party, group function, or other gathering (or even just having dinner)... do it at Carmine's and you won't regret a thing.   My wife and I just got married at Caesars Palace in Las Vegas, and of all the fabulous things about Las Vegas, this cozy Italian Restauarant in the forum shops that hosted our wedding reception was the highlight of our program.  The food is absolutely amazing, and it is something we are still hearing our guests rave about.  Baked Clams, Shrimp Scampi, and Porterhouse Steak got flying remarks.    Staff was remarkable.   Senior Special Events Manager Stephanie,  we seriously wish had been our wedding coordinator.  Our Server Ron was so attentive to the bridal party and was such a good sport while being roasted by the comedian at the reception.  Carmine's.  You'll only risk being disappointed if you choose somewhere else.

XS8dH9Upj8JkUVuXf6Yz5w.text: Good food, bad service. Hostesses who think they work at a nite club. If you ask for butter with your bread they wonder why. They think it's strange if you want ground pepper with your food. Nice place and food. The service is not commensurate With the price you pay.

3ISe-TZOy3vSSZnhqgFECw.text: Food is excellent and worth the price. Portions are so large and staff doesn't mind if you over do it so beware you may order way too much. Excellent food though.

gDTZ1oM-o5EBCHVCTRI6Jg.text: Two of us stopped in for dinner and realized the portions were too big for just two. The staff suggested we eat in the bar using the bar menu where the portions were half the size. The menu was a little limited compared to the full menu but it had the pasta we wanted. The Bolognese meat sauce with Angel Hair pasta portion was generous and delicious. The calamari appetizer was one of the best I've had. The atmosphere was perfect 1930-40 and made you forget you were in the casino's shopping mall. The wait staff was attentive and friendly which made for a perfect evening.

NDPVS0Hh8S3MQbjGoZgieQ.text: Don't make the mistake of going to Carmines. Go to Rao's, they won't disappoint you there.  Would not go and would not recommend again. Really disappointed. I have been coming to carmines for 4+ years based on my brothers recommendation. My brother is a Las Vegas local.  Had the worst experience last night. Ordered; bottle of wine which was not brought out when ordered, instead I needed to remind them when the appetizers came out. So we had no wine until the food was served. Appetizers; baked clams (not as good as usual, over cooked on top, too hard to chew), side of meatballs (was ok and really the only shining light of the dinner). Entree; penne vodka which was terrible. Sauce was runny, not creamy, with giant cloves of garlic. Almost as if some ingredients had been left out.  Penne vodka was sent back only to have it brought back to the table 2 minutes later to be clearly the same dish only nuked with overly cooked pasta added to the grotesque dish. Which was then sent back again and I asked for it not to be remade. The pasta was taken off and the female manager (Dani) did come over to speak with me. She attempted to resolve the situation by bringing out 6 Cannoli (3 to go and 3 for the table). I am deathly allergic to pistachio nuts and the Cannoli were covered. I told the woman who brought them out that I was allergic and she said no problem and that she would bring out some Cannoli without pistachio nuts. The manager Dani, also came over and I told her as well. I waited 20-25 minutes for the Cannoli to be brought out to the table and finally gave up and left.   Regret going to Carmines and wish I would have gone to Rao's.  Food and service are superior.

Rn534kBzFnxNir1INBupoA.text: Good food. Their bar wall is sky high and landed on my IG wall.   Their portions are HUGE!  Biggest portions I've seen. I was here for a company dinner and man things tasted extra good because it was paid for :)   The lamb dish is great and so was the porterhouse? Their noodle dishes were pretty decent. The shrimp scampi noodles could have had more shrimp. Felt a little lacking.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar section

i1wx7aF9pWLns1jVnxbS-Q.text: Your host staff tonight needs some major training. We call from inside the Forum Shops and were informed that there was a 15 min wait. One of our party goes to the host stand and the three girls tell him it will be a 15-25 min wait, and ask for his #. He gives it to one of them and she enters the wrong #, he corrects her and she enters it wrong three more times because of her ridiculous fake nails. No apologies just a "we'll text ya" We wait 30 min without a text and watch 3 other groups get seated immediately. We approach the stand and see that there are 3 empty tables. One of the girls catches an attitude and accuses us of ignoring the text. The person that gave his number shows his history on his phone which doesn't have anything received from the restaurant. Again no apologies, just a shrug and a "Oh well". We inquire about the empty tables and are informed that they aren't ready yet and again it will be 15min, and another request for a # so they can text us. We provide the number and wait outside. 15 min go by and 5 parties are seated without hesitation. Overhearing their conversations none of them had reservations either. We approach the stand again and one of them tells us yet again we will get to you in 15 min we need are waiting for your table to be cleared. We ask her why she is seating other groups of the same size ahead of us and she just points at the one with the fake nails. She then proceeds to seat another group that just walked up. We left and walked down the hallway and had a wonderful dinner at Cheescake Factory instead. That text we were supposed to receive? We didn't receive it until an hour into our meal at the other restaurant. Tonight was a real shame too, you are one of my favorite restaurants and we dine their frequently but your staff tonight may have cost you our business and we definitely won't be introducing others to your business.

j1TTeaJ6E9S1sUc8riR8FA.text: Disappointed...Ate there a couple of times over the past couple of years and it was excellent. Went back Easter Sunday and greatly disappointed. We ordered calamari for an appetizer. It was cold and lit was the pre-cut frozen crap that is served around town. Main dishes were cheese ravioli, cold and hardly any sauce. Rigatoni with broccoli in garlic and oil was also cold and dried out. Was going to send it all back but then thought why bother. Looks like the tourist trap has gotten busy enough that quality has gone out the window. How they stay as busy as they are is a miracle. I guess the heavy Cesar's Forum traffic keeps it going. It certainly isn't the food. Won't be back!!!!

N8HCAj25wiUFVKeKweQQ4A.text: When they say family style... they mean business. The portions are pretty damn big. My girlfriend decided to stop off here for some drinks and lunch. It was not crowded at all around 3pm I think happy hour starts around 4pm. Sat at the bar tops, our server was quick to get us started on drinks and did a quick run through on the menu. We decided to go with the grilled chicken caesar salad and some fried zucchini... we figure if we stayed long enough maybe we can order more off the happy hour menu. We so did not need to order anything else. The portions were HUGE and they loooooove their Parmesan here everything was covered in it. They also give you a side of it so you can add more.. not like you would need to unless you just want to eat spoon fulls of it by itself. For me it was on the salty side of everything... but I do like the concept of old style family italian restaurant.

Ubev3JKJnsQcWnRqK3QOFg.text: I enjoyed everything about this restaurant - the food, server and atmosphere was quite an enjoyable experience.   We ordered the Caesar salad, antipasto, fillet mignon , 2 pasta dishes and desert. The fillet mignon dish was the Thursday night special. This dish was spectacular - the meat melted in your mouth, the flavor had me thinking that I've been cooking beef the wrong way and veggies on the platter were cooked as though they just came out of the ground and put straight into the saute pan.   My recommendation is to go with a large group because it truly is family style dining. We had 8 adults and 2 kids, and we still went home with 20lbs of leftovers.

yqpzn9Z3Sy8unRnX2qj8xA.text: Really delicious Italian food, very large family portion. Great to come with a group. Love the service and ambiance, it's inside the forum shops.

8tJapZYM3qzYeu74AN8qTQ.text: Amazing food, amazing ambiance, great host / hostesses, phenomenal setting - love this place!!

mE5QpXwnU-Zg1_tII81PKg.text: Carmine's was great. The food was spectacular. So why not 5 stars? I want to get that out of the way -- the service, while prompt, felt rushed. Myself, my husband, and two other couples came here to have a nice, long, dinner. You know, the type of dinner you have with friends you haven't seen in awhile and you want to catch up. That's what we wanted to do. But our waiter asked us about three times if we were done with our meals (we weren't). I felt as though they wanted our table out to make room for another. I wish I hadn't felt that way, but I did.  On to the food -- the food, like I said, was spectacular. We ordered the lasagna, manicotti, and chicken dish with mushrooms, in a delish brown sauce. The portions were pretty much just right for 6 people. The lasagna was amazing, just absolutely sublime. The manicotti was all right, it could have used more sauce.  We did order drinks, and while I enjoyed my lemonade, I did not realize I would be charged for a re-fill when the busser asked me if I wanted "another one". $4.95 for a lemonade x2 is kind of ridiculous, and when I saw it on the bill and saw my half-drunk second cup still sitting on the table, I downed it before leaving.  To end our dinner we had The Titanic - a glorious dessert, with brownies, ice cream, whipped cream, chopped nuts, strawberries, and pineapples. You have to see it to believe it, and eat it to love it.   Besides the service and outrageous cost of lemonade I was very pleased. I would definitely go back. I'll just stick to drinks that can be re-filled next time.

LHtPb_rELq1FaamAcEBzzg.text: Great Italian food in Vegas. The entire menu is family style, so it is a little pricey (it's Vegas), but the food is very good. The restaurant is big considering it's located inside Caesar's Palace, but in a good location.

rfnxuOmcjDeDBhI7QEq0VQ.text: This is one of those restaurants that it does not matter how good or bad the food was, but that the employees and experience were so horrible and unpleasant that you cannot think of anything other than that. My husband and I went to Vegas because I had a seminar in the Wynn for Labor Day weekend. It happened to be my birthday on the Sunday, so he took me to the Mariah Carey show at Caesar's Palace. Afterwords, we decided to go here for my birthday dinner since it was in the same hotel. I made reservations on OpenTable. My poor husband is in a wheelchair because of a broken foot, and this made it more convenient since we didn't have to venture far from the concert. We arrived, and the restaurant wasn't busy at all. We checked in via our OpenTable reservation, and I asked if we could have a nice table since it was my birthday and we were celebrating. The two hostesses rolled their eyes and didn't even say "Happy Birthday" or "Welcome!".One of them just took us to our table, which was a tiny table in the middle of the restaurant. Mind you, this could have been their WORST table, and it was really difficult for my husband to maneuver around in a wheelchair and then sit in a cramped table with his foot in a huge case. I saw that there were three booths next to the table, with one of them being open, and asked if we could sit there. The hostess said "No, sorry. There is no server for that section" and walked away. My husband and I looked at each other, a little puzzled. I walked back to the front of the restaurant and asked the same hostess and the other hostess if we could please sit in the booth, especially since it would be a lot more comfortable for my disabled husband. She huffed and puffed and said she would ask her manager. I watched her walk a circle around the restaurant, but never asked anyone anything or spoke to anyone, and then walked back up to us and said "Okay it's fine, but just to let you know, it might take about 20 min for a server to come to your table or take your order". I said it was fine, and honestly I was at the point of laughing because she was behaving so ridiculously, and because I was in a good mood because it was my birthday and we just saw Mariah Carey. Again, this girl was full of s*** because a server immediately came to our table and brought us water and took our order. The server was a little robotic and cold to us at first, but he ended up being nice. He forgot to bring our bread basket, but made up for it by sending us home with some. The food was good, but the prices were very, very steep. $30 for a salad? If they made the portions a tiny bit smaller and the prices a tiny bit lower it would be better. A couple days later, I checked my OpenTable account and it said that the restaurant had CANCELED my reservation that night 15 min after we had been seated, which means I didn't get my OpenTable points. I was FURIOUS! Obviously that hostess didn't like that I questioned her choice of seat for us, and decided to retaliate by manually cancelling my reservation. What a miserable human being that would treat someone like that on their birthday! I called the restaurant, and spoke with the manager, Keely. She looked into it and said that "it looks like there was some confusion; the hostess said you may have not told them about the reservation so they cancelled it". BS. I told them twice! Trust me, I always want to make sure I get my OpenTable points. Keely ended up giving me the points, but did I really need to go through that trouble?

FS5MsJkHumd_7-F-vkkynw.text: Omg this place is the best my husband and I went there tonight its family style plates that means one plate of food is enough for 4 and everything was cooked to perfection bit pricey

dotUSMP_xgBepysbWFjYtQ.text: Just came back from a huge meal at this fine establishment. This was our first main meal in Vegas and might I say it was the best. Not sure if anything could top that. The executive chefs Michael and Jeff even came out to the table as we were there with someone who knew them personally. We took our servers recommendations as we had never been there before. Went with the Carmine's salad to start, followed by cheese ravioli with a vodka sauce, and the lemon chicken with a caper sauce. DELICIOUS!!!!  The dessert was fantastic! We had the Titanic which was gigantic! This thick brownie consistency bottom, topped with 3 scoops of vanilla ice cream and then 3 scoops of chocolate ice cream. Bananas, chocolate cookie type things. AWESOME! We were so full by that time that we did not eat but just a few bites, but what we did eat was amazing! Would DEFINITELY return here on my next trip to Vegas!

4O0qsFPJXoPiw5Znpfg28Q.text: Great family style Italian food. The food here is beyond amazing. I recommend starting with the Spicy Scarpariello Wings. Although the name i spicy it really int spicy at all, usually it takes a little longer for these to come out but definitely worth the wait! The portobello mushroom parm is delicious! For the main course I think you can't go wrong with the chicken  parm which is made thin but not crispy and dry. Also the eggplant parm is the best I've ever had. It is served like a loaf, this is the first place I've seen that at. I'm not a huge red sauce fan, which is why I love that these parms are not drenched in red sauce. If you like sea food you have to try the mixed seafood with white sauce it  has huge shrimp, lobster, clams and muscles served with pasta. They have great customer service. Overall worth it.

wUZ1m53Yo5_0js-BDsY6QA.text: Came into eat for the first time a few weeks ago and WOW! The mussels appetizer was excellent and a huge portion. Fiance and I shared the chicken Parmesan and added linguine...Very good! I also enjoyed my chocolate cherry martini. Marcus our sever was outstanding and the GM Terry even came over to say hello and chat. Impressed! :)

Rfh1BUOEZzOaSdipRX5CnA.text: So, sat down at an empty bar staffed with three bartenders. I ordered a margarita and asked one of the bartenders if this was the same Carmines as Carmine Vento the owner of Villa Pizza, a great place for locals to get a slice since the 70's. My favorite shop being in the old Commercial Center on East Sahara.  Well, I was looked at like I had 3 heads and was asked "where's Commercial Center?"  after trying to explain where and what and who Carmine Vento is, the bartender told me flatly this was owed by some lady and they were not associated with Villa Pizza in any way.   So I paid for my $13, standard, run-of-the-mill margarita and left the snotty bartender to tend to a pretty much empty bar and making average tasting margaritas. What happened to Old Vegas hospitality? You won't find it at Carmines in the Forum Shops.

KBMrSSCWS12Y8Lg6jATl_Q.text: I really like it. It's good for kids. They give them place mats and crayons. The food is verrry good. The pasta, chicken, fish. I love the Caesar salad and the desserts. They have a whole wall of wines behind the bar. The waiters sing for birthdays, anniversaries. Each entree is served on a platter, so if you have 4 people, you can easily get by on 2 entrees. Each dessert can cover 2 or 3 people. I can't imagine going in there alone. Too much food. We had an excellent waiter. It's a little pricey, but it's definitely worth it.

RG0eVvq1Sw-ydAYl8c-PNA.text: Great food and great service.....came here with a large group, hands down the best Italian restaurant I've ever been to.The atmosphere was cool , casual and a bit nostalgic.cant wait to come back!

8wJrr3-gDq0uLaOuflFKCA.text: This restaurant is huge! I believed it just recently opened and we stopped by for lunch.  Portions are huge so we only ordered one pasta and one salad and had plenty of left overs. Service was great and we were greeted with a lot of smiles.

n1b1kyhdDbpkAeUEnbHY2Q.text: We have ordered their Thanksgiving to Go for the past two years. Last year I would have given 3 stars because I didn't feel it was enough food compared to other options like Lawry's or the M. The food was so much better at Carmine's we decided to give it another try...we just ordered additional sides...they did not disappoint. Food was great and everyone went home with leftovers. The 5 stars is because of Stephanie in catering. Her service was excellent and she is the reason we went back a second year and will be returning for a third. Thank you for going out of your way to make sure everything was right Stephanie!

gcGAeyX7hMKsvyO_ncOsHA.text: We ordered the wings and meatballs and spaghetti.  The wings were good just a bit salty.  The meatballs were good.  Family style dishes.  Bread basket with varied bread.  We were a bit confused on who was our server because we had more than one come to our table which caused miscommunication. It seems that's how they work there.  It would have been nice if they would have told us before hand.  Overall good meal,  you get what you pay for.  Go check em out.  Plenty of leftovers for another meal.

tm65ECt-TNowqKi4cwOQ3A.text: My grandparents who are from NYC have been telling me to try Carmines when I go to NYC for years and I just haven't got around to it. I stumbled across this one in Vegas over the weekend though and when I saw it, I knew it was my chance to try it.   Our waiter was great - he explained how the dishes were FAMILY STYLE when we sat down and that those dishes are enormous so that we could try not to order too much food. Of course we still had too much food. The portions are ENORMOUS. He came around basically all the time to fill our water cups and had a great memory + sense of humor.   I came here in a group of 3 people. We decided to order 2 dishes to split between us 3. A pasta dish and the Shrimp Scampi. Note that the Shrimp Scampi doesn't come with pasta itself. Just the shrimp. Both the meals we ordered tasted great - I really enjoyed the shrimp. Note that 2 meals was way more than enough food for this group of 3. But 2 meals gave us some variety, so if I were to go again as a group of 3, I would order 2 meals and take the rest home. Needless to say, none of us had room for dessert after this meal.   Splitting the bill between 3 people including tip came out to around $30 per person which is pretty damn fair for Las Vegas for a nice dinner. Food in Vegas can get really expensive at a lot of the restaurants. Carmines has a great location being that is in the shops at Caesar's Palace. Anyone staying here or Bellagio or Palazzo/Venetian or anywhere around these can easily walk to dinner here which was a nice plus.   Would I come back with a group of 3 or more people? Yes, definitely. Would I come back with just me and one other person? If we were really hungry or if we were ok with a lot of left overs, then yes, definitely.

pslMxstESvHyVW6MvpJKmg.text: We went about 15 min before they close, yet they did not refuse to serve us. We only went for coffee and dessert, but I had a wonderful experience! Their staff were very customer oriented. We ordered cappuccino and tiramisu. The cappuccino had a deep coffee flavor. The tiramisu was creamy, had huge chocolate shavings and amazing coffee flavor! Everything is family style so it was fun! I will be back to try their main dishes!

thNRxrocfGObWO8Uj5Wqeg.text: I came here because I grew up in NY and loved the restaurant there... I love the ambiance and I love that there's no wait (usually had to wait over an hour in NY)! However the food is way too salty. We ordered the calamari and rigatoni with sausage. All I remember is drinking water afterwards. I really wanted to give it a chance and went a second time and same thing... everything was way too salty.

gEYEiJxp_pe5jX-B3wXJMA.text: It wasn't all that..,had the worse service.   Were told our waitress would be able to discuss menu which was written on big white boards....she only knew about the spaghetti and meatballs.  OMG stereotypical!   Had to ask for water and bread....another Waiter dropped off food and served for us.  That server was great.  It seemed like the server we had was hung over?  Just got off work as dealer? Food was ok. They are way too proud.

EEzipJxLICtpZbIjMEp5YA.text: We happen to come across this restaurant while shopping. It serves it's food family style so the portions feed 4-6. If you sit at the bar the meals generously serve 2. The ravioli was the best I've ever had. The sauce was excellent!  We also had Carmine's salad, which was awesome. Great ambiance. Definitely a place to bring the family.

myP3PPn3PXmj44fJIgUr9w.text: Excellent place for groups, family style Italian -- One of our main courses ordered was the lasagne -- amazing!  Ambiance was full of energy, yet casually elegant none-the-less.... Very kind and quick service!

X9CYoxrYY_lKYQxV36jNAg.text: Meh. We actually spent thanksgiving here. Very crowded and very loud. A little too loud to be pleasant. The food for me was average. The portions are large but that's not that important to me. The best thing I had was the fried zucchini. Rao's is the only place to go for Italian in caesar's IMHO.

0qf9h73eiLJpxdzmBEJSFw.text: On 11/11/17 my family went to Carmines for.my daughters 40th birthday. 500 dollars.later asked if they had a birthday desert for my daughter. And was told we'd have to buy a 30 dollar desert. Because the chef would be mad if.he.gave her a small scoop of ice cream. Bad business I'd never return. Food was fair. server scared of chef. Crazy. Won't be back

U-k0qoBdDuu_NahUb0AhuQ.text: Great food! Love everything! The steak pizzaiola is scrumptious plus best Caesar salad!

5C8SucQwYWFb15cSQPP2OA.text: We Love family Style The Mixed Seafood (Red) on linguine was very nice and the calamari was outstanding. 2 entrees and calamari as a starter fed our family of 8 just fine. Handsome wait staff and late hours make this a repeat option for our annual sojourn to Vegas.

7I4ir0pDk2kXWOpgfRNgag.text: Service and food were excellent, but I wouldn't expect anything less from any Carmine's coming from New York. Servers were friendly and knowledgeable about the menu. They also came by to check on us a few times to ensure dinner was going smoothly. Ordered 3 family sized dishes for 4 people and still had enough to take home. Would recommend.

m5zop1e9imVvYmGi5sD9Kw.text: Great food!  Tried the eggplant parmigiana, it is the best I have ever had!  Delicious!    The cessation salad is delicious!    Service was on point!  If I am in Vegas I will be back!

iG6sFKxuYNL_YRrHEXEY6w.text: We came here to celebrate my grandma's 70th birthday and there were about 40 of us, we had a private room upstairs with a balcony with a great view of the strip. We had about 3-4 servers that assisted us, it almost felt as if we had the restaurant to ourselves (which we did not) but we had the whole second floor to ourselves lol. We opted for this restaurant because my grandma loves Italian food and they do family style dining here so it was a great choice.  The restaurant itself was very beautiful and made you feel at home, there were lots of pictures gracing the walls. It was very reminiscent of Maggiano's and Buca di Beppo as far as the decor goes. It's very welcoming and spacious, lots of seating and the people here are so friendly.  We already had a set menu for the occasion, for the appetizers we had Caesar Salad and Calamari, for the pasta we had Lasagna and Linguine with Shrimp in white sauce, for the entrees we had Chicken Marsala and Chicken Parmigiana and for dessert we had Italian Cheesecake and Strawberry Shortcake. We had 3 tables full of people and each table was given two of each dish, talk about an overwhelming amount of food. There was so much food I wasn't able to taste everything (I made the mistake of filling up on their delicious bread before appetizers arrived lol). The Caesar Salad was very good and fresh, it wasn't drowned in dressing and it had a good flavor. Their Lasagna was amazing, it was the biggest portion I'd ever seen. It was layered with yummy ricotta cheese, lots of meat but I wish there was a bit more sauce because we all were fighting over the little sauce that was in the serving dish! The Linguine with Shrimp was also very good, the shrimp were more like prawns and they were quite generous with the amount given. The shrimp were cooked perfectly as was the linguine and the wine sauce was so delicious. But my favorite dish was the Chicken Parmigiana, it was seasoned, breaded and cooked to perfection!! The nice layer of Mozzarella on top as well as the yummy marinara complimented it well although it would have tasted perfect by itself. If I was not full at that point I surely would have had to big pieces. Lastly I tried the Italian Cheesecake for dessert, it was definitely different. It was very light and airy not like the typical cheesecake and it had a bit of a lemon flavor.   Overall this restaurant was amazing and the food was amazing, definitely in my top 5 for Italian restaurants. I will gladly be back when I'm in town.

Ha6A2tDOvergu5RsQ0n6DA.text: Ordered spaghetti marinara through Grub Hub. $32 supposed to feed 6. It arrived without plates, napkins, silverware, crushed red pepper, Parmesan cheese & bread. Grub Hub contacted the restaurant & they claimed that those items are not typical for delivery. What? Really?!   Spaghetti was OK nothing special (too garlicky) and certainly not enough for 6 people that  actually eat. It was only enough for 2 people. Won't reorder again and not a place I would want to visit in person.

8W9YdYJVoxmpa1jcxlgjaQ.text: I use to be such a huge fan, but after my dinning experience last Friday.. I'll pass. We came in for a late dinner. And the place had 4 tables. We were sat right away. Our server came and took our order and that was that for him. Never saw him again. Service was horrible . Good was cold and not tasty.

WN788Ev8Vof-jAkx5Iitqw.text: Drop it like it's hot. The stuffed mushrooms were so so... Spaghetti and Meatballs were perfect for a Craps Table pre-funk. Drinks were great - desert was heavy served. j-xftVc3h5CGmd_q8TonDg.text: First time eating here. Friends were visiting and they wanted Italian. There were eleven of us in the group. They seated us right at the entrance, right across from the host stand. This meant every person who walked gawked at our table. I really didn't like where we were sitting. The food portions were huge. We liked the linguini with clams so much we ordered a second serving.

e8Z8kIVQfEfTEpHq1L1LHg.text: We really enjoyed this place. This is family style dining so everything you order is meant to be shared. Great atmosphere and we had a great waiter. Will be back for sure

ARWn1CGCPpGg0TdPWGxk-A.text: This place was amazing! We had reservations at Joes but it smelled so good we decided to go here. Everything is served family style so it's better if you have a bigger group however since it was just my husband and I our server was able come up with something that wasn't too much food. But it was still A LOT of food! We went to a lot of great restaurants (including Hell's Kitchen but this far exceeded that!

2_cRZESkGrWy1qIfjQT3yQ.text: The portions are huge!!!!!!!!!!! The bread is so good. We split the chicken parmigiana and it was the best!

M61yjQNC-KpcUaKMs8YN-g.text: What can I say? Great, Great, great! We were so hungry while shopping at Caesar's Forum Shops and most restaurants had 1-2 hours wait. We came in and found bar seating on a Saturday night. Bartender was really friendly and gave us his attention right away. We ordered some salad and pasta. When our order came, we were so surprised ---serving was good for 3-4 people in big white platters. Flavors were so good and rightly balanced. We enjoyed the meal paired with Moscato wine.

MwfnwoQN4FOgWZTm8pPazA.text: We have been going to Carmine's for years in New York even though we noticed that in the last few years the quality of the food has been going down. We tried anyway this new Las Vegas location in the hope it would be different.  Unfortunately as in New York the food quality is inconsistent, sometimes you are lucky and it's ok sometimes it's awful.   We ordered the calamari and they were yummy,  well cooked.  The linguine lemon pasta tasted like detergent, may be the didn't rinse the pots, who knows.  Another problem were the artichokes. They were dry, without sauce and clearly weren't cooked since they were hard like a shoe. The very courteous waiter noticed that we didn't eat them and said he would talk to the manager. After that nothing happened.  Unfortunately we are done with Carmine's and we'll not go back.
