Sos821ZHqMZW37TOaVTvWw.text: ast October 19 I asked for a table in their retaurant and they asked for my number for the reservation and they told me that in 45 months later my husband went to ask for a table and they gave it immediately so that we could dine there, which I regretted that the waitress Elena wanted me to order more and since she did not think she gave us the dish with very little pasta and left me very disappointed so if it was one of my favorite restauran it has ceased to be that desepcion Was in Las Vegas

Gb1QbwXlyvrKTbTrNgjfpQ.text: Birthday dinner celebration!  Great place for large parties and family style dishes. All the dishes are huge and more than enough for everyone to share.   Service was great. There were about 20 of us and our server did a great job at paying attention, refills and making sure we didnt need anything else...  Only thing I dont like is the menu is on the wall and not to easy to read. We took a picture of the wall so we could go back to our seats abs order. A bit of an inconvenience..  I'd definitely go back!

LsBY5ViXuqpuN-E5z2hg1Q.text: A great Italian find on the Las Vegas strip amidst all of the shops at Caesar's. Come hungry and ready to dine family style. The menu is on the wall and easy to read, posted multiple times as well. All you need is to order a couple of dishes and everyone will be overly full.   We got the angel hair pasta with marinara, house salad, chicken marsala, and carbonara. It was all fantastic and way more than our group of 7 could eat! The house salad is basic with red onions, black and green olives and lots of lettuce. The house dressing is a spicy creamy balsamic and wasn't liked by half of our group who prefer something lighter. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the marinara covered it all. I could eat just that and be happy.   The standout food was the chicken marsala. Some how it wasn't too sweet but just sweet enough. There was no bad sour after taste that some have. There was a lot of mushrooms on top which for one of our members was a bit of let down but he worked around them. Get the chicken marsala and you will be content and ready to gamble. Or go into a food coma with all of it!

fRodPV3nvaOGVM1hSl5XNg.text: This is by far some of the best Italian food I have ever ate. Please do not confuse this with the Carmine's pizza spot in. Vegas these are 2 different places. Everything is family sized. The waiter told us to try the rigatoni and broccoli along with calamari for an appetizer, the portions were so big it was only 2 of use it was enough to feed 4 people . The staff is very friendly and inviting. Prices are a bit high but when your eating this good it counts. I recommend this to anyone looking to eat some really good southern Italian food.

XYleXV3xRDZ2wIvahYdJLg.text: Stumbled upon this gem while walking around wasting time for our table to be ready at cheesecake factory. My friend and I decided to give it a try and boy was it worth it! Our server Carmin was fabulous and executed the sequence of service to the T! We ordered the baked clams to start and they had to be on some type of HGH because they were huge! top 5 clams I have ever ate! We finished off with the chicken cutlet and pasta. Tasted like grandmas authentic italian cooking. We were table touched by a Gentleman name Jessy. Very friendly and professional. Amazing staff and very very accommodating. We loved it so much we came back the next day and ordered the mixed seafood over linguini. To die for. Our server for that day as angelo. All in all amazing service and since I don't live in vegas I will return to the one in NYC!

BWsSWxMD4UvPKnNKqNTHzQ.text: Great place to have dinner with friends. Casual atmosphere and awesome food. The seafood pasta was spectacular. The Cesar salad was also excellent. Come with a big appetite and order the Titanic dessert. It will make your evening!!

XOX5Me3o5rH_LC4adBR4FA.text: The service is good.  The food is good.  Price is a little on the steep size probably because of the portion size.  This reminds me of Buca Di Peppo.  I gave it four stars because we were sat near the server's prep area.  This caused a lot of bumps from traffic.  There was a lot of tables open.  Other than that the food is good.  Salad was good.  I recommend the butter lemon chicken.

RzIhLO6CRiTy1-0Df1uiug.text: We ordered the lasagna, chicken saltimbocca, and chocolate cannolis. The lasagna was good (but I have had better). The chicken saltimbocca was not very good. The chicken cutlets were very thin, and the chicken itself was not tender. They also skimped on the Prosciutto topping. The cannolis were ok, but taking into account that this resturuant is originally based in NYC (in which the NYC/NJ metro area has some of the best cannolis you will find anywhere in the world), Carmine's cannolis were disappointing. The service was slow, but we went on a Saturday night when the place was very busy, so I really can't fault them much for that. The decor is nice, but this is not the place to come if you want to have a nice quite dinner....the sound level of the crowd is very loud (more like being in a crowded bar, rather than a restaurant). Carmine's is very similar to Maggiano's, serving the large family style portions. I have not been to Maggiano's in several years, but what I do remember is that the food and atmosphere was far better than Carmine's. Overall, I think Carmine's is ok, and maybe if I ordered some other dishes, and it was a little less crowded/noisy, I would give it a higher rating. However, the best rating I can give it today is just 3 stars.

5p3q8P2Ao_q14tit6V5JEQ.text: Best Italian around.  We have been to the one in New York and the one in Atlantic City, NJ - all consistent, all delicious.  This is NOT a cheap Italian chain.  Chefs in all the locations make the same exact recipes - high quality only.  Best meatballs in the world.  Family style, big plates, big portions - GREAT to bring leftovers home.  Go hungry and/or with a group.  (Though, it's only the two of us sometimes but we know how to order to get just enough!)  Great service, super friendly staff..just love this place.  Prices were pretty good too - considering it's on the strip.  You get alot for your money.  Was so happy one opened here in Las Vegas. We will be regulars!!!

NGCxEZUkj6VzK6mN7Rhweg.text: It really is not a place for a couple to visit. Family style is great, but it wasteful to serve ridiculous amounts of food to a couple. Caesar salad for two for $26 is an outrage.

ePAyKxJ3odgtKqCRXLnYQg.text: Great food great service. Amazingly huge portions went with my husband and three kids and we only ordered to entrees and still had so much food left over. Make sure u go with a big party to eat here. I just wish they offered side salads and maybe some side appetizers. Wanted to try different stuff but had to pic and choose due to the size of the plates.

RP049KcCe0ZUd842GQyeGw.text: Cannot say enough good about this place.  It was my first visit and I attended with a group of 8.  The food was EXCELLENT as was the service provided by our server Matt.  The prices were extremely reasonable given the portion size.  This will certainly be on my list of regular places I visit when in Vegas.  The meatballs and chicken wings were incredible.  You must try this place.

cnbTD57AN6VakM4GtaAcUQ.text: Went to happy hour on my last night in town this past weekend. We sat at the bar and had a great time! I think our bartender was named Shelby, request her if you get the chance to make you a Lemon Drop Martini! It was absolutely delicious and she was a great time. Food was amazing and huge portions. My entire party was so full by the time we left. Definitely check the place out, it is worth it!

Vk9bqzJmQBwxzOduy4WkJg.text: Carmine's is one of my favorite restaurants, and I would love to give it a 5-star.   I've been before, and will probably go again. However, my experience on Christmas was completely terrible. I took my parents there for Christmas dinner. We of course waited for a table. While waiting, we got drinks at the bar, and had a nice time.  We were then seated at our table. It was obviously very busy so I didn't expect extremely fast service. However, after 10-15 minutes went buy without acknowledgment, we started getting a little bit irritated. Wanting to ensure a good mood for Christmas, I just played it off that they were busy.   After 30 minutes of not being acknowledged even once, I excused myself and told someone that we had been sitting for 30 minutes without so much as a "hello" or water. Another five minutes passed before someone came to our table. Following that, they were extremely attentive. The manager ended up comping our drinks for the dinner, and we left somewhat satisfied.   It's not the fact that there was a wait on Christmas, which I would totally understand. It's the fact that we were seated and no one had any idea until I told them about it 30 minutes later. That seems like an extreme lack of organizational skills.  All of that being said, the food here is consistent and delicious. If it were not for the service, I would have absolutely rated it a five. The atmosphere is classy and comfortable, the drinks are good, and the food is better.

9d9TtQAT6GlGk8fzEzODtA.text: Enjoyed our meal at Carmine's. Good for a large group of people.  Portions were very large (one dish feeds 4-6 people) and service was great. Byanka was wonderful. We ordered:  Caesar Salad Calamari Bolognese Meat Sauce Penne Alla Vodka Shrimp Fra Diavolo Angel Hair Marinara with Meatballs Cannoli Cheesecake  The penne and calamari were the best options. Shrimp Fra Diavolo was my least favorite.  Definitely get the cheesecake. The cannoli left something to be desired. It was coated in chocolate and sprinkled with pistachios.  Located in the Forum shops in Caesar's.  Average dish price:  $35

qOiVCzyL9GAfkUrLUigyGA.text: We wanted to try Carmine's when we were in midtown Manhattan a couple of months ago but it couldn't compete with the nearby Shake Shack. It's good they opened in town. First thing you need to know, all the servings are huge! Come hungry with a big group. Last night it was just me, my wife and our toddler son. There were so many things on the menu which was posted on the wall. I was told this was intended so you will get up from your table and check out what the other patrons were having. We decided to order a custom Veal Saltimbocca on angel hair pasta. The flavors were simple, nothing to really write home about. Next time we'll bring the whole family so we can try more. Service was good, servers were very attentive. Also on the pricey side, but I guess that's justified by the large servings.

HZ2ZQQRetVsClKJxWQWn0A.text: Food was amazing. Huge portions. Not many choices for appetizers for only two people. Must try the lasagna.

X5rkR-Epk3FEWnJucTNUiw.text: Not bad. Huge portions so plenty to share. For a chain restaurant I was pretty impressed. I would recommend going here if you are in Vegas as most of the restaurants are pretty iffy when it comes to quality.

IC75xwLuH3UQpz4Cx1TlKA.text: My sister had her wedding reception here. The food was phenomenal  (the best food i have EVER eaten at a wedding reception!)! The service my family and I received was impeccable. Mr. Michael Baker was our main server and, wow, you just don't come across a personality like his just anywhere! What a wonderful  experience! The highest recommendation!

qJE94KkUN8KOprnGNZirXQ.text: Extremely disappointing. Slow and unprofessional service with a 1/8 filled Resturant. All of the hot dishes came out cold or lukewarm. Very limited liquor choices. Certainly not like their New York Resturants.

9KbjwgaWyHUrCBMQ4PCiww.text: The food is good, but the servings are huge! I went to dinner with two girlfriends and though the portion sizes are generous, they cost around $30-$40 and unless you want to be overwhelmed with a bunch of food, you're forced to settle on one or two dishes that everyone likes. This place would be great for families; not so great for a girls dinner before a night out!

6bZx8sLsfM8wyXYn1qdTGQ.text: Went here with a friend and we were treated poorly.  I felt ignored and when our waiter was with us, I felt that he didn't want us there.  Only ordered a salad to share and a glass of wine because the waiter made us uncomfortable.  The portions are too large for 2 petite women to share.

dV4J-Ut4P_S2ftm3bZ2NgA.text: I very much enjoyed Carmines.  I've been to their NY location and this was right on par.  Sat at the bar with my guest and enjoyed basketball and some great food.  Drinks were priced reasonably and maybe even poured a tad heavy, which was great.  The food was HUGE as it's served family style but the prices are totally fair.  The challenge with eating at Carmines with 1 other person is that you have to agree on your dishes.  But since we did, it worked out great.  We had the fried zucchini to start and the manicotti as an entree.  Food, in total, was less than $45 and more than we could eat.  That, my friend, is a bargain considering the location and quality.  It's much cheaper than Rao's and I found the food substantially better, too.  You are getting a dish that serves 3 - 4 for the price of a single entree at Rao's.  Heck, it's about the same price as a burger at Ramsay's.  The service is similar and very good, also.  This will be our new go to Italian on the strip for sure.

_lQU_FD9ElE4nGRUAmiDVQ.text: Fabulous dinner!!! The family style portions could feed a small army. Everything we tried, Lamb, Manicotti, Veal Parm. It was all fantastic!!! there were 10 of us for dinner and not a single person walked away hungry

gFb7gfBYTfEmhBJLrwIPXA.text: If you like POOP in your food then you'll love Carmine's. 4 of 8 people in our party got food poisoning. Symptoms ranging from migraine, severe stomach cramping, diarrhea and vomit ting. Called the manager in the morning and he said he's been a restaurant manager for 20 years and "If this was from the actual food being bad, the symptoms would show up in about 24 hours, when its immediate like in this case, its from someone not washing their hands".  He asked to call everyone in our party to check on them...never did.  Did not offer to reimburse or compensate in any way.  Manager was supposed to call back, NEVER DID.  After 3 hostile messages left, he finally called back.  He said "how did he know that our group didn't eat somewhere together before Carmine's?  How did he know it came from his restaurant?  Did anyone go to the doctor to prove they were sick?"  We met at Carmines for our friends 25 year wedding anniversary and the guest of honor had to emergency stop on the way home to blow up and spent the rest of the night running to the toilet.  The manager went on about how the restaurant is new..etc..etc..finally after aggressively reasoning with this poor excuse of a manager, he agreed to refund the dinner.  Since the credit cards have been reimbursed, I am now writing this review.  I've lived in Vegas 32 years, a hotel admin major in school and HAVE NEVER seen a manager handle SICK CUSTOMERS FROM POOP IN THEIR FOOD like this. PS Calling the health department

gdlQAzNIX51ziGCf2HPlnA.text: Was here last night for a bachelorette party.  We had pre-selected our dinner items but I decided to order a round of drinks for our table of 10-- big mistake as this took over 30 minutes for them bring our drinks out and when they did they only brought 9.  I immediately let our server know and it then took an additional 20 minutes to get the other drink after we had already 30 minutes and for them to not bring enough is unacceptable.  These drinks were to have been for our dinner toast which they now ruined because by the time the last drink was brought over everyone was done eating.  When I complained to both the sever and a manager they told me they would see what they could do but the delay was because they only had 1 bartender.....the manager sent over green shots for our table and proceeded to charge me full price for our 10 cocktails at $14 per drink.  At $140 bucks our drinks should have all come out at the same time and not taken 40 minutes---epic fail and total buzz kill will not return.

a9mK8Zr7C_-ZBQGwHX-HYQ.text: Food is good, a bit salty, prices are satisfactory.  Our waiter seemed confused and rude.  I ordered a Mai Tai and was served pineapple juice 80% and rum 20%.  When I explained that Mai Tais have dark rum on top and red in them, I was received with a lost look.  My drink was returned to me with a splash of dark rum, and no effort was made to redo this cocktail.  New York Carmines is much better, better service and significantly better bar tenders and waiters.  2 stars

J4tsnbVLxXf8B9i0hKRoIA.text: I disagree with anyone who complains about high prices.  You get a HUGE portion of food for what you pay for.  I actually made a comment when we got the bill, that this was the best meal we had in Vegas and also the cheapest. I think the spaghetti and meatballs were excellent.  I loved it, and the huge plate was only $34.  There were 2 of us, that ate ourselves into a food coma and we still took a good portion home.  Nowhere else in Vegas can you get that much food for $34.  Granted, my girlfriend also ordered tiramisu and forgetting it was family style, he ended up bringing the entire pie, which was $25.  That was our fault.  So we took that to go to, but she loved it.  I think by far this place is the best value taking into account the price and quality of food.  It's a real Italian hearty restaurant.  I will definitely eat there again.

ad3BuCv3MO9Xk_ilbm0aDw.text: Service was great and the food was hot, flavorful and very tasty. We came with our two kids (7 and 5) and were welcomed with kindness. We look forward to coming back next time we are in town. We all had a great meal and fantastic dining experience.

vgPWvm2w8Scw0ohIAjK3EQ.text: Big portions and excellent service by Mike P.  His introduction of items on the menu was very helpful.  He knows his stuff! We will be back again!

FLurapOCGLPejwI7PvzGzw.text: As a local, this place is worth the trip down to the Strip. Great food and service. Don't let the high prices scare you away. Each dish serves from 4 to 6 people, making it a good value. Give it a try.

LXGv8ZoSg-w0tQfS2LR3pw.text: Went here with my gf last week for lunch at around 2pm. It was our first time. We actually came here because of the reviews on yelp. The food was mediocre this is why I rated it as 2 stars. But the waiter Frank P was horrible.  Unprofessional, inattentive, and nonexistent. I am not exaggerating when it came to his profession as a server.   We walked in got seated waited for our waiter for about 5 minutes. Saw another family get seated. A waiter approached them right away and took their drinks. Then he came over to our table didn't ask what we wanted to drink and told us about the food. He came back in about 20 mins. The other family already received their drinks and salad. At this point I was already getting impatient. He comes by after 20 mins and takes our order. We ordered the stuffed artichokes and a pasta dish. We waited and waited. Didnt know why it took so long since it was not busy. Didn't get our stuffed artichokes until another 25min at this point I was so hungry that I wasn't even mad when the appetizer had come. Not once did he check up on us. Then not long after our appetizers came our main dish arrived. They did not even give us plates. Our waiter was no where to be found and we had to ask a host to give us plates. At this point I was outraged. The food was ok but for it's reputation I expected better food. Then finally after being there an hour half he shows up asks how we were  doing while eating our meal. After finish eating we sat there waiting for our waiter Frank. After  15 mins we found him asked for our check and he puts our bill on the table said nothing. I did not want to leave a tip but it is so hard for me not to. So I only had given him 15% rather the 20%.  We didn't get a proper greeting or a proper farewell. We left disgusted of the service. I would not come here again because the service  was so bad. I expect bad service from a pit stop on a self serve buffet but not this place.  It was an unpleasant experience. I would  be more lenient if it was super busy but it was not busy at all. Just a lousy server.

0SheJiQnsXa6WUGrNyunNw.text: it was pretty good food.   it was def up to par with some other vegas italian places.

kSSYTJiJqNZEmrQenpnR0w.text: I, for one, am a huge fan of Italian food. More often than not, I will find that I like the food that I am having. Carmine's, however, is much more than just a good tasting pasta. The decor of the restaurant make it feels as if you are in a genuine Italian restaurant. It almost makes you feel at home. The food is truly stupendous. I find that I enjoy their spaghetti much more than I like my family's own. Although they have great food, they also have great prices. If you are eating with someone else, it would be in your best interest to split an entree with them. The portions at this place are huge, they almost look like party platters. Realistically, it isn't so expensive the cost is split amongst two people, but you can only get one thing. If you get two, you will find that there is an exuberant amount of leftovers, almost an overwhelming amount and the bill will be pricy as well. If you and your date can agree upon one thing, I would recommend this place, but if you wish to order different things, this might not be the place for you.

JA-zPSo06eQQI_Tb9wS3KA.text: The service was good, pricing a bit high but one dish can serve 4-6 people. The food was just so/so. The lasagna was dry and the Cheesecake was bland, no flavor at all. We were a party of four none of us were raving. Maggiano's in the Fashion Show mall is much better Italian!

arlp2loPAmBqQwLS1vmByw.text: Great food, huge portion sizes. My group of four shared two plates and could not finish it all. The angel hair with meatballs was absolutely amazing. Our server, Kyle, was great. Ask for him and you are guaranteed a great experience.

i43UVj9SAHYtKlukER82QA.text: We just ate here recently and we loved the food.  The service was great.  We would recommend it to anyone going to Las Vegas.

fNyJpxWJCnBbreD549RlGQ.text: Excited to go and try this place out, limited bar, not many flavored vodkas and food was mediocre at best, Maggiano's is much better, will not be back!

H_Ub8-Cpnq-TYHzMZaQ9_w.text: Food is amazing! Family style and tasty. Save room for the Titanic---my son wanted to make sure that was added!

7PGbxkdmsaurxpz2iFlPSg.text: We took our hungry family to Carmine's late on Sunday evening.  What made the dinner excellent was the outstanding service we received from Frank, the tall waiter from New York City.  He helped us with recommendations and genuinely cared that everything went well.  Frank made us feel like VIPs.  The assistant servers were on-point too.  The manager dropped by to make sure we were OK and the hostess was personable. We had the Rigatoni Country Style and Chicken Parmesan.  With our family of 4, we had leftovers too.  We are glad we chose Carmine's at the Forum.

Ar3hLMdEiucaDsYySr1KDQ.text: Went here on a whim while walking through Caesars.   I am SO glad we stopped in. The food is fantastic. Their chicken wings are the BEST I have ever had, and I have eaten my fair share of wings. My kids devoured them too. We came here about a month ago for the first time and just returned this weekend because of the wings! The other food is equally delicious. We had a special salad for Easter which we could barely eat (2 adults, 2 kids) it was so large. We also had Chicken Saltimbocca. Holy cow, so good! We had their spaghetti and meatballs last time which was a hit as well. For dessert, cannoli's. Wow is all I can say. The only negative I can see about this place is the seating. The first time we went we got stuck at a table in the middle of the room on top of everyone else. It was barely comfortable. However, this time I requested s booth with my reservation and they granted that request. Love this place, will definitely be back!!!

1f7vMaToCK9NvrBAweNl6w.text: If you like grey meatballs and chewy veal this place is for you.  A good meatball you can cut with a fork and it crumbles with brown juicy beef.  Not carmines you have to slice with a knife and solid grey in color, obviously filled with a lot of filler, soy?  The two large veal parmingan pieces had to be pounded out to fill the large platter.  It was either a large calf or perhaps ponded out flank steak.  Either way it was chewy for veal.  Veal should melt in your mouth.  Heavy with bread crumbs cheese and marina.  When I complained about the beef the wait staff QUICKLY took the platters away and sent the manager over.  He did remove from the bill.  The scampi was ok, heavy with bread crumbs tho.  I prefer scampi baked in olive oil or clarified butter, garlic, shallots, seasonings only.  The merlot was nice although odd served in small juice glasses.  The anti pasta salad was very good.  The large menu on the wall lacks how a dish is prepared and its ingredients.  I won't eat here again.

laD-7STIq7lTrX9mLZGUEQ.text: We decided to come here to celebrate my mothers BIG 50th birthday. And we were not disappointed!!! There was seven of us total with a reservation. Our waiter Micheal was the best waiter! He was incredibly knowledgeable of the menu. Michael was fun, ENTERTAINING, and had the best attitude! He would joke and tease with everyone at the table. He was so kind to stop my father from ordering too many dishes explaining that two main dishes was more than plenty to feed everyone at the table. We ended up getting the vodka pasta with chicken and the steak dish with sausage. Both dishes were prepared perfectly and tasted amazing. Michael was so right! We had more than enough and extra to take home. When Michael learned we had a cake for my mother at home for her he came back with a bowl of whip cream with a candle on it. Can't forget to sing happy birthday! But just the song was not good enough for our waiter! No sir!! Michael announced to the whole restaurant that there was a birthday in the house, but not just any birthday. The big 5 0 birthday! The look on my mothers face was priceless!!! Thank you Michael for making our experience one to remember!! We will be seeing you again real soon!

l4PK-2_In2U2V-5ALXmi1A.text: My daughter went to Carmines for her 21st Birthday and they had a fantastic meal. The food and upscale location is one of the best in Las Vegas.  The restaurant made a mistake and did not serve the Birthday cake we had ordered and delivered from a local bakery. Carmines could not find the cake and this was disappointing because of the 21st Birthday of my daughter. I had one of the managers from Carmines call me in Colorado. Stefanie one of Carmines managers was a real pro and made the situation all good. It is not that people make mistakes it is how you handle the problem and Carmines knows how to run a business. We will be back for many years to come.

7EnX_d2Y-AicZrmIckUblw.text: We have eaten - Atlantic City, Bahamas, and  NYC -/ food and service always great ! Micheal Baker in the Vegas location  is the Greatest Server we have had! We had a party of 30 and never wanted for anything. Truly an excellent representative for Carmine's !   Thanks Mike

6Sg7WJXJIp7GxcQhYbi4Pw.text: Great food and location in Ceasars Palace. Huge Family style portions. We were able to walk right in and be seated. Waiter (Michael) was very personable and attentive even though he had 4 other tables at the time. We ordered the pasta with the sausage (don't recall thr exact name) and the shrimp in tomato base (again, don't recall the name). The entrees were really good, not excellent, but good. The green salad and zucchini strips, however, were superb. I would recommend both of those to start. The mixed drinks were delicious. I'd definitely eat here again to try some other menu items.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni w/sausage and broccoli

M6gtzwgEkhcxApmzLrMupw.text: Now I realize that this is a chain from a much older beloved restaurant, that said sometimes imitation does not flatter the original.  The green salad was excellent beyond belief, huge easily enough for 6 hungry people.  The server did warn us that everything was "family style". Next came out chicken parm. on Turkey sized platter with about a pound of spaghetti under the chicken.  The chicken was pounded too thin, it was breaded but a bit too heavily, it was very dry.  Thin layer of cheese on top. Now my real complaint was "hey guys did you run out of sauce"? I have never seen such a meager portion of marinara on this dish not to mention the pound of pasta beneath.  It would easily serve 8 people.  This is so much waste, especially in Las Vegas where most of us can't take it home...I wouldn't have taken this home anyway.  I would recommend that they offer "Mama size, or little sister size, or kids table size" portions.  People might order more than one entree that way.  Very disappointing to see all that food thrown away.  There were 3 of us and we honestly just ordered salad and an entree.  Also, be more generous with your sauce or offer more on the side.  The menu's are on the wall. If your back is to one or you can't read the others your waiter is "there for you".  I wasn't happy with this as they don't have time to stand there and read you the entire large menu.  Its difficult for people without the eyesight of an eagle. Many people had to get up and go stand in front of one of the menus to read it.  I think having printed menus would be very kind as an alternative.

7o4kydh6rsedh6JwfEI_Sw.text: This was a great place to dine. Very affordable, especially for the area.  Family style servings are large with plenty of food. And the quality is exceptional. The menus are on the wall. So bring your camera. Take a picture. Then, go back to your table and make your selection. Easy.

lMBTDxPanFC9rl2Of084vg.text: No complaints here--went in with the company while in town for business. Located inside Caesar's Palace on the strip, Carmine's is an upscale, family-style restaurant a la Maggiano's, except darker and more intimate. Probably would be a place Tony Soprano would stop at while shopping in Vegas with Carmine and the kids. I has a couple Negroni's to start, which were a bit different than any standard Negroni recipe I've tasted--very lemon-forward and light in the Vermouth; still tasty, though. The menu is convenient projected onto the side wall, so everybody can view, discuss, and order--neat idea. The table ordered Ceasar Salad, Garden Salad (which I did not sample, but the Caesar was excellent--homemade dressing with the authentic anchovy notes and fresh garlic bite), Lasagna, which was a colossal, seemingly 10-layer monstrosity which was a real crowd-pleaser. Meatballs looked great too, but I did not try one. Manicotti and beef tenderloin were both delicious as well. The only thing I thought was a bit odd was that it was evident they usually do not bring out olive oil for the bread--when we requested it, we got a little caddy with pale, "possibly extra-version" oil usually seen on salad bars. No big deal. It would be tough to go wrong with Carmine's if you're hungry and with a group.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great for groups!

w-plcRwtaH7shNX0HrjTEg.text: Possibly the best Italian food I've had to date. This family style Italian restaurant was absolutely wonderful.  Being family style, the salads and entrees can easily serve five. For a table of six we ordered eggplant parmigiana, linguine bolognese and the Carmine salad. And there was more than enough food to go around...and leftovers to boot.  The bolognese sauce was excellent...but don't expect the typical tomato style. This bolognese sauce was meat, oil and herb based...and absolutely delicious. The eggplant was a many-layered affair of cheese, eggplant and marinara sauce that was devoured with abandon. And the salad had an excellent array of tastes and textures.  The bread basket is filled with a variety of breads, from focaccias to breadsticks, and they generously gave us three baskets in total.  Simply put, if you're in Las Vegas and want top notch Italian food, Carmine's is the place to go.

wknW6owrADOtdvV73LDZZA.text: Over Rated Shrimp Plate and Very Over Priced There are much Better Places to eat very close at that price was ok wouldn't recommend shrimp plate the Italian Place in Excalibur is a Better place my opinion

YLQQ47wSvim7_VHMfZJr9A.text: Attended a very large gathering upstairs. All of the food was very good and the service was constant and attentive.

mGQ7hx-q6csH86KXfI6oww.text: We walked in here by accident and boy was I happy we did. It's family style. Huge portions of food for everyone. We had the house salad and fried zucchini to start. It also came with a variety of bread that was very freshly baked. That in itself was very good. For our entrees we had the shrimp Diablo and rigatoni with broccoli and sausage. We had frozen cocktails that were expensive but delicious.Everything was excellent. We finished with coffee that was ok but nothing overly fancy. The price is as advertised. Expensive but worth it.  As a side note all of the other dishes that passed us looked equally as good.

k18ABy18Ipok8zg8RfuKpQ.text: It doesn't get more authentic than this. Taste just like my grandmothers cooking. I've been to the one in New York and the one here in Vegas is identical. So glad Vegas brought on Carmine's. This is a family style restaurant, bring your appetites or order the food at happy hour for smaller portions. You can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Oh, and the cocktails and beer are amazing too.

YCJzUhaj34dmLgDclOo1sg.text: We visit LV a couple times a year!  This is our ABSOLUTE favorite restaurant!  My 12 year insists we eat here each time we visit.  Love the food, love the service!

BYn4Tnx1lkbOS-gVDuQ7_g.text: Went in for a quick bite ordered the veal on a bun (even though wasn't on the menu) they accommodated us! They asked us what we ordered several times@! Nevertheless they got it right and it was amazing! Oh they also comp'd the order for taking so long which was a nice gesture! Would definitely recommend!

LlvQ6H7zwLVG3M8Y6HkTIg.text: The food here was amazing, but that was the only high point for us. As soon as we arrived service was less than expected. As a table of women they sat us in a terrible spot basically with the dishwashing. They were very accommodating when we asked to move though, we appreciated that. Then service continued downhill. Our server had three tables, he'd visit us every fifth lap, while tending to the other two frequently. We waited like 15 minutes for someone to offer us a box or check. Disappointing they treated us that way due to assuming we were women who wouldn't spend enough to serve us well. Won't be returning.

z50e9AT8jvWddLOyUUj_LQ.text: I would give zero stars if possible.  Went for dinner around 10:30, thirty minutes from close. We sat at one of the high tops at the bar and NO ONE came to take our order. Servers walked past numerous times. We just got ignored. After waiting fifteen minutes we left. Not cool Carmines.

h04T2UD6DhyLfeg8wI8USA.text: Food and service exceeded our expectations. Everything tasted so good and portions were gigantic. This is a great place to come with a large group. Surprisingly everything was very affordable as well given the quality and fact that it's in Vegas!

5MrQAiloUcjq_fS030iNAA.text: Family style Italian dinner. The food was not great, it was overly salty!  If you have a big group they are accommodating but the service is not the best either.   For the price you can definitely find somewhere better.

E8MWCwEhOfXIz_VlxfRUPw.text: Ugh. Was so looking forward to some manicotti. And was so disappointed in this place. Got served cold bread.  And it was several types of good bread- sourdough, cheesy, etc. But it was COLD. Like it came out of the fridge. Ugh. We should have left then. Then our meal came. We got the  4 pasta platter since it had manicotti on it. I was served manicotti and guess what? It was cold. Ugh. Other stuff was warm. Waitress came over and I sent manicotti back. We were given some comp wine and a small discount which was nice but the meal was a huge disappointment. Don't recommend. Won't ever go back.

dQgzh2yhjvLy5lGO_ACDvg.text: Interesting spot. Nice vibe and location. Maybe because it's a tourist spot but the service at the bar is very very average. You have to order food before they will give you a bread basket. A $50 bar bill does not count.

b-4OAcraVsdcwFNvR2Fz-Q.text: This has to be one of the best Italian restaurants that I have been to. The portions are out of control. Every thing is family style. Our waiter was awesome. Make sure you bring at least 6 people with you. We had a table for four and ordered a salad, the 40 ounce prime rib, chicken Marsala, and two meat balls. And we have another whole severing for 4.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Marsala
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 40 ounce prime rib, steak fried, a bed of spinach....

K5U-zDLv-ABZ86WiKaP70Q.text: Super yummy and we were able to get in with no reservation which i was surprised. The place was crowded. Very large portions as to be expected with family style restaurant. Great place for large groups. We had a small group so we left some food behind  love the atmosphere and music as well.

cfbWv-xCF_Bn7liOqDaV0w.text: Family style eating.  Everything was very filling.  The ambiance is great despite being in a casino.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

JV_fTyVKuUVnkK9Wx5KZyQ.text: I've been to Carmine's in New York before and I liked it. Huge family style portions but better than Buca di Beppo, I think. Made a reservation and went here with the family. It's not as busy like the one in the Theater District in NYC.  They make their lemonade fresh to order: strawberry or blueberry. They use real fruits...but refills aren't free. I personally love their strawberry lemonade because it's real tart...so refreshingly good. Since we're a small family (with a big appetite) we got the chicken scarpariello, manicotti...and the Titanic for dessert. Great bread service...combine olive oil, balsamic vinegar and Parmesan as a dip.  Chicken Scarpariello: Chicken in lemon butter and rosemary sauce. The meat is tender, juicy and perfectly cooked. The skin is light brown and crispy. Even the breast (normally the driest part of a chicken) was juicy. The sauce was delicious. 5/5   Manicotti: Pasta filled with ricotta. Tomato sauce was thick and tangy. 3.5/5  Titanic: Chocolate torta, gelato, ganache, whipped cream, pineapple, strawberry and hazelnuts. One of the best desserts I've had recently. It's a combination of their chocolate torta and gelato. Think banana split but waaaay better. This dessert (just like all of their desserts) is huuuuge. It would take 4 people to take down this behemoth. The ganache is what makes this so good. Everyone that would pass by our table would stop and admire this beauty. 5/5  Our server forced us to take our leftover dessert home. "Just freeze it and it would still be good". It looks like a mess now but it's still delicious! Service is a little slower here and our food took a long time.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Titanic (soooo good)
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Lemonade - real tart and made to order
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Scarpariello

iSa9aeLngKuQGFSAnOmr2w.text: Food was good! Huge portions-definitely for sharing! Service was attentive! Reasonable prices!   This restaurant is worth a try....

Q8liTF3jyiFGDus1f32bCQ.text: Huge huge portions!! Come with a group! I came just with my boyfriend and didn't realize it was "family style" servings. However even though it was after "lunch" since we came around 3-3:30 they accommodated us easily. We ordered the carmines salad and the shrimp parmigiana- both were fresh and delicious and the lunch portions are enough for two very hungry people! Also the lemonade is freshly squeezed by the glass- yum! Our waitress was great too and gave us to-go cups since we said we were going to walk outside and it was 110 degrees. Overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp parmigiana
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carmines salad

TJ1yQfxrDyA_MUIJ4_LOVg.text: The first time we had Carmines was in NYC theater district. The food is amazing... We recently tried carmines at caesars and nothing has changed since our first experience in ny. Everything we had was amazingly delicious  The entrees are sooo good, we had the bolognese pasta by far the best we ever had. The meatballs were a big hit absolutely finger licking delicious. Chicken parmigiana was sooo yummy.  The chicken was soo moist not dry and full of flavor all white meat no fat.. and lastly the garlic bread is a must. Authentic Italian food Carmines is just amazing. I wish i had one close to home.. 5 *****

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qzb37ZOifM9TD8hIwXeWhQ.text: Was in Vegas on business and walking through the forum shops and decided to have dinner at Carmine's. Being a big Maggiano's fan I had to try one of their main competitors. First off, if you are a single, Carmines is not the place to eat. They serve Family style which means larger portions at twice the price. I wanted a Caesar salad and the spaghetti and meatballs but that would've been over $55 and there was no way I could eat all of that and staying in a hotel had No way to store the leftovers. I decided to skip the Caesar salad, which was a disappointment because I really like to have some salad with my pasta. The restaurant IMO is much better suited to more than four people where everyone can order something and share with others. The spaghetti and meatballs were good, not great, but I prefer Maggiano's sauce. They state the Portions serve 2 to 3 but I would say they are more suited to two people.

fA5Gx7tuf6xhHuRLRlQEfA.text: Having dined in many Italian establishments & neighborhoods, I was somewhat disappointed with the overall quality and/or or taste of the dishes. The calamari was very delicious and tender no problems there the chicken marsala with seasoned perfectly the olive oil garlic dish was prepared with a chicken broth which made it very soupy like not enough garlic taste and the beef tenderloin was ordered medium and Kim Gray all the way through but other than that the meat was tender. For dessert we ordered tiramisu which came family style as well great presentation great taste. Please note the menu is up on the board and everything is family style each dish can feed about 4 people

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef tenderloin asparagus potatoes onion straws tomatoes with au jus
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Family style olive oil garlic pasta and chicken marsala
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View of the restaurant from the walkway

NajDz7qk2FvmR3qSzBYiiA.text: I am very sad to write this review. I have eaten here and in the New York location multiple times. First off the prices have doubled. For one meal it 39.00 including nothing. We ordered chicken Marsala and it was very very thin and all we tasted was flour. We told our waiter and he took the plate and handed us the bill 70.00 dollars and we left hungry. No manger came over, no apology or offer to get something else. I was so embarrassed that I brought my new boyfriend here and raved how awesome they are . I feel ripped off and very sad

MxeWP2oLtkkZyem2TCNHSg.text: A rarity on the Las Vegas Strip, good food.  This is family style dining.  Portions are huge.  Ate here with a party of 14 and never had to wait for drinks, the appetizers were very good, and the main courses were fantastic.  Both the lasagna and chicken parm were very good.  It ain't cheap but it is great for large groups.  We sat for 3 hours enjoying a meal and company.

KlakCK6M5-8j3icpL96jCw.text: This place has a fun atmosphere with pretty good food. The family style dining makes ordering with your party interesting as you have to compromise on what we'll all be eating.   We had Caesar salad and carbonara pasta and both were quality and delicious choices enjoyed by our entire party.   Two items that kinda bugged me: 1. The menu is on a wall so we had to stare at it from afar and had difficulty seeing it or appeared to be starting at the adjacent table sitting under the menu. It would be nice to just have a menu for my table.  2. I hate when a restaurant insists on making u reuse your salad fork for your dinner. Our forks were on our finished salad plates and the server took them off our salad plates and put them back on the placemat for us to reuse. For the price per entre I'd think we could be given a clean fork for the next course of the meal. Small things make a big difference.

1Wp_U0CGXyX8DOpLyA8cHg.text: No place better in Las Vegas to entertain a large group than Carmine's. Great service and family style old-school Italian. The wine list is great and very reasonable. Can't go wrong.

T_LRgA59sjn3gHQ7s4TMgA.text: OK - I know this is the offspring of some New York Times Square type concept restaurant and I'd never go to this in New York but I did in Vegas ( I may have been buying into the dubious concept that  what happens there - stays there.Although I'm fearful of eternal recurrence).It was  Saturday Night(which makes it  all right) we'd driven from Cedar City Utah that day and had no reservations and we were beat.Here we could sit at the bar and eat and you can't deny Carmines feeds you!( and feeds you).At least we were hungry - earlier we'd been wandering around the Valley of Fire drinking massive amounts of water in the 107 F temperature eating power bars.  It was explained to us one part of the menu was based on the dishes being able to serve 4 people, the other merely two.We ordered appetizers , they were huge! We had a big plate of calamari, which we enjoyed.We also had a Cesar salad with chicken , anchovies on the side .I was so hungry I ate the anchovies.The salad didn't have little  strips of chicken - it had whole chicken breasts- it was kind of insane.I ate them!The most insane thing I saw was the guy next to me didn't understand the bit about the menu with the dishes for 4.He was from Belgium and probably didn't quite get it .When his dish came out he looked astonished and I could not keep from laughing.It was HUGE !It would have allowed the entire village to feast.He ate about one fifth of it.Every time I looked , I laughed( I wasn't being mean - it just looked funny).I'm sure he's firmly convinced Americans eat too much.  Carmines seems profoundly influenced by old Ronzoni, Chef Boyardi , Spatini Spaghetti Sauce and Francesco Rinaldi commercials.You can picture Anthony running home for Princes spaghetti on Bostons North End  and people saying stuff like Mangia and Abbodonza.It's actually funny , fun and good natured.Here everyone gets to be a paisan.

JH5U6plKlLkYesMIVGQprg.text: Calamari and Carmine salad were both delish.    The portions are huge and family style...one of our party has a gluten allergy, so it didn't work out so well as she couldn't try any other dishes and no one really wanted to eat her cornmeal pasta....maybe they should consider offering gf option for half of a pasta entree and the other half with regular pasta?    Other than that, service was good and quick.

bTe5Jo13otv71ZAr5DcP_A.text: Best fried zucchini I've ever had! Granted, the portions are huge, but they do such a great job. We just went last night and enjoyed everything. For 3 of us, we only ate about half the zucchini, but it is certainly worth the money. We also got veal saltimbocca and added rigatoni to the dish for $12.50 instead of a whole pasta dish and it was spot on for 3 of us. This is always one of our "must go to" restaurants when in Vegas.

e2JXIU_q8GaJu4ddX7byhw.text: Great place to take the family. Portions are big and can be shared. At least 1 order of any item can feed 3 adults. Good energy in the dining room. Wait staff was great also

cHpMql5z1d0RjSTpFhY4Sg.text: My family went to This location in Ceasars Palace.  The lady at the front noticed the size of my family and said it's going to be at least an hour and half wait.  There were plenty of seats open but they were not interested in my group as they were half kids and half adults. This place is not family friendly!  I would not recommend it!  Apparently this place doesn't care about customer service.  I guess because they are located in the Ceasars Palace they do not have to take care of families.

Yy5_igXWKkzNHE8mlh554w.text: This is probably one of my favorite places to eat when my family is in town. The staff is very nice and their food is AMAZING! Yes they serve family style, and if you're blind like me you have to walk up to the wall with the menu on it to read it. But other than that it is great. Their veal is to die for, and another one of our favorites is their seafood medley. I highly recommend it!

AYoJlOQx-PjcFbbA8acwHw.text: Hands down the best wings I've had in my life!  I never expected to order wings at an Italian joint, but they came highly recommended from our waiter.  Carmine's is great all around.  I've been twice now to this location in Las Vegas and loved every bite.  The veal is out of this world.  It's family style, so bring your appetite.  It can be tough with just two in a party, but it can be done.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best blue cheese ever
