kNzixPAcK8a_qA6_MXIeGA.text: I liked the food and the service was good.we tried the Cesare salad, veal, and pasta and liked all of it. The portions are huge

BQlX1uJQwbV6e8F_qpB8lA.text: Horrible service! The hostess didn't want help us at all!!! You have to ask what you want many times and still not getting it! Will never come back again !!!

vtwg908XycA3Exv0kXhBzw.text: Stopped by here with the family ! We order Ceasers salad which was great! Then we had the chicken parmigiana which was very nicely cut and breaded, there was plenty!!! Even for the five of us!! We also ordered the meatball pasta and that really had no flavor, it was bland for even ragu . But overall it was a good experience, the waiter always made sure our drinks were filled!

edARo_Lqe0Bc_-eDtJwk8A.text: I am a local. The service is terrible and our waiter (Luiz) was rude, you'd think having a restaurant inside of a hotel such as Caesars Palace, the waiters would have some sort of professional training (which he had greatly lacked). I ordered stuffed mushrooms which didn't come and politely asked to cancel the order and make sure it's not on our bill, a simple apology would have sufficed, the waiter instead starts off by saying "well you didn't order it from me". The food was average and nothing special. It is definitely a place I do not intend on returning to. If possible I would give 0 stars if I could.

9fnj1RbUaZfZtgaCCPgepA.text: This is a family style Italian food place coz the portions here are HUUUGE.  We were in a group on around 15 people and still there was food on the serving dishes. The meatballs, pasta, lasagna were super delicious. Even the memory makes my mouth water #nokidding The desserts on the other hand could get disappointing. The cheesecake and the tiramisu were good but not the best I have had.

911LgROIL-D-nMNW8D1D6w.text: this review is for the service and mainly the lasagna.   we've been here before months ago on a sunday right before a volleyball tourney to carb up. the sunday platter special is ON POINT. the portions are huge. you're likely going to take some home.  the gnocchi was so good and so was the lasagna.  recently, we came and asked our server if gnocchi was available, and he said he would check with the kitchen, and also offered a creamy sauce with it similar to carbonara.  so we said yes, and also ordered a lasagna.   the bussers dropped off cabornara pasta, which all of us remembers never ordering, and we looked at eachother thinking this is not gnocchi. so there goes one seeminlgy petty but disappointing as a simple request where our server did not follow up with us on the gnocchi. if we wanted carbornara, we would've ordered it.    the lasagna, however, was so salty, we could'n't enjoy it. it overpowered the cheese. so when our server FRANK, returned to ask us how everything was, i mentioned genuinly how salty the lasagna was, and with no sympathy, he resonded with, "we don't add salt." well, i've made lasagna before, and obviously most people know the saltiness comes from the sausage/meat and not added salt. but if he was a good listener, he would have picked up that it was more "salty" than usual in terms of my palette.  then my dad tried to make light of the situation and made a joke saying, "maybe the salt was on sale" and the server just had no sense of humor. it was awful. and so was the lasagna. this is a place we thought we would enjoy, but definately a True disappointment. there are other italian hot spots for less and just as enjoyable with respectable servers.

dh3StE4s8wF6aJL-qN252w.text: I made a last minute reservation for 12 at 9:45 for a 10pm dinner. By the time our group had walked from the hotel we were at to the restaurant, we had a great table set and ready for us thanks to opentable. Our host was very accommodating and knowledgeable about the menu an places in general; it was like having a concierge at dinner. What was also nice is we had a strict vegan within our group and they were incredibly kind to go out of their way and make sure everything could suit her needs. Large portions, good wine, and moderately priced food. I think our total was $250. The food was very good, too.

2mq_tc12OBqQzieQj4JUGQ.text: My family had a great experience and loved the food.  I've eaten at the DC and NYC locations and they're all great.

F2j1khZUgAy_wjXErOW8eA.text: Wow - walked passed Carmine's a thousand times and never tried it. Decided to take my wife there for Valentine's Day and we loved it - HUGE portions of yumminess! Enjoyed every bite. The service wasn't the best but it could have been because they were very busy with the holiday. Overall would I go again? Yes!

PK4YXPjtryq5Q8-aWG5ueg.text: We didn't know enough food for at least 6-8 people so shared salad with gal at next table and rest will go to homeless who are always outside .. but the bolenesege was great and best Caesars salad.  Now need to walk off the calories.

Lv9GfMSR5Y5WF4Zkn1Ir-A.text: Located in the old Planet Hollywood spot inside the Forum shops, this place is pretty good.  High ceilings with plenty of pictures and an impressive bar that climbs up to the ceiling.  Or server who was from Brooklyn was efficient but not over friendly, NY attitude for sure.  As all the other reviews state, this place has huge portions but if there is only two of you, eat at the bar, they have portions for 2.  I was part of a party of 6.  We had the calamari, seafood pasta and spaghetti with sausage and meatballs.  Seafood pasta had a whole lobster in it.  It was full of calamari, shrimp and clams.  Delicious.  Meatballs were great too.  It was plenty of food for 6 with leftovers.  Tiramasu was a whole cake, delicious.  Impressed.

JWMN5W79RjF8AsWOCNZllg.text: Stefanie the event coordinator was amazing, along, with the staff and the mass amounts of food for our wedding reception. Highly recommend!

PNUeirLVZcN05Y743MbczQ.text: The discovery of Trevi in the Forums was fantastic. After wandering for what seemed like days (but really just hours) around the Forums and all the shops, Trevi provided a refreshing break. Located kind of in the middle of everything, pedestrian traffic flows around the restaurant, so it is a prime people-watching location. The food is first-rate, as would be expected from a Landry's restaurant. The menu obviously has an Italian theme, but enough variation that everyone should find something they like. While it appeared that Trevi does ask for reservations, we had no problem getting seated during the mid-afternoon time. Service was prompt; our waiter very courteous and helpful. We had the Fritto Misto appetizer, a crispy fried medley of shrimp, calamari, scallops and vegetables served with lemon aioli - watch out though; there are fried lemon slices in the mix and they were something of a surprise. Otherwise, excellent fare. It goes well with the La Fiera Pinot Grigio.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i7Lb1sIm9pckSdsHJz9phA.text: First time here for a business dinner. The food was very good. Huge portions served family style. We ordered the mixed salad with was tasty with radishes, onions, and olives. For the main entrees we got the seafood mixer in white sauce which was pretty amazing. It had lobster, squid, octopus, and clams. The sauce was very good. The other two entrees were spaghetti and meatballs and chicken parmesan which were both delicious but the seafood mixer took the cake with its flavor and presentation. Service was good but our waitress was a little short with us that why I'm given it 4 stars

5uw5MQuooRv3wasz0LLKIQ.text: Best Italian food! Must try the shrimp cocktail, the sauce is awesome.  Just as good as New York with great service from Mike P.   His recommendations were spot on. The Chicken Parm was prepared with a very light batter and great taste.   Been here several times and Carmine's never disappoints us.

Cu5ZAtXBWBRr_O3vehWaXw.text: Sooo good! Have been looking for a great Italian place for our rehearsal dinner and I think we have found it! Garlic bread is out of control, calamari was unreal, and Carl was amaze! Thanks so much, you'll be hearing from us for info on booking our party there. :)

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

48X-Z5VprE6OiXm7y5hfTg.text: I am a Vegas local and brought my family here tonight to enjoy a restaurant that can cater to such a large group.   From the beginning the service wasn't good. The two hostesses greeted us, took our names, & was informed that we had reservations (@ 7:28 pm). After giving our names she gestured for us to wait & told us our reservation wasn't till 7:30 pm & that's when we would be seated. At 7:35 after making eye contact with a member of my party she quickly stopped the "important" conversation she was having with her co-worker to let us know we can be seated.   Then the server, (I am really hoping she was just having a bad day), quickly greeted us and rushed us through our drink order. That's what our whole experience was...it felt like it was a hassle for us to be served. Our table consisted of 11 people, 4 being adults and the rest all children under the age of 10. So from the beginning she already had the "oh great" mentality. Thankfully our children were very obedient tonight (from what the surrounding tables told us) so she didn't have to do much. But still managed to make us scared to ask for a refill!   But what really killed it for me was being sat near the kitchen and having the doors be see-thru. A man (who I found out was Andy, the manager), reached into a plate of what looked like fried calamari, and took one which he tried to toss it into his mouth, missed, and had it drop... onto the floor!!! He then picked it up and put it back on the plate! I gasped and looked to my husband, he witnessed it as well. I brought it to the other adults attention and they looked on as he took another piece and placed it his mouth right before the server brought it out. After losing our appetites we quickly had our dishes boxed and handed over our money to quickly get out of there. And if you are wondering, yes I still did tip a minimum of 20%  When leaving I went up to the three hostesses (1 male, 2 females) asked the managers name & begin to walk away when the girl in my party called me back. I noticed the hostesses looking at me. They asked me why I asked who he was, after telling them what we saw, they responded in unison," okayyyyy!!!So what do you want?" I turned and left. And that is how my horrible dinner at Carmine's was. So, if you want an over priced, very salty, lack of professionalism, possible dinner off the floor experience Carmine's the place to go.

AbKzNlEo52WZL46nJLSvbw.text: Horrible service! The hostess was so rude, we had reservations for 10:00pm, got there at 9:30, she let everybody who came in after us and had no reservations sit down before us. We got seated at 10:30pm. Definitely never coming back!!!

X2syDxsqGhHYE6FhJZgrdQ.text: Ehh. We went into Carmines after walking by it on our way to Trevi in the forum shops (which to start off, I would advise you to go there instead). Seeing that it was family style, we were excited. So we decide to give it a try and our experience was not very good.  They start out by giving you one menu for the table and some cold bread. I wouldn't complain about cold bread, however this bread had some sort of marinara sauce on it, so it was cold crust sauce on cold bread. They also gave out odd pretzel like sticks as well. We look at the pasta dishes and decide to get the "Ragu", the most expensive thing on the menu. Meatballs, sausage, and pork. Sounds good! We get the dish and it gets served out...and it was just gross. WAY too much sauce, which is WAY too acidy. Trust me, I have been going to italian places since the 70's when I lived in New York. This sauce was horrible. Maybe the can they used was bad? The meatballs were just that...basic balls of meat. And the sausage was just one long sausage...not even sliced or cooked well. The pork was also weird...just salty skins of pork randomly placed in this garbage pile.  Needless to say after the 4 of us decided we were eating sh*t, we told the waitress and she immediately took our plates and the pasta away. 10 minutes later she hands us the bill, which is for the entire plate of pasta we didn't eat. What?? We ask the manager and she takes the bill in a huff....and returns with the bill with the drinks for about $12. The waitresses advice? Try not to order pasta if you don't want to eat something acidy.   We left a $20 and left and went to Trevi for a real dinner. I'm guessing this place only survives because it is in a tourist trap and most tourists aren't looking for quality food.

gZO3veMfQLyg2jwQEFMnEw.text: Food was ok. Service was very slow despite a non busy time of the day. Our beer glass came broken and it took them forever to replace and they still charged us for it. Also they brought us a different order than we asked and we were charged wrong. However, the waiter just laughed and kept the bill as it was. Needless to say we will never be back.

pZp-FJB_MpClw4tnzX6Z1g.text: This is now a must when I go to Vegas! Fabulous Italian food! Everything here tastes amazing and the portions are huge. Each entree feeds multiple people so be sure to order wisely otherwise you will be leaving with a lot of food. My family and I came here for dinner and there were 9 of us. We ordered calamari as an appetizer, meatballs, chicken Parmesan, and rigatoni in vodka sauce and all 9 of us were stuffed. It was plenty of food for our large group! So delicious!

uQ-RLXKhsUYIZyLHJILkbg.text: This place was absolutely terrible! We came here on Saturday with a party of 7 for our nephew's 21st birthday and I can honestly it was one of the worst restaurant experiences we've ever had. The service was terrible, and the food mediocre and way over priced; even for the Strip. My husband is a restaurant GM and has previously worked at Italian restaurants in town and he was appalled by the service. We were sat at our table fairly quickly. But it took a solid 20+ minutes for a server to come to just take our drink order and this was AFTER my husband got up and went to the host stand to request service. Our salad came quickly but we waited 40+ minutes for our entrees to arrive. It took so long that our friends were able to take a bag up to their room and come back and the entrees still hadn't arrived. When the food arrived, chicken parm was okay and the meatballs decent but were barely hot. The shrimp fra diavlo on the other hand was terrible. It had no flavor and only minimal sauce. When my in-laws asked for more sauce they were told they could only have bolognese. All in all, this just wasn't worth the $200+ my father in law paid for lunch - save your money and go somewhere else.

g-84bAUPLCtsuPTWuOojbg.text: We visited twice in the week were here. In the main restaurant they serve GIANT portions, if you aren't that hungry eat at the bar. The spaghetti and meatballs is very good and the calamari is amazing. The muscles in red sauce are delicious, order them spicy! It was busy on a Saturday night, yet we were seated immediately and had our appetizer within 5 minutes! The staff is friendly and know the dishes well. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fJf2kwyxFo6jGn1LTe4zCA.text: We really loved this place! After walking around all day it really hit the spot! They serve everything family style which is always fun in a big group. To be honest our favorite part of the whole meal was the Hot Antipasto appetizer that we ordered. We were a group of 4 and could have honestly probably been satisfied with just the appetizer. The Clams and Mussels were so good!! The fried ravioli wasn't my favorite. Andrew the bartender took great care of us and made good food suggestions! I would stop here again! Great food at a reasonable price for a place in Caesars

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hot Antipasto

0MVpGr7OXJRyjo_qO2BEQQ.text: Come here with a huge appetite and with a group of people who aren't afraid to blow their daily calorie intake through the roof. The food is rich, hearty, and the portions are ginormous and done in family style fashion.   APPETIZERS The Fried Calamari is an excellent choice. My group also ordered the Caesar Salad and Mixed Salad. Both were standard. I liked the Caesar, though it had too much dressing for my preference.   ENTREES We ordered several other pasta entrees, but below are the dishes that I tried.  Chicken Scarpariello: Skinlesss chicken thighs and breasts that were well-seasoned and flavorful.   Eggplant Parmigiana: Layers of eggplant, and plenty of gooey mozzarella cheese and marinara sauce.    Shrimp Scampi: These were gone almost in an instant. The garlicky, buttery shrimp was delicious, and they weren't the tiny frozen variety.   DESSERT Titanic:  My group and I sunk the Titanic. This is seriously a massive dessert that requires team effort. Its foundation was a decadent chocolate brownie. On top of that were scoops of ice cream, huge dollops of cream, slices of strawberries and pineapples, a drizzle of chocolate, and a sprinkling of chopped hazelnuts. After we dug in and devoured most of the monstrous dessert, the Titanic resembled the aftermath of the Stay Puft Marshmallow's annihilation in the first Ghostbusters movie.   SERVICE The staff did a great job taking care of my group.   OTHER There are gluten free options available, such as the Pasta Vodka Sauce.  OVERALL The food and service is fantastic, and I'll definitely be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Titanic

34pHo_9Y_tLbT2q8aYt2yQ.text: great food...highly recommend this family style...meaning you share everything! the bread basket was amazing..who doesn't love every flavor of bottomless homemade deliciously warm fresh bread!? the  service is fast and friendly. the only reason i didn't give it a five star was the tables are wierd... they extended to fit all ten of us... but not really...the outside edges were bending and moving which made  it hard to eat on. but with that said we would highly recommend going here to celebrate a 21st birthday with your whole family...we did and it was awesome!

VKnQiUUxdpIYCdXIin3jzw.text: I had my wedding reception here!!!! It was beyond AMAZING, lots of great food, great view of the Las Vegas strip, the room we had the reception in was just perfect for my wedding party, I ABSOLUTELY love this restaurant and I highly recommend this place for receptions and party's AND to even have an intimate dinner for two, Ask for Cassy if your having an event there she's wonderful and you won't be disappointed  CARMINES  Sabrina H.

tjiPj9GKesQLXzHeAiUs6Q.text: Went here with a group of 6 people and ordered spaghetti and meatballs, chicken Marsala and Caesar salad. All of it was good and it was the perfect amount to split between all of us. I also really enjoyed the focaccia bread you get on the side. Decent prices for the strip and everyone felt full and happy when they left. I would stop in again.

ujirNke0Jp_lvm93i-z0QA.text: Good for large parties, entertaining to have such large plates, decent food and price   "The dishes are big!" And the waiter was not just talking about the porcelain! This is definitely a place to take a large group of people who enjoy sharing and don't mind not getting their own dishes.   Carmine's boast their traditional Italian home cooking style- think big families around a table. I would say it's most optimal for a party of 6 or more.   I went with a party of 5 and we got 1 appetizer and 2 main dishes. Luckily my cousin lives in Vegas so she took the leftovers home or otherwise it would have been a waste since I don't want to take it back to the hotel room.   We had the fried zucchini appetizer which really good. It comes as a foot-tall mound of fried zucchini strings. Makes everyone's eyes pop out by the sight of it. The. We had the veal marsala (okay could pass but the mushrooms were cooked well), the special of the day - rack of lamb (cooked well), and the pasta pomadaro (good too).

lHrSvdLsXYlwbMnVS3rkDw.text: On November 11, we held a post-wedding ceremony dinner at Carmine's located in The Forum Shops at Caesars Palace. We are so happy to say that the evening went perfectly. We worked with Jose Saenz to coordinate for approximately 105 guests who had traveled from Ohio, Michigan and several other states to Las Vegas for our wedding ceremony, and he worked very diligently to ensure every detail was perfect. We reserved the Centrale semi-private dining area, and although it was not fully private, the staff had it arranged in a way that it was not noticeable that other guests were dining in the restaurant. With such a large group in Las Vegas for our "destination" wedding, we first contacted Carmine's about two months before our wedding day and were able to coordinate all of the details with Jose in advance. Everything went off without a hitch!  Not only did Jose work extremely hard to make sure all of our requests were fulfilled, the staff working our dinner event was extremely courteous, patient and kind. The best part: the food was DELICIOUS. Our guests loved the menu selections and we can confidently say that everyone left dinner full and happy that evening! We appreciate Jose's patience and hard work to ensure our evening was full of fun for our guests. We will definitely return to Carmine's whenever we have the opportunity to visit Las Vegas and look forward to checking out their other locations as well.

kFS-qoaQaKcSHPp8tR_c0A.text: I couldn't have been more pleased with our experience at Carmine's!  We chose to have a private party of 40 for my mom's 80th birthday.  To start, Cassie Bagnall, the Senior Special Events Manager, was amazing to work with.   The room was set up warmly, with a veranda that had a nice view of the city.   The service was amazing and the food was delicious, plentiful and well timed out is separate courses.  Servers were right there to take drink orders.  Everything was great!!  Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. happy family
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. table

ig54gux3uRbLzo5nqYaBfw.text: Superb was the service and food at Carmine's in the Forum Shops. I brought 20 clients to dine at Carmine's for the evening and they along with myself were extremely pleased with the service we received from Manny (the manager), James Graham (the waiter for the evening), Mingo and Ryan (the two bussers). All of these men were very attentive, warm and welcoming, they listened carefully to the requests of my clients and myself and immediately acted upon them and went above and beyond to make sure everyone had a fabulous dining experience. Sometimes it's very hard to please clients but if you take them to Carmine's they will be impressed with the level of service and food!

yKZfk9D8hMssL4ng8VFtrA.text: Before you come to eat here make sure you bring your appetite and a big party! This place is family style and all of their portions are served to feed at least four people.  If you are going out with just two people I would skip on this place unless you know you can eat a lot or want a lot of leftovers.  Our waitress was really nice and friendly. I was very happy with the service we received.  We ordered the fried zucchini. Even with four people eating it we ended up with the most leftovers of this. I really liked this dish and was impressed and was better than I thought it would be. I wasn't able to eat a lot because it was a bit on the greasy side and quickly filled me up.  For dinner we ordered the ravioli's and a side of meatballs. We didn't get the actual meatball dish because it came with pasta and we knew we wouldn't be able to eat all that food. I was smart because the pasta would have been too much. I really liked the meatballs. They were really tender and melted in your mouth. I would like to try the pasta next time though.  We opted out of dessert because we were all too full but if you have enough room I'd say go for it because everything I saw looked awesome!  Overall, good just very filling.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meatballs!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raviolis!
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried zucchini

dL96TznoHEPM3SesIrlH8w.text: While I was napping, it was decided that we would come here for dinner. We arrived for our reservation and it was busy.  The family portions are huge, seriously, we of course ordered too much and ended up giving our left overs to a hungry looking man on the street, he was thrilled and grateful. (we are good people like that :)-   Service was ok. Bread was ok. pasta wasn't anything too special. Cesar salad didn't have enough croutons IMHO.  The scrimp was breaded and yummy, we liked that with the angel hair.  We also had penne with bolognese and it was ok, not my choice.    Not sure I'd recommend coming here with a group smaller than 5, probably a good choice for families.

APLD81O1-hAfshOM8RfpGw.text: Food was very good, very friendly server would definitely eat here again. Wish there was one in Socal

Z4lBQ4lh8_9xN-PwgS-c1A.text: Average food in a cool setting with great soundtrack playing in the background.  I wouldn't suggest the calamari as I found it a bit greasy and bland.  Squeezing lemon over it helped add flavor but not enough.

pkhxxIGnoFLLy9XjOXBbTA.text: If you are looking for a large portion of entree look no further! They give you large portions so that you can share them like family style! The food taste good much better than Buca do Beppo! The atmosphere was great Friday nights very lively and full of energy! It's not cheap going here but if you want authentic Italian food and great atmosphere, this is it!

3Bj7foI35o-ry1p3VBRAiA.text: Fantastic! Absolutely amazing! Good thing this place isn't in our home town of Albuquerque otherwise we would be here all the time. The Cesar salad with shrimp was the very best I ever had, tasty with beautiful jumbo shrimp tender and cooked to perfection. We also had the calamari that was equally fantastic. We couldn't do a dinner entree, we were too full from calamari, wine, and salad. This place is family style, so bring your friends and your appetites!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W2kg0vNboZQ0GaLTsdXu_A.text: Absolutely terrific time!!! Family style dining at its best. The dishes are huge and sharing is encouraged. The Chicken Parmesan and the Lasagna was delicious and plenty for a table of 8. We also ordered meatballs and an appetizer calamari but it was really too much. We got talked into the big dessert since it was my 50th birthday because you have to go big or go home. They don't offer the Tugboat smaller dessert anymore so we went for the Titanic and it's GIGANTIC,  but absolutely awesome for a big birthday milestone like 50. The entire staff was extremely nice and made the night perfect. Great time in Vegas at Carmines. Just do it!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yYWuPIWw76VMhoqquWVW3w.text: Food and service was great. Bread was wonderful drinks were strong. Pasta was wonderful. We asked for an entire basket of tomato focacia bread and they readily accommodated us. It was great. Highly recommend it.

gwgp6z0gxpAcj6hUXeondA.text: Stick to the veal parm. Memorial Day weekend had a special with a few pastas which were just ok.

HI_fwU0eXdsO75wZOEtyVA.text: Not sure if Chicken Marsala is authentic without pasta. Never heard of it being served without pasta. Other than that, food was very good.

CFtAs_VFeZOgNmaEmNrc2Q.text: Attended a private wedding reception and had an amazing experience!  The couple had selected several appetizers, pasta dishes, and several desserts. The quality, preparation and presentation to the dishes were amazing. The servers were beyond attentive, pleasant and professional.  Best reception experience I have ever had!

JcrtXEyIWV-l3Gh9r50XFg.text: My friend and I were trying to find somewhere to eat when we stumbled across this restaurant! Took one look at the menu and we walked right in. We didn't make any reservations but the wait wasn't long.   First off, the portions are huge. Our waiter suggested that the both of us share an entree and I'm glad we listened.  We still had lots of left overs to take home after! The chicken Parmesan was delicious. Also, the bread is addicting. Pretty sure that's the reason we decided on only ordering one entree.   Now that I know it's a family style restaurant I will definitely be returning with a group! I heard that happy hour has a smaller serving size so I will have to come back for that!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JvdnN7IAspKAGvF4FwZhqw.text: Our server Allena was wonderful and very helpful in selecting our food. Food was amazing....so much food served family style. Atmosphere was great for people watching.

CSEKiXQDHAh6s1r7zWzVcQ.text: We had dinner at Carmine's celebrating our friends birthday last night. What a great evening. The food was great and plentiful. Our waiter and the overall staff were so very accommodating for our dietary needs.  We all agreed our Waiter, Michael Bane, was the "frosting on the cake" for a perfect Carmine's experience!

9OoImonMpT7e-zYEkTURgg.text: This review is only for their happy hour (2pm-6pm and 9:30pm-close at the bar). We sat ourselves at one of the high chair tables. This place is BIG so for the most part you won't have to wait for a table. At first no one came by to ask for drinks or anything so I got up and asked the bartender to order our drinks. When he came by with our drinks he also took our order.  APEROL FIZZ ($7) - surprisingly very good! I didn't know what this drink was but just took a shot in the dark and I really liked it. It has a slight carbonation and it was a refreshing drink.  MUSSELS IN RED SAUCE ($9) - a very visually appealing dish. The mussels were good and I liked the sauce that they were in.  GARLIC BREAD PARM ($6) - admittedly not the most visually appealing dish but the garlic bread was delicious and I really liked the melted part on top. Girlfriend wasn't a fan of the cheese so she took it off but we agreed the garlic bread was really good.  FRIED CALAMARI ($11) - my favorite of the dishes. The calamari was very good but I was a huge fan of the dipping sauce. You could tell that it was homemade and it had a ton of flavor.   They have a ton of pasta options that were served in big portions and sounded delicious but unfortunately were not part of the happy hour menu. I do want to come back and try some of them though.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels in red sauce ($9)
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic bread parm ($6)
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari ($11). Love the dipping sauce!

3CxUtIHsGK69iFv8XwHk0Q.text: We made reservations the day before for 4 at 7:30 and were seated quickly although there were only two of us at the time and the hostess proceeded to remove the 2 other place settings. Our server was Adrian and she greeted us when we sat down and asked if we wanted regular water or sparkling water and we ordered a large (10) shrimp cocktail, after that we rarely saw her, a different waiter brought us bread for the table, she never asked. Long story short, we never got the shrimp cocktail, had to get up and get her to order dessert which was comped for the missing appetizer. Food was good but the service was seriously lacking. Not sure we will ever go back. Very disappointed. We were there for a wedding reception a month ago and we thought it was great. Not anymore.....

pjHn2zURQa6ZfIe0dsRX5A.text: After a vigorous morning of shopping at the Forums, we stopped in for our annual drink at Carmine's. Our bartender, Joseph, gets 10 out of 10 for service and for keeping us entertained. I mentioned that my daughter always orders Shirley Temples whenever we travel and rates them at the end of each trip. A few minutes later, a Shirley Temple appeared in front of me so I could send a picture to my daughter (who was NOT there) followed by a rousing discussion about how Vegas is not a vacation destination for children. The drinks (including the Shirley Temple martini Joseph made for me from the initial drink), the atmosphere, and the staff were all excellent, and we will continue to go back there when shopping at the Forums!

vCOCwzaRXS5odfh5LM61ZA.text: Best chicken parmesan I've ever had. And the cheese that it's on the table is AMAZING! What a great restaurant!

SCNQUaMsh0T_jBDgV3jtfQ.text: I absolutely wish I could give this place 0 stars. SO. FREAKING. RUDE. Ordered a $35 dish that I was unable to eat because I am pregnant (which I explained to the waiter) and asked for some plain noodles which I knew I could tolerate. We waited 20 minutes for the first dish to be brought out, then after I couldn't tolerate it, I had to wait another 20 minutes for plain pasta. At that point I asked for it to go, as I am in my first trimester of pregnancy and very sick by the food I was originally presented with. My husband asks for the bill, which I review and find both the first item which I couldn't tolerate, and the replacement pasta that came 20 minutes late. I spoke with the manager who had no care or concern for the fact that I was charged for two meals, neither of which I could even eat. Such a poorly run establishment. I understand that places need to make money, however there is such a thing a customer service and this place absolutely has NONE.

7QVNt81Y1rAdCgI2sPzkVQ.text: Came into to today to have some lunch and wow! this place is no joke when it comes to family style.  The restaurant is large, open, and beautiful bottles on display at the bar area where we sat.  The whole ambiance and food was very True to their style!  They even serve wine in little table glasses.  Kelly was our bartender, she was super nice and had great conversation!   We split a Caesar salad, the lettuce was crisp and the salad was dressed to perfection.  Then we shared a bolognese with rigatoni noodles, we looovveed it!! Definitely want to come back and try to hit their happy hour at the bar.    Thanks Carmine's!

Z7tIWcEcpTrHEoYrZvTSxg.text: Absolutely a must do when in Vegas. The food is absolutely amazing the staff very friendly the place is very clean and the food is just out of this world!!!

UUqFe52C1gnCWZMSxKuPVg.text: 10 of us had a 730 reservation on a Ssturday, we were seated immediately.  Drinks came out quickly. Ceasar salad was excellent,  artichokes were great, a little burnt but still great. Veal, pasta, chicken, shrimp were all excellent.  Even the bread was fantastic.  Dave, our server was top notch, he was pleasant,  made great suggestions, attentive and fun.  Great atmosphere,  great food, great service. Well done Carmines.

-fo32Iy8NbHzrluXvZcwuw.text: This place was amazing! My daughter had the plain penne pasta with butter and it was prob the best butter pasta ever. Hubby and I had the veal with lemon butter and pasta. Also, the carmines salad was so good! Portions were huge family style. Will def come back!

h2qkDwHTLgmD7GiVgIm4qA.text: Carmine's is a decent choice for Italian food. Some other reviews have compared it to Bucca and I would say that is not far off. The flavors of the dishes we had were good not great.  The bread was average.  The calamari was decent but won't leave you wowed. The penne ala Vodka was average as was the veal saltimbocca. All in all this is an average Italian restaurant with nothing special going on.

MeJjC2sfy7LhOLsCkV9k7Q.text: This is absolutely a great place for dining with an empty stomach. And when I say empty please do fast 12 hours prior to coming because the plates are ginormous served with heaping mound of food. If you've never been here don't forget to bring your mom, dad, sister, brother, heck the entire town while you're at it. You'll still have enough leftovers to take home with you.   They'll start you off with bread. Ask them for the olive oil and balsamic vinegar because they don't just give it. Look up on the wall and you'll find a brightly lit marquee, which has the full menu. Great idea to save money on menus & trees, bad idea for people with poor eye sight. I just pulled up the menu on my phone. No biggie. You can pick any type of pasta and any sauce to your liking and they will gladly make it.   With just a party of three we had an appetizer and one entree for sharing. It was more than enough to be extremely full and to have leftovers.  For the appetizer we had the meat stuffed mushrooms, which were amazing. Tasted like a juicy meatball on top of a mushroom.  For the entree we opted for the linguini with bolognese sauce. The noodles were al dente and the thick meaty sauce was just perfect. On the table there's shaved Parmesan. Don't forget to add that to everything!  Overall great flavor, awesome service, cool ambiance, and the pricing is just right.   Tip: Do make reservations on holidays & weekend dinners. Lunch time during the week seems to have plenty of open seating.  Sit at the bar if you're coming in for a quick "small bite" (really it's normal portion-sized). They have great HH.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Stuffed Mushrooms
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bolognese Meat Sauce on top of linguini.

ZmYnrtCvsA-zsXdXjAEwOg.text: This was on my "To-Eat-Places" for my trip and it did not disappoint. Wasn't a fan of their mojito. I'm from Miami so I am used to South Beach  mojito I guess.  But their food was excellent. Next time I am taking my family there because they give you too much food.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No offense to the bartender but wasn&#39;t a fan of mojito. It was okay.

Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t let this picture fool you. That is NOT a single serving bowl. Waiter warned me it&#39;s a family dish. It was soooo good!

WrPEtL9M6WuC4LBHZNbWjw.text: Went for dinner after a magic show and have been wanting to go to the one in New York and figured, why not Vegas?! The service was great, and the food was even better. Be sure to go with a large group of people so that you can try everything! We had 4 people and got Caesar salad, the mussels in red sauce, penne alla vodka, and chicken parm and it was the perfect amount. If you can leave room, their "Titanic" dessert sounded incredible (we were just way too full!)

mn8wU69dUfZXJzRhLaKXsg.text: Great food!!!   I wish they had portions for one person so the prices would come down accordingly.   I highly recommend for groups!

G84TPxkzb1dONazYoJYiJw.text: We chose this as our last restaurant to have dinner in Las Vegas and were not disappointed whatsoever. It was so delicious! Everything fresh and the sauces were delicious. We got the fried calamari and I think it's the best I've ever had. So light and crisp with a fresh, bold marinara sauce to dip into. We also got the linguine alla vodka to share. Delicious. Be warned the family sized portions are huge, but if you are a couple, the bar sizes are best.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Facing front
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine alla vodka

8hwAdiR2dzg0XRj9VBpf5w.text: My brother, Sis in Law (who I like better than my little brother), wife (who I like better than everyone), and I tried out Carmine's on our last trip to Vegas.  We love going there together annually and one of the traditions is to go to a really nice restaurant. Carmine's didn't disappoint!  First, the cheese bread. HUGE! There were four of us and we probably could have made an entire meal out of that bread.  It was Delish!  The food comes out Family Style and so we ordered a porterhouse and some pasta.  It was fantastic.  The ambiance was awesome and the wait staff rivaled any I have seen.  Talk about well trained and on top of business.  I was really impressed.    Carmine's is very clean, not too crowded, and VERY Italian.  It reminded me of a Brooklyn eatery from back in the day, as I imagine they were.  The food was professionally done, but if you don't pay attention, you might think it came from Grandma's kitchen.    Carmine's is not cheap, but it is really good food.  Give them a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Porterhouse
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pene Vodka Sauce.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half garlic and half cheese bread.

jsjTIZiGd_XYW4aZUePgIA.text: A rocks solid italian restaurant right within the Forum Shops at Cesars Las Vegas. You would not expect this, but it's actually really good choice for italian dinner, specialy for groups.  Keep in kind the portions are family size - so easy to share by 2 or 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 3 platter with Penne ala Vodka, classic Spaghetti Bolognesea and Rigatoni Vegetariana (top down)

gvJy-gJQgbQstnqd4xuuYQ.text: Great service and HUUUUUUUGE portions. Great for family dining with parties of 10 or more.

4Sf3i0_nwdTUgpbaRScoyQ.text: I did not eat here, just popped in for a drink. The bartender didn't really seem interested in us being there. The drinks were more expensive then I thought they should be for a class of wine and a shot. 36 dollars later, we were on our way.   I've heard the food is good and they have great deals on breakfast. I'd try it next time I'm in town to change it up a bit.

2Bv5whSQOEj_J_EAFUEZ-A.text: Got there an hour or so before closing and Joe did a great taking care of the wife and I. Great service! Now to the food. FAN-F-ING tastic! Joe recommended the eggplant pasta dish that was one of the best I have ever had. We also had the calamari and linguini with clam sauce. Everything was great. Best meal I had in Vegas. I will be going back with a bigger group!

m0edW4GyXuUlCNsO6lrZQw.text: Terrible service. We sat at the bar and the server didn't even come to us for 20 min. Forgot our Order. And Kept saying sorry we are busy.  Well if this restaurant can't handle busy, then close your doors. Being too busy is not an excuse for slow crappy service. Disappoint

JF9ayd-mh2kS_wevNW6_-Q.text: I came to Carmine's for a team dinner, and this was a great option for us since we could share the plates family-style. I liked the basic decor that makes you feel like you're at a nonna's kitchen. The menu is projected alongside a wall. This was nifty, because it allowed us to easily collaborate on what to order rather than holler over our menus.  For a party of 8, the waiter suggested that we order 2 appetizers and 3 entrees. We took him up on his recommendation, but this ended up being way more food than we actually needed. Either the portions are over the top or our eyes were bigger than our stomach. Everything was delicious, however. We had the calamari and eggplant parm as the appetizers, and then we had spaghetti and meatballs, manicotti, and some type of rigatoni as the main entrees. The appetizers were the most memorable to me out of everything we ate. The calamari had a nice light batter, and the eggplant parm was like a lasagna with layers and layers of stacked eggplant pieces. The meatballs in the spaghetti were huge!   Overall I enjoyed the meal at Carmine's. The food is comforting and plentiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9BMEpBo9mGXMiP34NuZK2g.text: Amazing time at Carmines tonight! Our server Elena was amazing and the food was to die for.  Mussels and clams were cooked perfectly and the wings were perfection!

lNTsNBpL1cS2Lro-zyatdw.text: Silly silly, wait staff! You took one look at us and doubted we could finish anything in your family chow down establishment; everyone warning us from the hostess to the the waiter to even the bus boy that "we serve big family-style portions" and that this might be a lot for a couple. You doubted my self-assured nod each time, cuz you didn't know that the hubster and I have hyena bellies; that food is a sport for us and we are gold medal eaters.   So when we DID finish in 15 minutes that big ol' plate of delicious linguine and clams with two cocktails plus polished off our bread basket (I mean we had to dash off to the airport to head home), all of you looked incredulous. And though we're not big people, we walked outta there like we'd just won an award. Never doubt our bellies; we got this.

QkJTjNnSgTXomGD4YXgC3A.text: So, we're wandering through the altar of consumerism, excess and conspicuous consumption Caesars Palace and enjoying it thoroughly when we stumbled upon Carmine's. Having experienced and enjoyed the NY manifestation we immediately booked dinner for the following night and we were not disappointed. We had a seafood pasta - family style  - which was simply exquisite and every bit as good as that served in HQ. there were two of us but, in truth, there was enough for 3/4 people. Thoroughly enjoyable and highly recommended.

YQvhoYjaPBxae3hpR0rY5g.text: Way overrated. Our server was very friendly and food was good. Nothing exciting nor special that stood out from the last visit. Oh yes, their complimentary bread is amazing. Does anyone know why they have a photographer on site?! Forcing people to pose, take photos and then sell them at a premium price at the door. I just feel like if I wanted a show, I wouldn't have gone here.

vAwPLXxQa_t4p3oYTstYCQ.text: GF and i stopped in during happy hour and sat at one of the bar high tables for a quick bite. Great selection of authentic, family style Italian cuisine. Ambiance is great, especially being located in the busy shopping area of Caesar's.  Reasons for my mediocre 3-star review:   slow service...there were two other tables besides ours, and we waited 10min til we were asked if we wanted something to drink...another 12min til we could order our food...then over 20 til we started eating. (during busy hour, that wouldn't be bad...but there was only 5 tables seated in the whole restaurant at the time)  and the other thing that bugged me...ordered a hot sandwich (which was great...and huge!!) but i asked if my GF could have a little side plate of spaghetti w/ marinara instead of the side salad, but was immediately and definitely shut down. not a 'oh, let me see what i can do' or a 'that will be a $$ upcharge' etc etc. just a flat outright NO. c'mon, we're only two people and don't want to order a family size boatload of spaghetti just to try it. pretty sure that could have been arranged.   anyways, i'd caution any small parties from going in...will be hard to find appropriate sized dishes to order. but for larger groups who are open to sharing dishes family style, this would be fantastic

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Hour nibbles while shopping @TheForum

_rEGwJ0b9BpgSvkK9QPMBg.text: Tradition for my boyfriend and I every time we visit LV!! Love it! The stuffed mushrooms, scampi, porterhouse steak, are all phenomenal!! Huge portions and done family style!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VRjlPUUSolBukw2J-rAgvg.text: What is there not to love about Carmine's?! I love it every time I go, and I was shocked I hadn't written a review yet.  The service is great, and the food will fill you up. Make sure you try the epic Titanic dessert. It is worth it!!!

bTsYo91hwxhU_gLjXC86gg.text: We ventured down to the forum to meet family visiting from out of the country. I was a little nervous about family style and it worked out perfectly.   Martin was our server and he is a delight with fantastic knowledge of food and wine. His recommendations proved success.   We indulged in a bottle of Barolo and then a featured Piemonte. $78, $52 respectively which yes is pricey for those and you can't easily get these plus it's a big name establishment AND you're on the strip so for me elevated price is expected.   We ordered 2 dishes for 4 of us and no appetizer for fear of being too full seeing how large the portions were. I have to say the prices alone for the food are very reasonable because of the quantity. The lemon veal was delicious as long as you enjoy pounded floured veal. I loved it! We also got the mixed seafood penne with white (oil and garlic) as opposed to marinara sauce. There was a mix of clams mussels  calamari shrimp and lobster tossed in oil garlic and penne pasta. It was fresh flavorful and generous. The only challenge was not having small lobster forks to help with cracking the shells. Once we asked a couple waiters they finally found one for us but not before my husbands shirt was already splattered in oil from trying to use his hands.   We indulged in tiramisu because it was too pretty to pass up seeing it on the table next door and of course because it's tiramisu.   Overall I think this place is stellar. Our guests stated that this was their new go to for Italian when they visit the states.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful and delicious tiramisu. The chocolate shavings alone are impressive.

_OXCPukOEvXwEYfdn9ksqA.text: Carmine's Italian is always consistent and good quality service and food.  Love the lasagna and chicken parmigiana. Sorry forgot to take pics.  Very good choice for a family as well.

4IXD58fW9r-hreuF43hMfw.text: Amazing food and service as always! My husband and I are vegan and love that they offer a separate vegan menu if you ask for it. We ordered the mixed garden salad with oil and vinegar, and pomodoro pasta without prosciutto. Every last bite was perfection. I highly recommend everyone come here and splurge on this decadent and delicious food!

watxjLKGBWNO3dzuA3nLaA.text: Nice atmosphere and great service!  Food portions are extremely large so go hungry with friends to share.

9W1mcwOzMIlhDQxiqwlFqQ.text: Carmine's is a gem hidden away in Caesar's of all places,I was a little apprehensive at first,But after sitting down and seeing plates go by us and viewing the menu .we were further reassured after our server explained the menu to us and assured us that the serving of lasagna for 4 would be plenty .The meal along with bread was out of this world .Don't sleep on this spot we are so glad we didn't

BwmEBxOV_ZmIRv9Ac8Mdeg.text: It's actually a good deal if you calculate price per pound of food.  Penne vodka was good but not mind blowing, however these are the only meatballs on the planet that beat my own Jersey-born Italian mother's. (I hope to God she doesn't read this.)

hy5KU4jeZ-0-8bDo9HIeCg.text: Food was AMAZING. The menus are lit up in the wall and everything served Family style!   I suggest you have at least 5 people to help with the "Titanic" desert.   The staff were friendly and attentive! This place is  worth every cent! m  ~Myra

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qHYDiEnaLtsuxgZjI2NACw.text: My boyfriend an I have visited the Carmine's in NY last year and absolutely loved it! So I was excited to find out that there was a location here in Vegas. For our 3rd anniversary we decided to go to Carmine's because we love the cosmos and fried calamari we had at the NY location. We made a reservation and my boyfriend asked if they did anything special for anniversaries, which they confirmed by phone that they did. So he informed them that it was going to be our anniversary so it would be amazing if they could do something small to make it special.  While the food was good, all I can say is that my boyfriend and I were very unhappy with our service. We have never felt so uncomfortable with a server before and we will not be returning. Frankly, it made our anniversary much less special. Our waitress had a bad attitude and when she messed up our order and brought us fried zucchini instead, we nicely informed her of the mistake and asked for our calamari we ordered. Instead, she blamed us for the mistake and argued with us saying she was sure we had ordered the zucchini: "I'm sure you definitely said fried zucchini!" After this debacle, we could see her huffing and puffing, point at us to her co-workers and complaining that we had told her the wrong order and it was our fault. When the calamari came, she stopped by and asked "Did we mess it up this time too?" and waited staring at us. I was a bit worried about eating it in case she was one of those servers who spits in the food. But we sucked it up and tried to hurry and get out of there so we could salvage what was left of our night. After we paid our check were on our way out, she called out "Happy Anniversary!"  And just when we thought it couldn't get worse.... our leftovers came with a nice blanket of salt we didn't ask for. In conclusion, if you want to pay an arm and a leg for good food and get treated like trash, then welcome to Carmine's.

DV-v1qZa1F47ICyluNhiLA.text: Me & my family went yesterday to the restaurant. We had a great time. Kelli was our server she was nice & super awesome! Definitely recommend

BVFUgk3h31KxQXr70j_71Q.text: What a great place. The drinks are over priced but the food is well proportioned and delicious so who needs a drink. The best pene alla vodka I have ever had.  Try to get the happy hour food bar menu. Definitely coming back

HsLMaQT2gnenQQmwSnLPvQ.text: I have been to this place twice and pretty much enjoyed both times. I had reservations both times so I didn't have to wait. While I didn't have to wait, many people did. One tip I would give you is to request for them not to place you in the front. If you do, you will have people waiting to eat staring at you like you are in a fish bowl. The food might be some of the best Italian food I have ever had. The location is in an amazing spot, the price is still reasonable and not out of hand.   What kept me from going this place 5 stars was the service. I don't the service I received was not the best. I wish I remembered her name. I don't know if it was the number of people in there, but I expect good service no matter what. Plus some of us got our food 10 mins after others, That was not cool.

6Olj1DbuFHUtI-zfRJknMw.text: Wasn't overly thrilled with this spot. The best thing they have going for them is the eggplant rollatini at happy hour. Well priced and very good! Sauce is light and the eggplant is lightly breaded.   The mussels are HUGE almost not edible and the white wine broth is sub par. I typically enjoy dipping with bread and that wasn't even enjoyable.   We sat at the bar and the bartender seemed rushed even though it wasn't super busy. He messed up our bill, bar was sticky seemed like it had been a while since it was cleaned. I did enjoy their Carmines Pinot Grigio! Well priced.   I might return for the eggplant and vino!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mussels and eggplant rollatini. Mussels are huge and the broth is sub par. Eggplant is delicious!

mh2ejTt2KMzctqoLla2Ybw.text: My family and I always enjoy coming to carmines whenever we are in Vegas. Our server was okay, did not write down our orders and kept having to re-ask us what we ordered. If you are going to do that, remember what we tell you. Since there was a group of six, it would have been better to write it down. The food is exceptional as always and very prompt. We went through the spaghetti Bolognese so quickly we had to order another tray. The berry frozen cosmo drink was very good! I would just work on making sure to take down the orders every time, to ensure a more pleasant dining experience. It was not bad... just could be a little better.

w19VHMRCi1OpatCZ7NxMyA.text: Love the old-school decor: romantic ambiance, dim lighting, classic jazzy tunes,  black and white photos of past days at Carmines NYC everywhere. The bar area is nice, sit there for a cocktail before your meal or dine at one of the few high tops for minimal wait times.  Favorite dishes include the meatballs- huge and delicious mix of beef and veal, these are a must order! The seafood salad is also solid, decoratively served with fresh baby endive and plenty of octopus. Anything with fresh mozzarella is always a win, too. The main pasta dishes feature your choice of pasta and sauce- the penne and red sauce was fine, neither the sauce nor pasta really wowed me but they were cooked perfectly al dente, pasta is fresh made in house daily. I wish they had a mushroom pappardelle option.   I did not care for the tiramisu dessert (minimal lady fingers, mostly mascarpone) or the  cold eggplant salad dish we received. I would come back for the eggplant parmigiana, shrimp scampi, and chicken scarpariello dishes.   NOTE: Prices are not available on website menu, use Yelp photos- and don't freak out, everything is served family style, portions are ample for sharing with a group (~4).

0T9YcW7uH0QFmIiyxElD4g.text: Was actually very impressed with the food here, but come with a big group, the portion sizes are huge. The porterhouse steak with sausage and potatoes was fantastic. The steak was well seasoned with garlic and herbs. I would go back just for that, but you probably need 3-4 people to eat it. Bread, drinks, and lasagna were fine but nothing special.

Pn7QQHG2Fpk3NlrdU8dsiw.text: I fulfilled a bucket list item by finding a Carmine's and actually getting to eat there. Chicken parm and shrimp with white sauce were very tasty. Caesar salad was fresh and good. Would love to try eggplant parm and other dishes someday!

_Oi8udzS_BX_42Quvdg1sw.text: Came here with a large party celebrating a birthday.  First off they're great at accommodating large parties and bringing the food out at a good pace.  Especially for getting the food out to all of the tables at the same time.  The table bread, calamari, chicken wings, and broccoli were awesome!  The other food seemed to be pretty much on par with other Italian places such as Maggiano's.  Service was great, very attentive.

RuTSrGdsdCtIbDhVkOLTzA.text: Wow! This place is great. We ordered chicken Parmesan , salad, and spaghetti and meatballs. Best I have ever had in my life! All of it!' Service was great too ! Our new hot spot while visiting Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

C4cL5fvlW9PCZnzrstqJfA.text: Ok here's the thing about Vegas. The food is always over priced and always mediocre.   BUT THIS PLACE.  I just had an EXCELLENT meal here. The food is delicious and so flavorful! The portions are HUGE so bring a friend (or 10) so you can sample all the various delicious dishes on the menu. We had the Caesar salad, baked clams and penne bolognese. Everything was AWESOME.   Our server Natalie was STUNNING. She made great recommendations and really made the experience great. I highly recommend this place if you are looking for some hearty portions of delicious Italian fare!

MfljQLIO3W4tct7pvMQtPg.text: I was very pleasantly surprised to be presented with a special menu of substitutions available for my food allergy!  My friend and I ended up with a pomodoro pasta dish and a couple of happy hour drinks.  Our server was knowledgeable and attentive and the ambiance was pleasant.

3f73Gsvtycqu9kol8JrowA.text: Great service. Fun, lively atmosphere. Food was cooked perfectly and it's definitely family style / shareable. We would return.

zX0OtXOpQEfDM8a7qhZPog.text: Service was excellent! We loved our server, she was very attentive! We ordered the calamari and pasta with clam sauce. The calamari was great but disappointed a bit with the linguini and clams, the clams were very chewy and the clam sauce was very watery/oily. Ambiance was great though and I will definitely give this place another shot

ke3tMkEqOns7GvL4d3YFSw.text: Items Selected: Bread Basket - Focaccia, Rye, Tomato and Herb, Rustic Italian Cold Antipasto Platter - Mortadella, Prosciutto, Eggplant Caponata, Salmon Crostini, Seafood Salad, Mixed Olives, Panini and More Spicy Scarpariello Wings Eggplant Parmigiana Lasagna Double Espresso on Ice Bread Pudding Strawberry Shortcake Chocolate Cannoli  Opened in the Forum Shops at Caesars' by Artie Cutler and the team behind two New York City locations, one in Atlantic City, DC and even the Bahamas, Carmine's is cut from the same Southern-Italy-by-way-of-NYC cloth as chains such as Bucca di Beppo or Maggiano's Little Italy, yet by doing 'the little things' right the experience is upgraded at least two-fold while still maintaining its customer-friendly prices.  Assuredly a tourist gathering point, though a fair share of locals have been heard to say they enjoyed their visits, Carmine's Las Vegas location opened in Summer of 2013 and closing in on three years with Chef Michael Ingino involved since doors opened the very concept of a "scratch kitchen" feeding a room that seats up to eight hundred from 11:00AM to 11:00PM weekdays (and till Midnight on weekends) may seem exhausting, but in reality the attitude of everyone in the place remains not only pleasant but downright exuberant.  Currently managed by Anthony Esparza, a pleasant man whose enthusiasm for a big job seems contagious to his staff, it was as part of a party of four that seats were taken under one of the colossal menus mounted amidst black & white photos not dissimilar to any number of Italian-American restaurants and with portions as outsized as the restaurant's character the phrase "Family Style" rings True from the onset, our waiter warning that each plate was meant to serve anywhere from "two to four" guests.  Skipping the grandeur of a place like Carbone, casting aside stereotyped Italian phrases and an absurd check in favor of a sort of "Sunday at Grandma's" vibe, feasting at Carmine's commences with an ample Bread Basket likely to tempt all but the most carbohydrate conscious and with Sinatra, Dean and Sammy playing overhead in not-too-loud fashion the question of where best to begin is a daunting one, the fact that nearly everything but Pasta and imported Charcuterie is made on-site further complicating the decision.  Acknowledging from the start that over-ordering at Carmine's is a virtual guarantee, "two to four" better translated as "four or more," it was to a large platter of Antipasti that the table was soon treated and although the phrase "something for everyone" is often a dicey proposition it would be difficult to call the smorgasbord anything less as everything from simple meats and cheese to a complex seafood salad are presented elegantly with a price not dissimilar to what such a spread would cost from Whole Foods Market.  Told that the Spicy Scarpariello Wings were something crave-worthy, two dozen plump pieces of Chicken cooked crisp before a bath in vibrant sauce teaming with garlic, lemon and peppers, suffice it t say that the housemade Blue Cheese Dressing alone would make this plate worth ordering instead of lesser versions at the local Sports Bar, a followup of Lasagna and Eggplant Ptarmigan showing the former to not be quite as crisp as one might hope across the top while the 9-layered latter outperforms any other version in town by a significant degree as each hand-sliced and stacked piece is baked soft without turning mushy around what could easily be a pound or more of Tomato Sauce and Mozzarella Cheese.  Joking with the server about his description of Strawberry Shortcake, the desserts all tempting but that one sounding particularly odd when accidentally described as being served on Rye, it was in good humor that the actual dish was served complimentary alongside a block of Cinnamon and Chocolate Bread with fresh Whipped Cream and three filled-to-order Cannolis, the Bread Pudding actually almost *too*dense at the end of such a meal while Marble Cake beneath Cream and Strawberries was soft and light, the citrus-tinged Mascarpone filling each Chocolate-dipped Shell equally convincing of Carmine's commitment to quality.  **** Accounting for the fact that Carmine's is positioned to compete for the 'average' tourist dollars and not those looking for an 'event' meal or fine dining there is little doubt that what Michael, Anthony and their team is doing at Carmine's goes a step beyond to make the overall experience a worthwhile outing, and one that tourists as well as locals may equally be likely to enjoy.
