lBKFgpc0RaTyD67eW7Jqmw.text: Great family style Italian food with huge portions! There were 3 of us and we split the carmine's house salad which would probably have sufficed on its own! We followed that up with a classic: spaghetti and meatballs.  The meatballs were delicious! You could tell they were freshly made and even though we were pretty full from the salad we made room to eat all six! The sauce was just what you'd expect from a good Italian restaurant and the pasta was cooked to perfection too.  I wish they'd open one up in Austin which needs a good Italian restaurant like this!

fczN4lTITIeeG6ie9JATsw.text: We can definitely recommend eating at the bar during happy hour. Especially if you're not with a giant group, We had fried zucchini (more like fries, but tasty!), and eggplant rollatini. OMG the eggplant rollatini is fabulous!!! And the house wine was tasty too!

wUdLnt6KwHpLvD8lFjESZQ.text: Just like the one in nyc.  The food was amazing and the service was on point.  This is a place to order food to share.  We got calamari, baked clams, linguine With clams and shrimp scampi.  All yummy!

JhhW47BBKRK2-ovw3wqgnA.text: The first 15min after we were seated, no one came to welcome us except for the busboy who threw a basket of cold bread on the edge of our table.  After patiently waited for 15min, we waved to call a waiter, a group of them were together talking, when one of them saw us waved, he just smiled, waved back and continued with their own conversation.  Plain rude!   Just when we were about to walk out due to the poor service, our waiter came and he was very nice.  You need to train your waiters and busboys better.

QVizQTgpzvbK7kdwFWpnfg.text: I live in Las Vegas over 20 years I have finally found a real high quality Italian food restaurant. From what I hear The head chef and crew make all the food from scratch every morning. For the moderately priced plates the portions are so generous. The atmosphere is great the waitstaff is overly friendly also very clean the Greatview my compliments to the chef I will be going at least once a month you're definitely missing out if you don't try this place

VCqn1MObe6Z4oYw63t5Nsw.text: I've been to the NYC location, and it is good.  I took my team to Carmines during a recent conference and found the food to be mediocre.  The food wasn't terrible, it just wasn't great.  I do like the family style and the portions were great for 4 people. The ravioli was good but the sauce was on the bitter side. Ragu would have been a better alternative. At the waiters recommendation, we also tried the Chicken Marsala...Bad choice.  The salad was very good, but if you screw up salad you really have something wrong with you.

O-8Vz4KWoU_kLYaUpQmNsA.text: Okay, I normally have a hard time giving places in the casinos a full five stars, but this place is fantastic. The service is quick and friendly. But one piece of warning I would not go hear if you are dining by yourself. That could get pricey and well entirely too much food. At this place they serve family style. Meaning everything you order in huge and intended for sharing. My wife and I had Lasagna and it was fantastic. The best part is because sharing is assumed you can get a decent meal here for around $40-$50. Any time we see a show in Caesars moving forward we will dine here. The food is great and it sure beats spending $70-$80 somewhere else.

UMHx2cjrH84aaiJcKr9aDA.text: I was pretty happy with this place.  Family sized portions means your definitely taking food home.  I was a big fan of their Lasagna and even bigger fan of the clams.  Clams came out a little on the salty side but they were huge and delicious.  Definitely a good place to go to get your eat on.

etF0_bAOkjeQ0Mviy_znmw.text: Our Eggplant Parmesan need some extra sauce. We ask our waiter who brought us a small cup. We were shock to see a charge on the bill for the sauce. We called over the waiter and said we have never previously at a restaurant experienced an extra fee when a dish is dry and needed more sauce. The waiter response was that is they way they do it at Carmine's. He did not bring over the manager or remove the extra charge. We think this is poor customer service.

9Hmov5J7eDJHcGFTjYXy4w.text: Can't rate the food since I didn't eat there. Made a reservation for two which apparently is pointless. Options for two are the bar or the hightop, neither of which was available. To be seated at a regular table you have to order family style which serves a minimum of 4 people. Why take reservations if you have restrictions on what can be ordered and no availability at the bar or hightop. Pass if you're a smaller party. FAIL!

2EcEWkgJkJQ9QBlVsRee4w.text: This was a great evening out with friends. Our server Michael Baker did a great job not only being attentive but also with entertaining us. Food was great too. Highly recommend if you get to Las Vegas to eat here. Family style so portions are huge.

HRYcu50fuhcYY1orp0mp_g.text: I can not say enough good things about Carmine's that I am having trouble of where to begin.  First, I was running out of options of where to host my sorority's annual reunion day. We have grown quite large and size and needed a venue that could accommodate 150 sisters. Carmine's can host that many plus lots more.  Second, we were on a tight budget and Cassy, the special events manager, was able to put together a family style menu that that would accommodate almost all special diets. When planning for this many people it is difficult to make sure all diets are met and Cassy nailed it all making sure there was food that almost anyone with certain diets could eat.  Third, the day of any event is always quite stressful and the staff - especially one server in particular Micheal - went above and beyond to make every lady in the house felt special! Even the smallest request was handle with a smile and he even put on a show for the group and sang a song in Italian. Just a few other highlights: the food was absolutely delicious. The decor was elegant making decorating so easy with only really needing center pieces for the tables. But my favorite part is that the staff boxed up all the uneaten food and we were able to donate this to local shelter! If you are looking for a place to host your next special occasion this should certainly be on the list of places to consider.

g8HHW7O7R0KY-Wh4ztH95A.text: Family style Italian restaurant located in the Forum Shops. This place is amazing. The entree's are huge, meant for sharing, and the prices vary from $37 and up depending on the type of pasta. We started with the calamari appetizer ($28) and the most amazing garlic bread covered with generous portion of cheese. For our entree we ordered the lasagne ($38) that was light and fluffy with a rich tomato flavor, the best I have ever had. This would easily have fed a group of six. Our waiter, Mark, was wonderful. He was very informative with all of our questions and very attentive. Everyone was really nice. The ambience is really cool with high ceilings and framed pictures hung on the walls. I would recommend this place, in fact we are going back again tonight........can't wait.

h7x3R0VbIQHyM_KxB6dM_g.text: This place is totally meant for a group due to the family-style platters, which I did not realize until we sat down, but it was good experience nonetheless. I have always wanted to try Carmine's when I have been to NYC, but for some reason (probably the extremely long wait for a table), have never been. Since a lot of iconic NY eateries have made their mark on Vegas though, I have been able to try some of these hard-to-get spots, including Carmine's. We started with a delicious green salad, ordered from the "bar" menu at the suggestion of our server, as that size is a bit smaller and more appropriate for a duo like my husband and I. I ordered a delicious drink that I would love to replicate at home - it had lime, lemon juice, and blood orange, but was amazingly fresh and crisp! Our main was the chicken parmesan, which was delicious, cheesy, and crunchy. You order the pasta separately for around $12 to complete the meal and I would say you need it - the tomato sauce the meal comes with is super fresh and simple, the way I like it. The bread served here was pretty good, too. I was a fan of the awesome tomato focaccia bread, yum! Too bad we were stuffed, otherwise the dessert menu here looks really good. And if you're in a large group, the calamari looked divine, but would be a heap of food for two.  Our server was really nice, not attitude-y at all, and helpful in accommodating our small party. My Sicilian family would love this place! Very kitschy decor, a la Dolce Vita. I would definitely recommend Carmine's for a group.

XZCgdMHE9BKUdYYAY7jlLA.text: Carmine's has unfortunately closed. Super sad about it. I've been eating and drinking there for well over 10 years. Of course they blamed the economy for their closing not the fact that they did zero marketing. They blew a bunch of money on 2 remodels and put no effort into social media, promotions or advertising of any kind.  I feel horrible for the few bartenders that worked there for a very long time and kept the regular coming back.

oJJW1D7iDmFRZn6UNk3EYw.text: This place is stupid.  Family only.  Don't take a date.  What do you mean you can't feed 2 people what they want?

CZIDnlB_Hf50BqYZhtpkWA.text: Absolutely unprofessional and appalling service. Went Saturday night with my boyfriend and 7 of his guy friends for their bachelor party. I arrived late after they ordered, which is no big deal but we didn't get our food for an hour and 15 minutes. RIDICULOUS!!!!!!!! Which, I get ticket times can get out of hand, but come up to the table and apologize at least. We asked our server for the manager, a 30ish year old black man who came to the table and didn't say sorry at all but decided to cast the blame on me because I apparently wanted all the food to come out at once. Excuse me, I wasn't even present when they ordered! And he preceded to embarrass me in front of all these men I just met. Needless to say, I was shocked but I pulled him aside to tell him how patronizing and belittling he made me feel and set him straight that I wasn't even there when they ordered so his lame excuse as to why our food took forever wasn't even accurate and was a bit pathetic to blame the only girl at the table-- sexist.   Anyways, he told our table he would take care of some of the bill. We ate the mediocre and cold food and waited for the bill, which the host gave us. We realized nothing was taken off as previously promised. Upset, we asked for the manager again to discuss the matter and the host proceeded to call security on us. So uncalled for and rude. I will NEVER eat there again, and all of us agree that this place is utterly terrible and completely unprofessional. I hope they shut down because there are so many better places to eat in Las Vegas who actually know how to give customer service! Stay away, far away!  P.S. All the guys were mad they didn't have alfredo sauce... And they're an Italian restaurant.... Unheard of!

Pcl8pKlZOpGyUTuTBw514g.text: I went to Carmine's last Wednesday for dinner with my mother and my brother. First off the place took my breathe away. I am from New York and have been to the Carmine's there so I was very excited to have that New York meal ! Unlike the New York location I did not have to wait long.   The food was amazing and made me feel as if I was at home again. The veal scallopini is most defiantly a repeat offender.  Our server Joey was what topped off the experience! He gave great suggestions for wine. The Malbec was my favorite! I will definitely be back !

_sOsELRURdY1YNcsGj4PQQ.text: Food was amazing, price was good for the family sized portion you receive, best Italian food I've ever had. Best thing to do is if you are with a group of $ 3+ people is to share an appetizer and entree and split the bill..

nNKkktyEGbTC2WGWJXAFbQ.text: Seated far from a menu printed on the wall. I asked for a printed menu. "It's our tradition to not give you a printed menu.  You can go take a photo of it if you like."  Since it's my tradition to be handed a menu, and I was traveling with someone who is visually impaired, we politely left after explaining this was an unacceptable inconvenience.

36kXytrdpnwH3NQPZm4spQ.text: Tried the original I New York so had to try their Las Vegas version. Of course the portions were huge that big family style serving. Great spot for last minute meals for large parties. Went with a couple who need vegan options which they also provided.

otA2I1fmgK0LZP_Tl-LLAg.text: Michael p is a great waiter and made amazing recommendations, the food is phenomenal! Absolutely no complaints! What so ever! The Chicken scallopini with the penne a la vodka were terrific! The Chicken parm was terrific!!! Would go again and again! Portions are huge! Ours was a table of four and could feed well more than enough for 8! A must in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Absolutely amazing!!!! Words can&#39;t describe how awesome the food is! Chicken scarpariello, penne a la vodka, and chicken parm.

KaHt-CV62nUeDwol4LUxOA.text: This establishment is not worth the wait and the hype. I had the linguine and meat balls.  The food was not hot at all, the sauce was very sweet that was a little overbearing and the linguine tasted like it was straight out of a can. We asked for bread and the waitress literally gave us the bread as soon as we got our food, and the bread sucked.  The meat balls were very mushy and were very bland. Would highly recommend not coming to this establishment.

FXraWQdVYEgDLs3d2i2t7g.text: Very disappointed. Came here with my family. Everything. We had was super salty. We were so sad because we just came back from the Grand Canyon and was so hungry. Ordered he chicken parm, ziti, and pasta with meat sauce. We didn't finish the food (barely touched it) and gave it to someone on the streets. What a waste of money. Terrible experience. Even the server was kind of rude.

OUrm-Ix4pRI5tQX94w4H-A.text: I had friends staying at Casaers and we ordered take out and took the food to their suite at all of our disappointment   The overall quality of the food was poor other than the free bread that they give you   We asked for light cheese on the chicken Parmesan and it was still doused in heavy cheese. The sauce was light and left the linguine dry underneath.   The Caesars salad had delicious fresh croutons but at $30 I would  expect exceptional parmesan but it was really low quality cheese.  The dressing was very heavy in garlic and anchovies. We specifically asked if it was fishy and we were assured it was not. But it was too fishy for my taste and I couldn't eat it   The chocolate torte for desert was good.   The food is sold family style. The cost per person is higher than Cheesecake Factory down the mall which in my opinion has much better food.   Take out service was ok. We had questions about ingredients that the guy couldn't answer.  They didn't give us enough plates and plastic-ware  If you're really desperate for bad Italian food Olive Garden, buca di pepo , macaroni grill all have better food at a lower price.

t_rSpZ6h-d_rhZI_Nl4V-w.text: Wow is an understatement. The food here is delicious. I've been here twice and both times I received great service and most importantly fresh food. The portions are huge. One plate can feed two or three people. The food can be smelled from a block away. :) I'll defiantly be back the next time I'm in the area.

k5_rg81nfL606u1RkkeTyQ.text: Fantastic family style Italian food spot on the Las Vegas Strip inside the Forum Shops at Cesar's Place. Their menus are on the walls and everything is served to feed 2-4 people. You can tell that everything is made in house. For apps we had calamari and Cesar salad, we loved both, the Cesar had a great tang and the marinara was excellent, I also got a glass of red wine. For our entrees we had the Penne al la Vodka and Chicken Marsala. We would recommend both. We were too full to try dessert but next time I want to try the Titanic. We will definitely be back. The price is a little high but quality is top notch, great place for a group of 4 or more.

gO4Es3zL4yPqDMif9f3MlA.text: Crappy food and crappy service.  The manicotti tasted like there was ghost cheese inside it.  Don't bother.  The food wasn't fresh either.  Caesars palace needs to get rid of this place.

MeprQA1yb0jgvJVGh0kJ1w.text: The food was pretty darn good.  The service was awesome.  Would recommend for big groups. We had a lot left over. Very open Family style food.

5J003yGR8gnVNkukJJL7Ag.text: Food was delicious!   Staff was super nice! Went on a Monday night.  They had the NCAA March Madness championship basketball game on.  No reservation. Crowded but did not have to wait since it was just my husband and I. Sat at a high top table and was able to order off the Jr menu/bar menu.   We ordered an appetizer and entree.  We couldn't finish it all and took back leftovers to our hotel.  Highly recommend!! (Of note: I have also been to the Atlantic City restaurant and this was also A+ in my book)

C6VTPHchVBfdVQUCeEWOLA.text: Family style dining and atmosphere, grand menu on the wall for there grand portions. First time here for a group birthday party. The "white" sauce looked and taste like butter and oil, not much sauce just barely coated the noodles. Linguini pasta was not fully cooked but they did make us a fresh batch with no problem. Servers and staff was nice and accommodating.

RO1yM0N9w4K1x89ZW2zm6g.text: Oh.  My.  Gosh.  If there's only two of you, make sure you sit in the bar and order the half portions. This is a "family dining" style restaurant and the portions are sized to feed the table.  The bar staff collectively attends the bar tables so there's always someone around to ask questions about the sauces etc.... The only thing I think I would change is the bread basket. Their bread is served cold, and I prefer mine warm.  We ate here multiple times this trip, and will be back with our children on our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rigatoni with bolognese sauce  for the meat lovers.

cGkQjTrK8kKe40DnZMidLw.text: Walking to Carmine's real treat we were friendly and politely greeted by staff members. Upon walking in and being seated we were asked if we need a highchair. When the high chair was delivered to us the seat fastner was broken. I brought it to the attention of the staff member seeing this and she promptly brought me out a another chair to replace the broken one. Unfortunately, the highchair that she brought me out was also broken and the seat strap unusable. When I brought to her attention she simply shrugged at me and said "I don't know" and walked away. So, not so good on the server-side.  Aside from that mishap, the food was The food was good.  We had the porterhouse which came to my delight covered in garlic and olive oil absolutely phenomenal.  We also ordered the angel hair with oil and garlic and chicken Big mistake the chicken was dry as the Las Vegas desert we are surrounded by.  When it comes to lasagna, I'm afraid the lasagna leaves much to be desired.  It falls apart easily as you're cutting it and it's nearly impossible to serve without dropping back into the plate or onto the table.   These things combined with the fact of the lasagna is very bland and has almost no original taste of it's own. It seems it inherently flavor from the sauce surrounding it. Both the Ricota filing and the meat sauce used to build the layers I'm afraid need a little more work.

LHhXtMwjbJBYTxrtdfG0dg.text: Super good food and if you go during happy hour from 9:30pm-closing the food is great and affordable as far as the tasters and happy hour drinks! Regular priced meals are full price but can feed a army so becareful! Located in the Cesar's forum shops area!

bLkFoBkdhfFzLX11CWTmrg.text: Had dinner there last night and very impressed!  Food was amazing but word from the wise, portions are Extremely large! My wife and I went together and even requesting half orders were more then two can eat. It's primary focus is family style and large groups.  That said I'll be going back no matter what!  Caesar salad was one of the best ever and the pasta was simply perfect.   They said if you eat at the bar you can get a menu more designed for two people.

k1VLKJFbzFm04eEL_cyXHQ.text: Huge portions. And hearty flavorful food!  4 adults and 4 children.  Calamari for appetizer, Garlic and oil linguine, Sausage and broccoli rigatoni, Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Scaloppine w/lemon and butter.  We still had food leftover!   I was most surprised by the garlic and oil linguine. You would think that the pasta would be very light or plain in flavor, but it wasn't. Quite the opposite. It was incredibly flavorful without the heaviness of say a cream sauce.   Also,  I never order chicken dishes when I'm out for some reason. Especially dishes with chicken breast, mostly because I've never found a dish that I've liked, that wasn't bland or tough or just uninteresting with some sauce slopped on it. The chicken scaloppine was so tender, with the most delicious creamy, lemon butter sauce that had a refreshing delightful flavor.  Casual, family style ambience. I felt like I was dining at a good old Italian friends house for dinner. Big appetite is a must!  Had a great dinner with friends from out-of-town,  and it was a fun filled satisfying evening.

2qR6Uy2Bz7CWJ3LqT58y2A.text: Came to celebrate our fathers birthday. On time with our reservation & to be seated. We were a party of 13 including kids & our waiter was very patient, prompt, made sure drinks were always filled, & gave great suggestions for their dishes. Very family friendly. All plates are huge portions. Pasta ala vodka was our favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_h16759eCNt7ADe_L51eQw.text: Just as good as the New York location, but not *nearly* as crowded!   We made reservations for three for an early Friday night dinner, but I don't think the reservations were necessary. The restaurant got busy, but it definitely never got as busy as the restaurant in Times Square.  The staff was all friendly, and took the time to joke around with us. Our waiter recommended some drinks, and then gave us time to decide on our order.  I've been dreaming about Carmine's Bolognese since we had it in March, so of course that was the sauce that I wanted. We agreed on a pasta type and an appetizer (the calamari) and then stared at the bread basket that they placed on the table in front of us.  We'd all been to Carmine's New York location before, so we knew from experience that there'd be a ton of food coming our way, and were weighing the pros and cons of eating the bread ahead of our meal. We nibbled at the bread, but decided to save our appetites for the food.  And, oh! That food! That glorious, delicious, exceedingly large portion of food!  The calamari came out first, and initially, we thought we'd have no problem polishing it off. There were three of us, after all, and we were all pretty hungry. The calamari was delicious - crispy and piping hot, there was good flavor in both the batter and in the squid meat. I didn't try the marinara sauce, but the others seemed to love it. I preferred throwing a dusting of parmesan cheese on top, which made it even better.  As we were putting a dent into the platter of calamari, our waiter came by with our platter of Angel Hair pasta with Bolognese sauce. He then started to dish it all out for us, and for some reason, I ended up with the largest serving.   Maybe because I clapped and bounced up and down in my seat when he set it down on the table?  The sauce was just as good as I remembered it being, which was a huge relief. I tend to have very bad luck with things that I've experienced once, and end up craving. They never quite add up, you know? But, that wasn't the case here. The sauce was meaty and mildly spicy, without being too tomato-y. Is that a word? Tomato-y? It is now.  It wasn't long before we realized, not only had we failed in clearing out the calamari, there was a not-so-small portion of pasta left over. As we were all in hotel rooms without microwaves, we weren't sure we wanted to take the leftovers with us, but then decided to see if we could find someone...in need...to give it to.  I'm so glad that we found out about this location before our trip to Vegas. It was the perfect pre-race meal, and we loved everything from the service to the quality of the food.   Once again, we left overly full and impressed by Carmine's!

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Linguine with Bolognese sauce
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two pounds of calamari!

yBDj7i1Z6r0BixzasvNqrQ.text: The portions here are insane. One steak, a pasta, and a salad was more than enough to feed my table of 5.   We started off with a Caesar salad which could last me a week! The sauce proportion to iceberg lettuce was great. My family was saying how they would eat a salad everyday if it was that salad. But then we check the price and that salad alone was like $20-30.   The tomahawk steak was very good. It was well seasoned and even I, who hates steak, ate 3 giant pieces!   Next we had the seafood pasta which was ok. Half of our table got sick to our stomach with just one bite of the clam. The noodle and sauce tasted good though.

Qv1q2EJvQA_PJcvxRrId_Q.text: This is a family style Italian place with great food. The entrees are served family style and are big enough to feed four people. However on top of the great food this place has excellent service. Despite the place being busy we did not wait long for our food which was hot and fresh. This is worth the wait

LH5-5pHyuZbY51L8eJjKKQ.text: Outstanding service and food was even better. Family style so two entrees handled my wife and me, as well as the two boys ages 21 and 16.  We left the table full after a great experience.

RFdmxciU3STdx-Eu2pAsxQ.text: The best Italian food in Las Vegas by way of NYC. And the best porterhouse steak in Las Vegas as well. Carmines is a family style restaurant hence the high prices. But one entre' is enough for three people.  The seafood here is also the best you will find in this city.  Ask anyone from Maine how the lobster is here and they'll tell you " outstanding"! The Vegas location offers bar portions too for those sitting solo or who just want a smaller dish. Not all owns are available in this size though. Don't bother with any other Italian restaurants in Vegas..... Just go here. Great place to go too solo since 95% of the places here expect a solo diner to go to Burger King. Carmine's will never forgot your sitting there.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shrimp Shrimp Marinara

yBrQnE4SdtoC7GECqcp_Kw.text: We came here for happy hour and boy was it good! With 104 degree weather Peronis for $5.00 sounded so good;) I was surprised to get a tall glass of Peronis for that price on the Strip.  Nice atmosphere and pleasant waiter!! Food was delicious!  My hubby got the Calamari and I got the raw shelled clams.  Portion are huge!  Although I am not a bread eater, their bread basket had an assortment  of Italian and it looked yummy! Will be returning!

What made our dinning experience stink was Abigale, our server, she took our order and we didn't see her again until after our meal. We have to get the bread and water refills from other servers.

oDvVUEKGPqYzfhiNiPZV2Q.text: Service was great and food was so good. Serving size is huge so my wife and I sat at the bar where they do 1/2 size servings on some items. This is a must if you have less than 3 people in your party. We had the fried calamari, Caesar salad, and spaghetti with meatballs.  All were great and the waitress was very attentive and answered all the questions we had. We will be back.

BHrYa3S--eflRAPOoIa7jg.text: Huge plates of fantastic tasting Italian food!  I love Carmines.

ylS4X1upnmkBHOzFVXPG7Q.text: Fantastic food. HUGE portions! I  Quick Breakdown: Appetizers : Calmari & cold antipasto - good. Stuffed Muschrooms Ok Pasta: Penna Alla Vodka DAMN GOOD Chicken, Scaloppine: YUMMO Shrimp Scampi: The Best Lasgna: way to full to even try it Sides: Broccoli; Super good.  Desserts: HOLY cow..not sure how i did it, but i tried it all. The Titanic is awesome. BE aware that you need at least 4 people to split this. The Strawberry shortcake was my Fav.  Make sure to get reservations since this places fills up fast!

yaIzH9AUhtDzcZ5jLKyjcg.text: Carmine's has the biggest portion sizes I have ever seen, they could feed an army. We ended up sitting in the bar area which serves smaller portions (only for 3 people) but the menu is more restricted. The prices seem high but when you consider how much food is served they actually become very reasonable.  We ordered the Caesar salad and penne bolognaise, the food was so rich and there was so much of it that we ended up taking the final third of the bolognaise to eat the next day. I would definitely recommend Carmine's to anyone in search of a good quality hearty meal in Las Vegas.

WdcXULiz-SVcocgAdUi0Rw.text: Came here for my son's birthday. Party of 7  with 4 of them being 20something guys.  This is a great place for big groups.  The guys loved it and ate and are and are!  We started with the Caesar's salad, which was perfectly dressed and super fresh.  We also had the antipasto which my hubby and I lived but the guys thought a little exotic.  (They are burgers and fries kind of guys).  We had veal scalllopini, spaghetti with sausage and meatballs and lasagna.  A hearty carb fest for all! Nom nom! All were delish!  We finished with the amazing Italian Cheesecake.  Super light and fluffy!   Definitely a do again place! Yummy!

2Hsbi_nHwGFhe7LbhDwp8A.text: I've went to Carmine's in NYC about twenty years ago.  I don't recall the quality of the food but decided to try Carmine's in Las Vegas since the one in NYC has an excellent reputation.  I have mixed reviews.  For the incredibly high prices we paid for pasta, it's not worth it.  I went with a group of ten people and we ordered: Lasagna:  good but nothing to rave about Meatballs:  Wow...you call these meatballs?  Not very good at all Chicken Parmesan:  Actually quite good and the best item we ordered. Chicken Scarpariello:  Not much flavor, sausage was good. Rigatoni Pomodoro:  heavy basil sauce, tasty but not worth paying $35 for a huge bowl of $4 pasta.  We didn't order desserts since we were full from our entrees.  Portions are huge but what's the point of having huge portions of just average food?  How about focusing on quality instead?  Service was excellent except for one waiter who kept on hovering around our table after we were finished, almost as if he were trying to rush us out even though there wasn't anyone waiting to be seated.  Would I go back?  No way.

rqOK-a5IkLjJHvVOdevc9Q.text: I'd heard of Carmine's in New York so when they opened a location in the Forum Shops in Caesar's Palace, I really wanted to give them a try. From what I can tell they did a pretty good job of faithfully recreating the look and feel of the New York location. We arrived fairly late into the evening so things were very quiet inside which was actually kind of nice. If you're unaware, Carmine's is a family style restaurant which means the portions are HUGE because it's intended for you to share with others at your table. I ordered their chicken parmesan and my wife decided to go with their basic spaghetti. Both were pretty good! They're a few steps above a chain in terms of quality. With the massive portions and the above average taste I think this equals a solid effort. We'd definitely go back the next time we're out in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A view of the main dining room.
Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Massive family style chicken Parmesan.

cRd7qd-9sJky5DLLynWwVQ.text: Two parts to this review.  I originally visited the New York location and thought the food was absolutely amazing.  So good in fact, we went back twice.  I went to Las Vegas for my 30th birthday with my girl and we made a reservation.  We got there on time for our reservation and they turned us away telling us that the kitchen was closed.  I ended up eating at a place called DJs Tacos (you should stop by there if you haven't).  We went back though, told the manager what happened and he was great about making it up to us.  Free wine, free birthday cheesecake, and of course the food was delicious.  Definitely will go back when I'm in Vegas again.

Bv-BUs0sSOYIE9z_VL2_jA.text: We didn't read that this was a 'family style' restaurant. So we were a little overwhelmed when our lasagna came out. But talk about a delicious lasagna. Sure it's pretty hard to mess up lasagna, but it's not too often you have a really great lasagna, and this one was it. Took the leftovers and had them for lunch at  the pool next day. No shame in our game. It was soo good.

P5NOvVUduww0_QO2uW5c-Q.text: We had our reception here for our wedding.  It was a small affair, only 20ish people, but all of them kept telling me how the food was just awesome. One guy kept saying that he'd never had such great food at a wedding reception.  The food and the service were outstanding.  If you are considering an event in Las Vegas, I highly recommend this place.  Tara made me feel comfortable about the arrangements and the waitstaff was superb. I never stressed about things being done well.

7v03naJqlbOeIW_Aw1woAQ.text: Couples beware. My husband and I went on a date and were told it was family style. However, we weren't told the sizes were for 4 people. So much food was wasted, not to mention paying twice as much.

7RLej1P_7wYAWgqpP_AKHw.text: Carmine's in Las Vegas has the best Italian food I have had since NYC and Hoboken.  Our waiter Michael Baker provided excellent service and sang a fun opera B-day song encouraging everyone to clap along.  It was a lot of fun!  You must come to Carmine's in the Caesars Forum Shops when in LV.

5Y71U8U7Y9t8QWRUdYKW8A.text: This was my first experience dining in at Carmine's.  I did try the cheesecake at there DC location but only as carry out. As far as the Vegas location, we received a warm greeting upon entry. We sat at the bar and both bartenders were attentive and engaging. We ordered and the food and drinks were fabulous. The portions are huge for the price. I left very satisfied. I definitely will be returning and recommend to any that haven't been.

photos.caption: Photo of Carmine's Italian Restaurant - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gotta Love Em!!

iDCNgl0TZclf5dtQdeUCJg.text: The food here was definitely plentiful, but I thought it was only 'decent.'  Almost everything I tried lacked seasoning.  It's a very pretty restaurant, with traditional Italian (or New York Italian?) style.  Both levels are open to the bustling mall, which as great.  The staff was very friendly, but service was slow and disjointed.

4q-_kBb7_WOaRAyujm6i0g.text: We got the Rigatoni with Sausage and Broccoli. Absolutely terrible.  The sauce was water down and hand no real Italian flavor. It was pretty much just cooked rigatoni. The look of the restaurant was nice but did not go well with the quality of the food . The bread that was served was not cooked and we had to ask for olive oil and vinegar.  Although the concept of having family sized portions sounds good, but when you get bad quality of food it's makes for a bad experience for everyone.

lbi4UvLkLBm56ZIwEWvWOA.text: Food was amazing, I also loved the fact that we had 20 people in our after wedding party and they were able to provide the seating without a complaint. I would definitely go back without a second thought. I don't understand all of the bad reviews on here, maybe try and make sure your servers are happy and ready for a busy day in vegas. I did miss putting a 5th star because one of my drinks was forgot, luckily they did not charge us for it.

s1DkNY_ecEyPeqwrC6ldBw.text: This is a great place for family style portions.  We ordered the shrimp scampi and were asked if we wanted pasta.  I thought it would come with pasta, but whatever. We opted to get the pasta and were so glad we did.  If we hadn't gotten the pasta, we would have just gotten about 12 big lonely shrimp on a plate.  The food was very good, but the service was pretty slow.  It took about five minutes for our waitress to come to our table to take our drink order.  They have these oversized shot glasses for your water, which I thought was odd but maybe it is to prevent spilling when patrons reach across the table to get more food.  It is a big pricey, but you do get a lot of food, and we were able to take home leftovers and eat on it the next day.  It wasn't as good as the day before, but it was still pretty tasty.

Vg-4N0nmvfDCWyrbsRzDsA.text: The chicken parm was like rubber....worst we ever had (and we eat out as Vegas locals daily)!  Don't order it. The pasta carbonara was actually tasty. Would not recommend based on the parm dish. Salad was okay, not very tasty. Head to Capo's or The Palm instead!!
